Identify the previous filing by registration\nstatement number, or the Form or Schedule and the date of its filing.\n\n(1)   Amount Previously Paid:\n\n         \n\n(2)   Form, Schedule or Registration Statement No.:\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n         \n(3)   Filing Party:\n         \n(4)   Date Filed:\n         \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n2/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n \n\n&\n\n \n\nDear Stockholders:\n\nTRANSACTION PROPOSED\xe2\x80\x94YOUR VOTE IS VERY IMPORTANT\n\n           Each of the boards of directors of Rockwell Collins, Inc. and B/E Aerospace, Inc. has unanimously approved a merger, combining Rockwell Collins\' capabilities in flight\ndeck avionics, cabin electronics, mission communications and simulation and training and information management systems with B/E Aerospace\'s range of cabin interior products,\nwhich include seating, food and beverage preparation and storage equipment, lighting and oxygen systems and modular galley and lavatory systems for commercial airliners and\nbusiness jets. The merger presents an opportunity to accelerate growth and build value for Rockwell Collins\' stockholders through market-leading positions in cockpit and cabin\nsolutions, and presents to B/E Aerospace\'s stockholders an immediate premium and a substantial equity interest in a strong combined company with a broader range of products,\ncustomers and the combined expertise and resources to create future value.\n\n           Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace entered into an agreement and plan of merger on October 23, 2016. Subject to stockholder approvals and the satisfaction or (to the\nextent permitted by law) waiver of certain other closing conditions, Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace will combine their businesses through the merger of B/E Aerospace with a\nnewly formed, wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins, with B/E Aerospace thereupon becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins as the surviving\ncorporation, which transaction is referred to as the merger in this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\n           If the merger is completed, B/E Aerospace stockholders (other than (i) Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace and Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of\nRockwell Collins, and (ii) any stockholders holding shares of B/E Aerospace common stock with respect to which appraisal rights are properly demanded and not withdrawn under\nthe General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware) will receive $34.10 in cash, without interest, and a fraction of a validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable share of\nRockwell Collins common stock with a value of $27.90, subject to adjustment pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement as further described below, for each share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock, which cash and stock are collectively referred to as the merger consideration. The fraction of a share of Rockwell Collins common stock into which\neach share of B/E Aerospace common stock will be converted, which is referred to as the exchange ratio, will be determined based on the volume-weighted average price per share\nof Rockwell Collins common stock over a specified period of time before the closing of the merger, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins stock price. This exchange ratio\nwill be adjusted to reflect changes in the price of the Rockwell Collins common stock prior to the closing of the merger. If the Rockwell Collins stock price is less than $77.41 or\ngreater than $89.97, a two-way collar mechanism will apply, pursuant to which (i) if the Rockwell Collins stock price is greater than $89.97, the exchange ratio will be fixed at\n0.3101 and the value of the stock consideration will be more than $27.90, and (ii) if the Rockwell Collins stock price is less than $77.41, the exchange ratio will be fixed at 0.3604\nand the value of the stock consideration will be less than $27.90. Upon the completion of the merger, based on minimum and maximum exchange ratios of 0.3101 and 0.3604, the\nestimated number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock issuable as a portion of the merger consideration is between 31.1 million shares and 36.1 million shares, which will\nresult in former B/E Aerospace stockholders holding approximately 19.2% to 21.7% of the outstanding Rockwell Collins common stock, based on the number of outstanding shares\nof common stock and outstanding stock-based awards of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace as of January 26, 2017. For more details on the calculation of the Rockwell Collins\nstock price, the calculation of the exchange ratio and the two-way collar mechanism, see "The Merger Agreement\xe2\x80\x94Merger Consideration to be Received by B/E Aerospace\nStockholders" beginning on page 128 of this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\n           If the Rockwell Collins stock price were equal to the Rockwell Collins\' closing stock price on January 26, 2017, the most recent practicable date for which such information\nwas available, holders of B/E Aerospace common stock would receive $34.10 in cash, without interest, plus 0.3101 shares of Rockwell Collins common stock, resulting in Rockwell\nCollins issuing 31.1 million shares of Rockwell Collins common stock as a portion of the aggregate merger consideration and representing approximately $62.40 in value per share\nof B/E Aerospace common stock, which represents a premium of approximately 23.3% over B/E Aerospace\'s closing stock price on October 21, 2016, the last trading day before\nthe public announcement of the merger. The actual value of the merger consideration and the number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock to be issued by Rockwell Collins\nmay differ from this example, given the Rockwell Collins stock price will not be determinable until the trading day prior to the closing of the merger. The common stock of\nRockwell Collins is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "COL," and the common stock of B/E Aerospace is listed on The NASDAQ Stock Market under the\nsymbol "BEAV." We urge you to obtain current market quotations for the shares of common stock of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace.\n\n           All fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that would otherwise be issued to a B/E Aerospace stockholder as part of the merger consideration will be\naggregated to create whole shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that will be issued to B/E Aerospace stockholders as part of the merger consideration. If a fractional share of\nRockwell Collins common stock remains payable to a B/E Aerospace stockholder after aggregating all fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock payable to such B/E\nAerospace stockholder, then such B/E Aerospace stockholder will be paid, in lieu of such remaining fractional share of Rockwell Collins common stock, an amount in cash, without\ninterest, rounded down to the nearest cent, equal to the product of (x) the amount of the fractional share interest in a share of Rockwell Collins common stock to which such holder\nwould otherwise be entitled (rounded to three decimal places) and (y) the Rockwell Collins stock price. Rockwell Collins stockholders will continue to own their existing shares of\ncommon stock of Rockwell Collins, the form of which will not be changed by the transaction.\n\n           Each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace is holding a special meeting of its stockholders to vote on the proposals necessary to complete the merger. Information about\nthese meetings, the merger, the share issuance, and the other business to be considered by stockholders at each of the special meetings is contained in this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus. Any stockholder entitled to attend and vote at the Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace special meeting is entitled to appoint a proxy to attend and vote on such\nstockholder\'s behalf. Such proxy need not be a holder of Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace common stock. We urge you to read this joint proxy statement/prospectus and the\nannexes and documents incorporated by reference carefully. You should also carefully consider the risks that are described in the "Risk Factors" section beginning on page\n46.\n\n           Your vote is very important regardless of the number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock or B/E Aerospace common stock that you own. The merger\ncannot be completed without approval of (i) the proposal to issue Rockwell Collins common stock by the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by the\nshares of Rockwell Collins common stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the Rockwell Collins special meeting that are entitled to vote on such proposal and\n(ii) adoption of the merger agreement by the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the shares of B/E Aerospace common stock outstanding and entitled to vote on\nthe record date.\n\n           Whether or not you plan to attend your company\'s special meeting of stockholders, please submit your proxy as soon as possible to make sure that your shares are\nrepresented at that meeting.\n\n           The Rockwell Collins board of directors unanimously recommends that Rockwell Collins stockholders vote "FOR" the proposal to approve the issuance of\nRockwell Collins common stock in the merger, which is necessary to complete the merger.\n\n           The B/E Aerospace board of directors unanimously recommends that B/E Aerospace stockholders vote "FOR" the proposal to adopt the merger agreement, which\nis necessary to complete the merger.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n3/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n \n\nRobert K. Ortberg\nChairman, President and Chief\nExecutive Officer\nRockwell Collins, Inc.\n\n \n\n \n \n\nAmin J. Khoury\n\n \n\nExecutive Chairman of the\nBoard of Directors\nB/E Aerospace, Inc.\n\n           Neither the Securities and Exchange Commission nor any state securities commission has approved or disapproved of the merger or the other transactions\ndescribed in this joint proxy statement/prospectus or the securities to be issued in connection with the merger or determined if this joint proxy statement/prospectus is\naccurate or complete. Any representation to the contrary is a criminal offense.\n\n           This joint proxy statement/prospectus is dated February 3, 2017, and is first being mailed to stockholders of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace on or about February 6,\n2017.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n4/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nROCKWELL COLLINS, INC.\n400 Collins Road NE\nCedar Rapids, Iowa 52498\n\nNOTICE OF SPECIAL MEETING OF SHAREOWNERS\n\nTo be held on March 9, 2017\n\nTo the Shareowners of Rockwell Collins, Inc.:\n\n        We are pleased to invite you to attend the special meeting of shareowners of Rockwell Collins, Inc., a Delaware corporation, which\nwill be held at the Cedar Rapids Marriott, 1200 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa, on March 9, 2017, at 8:30 a.m. (Central time) for\nthe following purposes:\n\n1.\n\n2.\n\nApprove Share Issuance.    To vote on a proposal to issue Rockwell Collins common stock, par value $0.01 per share,\npursuant to the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of October 23, 2016, by and among Rockwell Collins, Quarterback\nMerger Sub Corp. and B/E Aerospace, Inc., as the same may be amended from time to time (which is referred to as the\nmerger agreement), which is further described in the sections titled "The Merger" and "The Merger Agreement," beginning\non pages 57 and 128, respectively, and a copy of which is attached as Annex A to the joint proxy statement/prospectus\naccompanying this notice, which is referred to as the Share Issuance proposal; and \n\nAdjournment or Postponement of the Special Meeting.    To vote on a proposal to approve the adjournment of the\nRockwell Collins special meeting to a later date or dates, if necessary or appropriate, to solicit additional proxies in the\nevent there are not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to approve the Share Issuance proposal, which is\nreferred to as the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal.\n\n        Rockwell Collins will transact no other business at the special meeting except such business as may properly be brought before the\nspecial meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof by or at the direction of the Rockwell Collins board of directors. Please refer\nto the joint proxy statement/prospectus of which this notice is a part for further information with respect to the business to be transacted at\nthe Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins board of directors has fixed the close of business on January 18, 2017 as the record date for the Rockwell\nCollins special meeting. Only Rockwell Collins shareowners of record at that time are entitled to receive notice of, and to vote at, the\nRockwell Collins special meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof. A complete list of such shareowners will be available for\ninspection by any Rockwell Collins shareowner for any purpose germane to the special meeting during ordinary business hours for the\n10 days preceding the Rockwell Collins special meeting at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa. The eligible Rockwell Collins\nshareowner list will also be available at the Rockwell Collins special meeting for examination by any shareowner of record present at such\nmeeting.\n\n        Completion of the merger is conditioned on approval of the share issuance by the Rockwell Collins shareowners, which requires the\naffirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by shares of Rockwell Collins common stock represented (in person or by proxy)\nat the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins board of directors has unanimously approved the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated\nby the merger agreement, declared the merger agreement advisable and in\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n5/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nthe best interest of Rockwell Collins and its shareowners, and unanimously recommends that Rockwell Collins shareowners vote:\n\n"FOR" the Share Issuance proposal; and \n\n"FOR" the proposal to approve the adjournment of the Rockwell Collins special meeting to a later date or dates, if\nnecessary or appropriate, to permit further solicitation of proxies.\n\n        Your vote is very important regardless of the number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that you own. Whether or\nnot you expect to attend the Rockwell Collins special meeting in person, to ensure your representation at the Rockwell Collins\nspecial meeting, we urge you to submit a proxy to vote your shares as promptly as possible by (i) visiting the Internet site listed on\nthe Rockwell Collins proxy card, (ii) calling the toll-free number listed on the Rockwell Collins proxy card or (iii) submitting your\nRockwell Collins proxy card by mail by using the provided self-addressed, stamped envelope. Submitting a proxy will not prevent\nyou from voting in person, but it will help to secure a quorum and avoid added solicitation costs. Any eligible holder of Rockwell Collins\nstock who is present at the Rockwell Collins special meeting may vote in person, thereby revoking any previous proxy. In addition, a\nproxy may also be revoked in writing before the Rockwell Collins special meeting in the manner described in the accompanying\ndocument. If your shares are held in the name of a broker, bank or other nominee, please follow the instructions on the voting instruction\ncard furnished by the broker, bank or other nominee. If you hold shares through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan and are an\nemployee of Rockwell Collins with regular computer access as an integral part of your job duties, you will receive an email with\ninstructions on how to vote the shares you hold through the plan. If you hold shares through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan\nand are not an employee, or you are an employee but do not have regular computer access as an integral part of your job duties, you can\nvote by following the instructions described in (i), (ii) or (iii) above.\n\n        The enclosed joint proxy statement/prospectus provides a detailed description of the merger and the merger agreement and the other\nmatters to be considered at the Rockwell Collins special meeting. We urge you to carefully read this joint proxy statement/prospectus,\nincluding any documents incorporated by reference herein, and the annexes in their entirety. To vote on a proposal to adopt the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of\nOctober 23, 2016, by and among Rockwell Collins, Inc., Quarterback Merger Sub Corp. and B/E Aerospace, as amended\nfrom time to time (which is referred to as the merger agreement), which is further described in the sections titled "The\nMerger" and "The Merger Agreement," beginning on pages 57 and 128, respectively, and a copy of which is attached as\nAnnex A to the joint proxy statement/prospectus accompanying this notice, which is referred to as the Merger proposal; \n\nAdvisory Vote Regarding Merger-Related Compensation.    To vote on an advisory (non-binding) proposal to approve\nthe compensation that may be paid or become payable to B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers that is based on or\notherwise related to the proposed transactions, which is referred to as the Merger-Related Compensation proposal; and \n\nAdjournment or Postponement of the Special Meeting.    To vote on a proposal to approve the adjournment of the B/E\nAerospace special meeting to a later date or dates, if necessary or appropriate, to solicit additional proxies in the event there\nare not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to approve the Merger proposal, which is referred to as the\nB/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal.\n\n        B/E Aerospace will transact no other business at the special meeting except such business as may properly be brought before the\nspecial meeting or any adjournment or postponement thereof by or at the direction of the B/E Aerospace board of directors. Whether or not\nyou expect to attend the B/E Aerospace special meeting in person, to ensure your representation at the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting, we urge you to submit a proxy to vote your shares as promptly as possible by (i) visiting the Internet site listed on the B/E\nAerospace proxy card, (ii) calling the toll-free number listed on the B/E Aerospace proxy card or (iii) submitting your B/E\nAerospace proxy card by mail by using the provided self-addressed, stamped envelope. Submitting a proxy will not prevent you from\nvoting in person, but it will help to secure a quorum and avoid added solicitation costs. In addition, a proxy may also be\nrevoked in writing before the B/E Aerospace special meeting in the manner described in the accompanying document. of Contents\n\nTABLE OF CONTENTS \n\n \nQUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE MERGER AND THE SPECIAL MEETINGS\nSUMMARY\nThe Parties\nThe Transaction\nConsideration to be Received in the Merger by B/E Aerospace Stockholders\nTreatment of Stock-Based Awards\nRockwell Collins Board of Directors Following Completion of the Merger\nHeadquarters\nRecommendations of the Rockwell Collins Board of The B/E Aerospace Adjournment Proposal\n\nUNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS\nNOTES TO UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL\n\nSTATEMENTS\n\nCOMPARISON OF RIGHTS OF STOCKHOLDERS OF ROCKWELL COLLINS AND\n\nB/E AEROSPACE\nLEGAL MATTERS\nEXPERTS\nDATES FOR SUBMISSION OF STOCKHOLDER PROPOSALS FOR 2017 AND 2018 ANNUAL\n\nMEETINGS\nRockwell Collins\n\n3\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n11/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n\nB/E Aerospace\n\nHOUSEHOLDING OF JOINT PROXY STATEMENT/PROSPECTUS\nWHERE YOU CAN FIND MORE INFORMATION\n\nRockwell Collins SEC Filings\nB/E Aerospace SEC Filings\n\nAnnex A: Agreement and Plan of Merger\n\nAnnex B: Opinion of J.P. Morgan Securities LLC\n\nAnnex C: Opinion of Citigroup Global Markets Inc.\n\nAnnex D: Opinion of Goldman, Sachs & Co.\n\nAnnex E: Section 262 of the Delaware General Corporation Law\n\n4\n\n  Page\n\n \n\n \n \n \n \n \n\n  197 \n  198 \n  198 \n  199 \n  199 \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n12/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nQUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE MERGER AND THE SPECIAL MEETINGS \n\n        The following questions and answers briefly address some commonly asked questions about the merger and each of the Rockwell\nCollins and B/E Aerospace special meetings. They may not include all the information that is important to stockholders of Rockwell\nCollins and B/E Aerospace. Stockholders should carefully read this entire joint proxy statement/prospectus, including the annexes and the\nother documents referred to or incorporated by reference herein.\n\nQ: What is the merger? \n\nA:\n\nRockwell Collins, Inc., which is referred to as Rockwell Collins, and B/E Aerospace, Inc., which is referred to as B/E Aerospace,\nhave entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of October 23, 2016, which (as the same may be amended from time\nto time) is referred to as the merger agreement. A copy of the merger agreement is attached as Annex A to this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus. The merger agreement contains the terms and conditions of the proposed business combination of Rockwell\nCollins and B/E Aerospace. Under the merger agreement, subject to satisfaction or (to the extent permitted by law) waiver of the\nconditions to the merger set forth in the merger agreement and described hereinafter, Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a wholly\nowned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins, which is referred to as Merger Sub, will merge with and into B/E Aerospace, with B/E\nAerospace continuing as the surviving corporation and a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins, in a transaction which is\nreferred to as the merger. \n\nQ: Why am I receiving these materials? \n\nA:\n\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace are sending these materials to their respective stockholders to help them decide how to vote\ntheir shares of Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace common stock, as the case may be, with respect to the merger and other matters\nto be considered at their respective special meetings.\n\nThe merger cannot be completed unless Rockwell Collins stockholders approve the issuance of Rockwell Collins common stock in\nthe merger and B/E Aerospace stockholders adopt the merger agreement. Each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace is holding\na special meeting of its stockholders to vote on the proposals necessary to complete the merger. Information about these special\nmeetings, the merger and the other business to be considered by stockholders at each of the special meetings is contained in this\njoint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\nThis joint proxy statement/prospectus constitutes both a joint proxy statement of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace and a\nprospectus of Rockwell Collins. It is a joint proxy statement because each of the boards of directors of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace are soliciting proxies from their respective stockholders. It is a prospectus because Rockwell Collins will issue shares of\nits common stock in exchange for outstanding shares of B/E Aerospace common stock in the merger.\n\nQ: What will B/E Aerospace stockholders receive in the merger? \n\nA:\n\nIf the merger is completed, B/E Aerospace stockholders (other than (i) Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace and Merger Sub and\n(ii) any stockholders holding shares of B/E Aerospace common stock with respect to which appraisal rights are properly demanded\nand not withdrawn under the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware) will receive $34.10 per share in cash, without\ninterest, and a fraction of a validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable share of Rockwell Collins common stock with a value of\n$27.90 per share, subject to adjustment pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement, for each share of B/E Aerospace common\nstock. The precise fraction of a share of Rockwell Collins common stock into which each share of B/E Aerospace common stock\nwill be converted, which is referred to as the exchange ratio, will be determined based upon the Rockwell Collins stock price, as\ndescribed in more detail in "The Merger\n\n5\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n13/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nAgreement\xe2\x80\x94Merger Consideration to be Received by B/E Aerospace Stockholders" beginning on page 128. If the Rockwell\nCollins stock price is greater than or equal to $77.41 and less than or equal to $89.97, the exchange ratio will be equal to the\nquotient of (a) $27.90 divided by (b) the Rockwell Collins stock price, which, in each case, will result in the stock consideration\nhaving a value equal to $27.90. If the Rockwell Collins stock price is less than $77.41 or greater than $89.97, a two-way collar\nmechanism will apply pursuant to which, (1) if the Rockwell Collins stock price is greater than $89.97, the exchange ratio will be\nfixed at 0.3101 and the value of the stock consideration will be more than $27.90, and (2) if the Rockwell Collins stock price is\nless than $77.41, the exchange ratio will be fixed at 0.3604 and the value of the stock consideration will be less than $27.90.\n\nAll fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that would otherwise be issued to a B/E Aerospace stockholder as part of\nthe merger consideration will be aggregated to create whole shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that will be issued to B/E\nAerospace stockholders as part of the merger consideration. If a fractional share of Rockwell Collins common stock remains\npayable to a B/E Aerospace stockholder after aggregating all fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock payable to such\nB/E Aerospace stockholder, then such B/E Aerospace stockholder will be paid, in lieu of such remaining fractional share of\nRockwell Collins common stock, an amount in cash, without interest, rounded down to the nearest cent, equal to the product of\n(x) the amount of the fractional share interest in a share of Rockwell Collins common stock to which such holder would otherwise\nbe entitled (rounded to three decimal places) and (y) the Rockwell Collins stock price.\n\nHow will Rockwell Collins pay the cash component of the merger consideration? \n\nRockwell Collins\' obligation to complete the merger is not conditioned upon its obtaining financing. Rockwell Collins anticipates\nthat approximately $3.6 billion will be required to pay the aggregate cash portion of the merger consideration to the B/E Aerospace\nstockholders. Rockwell Collins intends to fund the cash component of the merger through sources of debt financing.\n\nFor a more complete description of sources of funding for the merger and related costs, see "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94Source of Funding for\nthe Merger" beginning on page 123.\n\nQ: When do Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace expect to complete the transaction? \n\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace are working to complete the transaction as soon as practicable. We currently expect that the\ntransaction will be completed in the spring of 2017. Neither Rockwell Collins nor B/E Aerospace can predict, however, the actual\ndate on which the transaction will be completed because it is subject to conditions beyond each company\'s control, including the\nnecessary regulatory approvals.\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nA:\n\nSee "The Merger Agreement\xe2\x80\x94Conditions to the Merger" beginning on page 148.\n\nQ: What am I being asked to vote on, and why is this approval necessary? \n\nA:\n\nRockwell Collins stockholders are being asked to vote on the following proposals:\n\n        1.     to approve the issuance of Rockwell Collins common stock, par value $0.01 per share, pursuant to the merger agreement,\nwhich is referred to as the Share Issuance proposal; and\n\n        2.     to approve any proposal to adjourn the Rockwell Collins special meeting from time to time, if necessary or appropriate,\nto solicit additional proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to approve the Share\nIssuance proposal, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal.\n\n6\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n14/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nApproval of the Share Issuance proposal by Rockwell Collins stockholders is required to complete the merger.\n\nB/E Aerospace stockholders are being asked to vote on the following proposals:\n\n        1.     to adopt the merger agreement, which is referred to as the Merger proposal;\n\n        2.     to approve, on an advisory basis, the merger-related compensation arrangements of B/E Aerospace\'s named executive\nofficers, which is referred to as the Merger-Related Compensation proposal; and\n\n        3.     to approve any proposal to adjourn the B/E Aerospace special meeting from time to time, if necessary or appropriate, to\nsolicit additional proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to approve the Merger\nproposal, which is referred to as the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal.\n\nApproval of the Merger proposal by B/E Aerospace stockholders is required for completion of the merger.\n\nQ: What vote is required to approve each proposal at the Rockwell Collins Special Meeting? \n\nA:\n\nThe Share Issuance proposal:    The affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by shares of Rockwell Collins\ncommon stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the Rockwell Collins special meeting is required to approve the Share\nIssuance proposal, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins Stockholder Approval.\n\nThe Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal:    The affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the shares of Rockwell Collins\ncommon stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the Rockwell Collins special meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal,\nwhether or not a quorum is present, is required to approve the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal.\n\nQ: What vote is required to approve each proposal at the B/E Aerospace Special Meeting? \n\nA:\n\nThe Merger proposal:    The affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the issued and outstanding shares of B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock is required to approve the Merger proposal, which is referred to as the B/E Aerospace Stockholder Approval.\n\nThe Merger-Related Compensation proposal:    The affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by stockholders\nentitled to vote on the proposal that are present in person or represented by proxy, assuming a quorum, is required to approve the\nMerger-Related Compensation proposal. Because the vote on the Merger-Related Compensation proposal is advisory only, it will\nnot be binding on B/E Aerospace. Accordingly, if the Merger proposal is approved and the merger is completed, the merger-related\ncompensation will be payable to B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers, subject only to the conditions applicable thereto,\nregardless of the outcome of the approval of the Merger-Related Compensation proposal.\n\nThe B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal:    The affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by B/E Aerospace\nstockholders present in person or represented by proxy, whether or not a quorum is present is required to approve the B/E\nAerospace Adjournment proposal. If a quorum is present, the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by the\nshares of B/E Aerospace common stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and entitled to\nvote on the proposal is required to approve the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal.\n\n7\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n15/330\n\n\x0cA:\n\nA:\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nA:\n\n8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nQ: What happens if the non-binding advisory proposal to approve compensation that will or may be paid or provided by B/E\n\nAerospace to its named executive officers in connection with the merger is not approved? \n\nApproval, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, of compensation that will or may be paid or provided by B/E Aerospace to its\nnamed executive officers in connection with the merger is not a condition to completion of the merger. The vote is an advisory vote\nand is not binding. If the merger is completed, B/E Aerospace expects to pay "compensation in connection with the merger" to its\nnamed executive officers. \n\nQ: What constitutes a quorum? \n\nThe presence at the Rockwell Collins special meeting, in person or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of the shares of Rockwell\nCollins common stock issued and outstanding on the record date for the Rockwell Collins special meeting will constitute a quorum\nfor the transaction of business at the Rockwell Collins special meeting. The presence at the B/E Aerospace special meeting, in\nperson or by proxy, of the holders of a majority of B/E Aerospace votes entitled to be cast by stockholders entitled to vote on the\nrecord date for the B/E Aerospace special meeting will constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting. Abstentions (which are described below) will count for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum for\nthe transaction of business at each special meeting. \n\nHow does the Rockwell Collins Board recommend that I vote? \n\nThe board of directors of Rockwell Collins, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins Board, unanimously recommends that\nholders of Rockwell Collins common stock vote "FOR" the Share Issuance proposal and "FOR" the Rockwell Collins\nAdjournment proposal. \n\nHow does the B/E Aerospace Board recommend that I vote? \n\nThe board of directors of B/E Aerospace, which is referred to as the B/E Aerospace Board, unanimously recommends that B/E\nAerospace stockholders vote "FOR" the Merger proposal and "FOR" the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal. In addition, the\nB/E Aerospace Board unanimously recommends that holders of B/E Aerospace common stock vote "FOR" the Merger-Related\nCompensation proposal to approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, any "golden parachute" compensation arrangement that\nmay be paid or become payable to B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers that is based on or otherwise relates to the merger or\ncontemplated by the merger agreement. \n\nQ: What do I need to do now? \n\nAfter carefully reading and considering the information contained in this joint proxy statement/prospectus, please vote your shares\nas soon as possible so that your shares will be represented at your respective company\'s special meeting. Please follow the\ninstructions set forth on the proxy card or on the voting instruction form provided by the record holder if your shares are held in the\nname of your broker, bank or other nominee.\n\nPlease do not submit your B/E Aerospace stock certificates at this time. If the merger is completed, you will receive\ninstructions for surrendering your B/E Aerospace stock certificates in exchange for shares of Rockwell Collins common\nstock from the exchange agent.\n\n8\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n16/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nHow do I vote? \n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nIf you are a stockholder of record of Rockwell Collins as of January 18, 2017, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins record\ndate, or a stockholder of B/E Aerospace as of January 18, 2017, which is referred to as the B/E Aerospace record date, you may\nsubmit your proxy before your respective company\'s special meeting in one of the following ways: \n\nTelephone voting\xe2\x80\x94use the toll-free number shown on your proxy card; \n\nVia the Internet\xe2\x80\x94visit the website shown on your proxy card to vote via the Internet; or \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nMail\xe2\x80\x94complete, sign, date and return the enclosed proxy card in the enclosed postage-paid envelope.\n\nIf you are a stockholder of record, you may also cast your vote in person at your respective company\'s special meeting.\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nIf your shares are held in "street name," through a broker, bank or other nominee, that institution will send you separate\ninstructions describing the procedure for voting your shares. "Street name" stockholders who wish to vote at the meeting will need\nto obtain a "legal proxy" form from their broker, bank or other nominee.\n\nHow do I vote my shares of B/E Aerospace common stock held through B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan? \n\nIf you hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock through B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan, you may vote your shares by telephone,\nmail or via the Internet as described above. If you vote your shares by telephone or via the Internet, your voting instructions must\nbe received before 11:59 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 6, 2017 in order for you to instruct B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan trustee\nhow to vote your shares. If you vote your shares by mail, your voting instructions must be received before 6:00 p.m. (Eastern time)\non March 6, 2017 in order for you to instruct B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan trustee how to vote your shares. If you hold shares\nthrough B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan and do not timely submit your voting instructions by this deadline, your applicable shares\nwill be voted in the same proportion to the shares held in B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan for which votes were cast.\n\nIf you hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock through B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan, you may attend the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting. However, shares held through B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan can only be voted as described in the above\nparagraph, and cannot be voted in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\nHow do I vote my shares of Rockwell Collins common stock held through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan? \n\nIf you hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan, you may vote your\nshares by telephone, mail or via the Internet as described above. If you hold shares through the Rockwell Collins Retirement\nSavings Plan and are an employee of Rockwell Collins, you will receive an email with instructions on how to vote the shares you\nhold through the plan. If you vote your shares by telephone or via the Internet, your voting instructions must be received before\n11:59 p.m. (Central time) on March 5, 2017 in order for you to instruct the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan trustee how\nto vote your shares. If you vote your shares by mail, your voting instructions must be received by March 5, 2017 in order for you to\ninstruct the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan trustee how to vote your shares. If you hold shares through the Rockwell\nCollins Retirement Savings Plan and do not timely submit your voting\n\n9\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n17/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\ninstructions by this deadline, your applicable shares will be voted in the same proportion to the shares held in the Rockwell Collins\nRetirement Savings Plan for which votes were cast.\n\nIf you hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan, you may attend the\nRockwell Collins special meeting. However, shares held through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan can only be voted\nas described in the above paragraph, and cannot be voted in person at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\nIf my shares are held in "street name" by a broker, bank or other nominee, will my broker, bank or other nominee vote my\nshares for me? \n\nIf your shares are held in "street name" in a stock brokerage account or by a broker, bank or other nominee, you must provide the\nrecord holder of your shares with instructions on how to vote your shares. Please follow the voting instructions provided by your\nbroker, bank or other nominee. Please note that you may not vote shares held in street name by returning a proxy card directly to\nRockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace or by voting in person at your respective company\'s special meeting unless you provide a\n"legal proxy," which you must obtain from your broker, bank or other nominee. Your broker, bank or other nominee is obligated to\nprovide you with a voting instruction card for you to use.\n\nBrokers who hold shares in street name for a beneficial owner of those shares typically have the authority to vote in their discretion\non "routine" proposals when they have not received instructions from beneficial owners. However, brokers are not allowed to\nexercise their voting discretion with respect to the approval of matters determined to be "non-routine" without specific instructions\nfrom the beneficial owner. It is expected that all proposals to be voted on at the Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace special\nmeetings are such "non-routine" matters. Broker non-votes occur when a broker or nominee is not instructed by the beneficial\nowner of shares to vote on a particular proposal for which the broker does not have discretionary voting power.\n\nIf you are a Rockwell Collins stockholder and you do not instruct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote your shares:\n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Share Issuance proposal, which broker non-votes, if\nany, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present); and \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (regardless of whether a quorum is present).\n\nIf you are a B/E Aerospace stockholder and you do not instruct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote your shares:\n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Merger proposal, which broker non-votes, if any, will\nhave the same effect as a vote AGAINST such proposal; \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Merger-Related Compensation proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present); and \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (regardless of whether a quorum is present).\n\n10\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n18/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nattend the special meeting? \n\nQ: When and where are the Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace special meetings of stockholders? What must I bring to\n\nA:\n\nThe special meeting of Rockwell Collins stockholders will be held at the Cedar Rapids Marriott, 1200 Collins Road NE, Cedar\nRapids, Iowa on March 9, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. (Central time). Subject to space availability, all Rockwell Collins stockholders as of\nthe Rockwell Collins record date, or their duly appointed proxies, may attend the meeting. Since seating is limited, admission to\nthe meeting will be on a first-come, first-served basis. Registration and seating will begin at 8:00 a.m. (Central time).\n\nThe special meeting of B/E Aerospace stockholders will be held at the Hilton Palm Beach Airport, 150 Australian Avenue, West\nPalm Beach, Florida, 33406-1473 on March 9, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern time). Subject to space availability, all B/E Aerospace\nstockholders as of the B/E Aerospace record date, or their duly appointed proxies, may attend the meeting. Since seating is limited,\nadmission to the meeting will be on a first-come, first-served basis. Registration and seating will begin at 9:30 a.m. (Eastern time).\n\nIf you wish to attend your respective company\'s special meeting, you must bring photo identification. If you hold your shares\nthrough a broker, bank or other nominee, you must also bring proof of ownership such as the voting instruction form from your\nbroker or other nominee or an account statement.\n\nQ: What if I fail to vote or abstain? \n\nA:\n\nFor purposes of each of the Rockwell Collins special meeting and the B/E Aerospace special meeting, an abstention occurs when a\nstockholder attends the applicable special meeting in person and does not vote or returns a proxy with an "abstain" instruction.\n\nRockwell Collins\n\nB/E Aerospace\n\nShare Issuance proposal:    An abstention will have the same effect as a vote "AGAINST" the Share Issuance proposal. If a\nRockwell Collins stockholder is not present in person at the Rockwell Collins special meeting and does not respond by proxy, it\nwill have no effect on the vote count for the Share Issuance proposal.\n\nRockwell Collins Adjournment proposal:    An abstention will have the same effect as a vote "AGAINST" the Rockwell Collins\nAdjournment proposal. If a Rockwell Collins stockholder is not present in person at the Rockwell Collins special meeting and does\nnot respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal (assuming a quorum\nis present).\n\nMerger proposal:    An abstention will have the same effect as a vote cast "AGAINST" the Merger proposal. If a B/E Aerospace\nstockholder is not present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and does not respond by proxy, it will have the effect of\na vote cast "AGAINST" such proposal.\n\nMerger-Related Compensation proposal:    An abstention will have no effect on the vote count for the Merger-Related\nCompensation proposal. If a B/E Aerospace stockholder is not present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and does not\nrespond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for the Merger-Related Compensation proposal (assuming a quorum is\npresent).\n\nB/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal:    An abstention will have no effect on the vote count for the B/E Aerospace Adjournment\nproposal. If a B/E Aerospace stockholder is not present in person at\n\n11\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n19/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nthe B/E Aerospace special meeting and does not respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal\n(assuming a quorum is present).\n\nQ: What will happen if I return my proxy or voting instruction card without indicating how to vote? \n\nIf you sign and return your proxy or voting instruction card without indicating how to vote on any particular proposal, the\nRockwell Collins common stock represented by your proxy will be voted as recommended by the Rockwell Collins Board with\nrespect to that proposal or the B/E Aerospace common stock represented by your proxy will be voted as recommended by the B/E\nAerospace Board with respect to that proposal, as applicable. Unless a Rockwell Collins stockholder or a B/E Aerospace\nstockholder, as applicable, checks the box on its proxy card to withhold discretionary authority, the applicable proxy holders may\nuse their discretion to vote on other matters relating to the Rockwell Collins special meeting or B/E Aerospace special meeting, as\napplicable. \n\nQ: What if I hold shares of both Rockwell Collins common stock and B/E Aerospace common stock? \n\nIf you are a stockholder of both Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace, you will receive two separate packages of proxy materials.\nA vote as a B/E Aerospace stockholder will not constitute a vote as a Rockwell Collins stockholder and vice versa. Therefore,\nplease sign, date and return all proxy cards that you receive, whether from Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, or vote as both a\nRockwell Collins stockholder and as a B/E Aerospace stockholder by Internet or telephone. \n\nMay I change or revoke my vote after I have delivered my proxy or voting instruction card? \n\nYes. If you are a record holder, you may change or revoke your vote before your proxy is voted at the Rockwell Collins or B/E\nAerospace special meeting as described herein. You may do this in one of the following four ways: \n\nA:\n\nA:\n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nby sending a notice of revocation to the corporate secretary of Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as applicable; \n\nby logging onto the Internet website specified on your proxy card in the same manner you would to submit your proxy\nelectronically or by calling the telephone number specified on your proxy card, in each case if you are eligible to do so; \n\nby sending a completed proxy card bearing a later date than your original proxy card; or \n\nby attending the Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace special meeting, as applicable, and voting in person.\n\nIf you choose any of the first three methods, you must take the described action no later than the beginning of the applicable\nspecial meeting.\n\nIf your shares are held in an account at a broker, bank or other nominee or through B/E Aerospace\'s 401(k) Plan or the Rockwell\nCollins Retirement Savings Plan and you have delivered your voting instruction card or otherwise given instruction on how to vote\nyour shares to your broker, bank or other nominee or your plan administrator, you should contact your broker, bank or other\nnominee or your plan administrator to change your vote.\n\nQ: What are the U.S. federal income tax consequences of the merger? \n\nA:\n\nThe exchange of B/E Aerospace common stock pursuant to the merger will be a taxable transaction for U.S. federal income tax\npurposes. Accordingly, a U.S. holder (as defined in "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences") of B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock who receives the merger consideration in exchange for such U.S. holder\'s shares of B/E Aerospace common\n\n12\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n20/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nstock generally will recognize taxable gain or loss in an amount equal to the difference, if any, between (i) the sum of the fair\nmarket value of the Rockwell Collins common stock and the amount of cash, including cash in lieu of fractional shares, received in\nthe merger and (ii) such U.S. holder\'s adjusted tax basis in the shares of B/E Aerospace common stock exchanged therefor. If you\nare a non-U.S. holder (as defined in "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94U.S. Federal Income Tax Consequences"), the merger generally will not result\nin tax to you under U.S. federal income tax laws unless you have certain connections with the United States.\n\nFor a more complete description of the U.S. federal income tax consequences of the merger, see "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94U.S. Federal\nIncome Tax Consequences" beginning on page 125.\n\nThis joint proxy statement/prospectus contains a general discussion of United States federal income tax consequences of the\nmerger. This description does not address any non-U.S. tax consequences, nor does it pertain to state, local or other tax\nconsequences. Consequently, you are urged to contact your own tax advisor to determine the particular tax consequences to\nyou of the merger.\n\nDo I have appraisal rights in connection with the transaction? \n\nQ:\n\nA:\n\nUnder Delaware law, Rockwell Collins stockholders will not be entitled to exercise any appraisal rights in connection with the\nmerger or any other transaction described in this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\nSubject to the closing of the merger, record holders of B/E Aerospace common stock who do not vote in favor of the adoption of\nthe merger agreement and otherwise comply fully with the requirements and procedures of Section 262 of the General Corporation\nLaw of the State of Delaware, which is referred to as the DGCL, may exercise their rights of appraisal, which generally entitle\nstockholders to receive a lump sum cash payment equal to the fair value of their B/E Aerospace common stock exclusive of any\nelement of value arising from the accomplishment or expectation of the merger. The "fair value" could be higher or lower than, or\nthe same as, the merger consideration. A detailed description of the appraisal rights and procedures available to B/E Aerospace\nstockholders is included in "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94Appraisal Rights" beginning on page 119. The full text of Section 262 of the DGCL is\nattached as Annex E to this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\nQ: What will happen to my B/E Aerospace stock-based awards? \n\nA:\n\nTreatment of B/E Aerospace Restricted Stock Awards and RSU Awards\n\nUpon completion of the merger, each outstanding award of B/E Aerospace restricted stock and each B/E Aerospace restricted stock\nunit award that in each case was granted prior to the date of the merger agreement will (i) become fully vested and, to the extent\nsuch award is subject to performance conditions, such performance conditions will be deemed satisfied at the maximum level and\n(ii) be cancelled and converted into the right to receive a lump sum cash payment per share of B/E Aerospace common stock\nunderlying such award equal to the value of the per share merger consideration, less any applicable withholding taxes. Upon\ncompletion of the merger, except for outstanding restricted stock unit awards granted to the executive officers of B/E Aerospace in\nNovember 2016, consistent with past practice, which will be cancelled and converted into a cash payment pursuant to their terms,\neach outstanding award of B/E Aerospace restricted stock and each B/E Aerospace restricted stock unit award that in each case was\ngranted on or following the date of the merger agreement will be assumed by Rockwell Collins and converted into a Rockwell\nCollins award of restricted stock or restricted stock unit award, as applicable, which will vest subject to the grantee\'s continued\nservice with Rockwell Collins or its affiliates through each applicable vesting date (with any performance conditions that were\n\n13\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n21/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\napplicable to the B/E Aerospace award deemed satisfied at target level performance and following the closing, the converted\nRockwell Collins award subject only to time-based vesting) covering a number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock\n(rounded down to the nearest whole share) determined by multiplying the number of shares of B/E Aerospace that were subject to\nthe B/E Aerospace award by a ratio of the value of the merger consideration divided by the Rockwell Collins stock price (with the\nvalue of the stock consideration portion of the merger consideration determined by multiplying the number of such shares of\nRockwell Collins common stock by the Rockwell Collins stock price).\n\nTreatment of B/E Aerospace Stock Units\n\nEach stock unit credited to the account of any current or former director under the B/E Aerospace Amended and Restated Non-\nEmployee Directors Stock and Deferred Compensation Plan that is outstanding immediately prior to the effective time of the\nmerger, which is referred to as the effective time, will be converted into the right to receive the merger consideration.\n\nFor a more complete description of the treatment of outstanding restricted stock unit awards granted to the executive officers of\nB/E Aerospace in November 2016, see "The Merger\xe2\x80\x94Interests of Directors and Executive Officers in the Merger" beginning on\npage 102.\n\nAny applicable withholding taxes resulting from this treatment will be satisfied by reducing the amount of cash, if any, that would\notherwise be provided to holders of such awards. If no cash is to be provided to a holder of such an award or if the amount of cash\nthat would otherwise be provided to a holder of such awards is not sufficient to cover the applicable withholding taxes, then the\nnumber of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that would otherwise be provided to the holder in accordance with the terms\ndescribed above will be reduced to the extent necessary to cover the shortfall.\n\nQ: What happens if I sell my shares of B/E Aerospace common stock after the record date but before the B/E Aerospace\n\nspecial meeting? \n\nA:\n\nA:\n\nA:\n\nThe record date for the B/E Aerospace special meeting (the close of business on January 18, 2017) is earlier than the date of the\nB/E Aerospace special meeting and earlier than the date that the merger is expected to be completed. If you sell or otherwise\ntransfer your shares of B/E Aerospace common stock after the record date but before the date of the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting, you will retain your right to vote at the B/E Aerospace special meeting. However, you will not have the right to receive\nthe merger consideration to be received by B/E Aerospace stockholders in the merger. In order to receive the merger consideration,\nyou must hold your shares through completion of the merger. \n\nQ: What happens if I sell my Rockwell Collins shares after the record date but before the Rockwell Collins special meeting? \n\nThe record date for the Rockwell Collins special meeting (the close of business on January 18, 2017) is earlier than the date of the\nRockwell Collins special meeting. If you sell or otherwise transfer your Rockwell Collins common shares after the record date but\nbefore the date of the Rockwell Collins special meeting, you will retain your right to vote at the Rockwell Collins special meeting. \n\nQ: Whom should I contact if I have any questions about the proxy materials or voting? \n\nIf you have any questions about the proxy materials, or if you need assistance submitting your proxy or voting your shares or need\nadditional copies of this joint proxy statement/prospectus or\n\n14\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n22/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nthe enclosed proxy card, you should contact the proxy solicitation agent for the company in which you hold shares.\n\nIf you are a Rockwell Collins stockholder, you should contact Innisfree M&A Incorporated, the proxy solicitation agent for\nRockwell Collins, at (877) 825-8772 or (212) 750-5833 (bankers and brokers call collect).\n\nIf you are a B/E Aerospace stockholder, you should contact Georgeson LLC, the proxy solicitation agent for B/E Aerospace, at\n(800) 509-0917 (toll free).\n\n15\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n23/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSUMMARY \n\n        This summary highlights selected information contained in this joint proxy statement/prospectus and does not contain all the\ninformation that may be important to you. Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace urge you to read carefully this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus in its entirety, including the annexes. Additional, important information, which Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace also urge you to read, is contained in the documents incorporated by reference into this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\nSee "Where You Can Find More Information" beginning on page 198. Unless stated otherwise, all references in this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus to Rockwell Collins are to Rockwell Collins, Inc., all references to B/E Aerospace are to B/E Aerospace, Inc.\nand all references to the merger agreement are to the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of October 23, 2016, by and among\nRockwell Collins, Inc., Quarterback Merger Sub Corp. and B/E Aerospace, Inc., a copy of which is attached as Annex A to this joint\nproxy statement/prospectus.\n\nThe Parties \n\nRockwell Collins\n\n        Rockwell Collins designs, produces and supports communications and aviation systems for commercial and military customers\nand provides information management services through voice and data communication networks and solutions worldwide. The\nintegrated system solutions and products Rockwell Collins provides to its served markets are oriented around a set of core\ncompetencies: communications, navigation, automated flight control, displays/surveillance, simulation and training, integrated\nelectronics and information management systems. Rockwell Collins also provides a wide range of services and support to its\ncustomers through a worldwide network of service centers, including equipment repair and overhaul, service parts, field service\nengineering, training, technical information services and aftermarket used equipment sales. The structure of Rockwell Collins\'\nbusiness allows it to leverage these core competencies across markets and applications to bring high value solutions to its\ncustomers.\n\n        Rockwell Collins serves a worldwide customer base through its three operating segments: Commercial Systems, Government\nSystems and Information Management Services. The Commercial Systems segment supplies aviation electronics systems, products\nand services to customers located throughout the world. The customer base consists of original equipment manufacturers of\ncommercial air transport, business and regional aircraft, commercial airlines and business aircraft operators. The Government\nSystems segment provides a broad range of electronic products, systems and services to customers including the U.S. Department of\nDefense, various ministries of defense, other government agencies and defense contractors around the world. These products,\nsystems and services support airborne, precision weapon, ground and maritime applications on new equipment as well as in retrofit\nand upgrade applications designed to extend the service life and enhance the capability of existing aircraft, vehicle and weapon\nplatforms. The Information Management Services segment provides communications services, systems integration and security\nsolutions across the aviation, airport, rail and nuclear security markets to customers located around the world. The customer base\nincludes commercial airlines, business aircraft operators, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), airport and critical\ninfrastructure operators and major passenger and freight railroads.\n\n        Rockwell Collins serves a broad range of customers worldwide, including the U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Coast Guard,\ncivil agencies, airports, defense contractors, foreign ministries of defense, manufacturers of commercial helicopters, manufacturers\nof commercial air transport, business and regional aircraft, commercial airlines, fractional and other business jet operators, the FAA,\ncritical infrastructure operators and major passenger and freight railroads. Rockwell Collins markets its systems, products and\nservices directly to its customers through an internal marketing and sales force. In addition, it utilizes a worldwide dealer network to\ndistribute its products and international sales representatives to assist with international sales and marketing. In 2016, various\nbranches of the U.S.\n\n16\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n24/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nGovernment, both directly and indirectly through subcontracts, accounted for 33% of Rockwell Collins\' total sales.\n\n        Rockwell Collins\' executive offices are located at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa 52498 and its telephone number is\n(319) 295-1000. Rockwell Collins\' website address is www.rockwellcollins.com. Information contained on Rockwell Collins\'\nwebsite does not constitute part of this joint proxy statement/prospectus. Rockwell Collins\' stock is publicly traded on the New York\nStock Exchange, which is referred to as the NYSE, under the ticker symbol "COL."\n\nB/E Aerospace\n\n        B/E Aerospace is a world leading manufacturer of aircraft cabin interior products. B/E Aerospace designs, develops and\nmanufactures a broad range of products for both commercial aircraft and business jets. B/E Aerospace\'s manufactured products\ninclude aircraft cabin seating, lighting systems, oxygen systems, food and beverage preparation and storage equipment, galley\nsystems, and modular lavatory systems. B/E Aerospace also provides cabin interior reconfiguration, program management and\ncertification services. B/E Aerospace sells and supports its products through its own global direct sales and product support\norganization.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s commercial aircraft segment includes seating products, interior systems, and engineering services for\ncommercial aircraft, and brazing technologies and electronic systems for the commercial and military aerospace markets. B/E\nAerospace has the design and engineering capabilities to create and manufacture highly customized products tailored to customers\'\nunique preferences. As an industry leading manufacturer of interior systems for both narrow- and wide-body aircraft,\nB/E Aerospace supplies food and beverage preparation equipment, galleys and galley air chillers, cabin lighting, oxygen systems\nand passenger service units (PSUs), lavatories, and water and waste systems. B/E Aerospace services also include optimizing cabin\nlayout and installing crew rest compartments. Additionally, B/E Aerospace is a market leader in the design, engineering, and\nmanufacturing of customized, fully integrated thermal management, power conversion, and interconnect solutions that address\ncomplex power management requirements. Revenues for the commercial aircraft segment in the third quarter of 2016 were\n$578.8 million.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s business jet segment manufactures products that include a complete line of business jet seating and divan\nproducts, super first class environments, lighting systems, air valves, water and waste systems, oxygen delivery systems, and de-\nicing systems. B/E Aerospace is internationally recognized as a leading supplier of business jet products and services for leading\nprominent business jet manufacturers and completion centers. Revenues for the business jet segment in the third quarter of 2016\nwere $153.9 million.\n\n        B/E Aerospace was founded by Amin and Bob Khoury in 1987 upon the acquisition of Bach Engineering. After acquiring\nEECO, Inc. in 1989, the company\'s name was changed to B/E Avionics. B/E Aerospace became a public company listed on The\nNASDAQ Stock Market, which is referred to as the NASDAQ, in April 1990. In 1992, B/E Aerospace acquired the assets of PTC\nAerospace, Inc. and Aircraft Products Company, transforming B/E Aerospace into a cabin interiors provider, and the company\'s\nname became "B/E Aerospace, Inc." Over the next 10 years, acquisitions of interior equipment companies established B/E\nAerospace as a broad based provider of interior equipment. Over the following decade, B/E Aerospace consolidated and integrated\nthe acquired businesses, developed a global direct sales and customer support organization and developed into a global market\nleading manufacturer of aircraft cabin interior equipment. In 2014, the Consumables Management Segment, which consisted of B/E\nAerospace\'s aerospace distribution and energy services businesses, was spun-off to form KLX, Inc., which is referred to as KLX.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s executive offices are located at 1400 Corporate Center Way, Wellington Florida, 33414, its website address is\nwww.beaerospace.com, and its phone number is (561) 791-5000.\n\n17\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n25/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nInformation contained on B/E Aerospace\'s website does not constitute part of this joint proxy statement/prospectus. B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock is listed on the NASDAQ, trading under the symbol "BEAV."\n\n        Merger Sub, a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins, is a Delaware corporation incorporated on October 19, 2016 for\nthe purpose of effecting the merger. Merger Sub has not conducted any activities other than those incidental to its formation and the\nmatters contemplated by the merger agreement, including the preparation of applicable regulatory filings in connection with the\nmerger. The principal executive offices of Merger Sub are located at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa 52498.\n\nTable of Contents\n\nMerger Sub\n\nThe Transaction \n\nMerger Agreement\n\n        On October 23, 2016, Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace and Merger Sub entered into the merger agreement, which provides\nthat, subject to the terms and conditions of the merger agreement and in accordance with the DGCL, Merger Sub will merge with\nand into B/E Aerospace, with B/E Aerospace continuing as the surviving corporation and a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell\nCollins.\n\nAmendment to Tax Sharing Agreement\n\n        In connection with entry into the merger agreement, B/E Aerospace and KLX entered into a first amendment to the Tax\nSharing and Indemnification Agreement, dated as of December 15, 2014, which is referred to as the KLX tax sharing agreement.\nThe KLX tax sharing agreement was originally entered into in connection with B/E Aerospace\'s contribution of assets to KLX, B/E\nAerospace\'s repayment of certain debt obligations with the proceeds of a cash distribution from KLX, and B/E Aerospace\'s\ndistribution of the stock of KLX, all in December of 2014, in transactions intended to qualify for tax-free treatment under\nSections 355, 361 and 368(a)(1)(D) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, which transactions, collectively, are\nreferred to as the KLX spin-off and which tax treatment is referred to as the KLX spin-off tax treatment. Among other things, the\nKLX tax sharing agreement sets forth the allocation between B/E Aerospace and KLX of liabilities for taxes arising prior to, as a\nresult of, and subsequent to the KLX spin-off and certain related restructuring transactions and sets out certain restrictions on the\nactivities of both B/E Aerospace and KLX following the KLX spin-off.\n\n        The amendment to the KLX tax sharing agreement modifies a requirement under the KLX tax sharing agreement relating to\nthe ability of B/E Aerospace to enter into certain transactions after the KLX spin-off. In satisfaction of this modified requirement,\nB/E Aerospace provided KLX with an opinion that B/E Aerospace received from its tax advisor, Shearman & Sterling LLP, which\nis referred to as Shearman & Sterling, relating to the impact of the merger on the KLX spin-off tax treatment. In addition, pursuant\nto the terms of the amendment to the KLX tax sharing agreement, KLX delivered a representation letter to Shearman & Sterling, for\npurposes of such opinion. This opinion relies on certain representations, assumptions, undertakings and covenants, from KLX,\nB/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins and the conclusion set forth in the opinion may be adversely affected if one or more of the\nrepresentations and assumptions is incorrect or one or more of the undertakings and covenants is not complied with.\n\nConsideration to be Received in the Merger by B/E Aerospace Stockholders \n\n        At the effective time, each share of B/E Aerospace common stock that is issued and outstanding immediately prior to the\neffective time (other than (i) shares of B/E Aerospace common stock owned\n\n18\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n26/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nor held directly or indirectly by Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace (including as treasury stock) or Merger Sub, which will be\ncancelled immediately prior to the effective time, and (ii) shares of B/E Aerospace common stock with respect to which appraisal\nrights are properly demanded and not withdrawn under Section 262 of the DGCL) will be converted into the right to receive $34.10\nin cash, without interest, which is referred to as the cash consideration, and a fraction of a validly issued, fully paid and non-\nassessable share of Rockwell Collins common stock having a value equal to $27.90 (subject to adjustment based upon a two-way\ncollar mechanism), which is referred to as the stock consideration. The exchange ratio will be determined based upon the Rockwell\nCollins stock price, as described in more detail in "The Merger Agreement\xe2\x80\x94Merger Consideration to be Received by\nB/E Aerospace Stockholders" beginning on page 128. If the Rockwell Collins stock price is greater than or equal to $77.41 and less\nthan or equal to $89.97, the exchange ratio will be equal to the quotient of (a) $27.90 divided by (b) the Rockwell Collins stock\nprice, which, in each case, will result in the stock consideration having a value equal to $27.90. If the Rockwell Collins stock price\nis less than $77.41 or greater than $89.97, then the two-way collar mechanism will apply pursuant to which, (1) if the Rockwell\nCollins stock price is greater than $89.97, the exchange ratio will be fixed at 0.3101 and the value of the stock consideration will be\nmore than $27.90, and (2) if the Rockwell Collins stock price is less than $77.41, the exchange ratio will be fixed at 0.3604 and the\nvalue of the stock consideration will be less than $27.90. Upon the completion of the merger, based on minimum and maximum\nexchange ratios of 0.3101 and 0.3604, the estimated number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock issuable as a portion of\nthe merger consideration is between 31.1 million shares and 36.1 million shares, which will result in former B/E Aerospace\nstockholders holding approximately 19.2% to 21.7% of the outstanding Rockwell Collins common stock, based on the number of\noutstanding shares of common stock and outstanding stock-based awards of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace as of January 26,\n2017. For more details on the shares of Rockwell Collins common stock and other consideration to be received by B/E Aerospace\nstockholders, see "The Merger Agreement\xe2\x80\x94Merger Consideration to be Received by B/E Aerospace Stockholders" beginning on\npage 128 of this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\n        All fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that would otherwise be issued to a B/E Aerospace stockholder as part\nof the merger consideration will be aggregated to create whole shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that will be issued to B/E\nAerospace stockholders as part of the merger consideration. If a fractional share of Rockwell Collins common stock remains\npayable to a B/E Aerospace stockholder after aggregating all fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock payable to such\nB/E Aerospace stockholder, then such B/E Aerospace stockholder will be paid, in lieu of such remaining fractional share of\nRockwell Collins common stock, an amount in cash, without interest, rounded down to the nearest cent, equal to the product of\n(x) the amount of the fractional share interest in a share of Rockwell Collins common stock to which such holder would otherwise\nbe entitled (rounded to three decimal places) and (y) the Rockwell Collins stock price.\n\nTreatment of Stock-Based Awards \n\nB/E Aerospace\n\nTreatment of B/E Aerospace Restricted Stock Awards and RSU Awards\n\n        Upon completion of the merger, each outstanding award of B/E Aerospace restricted stock and each B/E Aerospace restricted\nstock unit award that in each case was granted prior to the date of the merger agreement will (i) become fully vested and, to the\nextent such award is subject to performance conditions, such performance conditions will be deemed satisfied at the maximum level\nand (ii) be cancelled and converted into the right to receive a lump sum cash payment per share of B/E Aerospace common stock\nunderlying such award equal to the value of the per share merger consideration, less any applicable withholding taxes. Upon\ncompletion of the merger, except for outstanding restricted stock unit awards granted to the executive officers of B/E Aerospace in\nNovember 2016, consistent with past\n\n19\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n27/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\npractice, which will be cancelled and converted into a cash payment pursuant to their terms, each outstanding award of B/E\nAerospace restricted stock and each B/E Aerospace restricted stock unit award that in each case was granted on or following the\ndate of the merger agreement will be assumed by Rockwell Collins and converted into a Rockwell Collins award of restricted stock\nor restricted stock unit award, as applicable, which will vest subject to the grantee\'s continued service with Rockwell Collins or its\naffiliates through each applicable vesting date (with any performance conditions that were applicable to the B/E Aerospace award\ndeemed satisfied at target level performance and, following the closing, the converted Rockwell Collins award subject only to
