and \n\ncertain internal financial analyses and forecasts for B/E Aerospace prepared by its management and for Rockwell Collins\nprepared by its management, in each case, as approved for Goldman Sachs\' use by B/E Aerospace (which is referred to as\nthe Forecasts) and certain operating synergies projected by the managements of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins to\nresult from the transaction, as approved for Goldman Sachs\' use by B/E Aerospace (which is referred to as the Synergies).\n\n        Goldman Sachs also held discussions with members of the senior managements of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins regarding\ntheir assessment of the strategic rationale for, and the potential benefits of, the merger and the past and current business operations,\nfinancial condition and future prospects of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins; reviewed the reported price and trading activity for\nshares of B/E Aerospace common stock and shares of Rockwell Collins common stock; compared certain financial and stock market\ninformation for B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins with similar information for certain other companies the securities of which are\npublicly traded; reviewed the financial terms of certain recent business combinations in the aerospace and defense industry and in other\nindustries; and performed such other studies and analyses, and considered such other factors, as it deemed appropriate.\n\n        For purposes of rendering its opinion, Goldman Sachs, with B/E Aerospace\'s consent, relied upon and assumed the accuracy and\ncompleteness of all of the financial, legal, regulatory, tax, accounting and other information provided to, discussed with or reviewed by, it,\nwithout assuming any responsibility for independent verification thereof. In that regard, Goldman Sachs assumed with B/E Aerospace\'s\nconsent that the Forecasts and Synergies were reasonably prepared on a basis reflecting the best currently available estimates and\njudgments of the management of B/E Aerospace. Goldman Sachs did not make an independent evaluation or appraisal of the assets and\nliabilities (including any contingent, derivative or other off-balance-sheet assets and liabilities) of B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins or\nany of their respective subsidiaries and it was not furnished with any such evaluation or appraisal. Goldman Sachs assumed that all\ngovernmental, regulatory or other consents and approvals necessary for the consummation of the merger will be obtained without any\nadverse effect on B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins or on the expected benefits of the merger in any way\n\n85\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n97/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nmeaningful to its analysis. Goldman Sachs has also assumed that the merger will be consummated on the terms set forth in the merger\nagreement, without the waiver or modification of any term or condition the effect of which would be in any way meaningful to its analysis.\n\n        Goldman Sachs\' opinion does not address the underlying business decision of B/E Aerospace to engage in the merger or the relative\nmerits of the merger as compared to any strategic alternatives that may be available to B/E Aerospace; nor does it address any legal,\nregulatory, tax or accounting matters. Goldman Sachs\' opinion addresses only the fairness from a financial point of view to the holders\n(other than Rockwell Collins and its affiliates) of outstanding shares of common stock of B/E Aerospace, as of the date of the opinion, of\nthe merger consideration to be paid to such holders pursuant to the Merger Agreement. Goldman Sachs\' opinion does not express any view\non, and does not address, any other term or aspect of the merger agreement or the merger or any term or aspect of any other agreement or\ninstrument contemplated by the merger agreement or entered into or amended in connection with the merger, including the fairness of the\nmerger to, or any consideration received in connection therewith by, the holders of any other class of securities, creditors, or other\nconstituencies of B/E Aerospace; nor as to the fairness of the amount or nature of any compensation to be paid or payable to any of the\nofficers, directors or employees of B/E Aerospace, or class of such persons in connection with the merger, whether relative to the merger\nconsideration to be paid to the holders (other than Rockwell Collins and its affiliates) of outstanding shares of common stock of\nB/E Aerospace pursuant to the merger agreement or otherwise. In addition, Goldman Sachs does not express any opinion as to the prices at\nwhich shares of common stock of Rockwell Collins will trade at any time or as to the impact of the merger on the solvency or viability of\nB/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins or the ability of B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins to pay their respective obligations when they\ncome due. Goldman Sachs\' opinion was necessarily based on economic, monetary, market and other conditions, as in effect on, and the\ninformation made available to it as of, the date of the opinion and Goldman Sachs assumed no responsibility for updating, revising or\nreaffirming its opinion based on circumstances, developments or events occurring after the date of its opinion. Goldman Sachs\' opinion\nwas approved by a fairness committee of Goldman Sachs.\n\n        Goldman Sachs and its affiliates are engaged in advisory, underwriting and financing, principal investing, sales and trading, research,\ninvestment management and other financial and non-financial activities and services for various persons and entities. Goldman Sachs and\nits affiliates and employees, and funds or other entities in which they invest or have other economic interests or with which they co-invest,\nmay at any time purchase, sell, hold or vote long or short positions and investments in securities, derivatives, loans, commodities,\ncurrencies, credit default swaps and other financial instruments of B/E Aerospace, Rockwell Collins, any of their respective affiliates and\nthird parties, or any currency or commodity that may be involved in the merger contemplated by the merger agreement. Goldman Sachs\nacted as financial advisor to B/E Aerospace in connection with, and participated in certain of the negotiations leading to, the merger\ncontemplated by the merger agreement. Goldman Sachs has provided certain financial advisory and/or underwriting services to\nB/E Aerospace and/or its affiliates from time to time for which the Investment Banking Division of Goldman Sachs has received, and may\nreceive, compensation, including having acted as book manager with respect to a private offering of KLX, a former subsidiary of\nB/E Aerospace, 5.875% Senior Notes due 2022 (aggregate principal amount of $1,200,000,000) in November 2014; as lead arranger with\nrespect to B/E Aerospace\'s term loan (aggregate principal amount of $2,200,000,000) put in place in November 2014; as B/E Aerospace\'s\nfinancial advisor in connection with the KLX spin-off in December 2014; and as a participant in B/E Aerospace\'s revolving credit facility\n(aggregate principal amount of $600,000,000) put in place in December 2014. During the two year period ended October 23, 2016,\nGoldman Sachs has received compensation for financial advisory and/or underwriting services provided by its Investment Banking\nDivision directly to B/E Aerospace and/or to its affiliates of approximately $9,900,000. During the two-year period ended October 23,\n2016, Goldman Sachs has not been engaged by Rockwell Collins or its affiliates to provide financial advisory or underwriting services for\nwhich the\n\n86\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n98/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nInvestment Banking Division of Goldman Sachs has received compensation. Goldman Sachs may also in the future provide financial\nadvisory and/or underwriting services to B/E Aerospace, Rockwell Collins and their respective affiliates for which the Investment Banking\nDivision of Goldman Sachs may receive compensation.\n\n        The B/E Aerospace Board selected Goldman Sachs as its financial advisor because it is an internationally recognized investment\nbanking firm that has substantial experience in transactions similar to the merger. Pursuant to a letter agreement dated September 6, 2016,\nB/E Aerospace engaged Goldman Sachs to act as its financial advisor in connection with the merger. The engagement letter between\nB/E Aerospace and Goldman Sachs provides for a transaction fee that is estimated, based on the information available as of the date of\nannouncement, at approximately $27.3 million, $5 million of which became payable at announcement of the transaction, and the\nremainder of which is contingent upon consummation of the transaction. In addition, B/E Aerospace has agreed to reimburse Goldman\nSachs for certain of its expenses, including attorneys\' fees and disbursements, and to indemnify Goldman Sachs and related persons against\nvarious liabilities, including certain liabilities under the federal securities laws.\n\nFinancial Analyses by Financial Co-Advisors \n\n        The following is a summary of the material financial analyses delivered by Citigroup and Goldman Sachs, referred to as the financial\nco-advisors, to the B/E Aerospace Board in connection with rendering their respective opinions described above. The following summary,\nhowever, does not purport to be a complete description of the financial analyses performed by the financial co-advisors, nor does the order\nof analyses described represent relative importance or weight given to those analyses by the financial co-advisors. Some of the summaries\nof the financial analyses include information presented in tabular format. The tables must be read together with the full text of each\nsummary and are alone not a complete description of the financial co-advisors\' financial analyses. Except as otherwise noted, the following\nquantitative information, to the extent that it is based on market data, is based on market data as it existed on or before October 20, 2016,\nand is not necessarily indicative of current market conditions.\n\n        The preparation of financial opinions is a complex process involving various determinations as to the most appropriate and relevant\nmethods of financial analysis and the application of those methods to the particular circumstances and, therefore, financial opinions are not\nreadily susceptible to partial analysis or summary description. Selecting portions of the analyses or of the summary set forth below,\nwithout considering the analyses as a whole, could create an incomplete view of the processes underlying each financial co-advisor\nopinion. In arriving at their respective fairness determinations, the financial co-advisors considered the results of all of their analyses and\ndid not attribute any particular weight to any factor or analysis considered by them. Rather, each financial co-advisor made its\ndetermination as to fairness on the basis of its experience and professional judgment after considering the results of all of its analyses. No\ncompany or transaction used in the above analyses as a comparison is directly comparable to B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins or the\ncontemplated merger.\n\n        The financial co-advisors prepared these analyses for purposes of providing their respective opinions to the B/E Aerospace Board as\nto the fairness, from a financial point of view, to the holders (other than Rockwell Collins and its affiliates) of outstanding shares of\ncommon stock of B/E Aerospace, as of the date of the opinions, of the merger consideration to be paid to such holders pursuant to the\nmerger agreement. These analyses do not purport to be appraisals nor do they necessarily reflect the prices at which businesses or\nsecurities actually may be sold. Analyses based upon forecasts of future results are not necessarily indicative of actual future results, which\nmay be significantly more or less favorable than suggested by these analyses. Because these analyses are inherently subject to uncertainty,\nbeing based upon numerous factors or events beyond the control of the parties or their respective advisors, none of B/E Aerospace,\nRockwell Collins, Citigroup, Goldman\n\n87\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n99/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSachs or any other person assumes responsibility if future results are materially different from those forecast.\n\n        The merger consideration was determined through arm\'s-length negotiations between B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins, rather\nthan by any financial advisor, and was approved by the B/E Aerospace Board. The financial co-advisors provided advice to B/E Aerospace\nduring these negotiations. The financial co-advisors did not, however, recommend any specific amount of consideration to B/E Aerospace\nor the B/E Aerospace Board or that any specific amount of consideration constituted the only appropriate consideration for the transaction.\n\n        As described above, each financial co-advisor\'s opinion to the B/E Aerospace Board was one of many factors taken into consideration\nby the B/E Aerospace Board in making its determination to approve the merger agreement. The foregoing summary does not purport to be\na complete description of the analyses performed by the financial co-advisors in connection with their respective fairness opinions and is\nqualified in its entirety by reference to their respective written opinions attached as Annex C for Citigroup and Annex D for Goldman\nSachs.\n\n        Historical Stock Trading Analysis.    The financial co-advisors first calculated $62.00 as the implied value of the per share merger\nconsideration (which we refer to as the "implied per share consideration") by adding the cash consideration of $34.10 per share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock to $27.90, the implied value of the stock portion of the per share merger consideration based on the closing\nprice per share of Rockwell Collins common stock on October 20, 2016.\n\n        The financial co-advisors then reviewed the historical trading prices for B/E Aerospace common stock and compared the implied per\nshare consideration to the closing price per share of B/E Aerospace common stock as of October 20, 2016, the volume weighted average\nprices per share of B/E Aerospace common stock for the 30-day and 90-day periods ended October 20, 2016, the intra-day high price per\nshare of B/E Aerospace common stock for the 52-week period ended October 20, 2016, and the closing price per share of B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock as of July 20, 2016 (the date of the initial meeting between the managements of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins to\ndiscuss a potential merger).\n\n        This analysis indicated that the implied per share consideration to be paid to the holders (other than Rockwell Collins and its\naffiliates) of outstanding shares of common stock of B/E Aerospace pursuant to the merger agreement represented:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\na premium of 22.4% to the closing price of $50.65 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock as of October 20, 2016; \n\na premium of 22.5% to the volume weighted average price of $50.61 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock for the 30-\nday period ended October 20, 2016; \n\na premium of 28.4% to the volume weighted average price of $48.30 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock for the 90-\nday period ended October 20, 2016; \n\na premium of 16.4% to the 52-week intraday high price of $53.25 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock for the 52-\nweek period ended October 20, 2016; and \n\na premium of 33.8% to the closing price of $46.34 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock as of July 20, 2016.\n\n        Implied Premia Analysis for U.S. Transactions.    For each year from 2013 through 2016 (as of October 6, 2016), the financial co-\nadvisors calculated, using publicly available information, the first quartile, median and third quartile one-day unaffected stock price premia\npaid in such year for acquisition transactions announced in such year (expressed as a percentage of the merger consideration on the trading\nday prior to either (i) the announcement of the transaction or (ii) the date on which either the target confirmed a sale process or merger\ntalks in the six months leading up to the\n\n88\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n100/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ntransaction or rumors surfaced in the month leading up to the transaction). This analysis covered transactions announced or completed in\nthis time period involving U.S. domiciled companies where the consideration exceeded $500 million and consisted of a mixture of cash\nand stock. The analysis excluded transactions in the financial institutions and real estate sectors as well as transactions with premia below\n0%. The analysis indicated a first quartile, median and third quartile one-day unaffected stock premia of 18.5%, 27.7% and 41.7%,\nrespectively. The financial co-advisors then multiplied the 18.5%-41.7% range of premia to the closing price of $51.35 per share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock as of October 17, 2016, which resulted in an illustrative range of prices per share of B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock of $60.75 to $72.75 (rounded to the nearest $0.25).\n\n        Selected Transactions Analysis.    The financial co-advisors analyzed certain publicly available information relating to the following\nselected transactions in the aerospace and defense industry since September 2011:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nBerkshire Hathaway Inc./Precision Castparts Corp. (announced August 2015) \n\nRBC Bearings Incorporated/Sargent Aerospace and Defense (announced March 2015) \n\nTransDigm Group Incorporated/Telair Cargo Group (announced February 2015) \n\nCobham plc/Aeroflex Inc. (announced May 2014) \n\nRockwell Collins, Inc./Aeronautical Radio, Incorporated (announced August 2013) \n\nGeneral Electric Company/Avio S.p.A. (announced December 2012) \n\nUnited Technologies Corporation/Goodrich Corporation (announced September 2011)\n\n        For each of the selected transactions, the financial co-advisors calculated and compared FV as a multiple of the target\'s EBITDA for\nthe last 12 months as most recently disclosed at the time of the announcement of the transaction (which we refer to as the FV/LTM\nEBITDA Multiple). While none of the companies that participated in the selected transactions are directly comparable to B/E Aerospace,\nthe target companies that participated in the selected transactions are companies with operations that, for the purposes of analysis, may be\nconsidered similar to certain of B/E Aerospace\'s results, market size and product profile. In addition, the financial co-advisors calculated\nthe FV/LTM EBITDA Multiple of B/E Aerospace, using the implied per share consideration and B/E Aerospace\'s EBITDA for the\n12 months ended September 30, 2016 as provided to the financial co-advisors by the management of B/E Aerospace.\n\n        The following tables present the results of this analysis:\n\nMonth/Year Announced\nAugust 2015\nMarch 2015\nFebruary 2015\nMay 2014\nAugust 2013\nDecember 2012\nSeptember 2011\n\nAcquiror\n\n \n  Berkshire Hathaway Inc.\n  RBC Bearings Incorporated\n  TransDigm Group Incorporated\n  Cobham plc\n  Rockwell Collins, Inc.\n  General Electric Company\n  United Technologies Corporation\n\nTarget/Seller\n\n \n  Precision Castparts Corp.\n  Sargent Aerospace & Defense\n  Telair Cargo Group\n  Aeroflex Inc.\n  Aeronautical Radio, Incorporated\n  Avio S.p.A.\n  Goodrich Corporation\n\nFV/LTM\nEBITDA\n\n \n\n \n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n\n13.2x \n13.3x(1)\n12.1x \n11.4x \n12.6x \n8.5x \n12.9x \n\n(1)\n\nReflects $500 million headline value. The financial co-advisors then applied the 11.6x to 13.6x range of FV/LTM EBITDA Multiples to\nB/E Aerospace\'s EBITDA for the last 12 months ended September 30, 2016 as provided to the financial co-advisors by the management of\nB/E Aerospace, which resulted in a range of illustrative prices per share of B/E Aerospace common stock of $50.00 to $61.75 (rounded to\nthe nearest $0.25).\n\n        Illustrative Present Value of Future Share Price Analysis\xe2\x80\x94B/E Aerospace Standalone.    The financial co-advisors performed an\nillustrative analysis of the implied present value of the future price per share of B/E Aerospace common stock (including the present value\nof projected dividends).\n\n        The financial co-advisors first calculated an illustrative range of the implied future values per share of B/E Aerospace common stock\nas of the end of each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, respectively, by applying a forward earnings per share multiple range of 13.5x to\n15.0x to the estimated earnings per share for B/E Aerospace for each of the fiscal years from 2018 to 2021 using the Forecasts. The\nfinancial co-advisors then discounted these implied future values per share to determine the implied present values as of September 30,\n2016 using an illustrative discount rate of 10.0% reflecting an estimate of B/E Aerospace\'s cost of equity. The financial co-advisors then,\nfor each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, used the same illustrative discount rate to discount the future values per share of projected\ndividends from September 30, 2016 through and including the applicable fiscal year (using the Forecasts) to determine the implied present\nvalues of such projected dividends as of September 30, 2016, and added such implied present values of the projected dividends to the\nrange of present values it derived above. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of $52.29 to $61.06 per share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock.\n\n        The financial co-advisors also used the Forecasts to calculate an illustrative range of the implied future values per share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock as of the end of each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, respectively, by applying a price to next 12 months\nearnings per share multiple of 14.2x, which represented B/E Aerospace\'s standalone next 12 months earnings per share multiple as of\nOctober 17, 2016 based on IBES estimates, to the earnings per share of B/E Aerospace for each of the fiscal years from 2018 to 2021 using\nthe Forecasts and then discounted these implied future values per share to determine the implied present values as of September 30, 2016\nusing an illustrative discount rate range of 9.0% to 10.5%, reflecting an estimate of B/E Aerospace\'s cost of equity. The financial co-\nadvisors then, for each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, used the same illustrative range of discount rates to discount the future values per\nshare of projected dividends from September 30, 2016 through and including the applicable fiscal year (using the Forecasts) to determine a\nrange of the implied present values of such projected dividends as of September 30, 2016, and added such range of implied present values\nof the projected dividends to the range of present values it derived above. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of\n$54.64 to $60.23 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock.\n\n        Illustrative Present Value of Future Share Price Analysis\xe2\x80\x94Rockwell Collins Standalone.    The financial co-advisors performed an\nillustrative analysis of the implied present value of the future price per share of Rockwell Collins common stock (including the present\nvalue of projected dividends).\n\n        The financial co-advisors first calculated an illustrative range of the implied future values per share of Rockwell Collins common\nstock for each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, respectively, by applying a forward earnings per share multiple range of 14.0x to 15.5x to\nthe estimated earnings per share of Rockwell Collins for each of the fiscal years from 2018 to 2021 using the Forecasts and then\ndiscounted these implied future values per share to determine the implied present values as of September 30, 2016 using an illustrative\ndiscount rate of 8.5%, reflecting an estimate of Rockwell Collins\' cost of equity. The financial co-advisors then, for each of the fiscal years\n2017 to 2020, used the same illustrative discount rate to discount the future values per share of projected dividends from September 30,\n2016 through and including the applicable fiscal year (using the Forecasts) to determine the implied present values of such projected\ndividends as of September 30, 2016, and added such implied present values of\n\n90\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n102/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nthe projected dividends to the range of present values it derived above. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of\n$75.14 to $96.92 per share of Rockwell Collins common stock.\n\n        The financial co-advisors also calculated an illustrative range of the implied future values per share of Rockwell Collins common\nstock for each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, respectively, by applying a price to next 12 months earnings per share multiple of 14.8x,\nwhich represented Rockwell Collins\' standalone next 12 month earnings per share multiple as of October 17, 2016 based on IBES\nestimates, to the earnings per share for Rockwell Collins for each of the fiscal years from 2018 to 2021 using the Forecasts and then\ndiscounted these implied future values per share to determine the implied present values as of September 30, 2016 using an illustrative\ndiscount rate range of 7.5% to 9.0%, reflecting an estimate of Rockwell Collins\' cost of equity. The financial co-advisors then, for each of\nthe fiscal years 2017 to 2020, used the same illustrative range of discount rates to discount the future values per share of projected\ndividends from September 30, 2016 through and including the applicable fiscal year (using the Forecasts) to determine a range of the\nimplied present values of such projected dividends as of September 30, 2016, and added such range of implied present values of the\nprojected dividends to the range of present values it derived above. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of $78.99 to\n$96.17 per share of Rockwell Collins common stock.\n\n        Illustrative Present Value of Future Pro Forma Combined Company Share Price Analysis Plus Cash Consideration.    The financial\nco-advisors performed an illustrative analysis of the implied present value of the future price per share of the combined company\'s\ncommon stock (including the present value of projected dividends) pro forma for consummation of the merger to determine an illustrative\nrange of the implied present values of the portion of the per share merger consideration consisting of Rockwell Collins common stock and\nadded the per share cash consideration to be paid pursuant to the merger to determine an illustrative range of the implied present values of\nthe per share merger consideration into which each share of B/E Aerospace common stock converts in the merger.\n\n        The financial co-advisors calculated the implied future values per share of the pro forma combined company\'s common stock for each\nof the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, respectively, by applying a price to next 12 months earnings per share multiple of 14.6x, which\nrepresented the blended next 12 month earnings per share multiple for B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins as of October 17, 2016 based\non IBES estimates, to the earnings per share of the pro forma combined company for each of the fiscal years from 2018 to 2021 using the\nForecasts (including the Synergies), and then discounted these implied future values per share to determine the implied present values as\nof September 30, 2016 using an illustrative discount rate range of 8.5% to 10%, reflecting an estimate of the pro forma combined\ncompany\'s cost of equity. The financial co-advisors then, for each of the fiscal years 2017 to 2020, used the same illustrative range of\ndiscount rates to discount the future values per share of projected dividends from September 30, 2016 through and including the applicable\nfiscal year (using the Forecasts and including the Synergies) to determine a range of the implied present values of such projected dividends\nas of September 30, 2016, and added such range of implied present values of the projected dividends to the range of present values it\nderived above. The financial co-advisors then multiplied the resulting range of implied present values for shares (which included the\npresent values of project dividends) of the pro forma combined company\'s common stock by an assumed exchange ratio of Rockwell\nCollins common stock for each share of B/E Aerospace stock (determined by using the closing price per share of Rockwell Collins\ncommon stock on October 17, 2016), and added the product of that calculation to the $34.10 in per share cash consideration to be paid to\nholders of B/E Aerospace common stock in the merger. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of the per share merger\nconsideration, into which each share of B/E Aerospace common stock converts in the merger, of $63.17 to $67.57.\n\n        Illustrative Discounted Cash Flow Analysis\xe2\x80\x94B/E Aerospace Standalone.    Using the Forecasts, the financial co-advisors performed\nan illustrative discounted cash flow analysis on B/E Aerospace. Using discount rates ranging from 7.75% to 9.25%, reflecting estimates of\nB/E Aerospace\'s weighted average\n\n91\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n103/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ncost of capital and derived by application of the Capital Asset Pricing Model, which takes into account certain company-specific metrics,\nincluding B/E Aerospace\'s target capital structure, the cost of long-term debt, after-tax yield on permanent excess cash, if any, forecast tax\nrate and beta, as well as certain financial metrics for the United States financial markets generally, the financial co-advisors discounted to\npresent value as of September 30, 2016, (i) estimates of unlevered free cash flow for B/E Aerospace for the fourth calendar quarter of 2016\nand the calendar years 2017 through 2021 as reflected in the Forecasts and (ii) a range of illustrative terminal values for B/E Aerospace,\nwhich was calculated by applying a last 12 months EBITDA multiple ranging from 10.5x to 12.0x to the terminal year estimate of the last\n12 months of EBITDA for B/E Aerospace, as reflected in the Forecasts. The financial co-advisors derived ranges of illustrative FVs for\nB/E Aerospace by adding the ranges of present values derived above. The financial co-advisors then subtracted from the range of\nillustrative FVs it derived for B/E Aerospace the $1.938 billion of net debt of B/E Aerospace as of September 30, 2016 as provided by the\nmanagement of B/E Aerospace to derive a range of illustrative equity values for B/E Aerospace. The financial co-advisors then divided\nthis range of illustrative equity values by the number of fully diluted outstanding shares of B/E Aerospace as provided by the management\nof B/E Aerospace to derive a range of illustrative present values ranging from $59.15 to $73.02 per share of B/E Aerospace common stock.\n\n        Illustrative Discounted Cash Flow Analysis\xe2\x80\x94Rockwell Collins Standalone.    Using the Forecasts, the financial co-advisors\nperformed an illustrative discounted cash flow analysis on Rockwell Collins. Using discount rates ranging from 7.00% to 8.00%,\nreflecting estimates of Rockwell Collin\'s weighted average cost of capital and derived by application of the Capital Asset Pricing Model,\nwhich takes into account certain company-specific metrics, including Rockwell Collins\' target capital structure, the cost of long-term debt,\nafter-tax yield on permanent excess cash, if any, forecast tax rate and beta, as well as certain financial metrics for the United States\nfinancial markets generally, the financial co-advisors discounted to present value as of September 30, 2016, (i) estimates of unlevered free\ncash flow for Rockwell Collins for the fiscal years ending on September 30, 2017 through September 30, 2021 as reflected in the Forecasts\nand (ii) a range of illustrative terminal values for Rockwell Collins, which was calculated by applying a last 12 months EBITDA multiple\nranging from 9.5x to 11.0x to the terminal year estimate of the last 12 months of EBITDA for Rockwell Collins, as reflected in the\nForecasts. The financial co-advisors derived ranges of illustrative FVs for Rockwell Collins by adding the ranges of present values derived\nabove. The financial co-advisors then subtracted from the range of illustrative FVs it derived for Rockwell Collins the $1.755 billion of net\ndebt of Rockwell Collins as of September 30, 2016, as provided by the management of Rockwell Collins and as approved for the financial\nco-advisors\' use by B/E Aerospace, to derive a range of illustrative equity values for Rockwell Collins. The financial co-advisors then\ndivided this range of illustrative equity values by the number of fully diluted outstanding shares of Rockwell Collins, as provided by the\nmanagement of Rockwell Collins and as approved for the financial co-advisors\' use by B/E Aerospace, to derive a range of illustrative\npresent values ranging from $104.52 to $125.33 per share of Rockwell Collins common stock.\n\n        Illustrative Discounted Cash Flow Analysis\xe2\x80\x94Pro Forma for Combined Company Plus Cash Consideration.    Using the Forecasts\n(including the Synergies), the financial co-advisors performed an illustrative discounted cash flow analysis on the pro forma combined\ncompany to determine an illustrative range of implied present values of the portion of the per share merger consideration consisting of\nRockwell Collins common stock and added the per share cash consideration to be paid pursuant to the merger to determine an illustrative\nrange of the implied present values of the per share merger consideration into which each share of B/E Aerospace common stock converts\nin the merger. Using discount rates ranging from 7.25% to 8.50%, reflecting estimates of the pro forma combined company\'s weighted\naverage cost of capital and derived by application of the Capital Asset Pricing Model, which takes into account certain company-specific\nmetrics, including the pro forma combined company\'s target capital structure, the cost of long-term debt, after-tax yield on permanent\nexcess cash,\n\n92\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n104/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nif any, forecast tax rate and beta, as well as certain financial metrics for the United States financial markets generally, the financial co-\nadvisors discounted to present value as of September 30, 2016, (i) estimates of unlevered free cash flow for the pro forma combined\ncompany for the fiscal years ending on September 30, 2017 through September 30, 2021 as reflected in the Forecasts and including the\nSynergies, and (ii) a range of illustrative terminal values for the pro forma combined company, which was calculated by applying a last 12\nmonths EBITDA multiple ranging from 9.75x to 11.25x to the terminal year estimate of last 12 months EBITDA for the pro forma\ncombined company, as reflected in the Forecasts and including the Synergies. The financial co-advisors derived ranges of illustrative FVs\nfor the pro forma combined company by adding the ranges of present values derived above. The financial co-advisors then subtracted from\nthe range of illustrative FVs they derived for the pro forma combined company the $7.278 billion of pro forma net debt of the pro forma\ncombined company, assuming the merger closed on December 31, 2016, as provided by the managements of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell\nCollins, and approved for the financial co-advisors use by B/E Aerospace, to derive a range of illustrative equity values for the pro forma\ncombined company. The financial co-advisors then divided this range of illustrative equity values by the number of fully diluted\noutstanding shares of the pro forma combined company, as provided by the managements of B/E Aerospace and Rockwell Collins and\napproved for the financial co-advisors use by B/E Aerospace, to derive a range of illustrative present values per share for the combined\ncompany\'s common stock. The financial co-advisors then multiplied the resulting range of implied present values per share of the pro\nforma combined company\'s common stock by an assumed exchange ratio of Rockwell Collins common stock for each share of\nB/E Aerospace stock (determined by using the closing price per share of Rockwell Collins common stock on October 17, 2016), and added\nthe product of that calculation to the $34.10 in per share cash consideration to be paid to holders of B/E Aerospace common stock in the\nmerger. This analysis resulted in a range of implied present values of the per share merger consideration, into which each share of\nB/E Aerospace common stock converts in the merger, of $69.13 to $78.09.\n\n        Selected Companies Analysis.    The financial co-advisors reviewed and compared certain financial information for B/E Aerospace to\ncorresponding financial information, ratios and public market multiples for the following publicly traded corporations in the aerospace and\ndefense industry (collectively referred to as the selected companies):\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nAstronics Corporation, \n\nEsterline Technologies Corporation, \n\nMeggit PLC, \n\nMoog Inc., \n\nRockwell Collins, Inc., \n\nWoodward, Inc., and \n\nZodiac Aerospace, S.A.\n\n        Although none of the selected companies is directly comparable to B/E Aerospace, the companies included were chosen because they\nare publicly traded companies with operations that, for purposes of analysis, may be considered similar to certain operations of\nB/E Aerospace. The quantitative information used in this analysis, to the extent that it is based on market data, was based on market data\nas of October 17, 2016.\n\n        The financial co-advisors also calculated and compared various financial multiples and ratios using information they obtained from\nSEC filings and IBES estimates. With respect to the selected companies, the financial co-advisors calculated the ratio of the price of a\nshare of common stock of the selected companies (using the applicable closing market price per share as of October 17, 2016) to estimated\nearnings per share (which is referred to as the P/E Ratio) for calendar year 2017, and firm\n\n93\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n105/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nvalue, which is the market value of the diluted common equity, plus the book value of any preferred stock and debt, less the book value of\ncash and cash equivalents (which is referred to as FV), as a multiple of projected earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and\namortization (which is referred to as EBITDA, and such multiple is referred to as the FV/EBITDA Multiple) for calendar year 2017. The\nmultiples and ratios for each of the selected companies were based on IBES estimates. Rockwell Collins avoids making public\nprojections for extended periods due to, among other things, the unpredictability of the underlying assumptions and estimates.\n\n        In connection with the proposed transaction, certain non-public, unaudited financial projections regarding Rockwell Collins\'\nanticipated results of operations for fiscal years 2017 through 2021 were provided to the Rockwell Collins Board, Rockwell Collins\'\nfinancial advisor, J.P. Morgan, and to B/E Aerospace. Such projections are referred to as the Rockwell Collins management forecast. The\nRockwell Collins management forecast includes the results of projected acquisitions over the forecast period. Also, in connection with the\nproposed transaction, certain non-public, unaudited financial projections regarding Rockwell Collins\' anticipated results of operations for\nfiscal years 2017 through 2021 excluding the results of projected acquisitions were provided to the Rockwell Collins Board, J.P. Morgan\nand B/E Aerospace. Such projections are referred to as the Rockwell Collins stand-alone management forecast. The Rockwell Collins\nmanagement forecast and the Rockwell Collins stand-alone management forecast are the only financial forecasts provided by Rockwell\nCollins to B/E Aerospace.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins management forecast and Rockwell Collins stand-alone management forecast are based on numerous estimates\nand assumptions. The 2017 amounts resulted from Rockwell Collins\' operating plan process, and reflect a detailed forecast primarily\ndriven by Rockwell Collins\' original equipment manufacturer production rate projections and other market insights into expected revenues,\nas well as anticipated product line margins and discretionary spending. The 2017 amounts are consistent with the fiscal 2017 financial\nguidance provided publicly on October 23, 2016. The 2018 to 2021 amounts resulted from Rockwell Collins\' strategic and financial\nplanning process, and reflect more general market-level forecasts primarily driven by original equipment manufacturer rate projections and\nother market growth rate projections, as well as anticipated portfolio margins and discretionary spending. The underlying assumptions\nused in the strategic and financial planning process are generally based on information and market factors known to management in the\nspring of 2016.\n\n        In addition, the Rockwell Collins Board received and reviewed certain non-public, unaudited financial projections regarding\nB/E Aerospace\'s anticipated results of operations for the fiscal years 2016 through 2021, which were prepared by B/E Aerospace\'s\nmanagement as described in the section of this joint proxy statement/prospectus entitled "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial Projections Utilized by the\nB/E Aerospace Board of Directors and B/E Aerospace\'s Financial Advisors" beginning on page 98. Rockwell Collins\' management\nreviewed and performed due diligence regarding such projections. Rockwell Collins\' management made certain adjustments to the\nB/E Aerospace management forecast described below. Such projections, as adjusted, are referred to as the adjusted B/E Aerospace\nforecast.\n\n        As discussed below, the B/E Aerospace management forecast is based on numerous estimates and assumptions. In preparing the\nadjusted B/E Aerospace forecast, Rockwell Collins made adjustments to such forecast based on Rockwell Collins\' view of key market\ndrivers such as air traffic growth rates, original equipment manufacturer delivery rates, aircraft fleet growth, as well as Rockwell Collins\'\nviews of B/E Aerospace\'s competitiveness in each product line and its backlog levels.\n\n        The forecasted financial information contained in this section "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial Projections Utilized by the Rockwell Collins\nBoard of Directors and Rockwell Collins\' Financial Advisor" was not prepared for public disclosure. The inclusion of this information in\nthis joint proxy statement/prospectus does not constitute an admission or representation by Rockwell Collins that the information is\nmaterial.\n\n95\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n107/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nYou should note that this forecasted financial information constitutes forward-looking statements. Morgan or\nB/E Aerospace in the course of evaluating the merger, and are not intended to influence your decision whether to vote for the Share\nIssuance proposal or any other proposal at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        Rockwell Collins uses certain financial measures that are not in accordance with GAAP as supplemental measures to evaluate its\noperational performance. While Rockwell Collins believes that non-GAAP financial measures provide useful supplemental information,\nthere are limitations associated with the use of non-GAAP financial measures. Non-GAAP financial measures are not prepared in\naccordance with GAAP, are not reported by all of Rockwell Collins\' competitors and may not be directly comparable to similarly titled\nmeasures of Rockwell Collins\' competitors due to potential differences in the exact method of calculation.\n\n        The following is a summary of the Rockwell Collins management forecast prepared by senior management of Rockwell Collins and\ngiven to B/E Aerospace, the Rockwell Collins Board and J.P. operations minus capital expenditures.\n\n97\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n109/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Unlevered free cash flow is a non-GAAP operating financial measure defined as EBIAT plus depreciation and amortization, less\ncapital expenditures and less changes in net working capital. Unlevered free cash flow for Rockwell Collins also factored in certain other\noperating adjustments and pension contributions.\n\nCertain Financial Projections Utilized by the B/E Aerospace Board of Directors and B/E Aerospace\'s Financial Advisors\n\n        B/E Aerospace does not, as a matter of course, create long-term projections as to future performance or make any other projections as\nto future performance available to the public other than generally providing, from time to time, estimated ranges of certain expected\nfinancial results and operational metrics for the current or impending fiscal year in its regular earnings press releases and other investor\nmaterials. B/E Aerospace avoids making public projections for extended periods due to, among other things, the unpredictability of the\nunderlying assumptions and estimates. However, in connection with its evaluation of the proposed merger, B/E Aerospace\'s senior\nmanagement prepared certain non-public, unaudited financial projections regarding B/E Aerospace\'s anticipated results of operations for\nfiscal years 2016 through 2021. Such projections were provided to B/E Aerospace\'s financial advisors, Citigroup and Goldman Sachs, and\nto Rockwell Collins. Such projections are referred to as the B/E Aerospace management forecast. The B/E Aerospace management\nforecast was not prepared for public disclosure. The B/E Aerospace management forecast is based on numerous estimates and\nassumptions. The outlook is developed in the context of assumed passenger traffic growth and sustained airline profitability. The forecasts\ntake into account awarded backlog with scheduled delivery dates, original equipment manufacturer rate projections, expected new product\nintroductions and anticipated program launches. The forecasts incorporate products produced for both new aircraft deliveries and\nrefurbishment of existing aircraft. The projections are based upon anticipated program margins with the continued benefit of cost reduction\ninitiatives and disciplined expense management. The inclusion of the B/E Aerospace management forecast in this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus does not constitute an admission or representation by B/E Aerospace that the information is material. You should\nnote that projections included in the B/E Aerospace management forecast constitute forward-looking statements. See "Cautionary Note\nRegarding Forward-Looking Statements" beginning on page 44 of this joint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\n        In addition, the B/E Aerospace Board received and reviewed certain non-public, unaudited financial projections regarding Rockwell\nCollins\' anticipated results of operations for the fiscal years 2017 through 2021, which were prepared by Rockwell Collins\' management as\ndescribed in the section of this joint proxy statement/prospectus entitled "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial Projections Utilized by the Rockwell Collins\nBoard of Directors and Rockwell Collins\' Financial Advisor" beginning on page 95. B/E Aerospace\'s management reviewed and\nperformed due diligence regarding such projections. Such projections were also provided to Citigroup and Goldman Sachs.\n\n        The summaries of these projections are being included in this joint proxy statement/prospectus to give B/E Aerospace\'s stockholders\naccess to non-public information that was provided to Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, and Rockwell Collins in the course of evaluating the\nproposed merger, and are not intended to influence your decision whether to vote for adoption of the merger agreement or any other\nproposal at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n        B/E Aerospace uses certain financial measures that are not in accordance with GAAP as supplemental measures to evaluate its\noperational performance. While B/E Aerospace believes that non-GAAP financial measures provide useful supplemental information,\nthere are limitations associated with the use of non-GAAP financial measures. Non-GAAP financial measures are not prepared in\naccordance with GAAP, are not reported by all of B/E Aerospace\'s competitors and may not be directly comparable to similarly titled\nmeasures of B/E Aerospace\'s competitors due to potential differences in the exact method of calculation.\n\n98\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n110/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        The following is a summary of the B/E Aerospace management forecast prepared by senior management of B/E Aerospace and given\nto Rockwell Collins, the B/E Aerospace Board, Citigroup and Goldman Sachs, in each case, prior to the execution of the merger\nagreement (based on B/E Aerospace\'s fiscal year, in millions):\n\n \nRevenue\nEBITDA\nEBIT\nFree Cash Flow\n\n2018\n\n2016\n\n2017\n\n \n\n \n\n \n \n  $ 2,871  $ 3,072  $ 3,196  $ 3,364  $ 3,513  $ 3,691 \n797 \n707  $\n  $\n686 \n604  $\n  $\n565 \n460  $\n  $\n\n735  $\n629  $\n510  $\n\n655  $\n558  $\n354  $\n\n765  $\n657  $\n551  $\n\n603  $\n517  $\n247  $\n\n \n\n \n\n2019\n\n2020\n\n2021\n\n \n\n        In addition, the following table shows the estimated amount of unlevered free cash flow of B/E Aerospace, which was calculated by\nCitigroup and Goldman Sachs using the B/E Aerospace management forecast and the use of which was approved by B/E Aerospace\nmanagement. information contained in the section of this joint proxy statement/prospectus entitled "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial\nProjections Utilized by the Rockwell Collins Board of Directors and Rockwell Collins\' Financial Advisor" beginning on page 95 and the\nforecasted financial information contained in the section of this joint proxy statement/prospectus entitled "\xe2\x80\x94Certain\n\n99\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n111/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nFinancial Projections Utilized by the B/E Aerospace Board of Directors and B/E Aerospace\'s Financial Advisors" beginning on page 98\nare collectively referred to as the unaudited financial projections. While the unaudited financial projections summarized above in the\nsections of this joint proxy statement/prospectus entitled "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial Projections Utilized by the Rockwell Collins Board of\nDirectors and Rockwell Collins\' Financial Advisor" beginning on page 95 and "\xe2\x80\x94Certain Financial Projections Utilized by the\nB/E Aerospace Board of Directors and B/E Aerospace\'s Financial Advisors" beginning on page 98 were prepared by the respective\nmanagements of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace in good faith and based on information available at the time of preparation, they\nconstitute forward-looking information and no assurance can be made regarding actual future events. The estimates and assumptions\nunderlying the unaudited financial projections involve judgments with respect to, among other things, future economic, competitive,\nregulatory and financial market conditions and future business decisions that may not be realized and that are inherently subject to\nsignificant uncertainties and contingencies, including, among others, risks and uncertainties described in the sections of this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus entitled "Risk Factors" beginning on page 46 and "Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements"\nbeginning on page 44, all of which are difficult to predict and many of which are beyond the control of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace. There can be no assurance that the underlying assumptions or projected results will be realized, and actual results will likely\ndiffer, and may differ materially, from those reflected in the unaudited financial projections, whether or not the merger is completed. As a\nresult, the unaudited financial projections cannot be considered predictive of actual future operating results, and this information should\nnot be relied on as such.\n\n        The unaudited financial projections were prepared solely for internal use by Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as the case may be,\nor their respective financial advisors, and not with a view toward public disclosure or with a view toward complying with the guidelines\nestablished by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants for preparation and presentation of prospective financial data,\npublished guidelines of the SEC regarding forward-looking statements and the use of non-GAAP measures or GAAP. In the view of\nRockwell Collins\' management and B/E Aerospace\'s management, the respective forecasts prepared by them were prepared on a\nreasonable basis based on the information available to Rockwell Collins\' management and B/E Aerospace\'s management, respectively, at\nthe time of their preparation. The unaudited financial projections, however, are not facts and should not be relied upon as being indicative\nof actual future results, and readers of this joint proxy statement/prospectus are cautioned not to place undue, or any, reliance on this\ninformation. The inclusion of the unaudited financial projections in this joint proxy statement/prospectus is not an admission or\nrepresentation by Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace that such information is material or that the results contained in the prospective\nfinancial information will be achieved. None of the unaudited financial projections reflect any impact of the merger or the other\ntransactions contemplated by the merger agreement, except as noted herein. As a reminder, actual results may differ materially from those\ncontained in these unaudited financial projections.\n\n        The unaudited financial projections summarized in this section were prepared by and are the responsibility of the management of\nRockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as the case may be. No independent registered public accounting firm has examined, compiled or\notherwise performed any procedures with respect to the prospective financial information contained in these financial forecasts and,\naccordingly, no independent registered public accounting firm has expressed any opinion or given any other form of assurance with\nrespect thereto and no independent registered public accounting firm assumes any responsibility for the prospective financial information\nor its achievability. The reports of the independent registered public accounting firms incorporated by reference into this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus relate to the historical financial information of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace, respectively. Such reports do\nnot extend to the unaudited financial projections and should not be read to do so. Each of these independent registered public accounting\nfirms disclaims any association with the prospective financial information. By including in this joint proxy\n\n100\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n112/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nstatement/prospectus a summary of certain of the unaudited financial projections regarding the operating results of Rockwell Collins and\nB/E Aerospace, neither Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace nor any of their respective advisors or other representatives has made or makes\nany representation to any person regarding the ultimate performance of Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace compared to the information\ncontained in the financial projections. The unaudited financial projections cover multiple years and such information by its nature becomes\nless predictive and subject to greater uncertainty with each succeeding year.\n\n        Summaries of the unaudited financial projections are not included in this joint proxy statement/prospectus in order to induce any B/E\nAerospace stockholder to vote in favor of the B/E Aerospace merger proposal or any of the other proposals to be voted on at the B/E\nAerospace special meeting or any Rockwell Collins stockholder to vote in favor of the Rockwell Collins share issuance proposal or any\nother proposal to be voted on at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        EXCEPT AS MAY BE REQUIRED BY FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS, NEITHER ROCKWELL COLLINS NOR B/E\nAEROSPACE INTENDS TO UPDATE, AND EACH EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY RESPONSIBILITY TO UPDATE, OR\nOTHERWISE REVISE THE ABOVE PROJECTIONS TO REFLECT CIRCUMSTANCES EXISTING SINCE THEIR RESPECTIVE\nPREPARATION OR TO REFLECT THE OCCURRENCE OF UNANTICIPATED EVENTS, EVEN IN THE EVENT THAT ANY OR\nALL OF THE UNDERLYING ASSUMPTIONS ARE SHOWN TO BE IN ERROR OR NO LONGER APPROPRIATE (EVEN IN THE\nSHORT TERM) OR TO REFLECT CHANGES IN GENERAL ECONOMIC OR INDUSTRY CONDITIONS.\n\n        In light of the foregoing and the uncertainties inherent in the unaudited financial projections summarized in this section,\nstockholders of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace are cautioned not to place undue, if any, reliance on such unaudited financial\nprojections. Since the date the unaudited financial projections summarized in this section were prepared, Rockwell Collins has\nmade publicly available its actual results of operations for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016 and B/E Aerospace has made\npublicly available its actual results of operations for the quarter ended September 30, 2016. You should review Rockwell Collins\'\nAnnual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016, filed on November 15, 2016 and B/E Aerospace\'s\nQuarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended September 30, 2016, filed on October 28, 2016, to obtain this information.\nSee the section entitled "Where You Can Find More Information" beginning on page 198.\n\nGovernance of Rockwell Collins Following Completion of the Merger \n\n        The merger agreement provides that Rockwell Collins will take all necessary corporate action so that, upon and after the effective\ntime, the size of the Rockwell Collins Board will be increased by two members to a total of eleven, and two individuals selected by B/E\nAerospace who meet Rockwell Collins\' independence criteria and are otherwise reasonably acceptable to Rockwell Collins will be\nappointed to the Rockwell Collins Board. One such individual will serve as a member of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins\nBoard with terms expiring in 2018, and the other will serve as a member of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins Board with terms\nexpiring in 2020. Pursuant to this provision of the merger agreement, John T. Whates and Richard G. Hamermesh, both members of the\nB/E Aerospace Board, were selected by B/E Aerospace to be appointed to the Rockwell Collins Board and are expected to serve as\nmembers of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins Board with terms expiring in 2018 and 2020, respectively. Other than such\nadditional directors, no changes to the Rockwell Collins Board are expected in connection with the consummation of the merger.\n\n        For a more complete description of the material interests of directors of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace in the merger that may\nbe in addition to, or different from, their interests as\n\n101\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n113/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nstockholders, see "\xe2\x80\x94Interests of Directors and Executive Officers in the Merger" beginning on page 102.\n\nTable of Contents\n\nHeadquarters \n\n        Upon completion of the merger, Rockwell Collins\' headquarters will remain in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.\n\nInterests of Directors and Executive Officers in the Merger \n\nInterests of Directors and Executive Officers of B/E Aerospace in the Merger\n\n        In considering the recommendation of the B/E Aerospace Board that B/E Aerospace stockholders vote "FOR" the merger proposal,\nB/E Aerospace stockholders should be aware that B/E Aerospace\'s directors and executive officers have interests in the merger that may be\ndifferent from, or in addition to, those of B/E Aerospace stockholders generally. The B/E Aerospace Board was aware of these interests\nand considered them, among other matters, in approving the merger agreement and recommending that the B/E Aerospace stockholders\nadopt the merger agreement.\n\n        The following discussion sets forth certain of these interests in the merger of each person who has served as a non-employee director\nor executive officer of B/E Aerospace since January 1, 2015. The amounts presented in the following discussion do not reflect the impact\nof applicable withholding or other taxes.\n\nConsideration Payable for Shares Converted Pursuant to the Merger Agreement\n\n        As of January 18, 2017, the non-employee directors and executive officers of B/E Aerospace beneficially owned, in the aggregate,\n269,296 shares of B/E Aerospace common stock (or approximately .3% of the outstanding shares as of such date), which for the purposes\nof this discussion and the table immediately below does not include shares underlying outstanding unvested restricted stock awards or\nshares subject to restricted stock units. Each share of B/E Aerospace common stock issued prior to the effective time of the merger (other\nthan canceled shares and dissenting shares) will be converted into the right to receive $34.10 per share in cash, without interest, from\nRockwell Collins and a number of validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable shares of Rockwell Collins common stock equal to the\nexchange ratio and, if applicable, cash in lieu of fractional shares of Rockwell Collins common stock. Upon the conversion of all shares of\nB/E Aerospace common stock held by the non-employee directors and executive officers of B/E Aerospace, they would receive an\naggregate of $16,696,352 in cash, which includes the value of the shares of Rockwell Collins common stock to be issued pursuant to the\nmerger agreement, assuming an exchange ratio of 0.3604 pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement.\n\n        The following table sets forth, as of January 18, 2017, the cash consideration and the value of the Rockwell Collins common stock\nbased on a presumed exchange ratio of 0.3604 that each non-employee\n\n102\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n114/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ndirector and executive officer would receive in respect of their outstanding shares of B/E Aerospace common stock upon conversion\npursuant to the merger agreement:\n\nName\nNon-Employee Directors\nJames F. As described below under "\xe2\x80\x94\nTreatment of B/E Aerospace Stock-Based Awards" beginning on page 130, each unvested B/E Aerospace RSU award granted under a B/E\nAerospace equity plan prior to the date of the merger agreement will vest as a result of the merger (provided that to the extent that such\naward is subject to performance conditions, any performance conditions will be deemed to have been satisfied at the maximum level,\nwhich, in certain cases, is 200% of target) and such award will be cancelled and converted into the right to receive a lump sum cash\npayment equal to the product of the merger consideration and the number of shares of B/E Aerospace common stock underlying such B/E\nAerospace RSU awards. Accordingly, the number of B/E Aerospace RSU awards for which vesting will accelerate set forth in the table\nbelow will be greater than the number of RSU awards outstanding as of January 18, 2017.\n\n        Consistent with past practice, each of Amin J. Khoury, Joseph T. Lower, and Ryan M. Patch, as well as two additional executive\nofficers, all of whose employment will terminate upon consummation of the merger, have been granted on November 15, 2016\nB/E Aerospace RSU awards (time- and performance-based), which will vest in full (with performance-based restricted stock units vesting\nat\n\n104\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n116/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n200% of target for Messrs. Khoury, Lower, and Patch and 100% of target for the two additional executive officers) in the event the merger\nis consummated, and each such executive will be entitled to a lump sum cash payment in cancellation of such awards in accordance with\nthe terms of the merger agreement. Mr. Lieberherr\'s November 2016 B/E Aerospace RSU awards that are outstanding prior to the effective\ntime of the merger, will be converted to a cash amount (with performance conditions deemed to be satisfied at 200% of target) payable on\nthe first anniversary of the consummation of the merger, provided that he has not resigned without "good reason" (as defined in his\nemployment agreement with Rockwell Collins, as described below). Pursuant to the transaction bonus agreements between B/E Aerospace\nand each of Messrs. Khoury, Lieberherr, Patch, and Lower, as described further under "\xe2\x80\x94Interests of Directors and Executive Officers in\nthe Merger\xe2\x80\x94Transaction Bonuses" beginning on page 112, if such executive\'s employment is terminated prior to the consummation of the\nmerger due to the executive\'s death or disability, by B/E Aerospace for any reason or by the executive for "good reason" (as defined in the\nexecutive\'s employment agreement), the executive will be entitled to the immediate full vesting of the executive\'s November 2016 B/E\nAerospace RSU awards (with performance-based RSUs vesting at 200% of target), with payment to be made upon the consummation of\nthe merger.\n\n        As negotiated as part of the merger agreement, each outstanding B/E Aerospace RSU award that is granted by B/E Aerospace on or\nfollowing the date of the merger agreement other than the RSU awards described in the immediately preceding paragraph, pursuant to the\nmerger agreement, will upon the consummation of the merger be assumed by Rockwell Collins and converted into restricted stock unit\nawards covering shares of Rockwell Collins common stock with performance-based B/E Aerospace RSU awards converting to time-based\nrestricted stock units of Rockwell Collins based on achievement of performance-based vesting conditions at 100% of target level.\n\n        The following table provides information for each of the non-employee directors and executive officers of B/E Aerospace as of\nJanuary 18, 2017, regarding the aggregate number of shares of B/E Aerospace common stock underlying outstanding unvested\nB/E Aerospace RSU awards for which vesting will accelerate pursuant to the merger agreement.\n\nName\nNon-Employee Directors\nJames F.
