See "The Merger Agreement\xe2\x80\x94Merger\nConsideration to be Received by B/E Aerospace Stockholders" beginning on page 128.\n\nPotential Severance Payments in Connection with the Merger\n\n        B/E Aerospace has entered into employment agreements with Amin J. Khoury, Werner Lieberherr, Joseph T. Lower, Sean J. Cromie,\nTommy G. Plant, and Ryan M. Patch, as well as two additional executive officers. The employment agreements for Messrs. Khoury,\nLieberherr, Lower, and Patch provide for automatic termination, severance payments, and certain other benefits in connection with a\nchange in control. Conversely, the employment agreements for Mr. Cromie and the two additional executive officers provide for certain\nseverance payments in the event of the executive\'s involuntary termination of employment in connection with a change in control, but do\nnot provide for automatic termination upon a change in control. The employment agreements generally provide for some variation of\ntermination payments equal to the executive\'s salary and certain other forms of\n\n106\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n118/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ncompensation payable from the date the executive is terminated until the last valid date of his employment agreement, plus an additional\namount equal to a multiple of the executive\'s salary and/or other forms of compensation.\n\n        In addition, pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement, the existing employment agreements of Messrs. Cromie and Plant will be\namended to provide for severance payments equal to the greater of (1) two times the executive\'s 2017 base salary or (2) the termination\npayments otherwise provided under the existing terms of the executive\'s employment agreement, subject to other terms and conditions\ndiscussed below.\n\n        The existing employment agreements of the two additional executive officers, whose employment will be terminated in connection\nwith the merger, will also be amended to provide for severance payments equal to the greater of (i) three times the executive\'s 2017 base\nsalary, as pursuant to a commitment in effect prior to the signing of the merger agreement, or (ii) the termination payments otherwise\nprovided under the existing terms of the executive\'s employment agreement, subject to other terms and conditions discussed below.\n\n        Under the terms of Messrs. Khoury, Lieberherr, Lower, and Patch\'s employment agreements, upon the executive\'s termination, each\nexecutive and B/E Aerospace will execute a mutual waiver and release of claims substantially in the form prescribed by their agreement.\n\n        The merger will constitute a "change in control" under each employment agreement.\n\n        The current employment agreements for Messrs. Khoury, Lieberherr, Lower, and Patch first became effective on September 15, 2014,\nJuly 29, 2013, October 1, 2014, and July 29, 2013, respectively. The current agreements for Messrs. Cromie and Plant first became\neffective on May 4, 2012 and February 4, 2013, respectively, and will be amended pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement, as\ndescribed above.\n\nSeverance Terms of Employment Agreements with Messrs. Cromie and Plant\n\n        Under the terms of his existing employment agreement, if the employment of Mr. Cromie is terminated in connection with the merger\ndue to Mr. Cromie\'s termination by B/E Aerospace without "cause" (as defined in his employment agreement), or Mr. Cromie\'s resignation\non account of a material reduction or change, without Mr. Cromie\'s agreement, in his position, location, powers, duties or responsibilities,\nor due to an elimination or a material reduction of any compensation or material benefit payable pursuant to Mr. Cromie\'s existing\nemployment agreement, B/E Aerospace or its successor will pay Mr. Cromie a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the\namounts provided below:\n\nMr. Cromie\'s salary payable through the remainder of the full employment term, which ends on May 4, 2018; and \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nOne times Mr. Cromie\'s salary as in effect at the time of his termination.\n\n        In addition, Mr. Cromie, his spouse, and his eligible dependents will also be entitled to continued coverage under B/E Aerospace\'s\nmedical, dental, and health plans (except for the executive medical reimbursement plan) generally available to B/E Aerospace\'s executive\nofficers as of the date of Mr. Cromie\'s termination on similar terms and conditions as active executives until the earlier of one year from\nMr. Cromie\'s termination or the date on which he becomes eligible for comparable benefits provided by another party.\n\n        Under the terms of his existing employment agreement, Mr. Plant is not entitled to any single- or double-trigger severance payments\nin connection with the merger.\n\n107\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n119/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        In connection with the merger, B/E Aerospace will amend the existing employment agreements of Messrs. Cromie and Plant to\nprovide that:\n\nThe executive will be entitled to the cash retention awards as described below under "\xe2\x80\x94Grants of Retention Awards"\nbeginning on page 112; and \n\nIn the event of the executive\'s termination of employment without "cause" (as defined in their employment agreement) or\nresignation for the mitigating factors described above at or within one year following the merger, the executive will be\nentitled to severance payments equal to the greater of (1) two times the executive\'s 2017 base salary or (2) the termination\npayments otherwise provided under the existing terms of the executive\'s employment agreement.\n\nSeverance Terms of Employment Agreements with Additional Executive Officers\n\n        Under the terms of their existing employment agreements, if the employment of either of the two additional executive officers is\nterminated in connection with the merger due to the executive\'s termination by B/E Aerospace without "cause" (as defined in their\nemployment agreement), or the executive\'s resignation on account of a material reduction or change, without the executive\'s agreement, in\nhis position, location, powers, duties or responsibilities, or due to an elimination or a material reduction of any compensation or material\nbenefit payable pursuant to the executive\'s existing employment agreement, B/E Aerospace or its successor will generally pay the\nexecutive a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the amounts provided below:\n\nThe executive\'s salary or the executive\'s salary and automobile allowance, as applicable, payable through the remainder of\nthe full employment term; \n\nOne times the executive\'s salary or the executive\'s salary and automobile allowance, as applicable, as in effect at the time\nof his termination; and/or \n\nThe executive\'s target incentive performance bonus, if not previously paid.\n\n        In addition, the two executive officers and certain of their eligible dependents will also be entitled to continued coverage under B/E\nAerospace\'s medical, dental, and health plans (which may include, without limitation, B/E Aerospace\'s executive medical reimbursement\nplan) then generally available to B/E Aerospace\'s executive officers on similar terms and conditions as active executives for a period that\nmay extend to one year following the executive\'s termination or terminate earlier when the executive becomes eligible for comparable\nbenefits provided by another party.\n\n        Pursuant to the terms of the merger agreement, B/E Aerospace will amend the existing employment agreements of the two additional\nexecutive officers to provide that the executive\'s employment will be terminated upon the consummation of the merger and following such\nautomatic termination:\n\nThe executive will be entitled to severance payments equal to the greater of (i) three times the executive\'s 2017 base salary,\nas pursuant to a commitment in effect prior to the signing of the merger agreement, or (ii) the termination payments\notherwise provided under the existing terms of the executive\'s employment agreement; and \n\nIf requested, the executive will be available to provide transition consulting services for a period of up to one year after the\nmerger for a monthly fee equal to 1/12 of the sum of the executive\'s salary, incentive bonus, and target restricted stock units\nfor 2017.\n\n108\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n120/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSeverance Terms of Mr. Khoury\'s Employment Agreement\n\n        Pursuant to the terms of his employment agreement, Mr. Khoury\'s employment will be terminated upon the consummation of the\nmerger and B/E Aerospace or its successor will pay Mr. Khoury a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the amounts provided\nbelow:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nAny accrued and unpaid salary and benefits through the date of his termination; \n\nAny earned but unpaid bonuses payable to Mr. Khoury, as determined by the Compensation Committee, for any fiscal\nperiods of B/E Aerospace ending prior to the date of Mr. Khoury\'s termination; and \n\nPayment of $11,870,000, which represents previously vested compensation which Mr. Khoury agreed to defer in\nconnection with the KLX spin-off until the termination of his employment.\n\n        In addition, following any termination of his employment, Mr. Khoury and his spouse, for as long as they each may live, will be\nentitled to (i) all medical, dental, and health benefits available from time to time to B/E Aerospace\'s executive officers and their spouses,\nrespectively, on similar terms and conditions as active employees are receiving on the date of Mr. Khoury\'s termination of employment\n(provided that the level of such benefits is not less than the benefits available to Mr. Khoury on July 1, 2014, including, without limitation,\n100% payment for or reimbursement of medical and dental services or costs incurred by Mr. Khoury and his family (i.e., his spouse, his\nformer spouse, his eligible dependents), the cost of which will be fully paid by B/E Aerospace) and (ii) the benefits available under B/E\nAerospace\'s executive medical reimbursement plan as of the date of Mr. Khoury\'s termination of employment, but in no event less than\nthose in effect as of July 1, 2014 (the "Post-Employment Benefits").\n\n        Mr. Khoury\'s agreement provides that if his employment terminates at any time for any reason other than death or incapacity, B/E\nAerospace will retain him as a consultant for strategic planning, financial planning, and merger and acquisition advice as well as such\nother services as may be mutually agreed by Mr. Khoury and B/E Aerospace for a five-year period. During the consulting term,\nMr. Khoury is entitled to receive, without limitation, $209,400 in annual consulting fees, an office in Wellington, Florida or another agreed\nupon location, a full-time assistant, an automobile allowance, and travel in accordance with B/E Aerospace\'s policy on officer travel. In\naddition to the compensation, benefits, and perquisites to be provided pursuant to the consulting agreement, Mr. Khoury\'s agreement\nfurther provides that Mr. Khoury will also be entitled to continue to participate in all employee benefit plans, life insurance plans,\ndisability income plans, incentive compensation plans and other benefit plans, as may be from time to time in effect for executives of B/E\nAerospace generally, plus the Post-Employment Benefits.\n\n        If any payments from B/E Aerospace to Mr. Khoury under the employment agreement or otherwise would be subject to an excise tax\nunder Section 4999 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, which is referred to as the Code (including any interest or\npenalties), an accounting firm and a legal advisor to, or other advisor designated by, Mr. Khoury will determine whether to reduce those\npayments so that they would not be subject to the excise tax. Such payments will be reduced only if doing so would result in greater net\nafter-tax proceeds being received by Mr. Khoury. B/E Aerospace will pay the expenses of the accounting firm, and will reimburse\nMr. Khoury for the fees of his legal or other advisor incurred in connection with such determination and any legal and accounting fees\nincurred in connection with related disputes.\n\n109\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n121/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSeverance Terms of Mr. Lieberherr\'s Employment Agreement and New Employment Agreement with Rockwell Collins\n\n        Pursuant to his existing employment agreement, Mr. Lieberherr\'s employment will be terminated as of the consummation of the\nmerger and B/E Aerospace or its successor will pay Mr. Lieberherr a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the amounts\nprovided below:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nAny accrued and unpaid salary, automobile allowance, vacation time and benefits through the date of Mr. Lieberherr\'s\ntermination; From and after the effective time of the merger, Mr. Lieberherr\'s new agreement\nwith Rockwell Collins will govern Mr. Lieberherr\'s employment with Rockwell Collins. However, under the new employment agreement,\nRockwell Collins agrees to honor all the obligations of Mr. Lieberherr\'s existing agreement with B/E Aerospace that continue following\nthe effective time of the merger (including, without limitation, the benefit continuation, governing law, legal fees, and indemnification\nprovisions of Mr. Lieberherr\'s agreement with B/E Aerospace). The new agreement with Rockwell Collins also provides for the payment\nof the severance amounts under Mr. Lieberherr\'s existing employment agreement pursuant to the terms of such agreement.\n\n        Pursuant to the new employment agreement with Rockwell Collins, Mr. Lieberherr will serve as an Executive Vice President of\nRockwell Collins and Chief Operating Officer of Rockwell Collins\' aircraft interior systems business unit for an indefinite employment\nterm. Mr. Lieberherr will receive an annual base salary of $875,000, which is subject to upward adjustment by the compensation\ncommittee of Rockwell Collins\' Board, and will be eligible to receive an annual incentive target bonus equal to not less than 90% of his\nbase salary. In addition, Mr. Lieberherr will receive an automobile allowance of at least $1,700 per month. Mr. Lieberherr will be eligible\nto participate in and receive benefits under any life or disability insurance, health, executive medical expense reimbursement, pension,\nretirement, accident and other benefit plans generally available to the executives of Rockwell Collins. Both during and after the term of his\nemployment with Rockwell Collins, Mr. Lieberherr will continue to receive certain benefits pursuant to his existing employment\nagreement with B/E Aerospace (including, without limitation, executive medical, dental, and health plan benefits and executive health\nreimbursement benefits based on his base salary as in effect prior to the effective time of the merger).\n\n110\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n122/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        As soon as practicable after the consummation of the merger, Rockwell Collins will grant Mr. Lieberherr a $2,000,000 cash retention\naward, which will vest and become payable in a lump sum on the first anniversary of the effective date of the merger. In the event\nMr. Lieberherr\'s employment is terminated by Rockwell Collins without "cause" (as defined in his employment agreement with Rockwell\nCollins) or he resigns for "good reason" (as defined in his employment agreement with Rockwell Collins), the retention award will vest\nand be paid in a lump sum on the sixtieth day following the date of his termination, subject to Mr. Lieberherr\'s execution and non-\nrevocation of a mutual waiver and release of claims. Commencing in November 2017 and continuing throughout the term of his\nemployment, Mr. Lieberherr will be eligible to participate in any applicable equity compensation program of Rockwell Collins with terms\nno less favorable than those provided to Rockwell Collins\' other senior executives, provided that the grant date value of annual equity\nawards granted by Rockwell Collins will have a target value of $1,300,000. In addition, on January 1 of each year, Rockwell Collins will make a contribution to the DCP in an amount equal to 20%\nof Mr. Lieberherr\'s salary in effect at that time. All contributions to the DCP will vest in full on the date of contribution.\n\n        Mr. Lieberherr is subject to non-competition and non-solicitation obligations during his employment with Rockwell Collins and for\nthree years thereafter.\n\n        Mr. Lieberherr\'s employment may be terminated by either himself or Rockwell Collins at any time and for any reason. In the event of\nthe termination of Mr. Lieberherr\'s employment due to his death or incapacity, Mr. Lieberherr or his designated beneficiary will receive\nany accrued and unpaid salary, automobile allowance, vacation time, and benefits through the date of his termination (the "Lieberherr\nAccrued Amounts") and any earned but unpaid bonuses payable, as determined by the compensation committee of Rockwell Collins, for\nany fiscal periods ending prior to the termination. In the event of termination of Mr. Lieberherr\'s employment for any reason other than his\ndeath or incapacity, Mr. Lieberherr will receive the Liberherr Accrued Amounts.\n\nSeverance Terms of Mr. Lower\'s Employment Agreement\n\n        Pursuant to his employment agreement, Mr. Lower\'s employment will be terminated as of the consummation of the merger and B/E\nAerospace or its successor will pay Mr. Lower a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the amounts provided below:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nAny accrued and unpaid salary, automobile allowance, vacation time and benefits through the date of Mr. Lower\'s\ntermination; \n\nAny earned but unpaid bonuses payable to Mr. Lower, as determined by the Compensation Committee, for any fiscal\nperiods of B/E Aerospace ending prior to the date of Mr. Lower\'s termination; and \n\nTwo times Mr. Lower\'s salary and applicable target bonus in effect as of the date of his termination.\n\n        If any payments from B/E Aerospace to Mr. Lower would be subject to an excise tax under Section 4999 of the Code, an accounting\nfirm and a legal or other advisor to Mr. Lower will determine whether to reduce those payments so that they would not be subject to the\nexcise tax. Such payments will be reduced only if doing so would result in greater net after-tax proceeds being received by Mr. Lower. B/E\nAerospace will pay the expenses of the accounting firm, and will reimburse Mr. Lower for the fees of his legal or other advisor.\n\n111\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n123/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSeverance Terms of Mr. Patch\'s Employment Agreement\n\n        Pursuant to his employment agreement, Mr. Patch\'s employment will be terminated as of the consummation of the merger and B/E\nAerospace or its successor will pay Mr. Patch a lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of the amounts provided below:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nAny accrued and unpaid salary, automobile allowance and vacation time through the date of Mr. Patch\'s termination; \n\nOne times Mr. Patch\'s salary and automobile allowance in effect as of the date of his termination; and \n\n90% of Mr. Patch\'s salary in effect as of the date of his termination.\n\n        In addition, following any termination of his employment other than for cause, Mr. Patch, his spouse/domestic partner, and his\ndependents, for a period of three years from his termination date, will be entitled to (i) all medical, dental, and health benefits available\nfrom time to time to B/E Aerospace\'s executive officers on similar terms and conditions as active employees (provided that the level of\nsuch benefits is not less than the benefits available to Mr. Patch on July 1, 2013), as well as 100% payment for and reimbursement of\nmedical and dental services and costs incurred by Mr. Patch, his spouse/domestic partner, and his dependents, the cost of which will be\nfully paid by B/E Aerospace, and (ii) the benefits available under B/E Aerospace\'s executive medical reimbursement plan as of the date of\nMr. Patch\'s termination of employment, but in no event less than those in effect as of July 1, 2013.\n\n        Should a dispute related to the payments due under Mr. Patch\'s employment agreement arise in connection with the consummation of\nthe merger, B/E Aerospace will pay all associated legal fees.\n\n        If the severance payments and benefits provided under Mr. Patch\'s employment agreement would be subject to the excise taxes under\nSection 409A of the Code, he is also entitled to receive (i) a payment sufficient to cover such excise taxes and (ii) an additional gross-up\npayment sufficient to pay for the taxes arising as a result of that payment.\n\n        Pursuant to the merger agreement, Rockwell Collins will, upon consummation of the merger, make grants of Rockwell Collins cash\nretention awards, which are referred to as parent retention awards, to Messrs. Cromie and Plant with a grant date value equal to 100% of,\nrespectively, Mr. Cromie\'s and Mr. Plant\'s base salary, 50% of which parent retention awards will vest and be payable on the six-month\nanniversary of the consummation of the merger and the remaining 50% on the first anniversary of the consummation of the merger, subject\nto continued employment through each vesting date.\n\nGrants of Retention Awards\n\nTransaction Bonuses\n\n        On October 23, 2016, B/E Aerospace entered into transaction bonus agreements with each of Messrs. Khoury, Lieberherr, Patch and\nLower. The transaction bonus agreements provide that, upon consummation of the merger, Messrs. Khoury, Lieberherr, Patch and Lower\nwill receive transaction bonuses equal to, respectively, $16,531,462, $8,400,000, $1,680,000 and $1,120,000, subject to the\n\n112\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n124/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nexecutive\'s continued employment through the date of the consummation of the merger. Each executive will be entitled to receive his\ntransaction bonus (contingent on the consummation of the merger on or before December 31, 2017), if his employment is terminated prior\nto the consummation of the merger due to his death or disability, by B/E Aerospace for any reason or by the executive for "good reason"\n(as defined in the executive\'s employment agreement). In addition, the transaction bonus agreements with Messrs. Lower and Patch\ninclude a non-compete covenant covering the period during the executive\'s employment and 18 (for Mr. Lower) or 12 (for Mr. Patch)\nmonths following the executive\'s termination.\n\n        To the extent that any payments or benefits under the transaction bonus agreements, in combination with any other severance and\nchange in control payments and benefits, otherwise constitute "parachute payments" then such payments and benefits will be "cut-back" or\nreduced to the extent necessary, such that no portion of the payments and benefits is subject to the imposition of excise taxes, but only if\nthe net amount of such payment and benefits, as so reduced (and after subtracting any additional taxes due on such reduced payments and\nbenefits) is greater than or equal to the net amount of such payments and benefits without such reduction (but after subtracting the net\namount of excise taxes and all additional taxes due on such unreduced payments and benefits).\n\nQuantification of Potential Payments\n\n        The severance payments and benefits to each executive officer (excluding the two additional executive officers) are set forth below in\n"\xe2\x80\x94Payments Upon a Change in Control and a Qualifying Termination," and assume the closing of the merger occurred on January 26,\n2017, which is the latest practicable date prior to the filing of this proxy statement, and such executive officer\'s employment is terminated\nby the executive officer for "good reason" (as defined in his November 2016 award agreement) or by the surviving corporation without\n"cause" (as defined in the executive officer\'s employment agreement) (which we refer to as a qualifying termination), if applicable,\nimmediately after the closing of the merger. Payments included in "\xe2\x80\x94Payments Upon a Change in Control and a Qualifying Termination"\nassume that severance payments and benefits are provided under the applicable officer\'s employment agreement (which, in the case of\nMr. Lieberherr, refers to his new employment agreement with Rockwell Collins, and, in the case of Messrs. Cromie and Plant, will be the\nexecutives\' employment agreements, as such agreements will be amended in connection with the merger). The two additional executive\nofficers not covered under the table for "\xe2\x80\x94Payments Upon a Change in Control and a Qualifying Termination" would be entitled to\nreceive an aggregate amount of approximately $3,017,122 pursuant to their employment agreements, as such agreements will be amended\nin connection with the merger.\n\nIndemnification and Insurance\n\n        The merger agreement provides that, for six years following the effective time of the merger, Rockwell Collins or the surviving\ncorporation will provide current and former directors and officers of B/E Aerospace with exculpation, indemnification and advancement of\nexpenses no less favorable than currently provided by equivalent provisions of the B/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation and\nB/E Aerospace\'s bylaws as in effect immediately prior to the effective time of the merger. In addition, prior to the merger, B/E Aerospace\nor Rockwell Collins will cause the surviving corporation as of or after the effective time, to purchase a six-year prepaid policy, with terms,\nconditions, retentions and limits of liability that are no less favorable than the coverage provided under B/E Aerospace\'s existing policies\nof directors\' and officers\' liability insurance and fiduciary liability insurance, with respect to matters arising on or before the effective time,\nincluding in connection with the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby (provided that B/E Aerospace will not pay,\nand the surviving corporation will not be required to pay, in excess of 300% of the last annual premium paid by B/E Aerospace prior to the\ndate of the merger agreement in respect of such policy).\n\n113\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n125/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nNew Compensation Arrangements with Rockwell Collins\n\n        As described under "\xe2\x80\x94Governance of Rockwell Collins Following Completion of the Merger" beginning on page 101, the Rockwell\nCollins Board will be increased by two members to a total of eleven members, and Richard G. Hamermesh and John T. Whates, members\nof the B/E Aerospace Board, will be appointed to the Rockwell Collins Board.\n\n        Any executive officers and directors who become officers, directors or employees or who otherwise are retained to provide services to\nRockwell Collins or the surviving corporation may enter into new individualized compensation arrangements and may participate in cash\nor equity incentive or other benefit plans maintained by Rockwell Collins or the surviving corporation.\n\nGolden Parachute Compensation\n\n        The following table sets forth the information required by Item 402(t) of Regulation S-K regarding the compensation for each of the\nnamed executive officers, which are referred to as NEOs, of B/E Aerospace (i) that is based on or otherwise becomes payable immediately\nprior to, or upon the effectiveness of, the merger, assuming the closing of the merger occurred on January 18, 2017, which is the latest\npracticable date prior to the filing of this proxy statement, (ii) that becomes payable upon the termination of employment of such NEO if\nsuch termination is a qualifying termination and occurs immediately after the closing of the merger, as well as additional amounts payable\nin connection with the termination or (iii) that otherwise relates to the merger. In connection with the merger, Mr. Lieberherr\'s existing\nemployment agreement with B/E Aerospace will be replaced by a new employment agreement with Rockwell Collins, pursuant to which\nRockwell Collins will continue to honor all the obligations of Mr. Lieberherr\'s existing agreement with B/E Aerospace that survive\nfollowing the effective time of the merger, as described more fully above under "\xe2\x80\x94Severance Terms of Mr. Lieberherr\'s Employment\nAgreement."\n\n        The following table does not include any amount that would be payable upon any termination of service that is not in connection with\nthe merger.\n\n        The payments described in the table below are made pursuant to the arrangements discussed in "\xe2\x80\x94Potential Severance Payments in\nConnection with the Merger" beginning on page 106.\n\nGolden Parachute Compensation Table\n\nName\nAmin Khoury\nWerner Lieberherr\nJoseph T.
