For purposes of the merger agreement, "material adverse effect," when used in reference to Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace,\nmeans any event, occurrence, development or change that has a material adverse effect on the business, financial condition or results of\noperations of the referenced party and its subsidiaries, taken as a whole, except that, for purposes of the definition of "material adverse\neffect," none of the following (or the results thereof) will constitute or be taken into account in determining whether a material adverse\neffect has occurred:\n\nchanges in general economic, financial market, regulatory, business, financial, political, geopolitical, credit or capital\nmarket conditions, including interest or exchange rates; \n\ngeneral changes or developments in any of the industries or markets, or in the business conditions in the geographic\nregions, in which the referenced party or any of its subsidiaries operate (or applicable portions or segments of such\nindustries or markets); \n\nchanges in any applicable U.S. laws or accounting regulations or principles or interpretations thereof; \n\nany outbreak or escalation of hostilities or war or any act of terrorism, or any acts of God, weather-related events, fires or\nnatural disasters; \n\nany change in the price or trading volume of the referenced party\'s securities or other financial instruments or change in the\nreferenced party\'s credit rating, in and of itself (except that the facts or occurrences giving rise to or contributing to such\nchange that are not otherwise excluded from the definition of "material adverse effect" may be taken into account in\ndetermining whether a material adverse effect has occurred);\n\n133\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n146/330\n\n\x0c\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nany failure by the referenced party to meet its internal or published projections, budgets, plans or forecasts of its revenues,\nearnings or other financial performance or results of operations or any published analyst or other third-party estimates or\nexpectations of the referenced party\'s revenue, earnings or other financial performance or results of operations for any\nperiod, in and of itself (except that the facts or occurrences giving rise to or contributing to such failure that are not\notherwise excluded from the definition of "material adverse effect" may be taken into account in determining whether a\nmaterial adverse effect has occurred); \n\nany action taken or not taken at the express written request of the other party after the date of the merger agreement; or \n\nthe public announcement or pendency of the merger or the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement or the\nidentity of the other party;\n\nprovided that if the facts, circumstances, events, changes, occurrences or effects set forth in the first four bullets have a material\ndisproportionate impact on the referenced party and its subsidiaries, taken as a whole, relative to the other participants in the industries in\nwhich the referenced party and its subsidiaries operate, such facts, circumstances, events, changes, occurrences or efforts may be taken\ninto account in determining whether a material adverse effect has occurred.\n\nCovenants and Agreements \n\nConduct of Business\n\n        Each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace has agreed to certain covenants in the merger agreement restricting the conduct of its\nrespective business between the date of the merger agreement and the effective time. In general, each of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace has agreed that prior to the effective time or the termination of the merger agreement in accordance with its terms, except as\nrequired by law, as agreed in writing by the other party (which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned) or as\notherwise expressly contemplated or permitted by the merger agreement, it will and will cause its subsidiaries to:\n\nconduct its business in the ordinary course of business and in a manner consistent with past practice; and \n\nto the extent consistent with the prior bullet, use reasonable best efforts to preserve its assets and business organization and\nmaintain its existing relationships with material customers, suppliers, distributors, regulators and business partners.\n\nConduct of Business of B/E Aerospace\n\n        In addition, without limiting the generality of the foregoing covenants described above, B/E Aerospace has agreed that, prior to the\neffective time or the termination of the merger agreement in accordance with its terms, except as required by law, as agreed in writing by\nRockwell Collins (which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned) or as otherwise expressly contemplated or\npermitted by the merger agreement, it will not and will cause its subsidiaries not to:\n\namend the B/E Aerospace certificate of incorporation or by-laws (or such equivalent organizational or governing\ndocuments of any of its subsidiaries); \n\nadjust, split, combine, subdivide, reclassify, redeem, repurchase or otherwise acquire or amend the terms of B/E\nAerospace\'s or any of its subsidiaries\' capital stock or other equity interests or any options, equity or equity-based\ncompensation, warrants, convertible securities or other rights of any kind to acquire any shares of B/E Aerospace\'s or any\nof its subsidiaries\' capital stock or other equity interests;\n\n134\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n147/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable base compensation of $225,000 or more; \n\nexcept as contemplated by the ESPP in effect as of the date of the merger agreement, grant, confer or award equity or\nequity-based compensation, options, Rockwell Collins\n\n        In addition, without limiting the generality of the foregoing covenants described above, Rockwell Collins has agreed that, prior to the\neffective time or the termination of the merger agreement in accordance with its terms, except as required by law, as agreed in writing by\nB/E Aerospace (which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned) or as otherwise expressly contemplated or\npermitted by the merger agreement, it will not and will cause its subsidiaries not to:\n\namend Rockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation or by-laws in a manner that would be adverse to B/E Aerospace or its\nstockholders or would, or would reasonably be expected to, have the effect of delaying or preventing the consummation of\nthe merger or the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement; \n\nincrease the size of the Rockwell Collins Board; \n\nexcept with respect to quarterly cash dividends paid in the ordinary course, consistent with past practice, subject to increase\nby no more than 25% on a quarterly basis, declare, set aside, authorize, make or pay any dividend or other distribution,\npayable in cash, stock, property or otherwise, with respect to its capital stock or other equity interests; \n\nadopt a plan of complete or partial liquidation or dissolution; \n\nadjust, split, combine, subdivide or reclassify Rockwell Collins\' capital stock; \n\nissue or sell any shares of Rockwell Collins common stock representing more than 5% of the issued and outstanding shares\nof Rockwell Collins stock as of the date of the merger agreement; provided that Rockwell Collins may issue or sell shares\nof Rockwell Collins common stock pursuant to Rockwell Collins stock-based awards; or \n\nenter into any agreement to do, or adopt any resolutions in support of, any of the foregoing.\n\nStockholder Meetings and Board Recommendations\n\n        The merger agreement requires each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace to, as promptly as practicable following effectiveness of\nthe registration statement of which this joint proxy statement/prospectus forms a part, duly call, give notice of, convene and hold a meeting\nof its respective stockholders for the purpose of seeking (i) in the case of B/E Aerospace, the adoption of the merger agreement and the\napproval of the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement by the holders of at least a majority of the outstanding shares of B/E\nAerospace common stock and (ii) in the case of Rockwell Collins, approval of the issuance of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock\nin connection with the merger by at least a majority of the votes cast by shares of Rockwell Collins common stock represented (in person\nor by proxy) at such meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal, and will submit the applicable proposal to its respective stockholders at\nsuch meeting and will not submit any other proposal in connection with such meeting without the prior written consent of the other party.\n\n        If the applicable party\'s board of directors has not made an adverse recommendation change pursuant to the terms of the merger\nagreement, such party\'s board of directors will (i) recommend that its stockholders approve the proposal (a) in the case of B/E Aerospace,\nto adopt the merger agreement, referred to as the B/E Aerospace Recommendation and (b) in the case of Rockwell Collins, for the issuance\nof shares of Rockwell Collins common stock in connection with the merger, referred to as the Rockwell Collins Recommendation,\n(ii) include the applicable recommendation in this Aerospace nor its subsidiaries or affiliates\nwill grant or offer to grant any accommodation or concession (financial or otherwise), or make any payment, to any third party in\nconnection with seeking or obtaining its consent to the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement and (ii) neither Rockwell\nCollins nor any of its affiliates will be required to agree to or proffer to sell, divest, annual revenue\ngenerated between January 1, 2015 and December 31, 2015.\n\n        Each of the parties has agreed to (i) furnish to the other such necessary information and reasonable assistance as the other may\nrequest in connection with the preparation of any governmental filings, submissions or other documents; (ii) give the other reasonable\nprior notice of any such filing, submission or other document and, to the extent reasonably practicable, of any communication with or from\nany governmental authority regarding the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, and permit the other to review and discuss\nin advance, and consider in good faith the views, and secure the participation, of the other in connection with any such filing, submission,\ndocument or communication; (iii) and cooperate in responding as promptly as reasonably practicable to any investigation or other inquiry\nfrom a governmental authority or in connection with any legal, administrative or other similar proceeding or action initiated by a\ngovernmental authority or private party, including immediately informing the other party of any such investigation, inquiry or proceeding,\nand consulting in advance before making any presentations or submissions to a governmental authority, or, in connection with any legal,\nadministrative or other similar proceeding or action initiated by a private party, to any other person or entity.\n\n        Each of the parties has also agreed to give reasonable prior notice to and consult with the other in advance of any meeting, conference\nor substantive communication with any governmental authority, or, in connection with any legal or administrative proceeding by a private\nparty, with any other person or entity, and to the extent not prohibited by applicable law or by the applicable governmental authority or\nother person or entity, and to the extent reasonably practicable, not participate or attend any meeting or conference, or engage in any\nsubstantive communication, with any governmental authority or such other person or entity in respect of the transactions contemplated by\nthe merger agreement without the other party, and in the event one party is prohibited from, or unable to participate, attend or engage in,\nany such meeting, conference or substantive communication, keep such party apprised with respect thereto.\n\n        Each party has agreed to furnish to the other copies of all substantive filings, submissions, correspondence and communications\nbetween it and its affiliates and their respective representatives, on the one hand, and any governmental authority or members of any\ngovernmental authority\'s staff (or any other person or entity in connection with any legal, administrative or other similar proceeding or\nactions initiated by a private party), on the other hand, with respect to the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement. agreed:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nto immediately cease and terminate, and to use reasonable best efforts to cause its officers, directors and other\nrepresentatives to cease and terminate, all existing discussions, negotiations and communications with any person or entity\nwith respect to any acquisition proposal, such term referring to a proposal or offer from any person or entity providing for\nany (i) merger, consolidation, share exchange, business combination, recapitalization or similar transaction involving\nRockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as applicable, pursuant to which any such person or entity would own or control,\ndirectly or indirectly, 20% or more of the voting power of the referenced party, (ii) sale or other disposition, directly or\nindirectly, of assets of the referenced party (including the capital stock or other equity interests of any of its subsidiaries) or\nany subsidiary of the referenced party representing 20% or more of the consolidated assets, revenues or net income of the\nreferenced party and its subsidiaries taken as a whole, (iii) issuance or sale or other disposition of capital stock or other\nequity interests representing 20% or more of the voting power of the referenced party, (iv) tender offer, exchange offer or\nany other transaction or series of transactions in which any person or entity will acquire, directly or indirectly, beneficial\nownership or the right to acquire beneficial ownership of capital stock or other equity interests representing 20% or more of\nthe voting power of the referenced party or (v) any related combination of the foregoing; provided that, with respect to\nRockwell Collins, such a proposal will only be deemed an acquisition proposal if it is conditioned upon or requires for its\ncompletion the failure of the merger to occur; \n\nnot to, and not to authorize any of its representatives to, directly or indirectly (i) initiate, seek, solicit, knowingly encourage\nor knowingly induce or take any other action reasonably expected to lead to an acquisition proposal, (ii) engage in\nnegotiations or discussions with or provide any non-public information to any person or entity relating to an acquisition\nproposal or grant any waiver or release under any standstill or other agreement (unless either party\'s board of directors\ndetermines in good faith that refusing to grant such waiver or release would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under\napplicable law, in which case such party may waive such standstill provision in order to permit a third party to make an\nacquisition proposal) or (iii) resolve to do any of the foregoing; \n\nnot to provide access (and within one business day of the date of the merger agreement, to terminate any such access) to\nany third party to any data room (virtual or actual) containing any of such party\'s information; and \n\nwithin two business days of the date of the merger agreement, to demand the return or destruction of all confidential, non-\npublic information and materials and all other information and materials related to any acquisition proposal that have been\nprovided to third parties that have entered into confidentiality agreements relating to a possible acquisition proposal with\nthe referenced party or any of its subsidiaries.\n\n141\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n154/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Notwithstanding the foregoing, prior to obtaining stockholder approval with regard to the merger agreement and the transactions\ncontemplated by the merger agreement, if either party receives a bona fide written acquisition proposal that was not initiated, sought,\nsolicited, knowingly encouraged, knowingly induced or otherwise procured in violation of the merger agreement, then such party may:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\ncontact the person or entity who has made such acquisition proposal in order to clarify the terms of such acquisition\nproposal so that such party\'s board of directors (or any committee thereof) may inform itself about such acquisition\nproposal; \n\nfurnish information concerning its business, properties or assets to such person or entity pursuant to a confidentiality\nagreement with confidentiality terms that, taken as a whole, are not materially less favorable to such party than those\ncontained in the confidentiality agreement, dated as of July 7, 2016, between Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace; and \n\nnegotiate and participate in discussions and negotiations with such person or entity concerning such acquisition proposal;\n\nif, in the case of the circumstances described in the immediately preceding two bullet points, the party\'s board of directors determines in\ngood faith that such acquisition proposal constitutes or is reasonably likely to constitute or result in a superior proposal, such term\nreferring to a bona fide written acquisition proposal (provided that for purposes of the definition of superior proposal, references to 20% in\nthe definition of acquisition proposal will be deemed to be references to 50%) that the referenced party\'s board of directors determines in\ngood faith (i) to be reasonably likely to be consummated if accepted and (ii) to be more favorable to the referenced party\'s stockholders\nfrom a financial point of view than the merger and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, in each case, taking into\naccount at the time of determination all relevant circumstances, including the various legal, financial and regulatory aspects of the\nproposal, all the terms and conditions of such proposal and the merger agreement, and any changes to the terms of the merger agreement\noffered by the other party to the merger agreement in response to such acquisition proposal.\n\n        Each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace will (i) promptly (and in any case within 24 hours) provide the other party notice (a) of\nthe receipt of any acquisition proposal, which notice will include a complete, unredacted copy of such acquisition proposal, and (b) of any\ninquiries, proposals or offers received by, any requests for non-public information from, or any discussions or negotiations initiated or\ncontinued (or sought to be initiated or continued) with, the party or any of its representatives concerning an acquisition proposal, and\ndisclose the identity of the other party (or parties) and the material terms of such inquiry, offer, proposal or request and, in the case of\nwritten materials, provide copies of such materials, (ii) promptly (and in any case within 24 hours) make available to the other party copies\nof all written materials provided by the referenced party to the proposing party but not previously made available to the other party and\n(iii) keep the other party informed on a reasonably prompt basis (and, in any case, within 24 hours of any significant development) of the\nstatus and material details (including amendments and proposed amendments) of any such acquisition proposal or other inquiry, offer,\nproposal or request.\n\nAdverse Recommendation Change and Termination\n\n        Except as permitted by the merger agreement in the case of a superior proposal or an intervening event (in each case, as described\nimmediately below), neither the Rockwell Collins Board, the B/E Aerospace Board, nor any committee thereof will (i) make an adverse\nrecommendation change or (ii) adopt or approve, or publicly propose to adopt or approve, or allow such party to execute or enter into, any\nbinding or non-binding letter of intent, agreement in principle, memorandum of understanding, merger agreement, acquisition agreement,\noption agreement, joint venture agreement, partnership agreement or other agreement, commitment, arrangement or understanding\ncontemplating\n\n142\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n155/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nor otherwise in connection with, or that is intended to or would reasonably be expected to lead to, any acquisitions proposal.\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSuperior Proposal \n\n        Subject to the non-solicitation obligations described above and the obligations further described in this paragraph, if, prior to receipt\nof the approval of their respective stockholders, either party receives an acquisition proposal that its respective board of directors\ndetermines in good faith constitutes a superior proposal that was not initiated, sought, solicited, knowingly encouraged, knowingly induced\nor otherwise procured in violation of the merger agreement, such party\'s board of directors may (i) effect an adverse recommendation\nchange or (ii) terminate the merger agreement pursuant to the termination provisions as described below in order to enter into a definitive\nagreement providing for such superior proposal if (a) such party\'s board of directors determines in good faith that the failure to take such\naction would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable law; (b) such party has notified the other party in writing that it\nintends to effect an adverse recommendation change or terminate the merger agreement pursuant to the termination provisions as described\nbelow in order to enter into a definitive agreement providing for such superior proposal; (c) if applicable, such party has provided the other\nparty a copy of the proposed definitive agreements between such party and the person or entity making such superior proposal; (d) for a\nperiod of four days following the notice delivered pursuant to clause (b) above, such party will have discussed and negotiated in good faith\nand made its representatives available to discuss and negotiate in good faith (in each case to the extent the other party desires to negotiate)\nwith the other party\'s representatives any proposed modifications to the terms and conditions of the merger agreement or the transactions\ncontemplated by the merger agreement so that the failure to take such action would no longer be inconsistent with the fiduciary duties of\nsuch party\'s board of directors under applicable law (it being understood and agreed that any amendment to any material term or condition\nof any superior proposal will require a new notice and a new negotiation period that will expire on the later to occur of (1) two days\nfollowing delivery of such new notice from such party to the other party and (2) the expiration of the original four-day period described in\nclause (d) above); and (e) no earlier than the end of such negotiation period, such party\'s board of directors will have determined in good\nfaith, after considering the terms of any proposed amendment or modification to the merger agreement, that (x) the acquisition proposal\nthat is the subject of the notice described in clause (b) above still constitutes a superior proposal and (y) the failure to take such action\nwould still be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable law.\n\nIntervening Event \n\n        Subject to the non-solicitation obligations described above and the obligations further described in this paragraph, other than in\nconnection with a superior proposal and prior to receipt of the approval of their respective stockholders, each of the board of directors of\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace may, in response to an intervening event, withdraw, qualify, or modify, or publicly propose to\nwithdraw, qualify or modify, the Rockwell Collins Recommendation or the B/E Aerospace Recommendation, as applicable, only if (i) such\nparty\'s board of directors determines in good faith that the failure to take such action would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under\napplicable law; (ii) such party has notified the other party in writing that it intends to effect such adverse recommendation change (which\nnotice will specify the facts and circumstances providing the basis of the intervening event and for the determination of such party\'s board\nof directors to effect such adverse recommendation change in reasonable detail); (iii) for a period of four days following the notice\ndelivered pursuant to clause (ii) above, such party will have discussed and negotiated in good faith and made its representatives available\nto discuss and negotiate in good faith (in each case to the extent the other party desires to negotiate) with the other party\'s representatives\nany proposed modifications to the terms and conditions of the merger agreement or the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement\nso that the failure to take such action would no longer be inconsistent with the fiduciary duties of such party\'s\n\n143\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n156/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nboard of directors under applicable law (it being understood and agreed that any material change to the relevant facts and circumstances\nwill require a new notice and a new negotiation period that will expire on the later to occur of (a) two days following delivery of such new\nnotice from such party to the other party and (b) the expiration of the original four-day period described above in this clause (iii)); and\n(iv) no earlier than the end of such negotiation period, the board of directors of such party will have determined in good faith, after\nconsidering the terms of any proposed amendment or modification to the merger agreement, that the failure to take such action would still\nbe inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable law.\n\n        Subject to Rockwell Collins\' and B/E Aerospace\'s obligations with respect to their merger recommendations, as summarized in the\nsection above, their obligations with respect to effecting an adverse recommendation change as summarized immediately above, and their\nobligations with respect to publicity related to the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, nothing in the merger agreement\nprohibits Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace or either of their respective boards of directors, as applicable, from (i) disclosing to its\nstockholders a position contemplated by Rules 14d-9 and 14e-2(a) promulgated under the Exchange Act, or from issuing a "stop, look and\nlisten" statement pending disclosure of its position thereunder or (ii) making any disclosure to its stockholders if the applicable board of\ndirectors determines in good faith that its failure to make such disclosure would be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable\nlaw; provided, however, that the obligations with respect to the adverse recommendation change and termination provisions described\nabove will not be affected by this provision and any such disclosure (other than issuance by the applicable party of a "stop, look and listen"\nor similar communication of the type contemplated by Rule 14d-9(f) under the Exchange Act) that addresses or relates to the approval,\nrecommendation or declaration of advisability by the applicable board of directors with respect to the merger agreement or an acquisition\nproposal will be deemed to be an adverse recommendation change unless the applicable board of directors in connection with such\ncommunication publicly states that its recommendation with respect to the merger agreement has not changed or refers to its prior\nrecommendation without disclosing any adverse recommendation change.\n\nEmployee Benefits Matters\n\n        For the period beginning at the effective time and ending on December 31, 2018 employees who are actively employed by\nB/E Aerospace or any of its subsidiaries immediately prior to the effective time, who are referred to as covered employees, will be\nprovided by Rockwell Collins or any of its subsidiaries, for so long as such covered employees remain employees of Rockwell Collins or\nany of its subsidiaries, with compensation (including salary or base rate of compensation, annual cash bonus opportunities, commissions\nand severance) and benefits that are in the aggregate, no less favorable than the compensation (excluding any equity or equity-based\ncompensation, retention, change of control, transaction or similar bonuses and nonqualified deferred compensation) and benefits\n(excluding any defined benefit pension plan or retiree medical benefits) being provided by B/E Aerospace or its subsidiaries to covered\nemployees immediately prior to the effective time.\n\n        If any covered employee first becomes eligible to participate under any Rockwell Collins benefit plan, following the effective time,\nRockwell Collins will, for covered employees who become eligible during 2017, use commercially reasonable efforts to (i) waive any\npreexisting condition exclusions and waiting periods with respect to participation and coverage requirements applicable to any covered\nemployee under any Rockwell Collins benefit plan providing medical, dental or vision benefits to the same extent such limitation would\nhave been waived or satisfied under any similar material employee benefit plan of B/E Aerospace, which is referred to as a B/E Aerospace\nbenefit plan, that the covered employee participated in immediately prior to coverage under the Rockwell Collins benefit plan and\n(ii) provide each covered employee with credit for any copayments and deductibles paid prior to the covered employee\'s coverage under\nany Rockwell Collins benefit plan during the plan year in which the\n\n144\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n157/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\neffective time occurs, to the same extent such credit was given under any similar B/E Aerospace benefit plan that covered employee\nparticipated in immediately prior to coverage under the Rockwell Collins benefit plan, in satisfying any applicable deductible or out-of-\npocket requirements under the Rockwell Collins benefit plan for the plan year in which the effective time occurs.\n\n        As of the effective time, Rockwell Collins will recognize all service of each covered employee prior to the effective time, to\nB/E Aerospace (or any of its predecessor entities or subsidiaries) for vesting and eligibility purposes (but not for benefit accrual purposes\nunder any defined benefit pension plan) and for purposes of determining future vacation accruals and severance amounts to the same\nextent as such covered employee received, immediately before the effective time, credit for such service under any similar B/E Aerospace\nbenefit plan in which such covered employee participated immediately prior to the effective time; provided that service of each covered\nemployee prior to the effective time will not be recognized for the purpose of any entitlement to participate in, or receive benefits with\nrespect to, any (i) non-elective employer contributions under any plan of Rockwell Collins under Section 401(k) of the Code or\n(ii) Rockwell Collins retiree medical program in which any covered employee participates after the effective time. In no event will there be\nany duplication of benefits for the same period of service.\n\n        B/E Aerospace and its subsidiaries will satisfy all legal or contractual requirements to provide notice to, or to carry out any\nconsultation procedure with, any employee or groups of employees of B/E Aerospace or any of its subsidiaries, or any labor or trade union,\nlabor organization or works council, which is representing any employee of B/E Aerospace or any of its subsidiaries, in connection with\nthe transactions contemplated by the merger agreement.\n\nFinancing\n\n        The merger is not conditioned upon Rockwell Collins obtaining financing. If Rockwell Collins fails to obtain financing for the\nmerger, it will still be required to fulfill its obligations under the merger agreement, including, subject to provisions related to termination\nand fulfillment or waiver of the conditions to closing, its obligation to consummate the merger and the other transactions contemplated by\nthe merger agreement.\n\n        Rockwell Collins has agreed to keep B/E Aerospace reasonably informed on a reasonably current basis of material developments in\nrespect of obtaining financing for the merger. B/E Aerospace has agreed to use reasonable best efforts to provide reasonable cooperation\nthat is customary in connection with the arrangement of debt or equity financing that Rockwell Collins deems reasonably necessary in\nconnection with the merger and that is consistent with transactions substantially similar to the merger.\n\nDesignation of Directors\n\n        The merger agreement provides that Rockwell Collins will take all necessary corporate action so that, upon the effective time, the size\nof the Rockwell Collins Board will be increased by two members to a total of eleven members, and two individuals selected by B/E\nAerospace who meet Rockwell Collins\' independence criteria and are otherwise reasonably acceptable to Rockwell Collins will be\nappointed to the Rockwell Collins Board. One such individual will serve as a member of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins\nBoard with terms expiring in 2018, and the other will serve as a member of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins Board with terms\nexpiring in 2020. Pursuant to this provision of the merger agreement, John T. Whates and Richard G. Hamermesh, both members of the\nB/E Aerospace Board, were selected by B/E Aerospace to be appointed to the Rockwell Collins Board and are expected to serve as\nmembers of the class of directors of the Rockwell Collins Board with terms expiring in 2018 and 2020, respectively. Other than such\nadditional directors, no changes to the Rockwell Collins Board are expected in connection with the consummation of the merger.\n\n145\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n158/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nOther Covenants and Agreements\n\n        The merger agreement contains additional agreements relating to, among other matters:\n\nDirectors\' and Officers\' Indemnification and Insurance\n\n        The parties have agreed that all rights, existing at the time of the merger agreement, to indemnification and exculpation from\nliabilities (including advancement of expenses) for acts or omissions occurring at or prior to the effective time, in favor of the current or\nformer directors or officers of B/E Aerospace as provided in the certificate of incorporation or the by-laws of B/E Aerospace or in any\nindemnification contract between such directors or officers and B/E Aerospace will survive the merger and will continue in full force and\neffect.\n\n        For 6 years after the effective time, Rockwell Collins will maintain in effect the exculpation, indemnification and advancement of\nexpenses equivalent to the provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the by-laws of B/E Aerospace as in effect immediately prior to\nthe effective time with respect to acts or omissions occurring prior to the effective time and will not amend, repeal or otherwise modify\nany such provisions in any manner that would adversely affect the rights thereunder of any of the current or former directors or officers of\nB/E Aerospace; provided that all rights to indemnification in respect of any action pending or asserted or any claim made within such 6-\nyear period will continue until the disposition of such action or resolution of such claim.\n\n        Prior to the effective time, B/E Aerospace will (or, if B/E Aerospace is unable to, after the effective time, Rockwell Collins will),\npurchase a 6-year prepaid "tail" policy, with terms, conditions, retentions and limits of liability that are no less favorable than the coverage\nprovided under B/E Aerospace\'s existing policies of directors\' and officers\' liability insurance and fiduciary liability insurance, with respect\nto matters arising on or before the effective time (including in connection with the merger agreement and the transactions or actions\ncontemplated by the merger agreement), and Rockwell Collins will maintain such policy in full force and effect, for its full term, and no\nother party will have any further obligation to purchase or pay for insurance; provided that B/E Aerospace will not pay, and Rockwell\nCollins will not be required to pay, in excess of 300% of the last annual premium paid by B/E Aerospace prior to the date of the merger\nagreement in respect of such "tail" policy. If B/E Aerospace for any reason fails to obtain such "tail" insurance policies prior to, as of or\nafter the effective time, Rockwell Collins will, for 6 years from the effective time, maintain in effect the current policies of directors\' and\nofficers\' liability insurance and fiduciary liability insurance maintained by B/E Aerospace with respect to matters arising on or before the\neffective time, again without being required to pay annual premiums in excess of 300% of the last annual premium paid by B/E Aerospace\nprior to the date of the merger agreement in respect of the coverage required to be obtained, but in such case Rockwell Collins will\npurchase as much coverage as reasonably practicable for such amount.\n\nCertain Tax Matters\n\n        Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace have agreed to use reasonable best efforts to obtain from their respective legal advisors the\nopinions related to the KLX spin-off tax treatment that are required as conditions to the closing of the merger, as described above.\n\n        In addition, Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace have each agreed to deliver tax representation letters similar to the Rockwell\nCollins Signing Representation Letter and the B/E Aerospace Signing Representation Letter, respectively, immediately prior to the closing,\nand covenanted that neither knew of any reason that it would not be able to deliver their respective tax representation letters at the closing.\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace each agree to use their respective reasonable best efforts not to take any action what would cause any\nof the representations, warranties and covenants in their respective tax representation letters that were delivered at signing to become\nuntrue.\n\n146\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n159/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace represented that they had each received opinions as of the date of the merger agreement from\ntheir respective tax counsels to the effect that the merger will not cause the KLX spin-off to fail to qualify for the KLX spin-off tax\ntreatment.\n\n        Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace agreed to use reasonable best efforts to jointly engage promptly after the date of the merger\nagreement a nationally recognized law firm to serve as additional tax counsel in accordance with the terms of the merger agreement.\n\nSection 16 Matters\n\nPublic Disclosure\n\n        Prior to the effective time, the parties will take all such steps as may be reasonably necessary or advisable to cause any dispositions of\nB/E Aerospace common stock (including derivative securities) or acquisitions of Rockwell Collins common stock (including derivative\nsecurities) resulting from the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement by each individual who is subject to the reporting\nrequirements of Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act with respect to B/E Aerospace or will become subject to such reporting requirements\nwith respect to Rockwell Collins, to be exempt under Rule 16b-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act, to the extent permitted by law.\n\n        While the merger agreement is in effect, neither Rockwell Collins, B/E Aerospace nor any of their affiliates will disseminate any\npress release or other public announcement concerning the merger agreement, the merger or the other transactions contemplated by the\nmerger agreement without the prior written consent of the other parties to the merger agreement (which consent will not be unreasonably\nwithheld, conditioned or delayed), except (i) as required by law or the rules of a national securities exchange, (ii) to the extent disclosed in\nor consistent with a press release or other document previously approved for external distribution by the other parties to the merger\nagreement or the registration statement on Form S-4, of which this joint proxy statement/prospectus forms a part, (iii) and to the extent the\ninformation included therein is not confidential information of any other party, a party may communicate to financial analysts, investors\nand media representatives in a manner consistent with its past practice in compliance with applicable law. In addition, such obligation to\nobtain prior written consent of the other parties to the merger agreement will not apply to press releases or public announcements if\nB/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins has effected an adverse recommendation change, to any disclosures in connection with either a\ndetermination by B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins, in accordance with their respective obligations under the non-solicitation provisions\nof the merger agreement, that an acquisition proposal is a superior proposal or to any disclosures in connection with any dispute between\nthe parties regarding the merger agreement, the merger or the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement.\n\nStock Exchange Listing\n\nDividend Record Dates\n\n        Rockwell Collins has agreed to use reasonable best efforts to cause the shares of Rockwell Collins common stock to be issued in\nconnection with the merger to be approved for listing on the NYSE, subject to official notice of issuance, prior to the effective time.\n\n        B/E Aerospace will coordinate with Rockwell Collins to designate the record dates and payment dates for B/E Aerospace\'s quarterly\ndividends to coincide with the record dates and payment dates for Rockwell Collins\' quarterly dividends, it being the intention of the\nparties that holders of B/E Aerospace common stock and Rockwell Collins common stock will not receive dividends twice for a\ncorresponding fiscal quarter of either B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins.\n\n147\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n160/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nConditions to the Merger \n\nConditions to the Obligations of the Parties to Complete the Merger\n\n        The obligations of each of Rockwell Collins, Merger Sub and B/E Aerospace to consummate the merger are subject to the satisfaction\nor (to the extent permitted by law) waiver of the following conditions:\n\nRockwell Collins having obtained the Rockwell Collins Stockholder Approval and B/E Aerospace having obtained the\nB/E Aerospace Stockholder Approval; \n\nthe shares of Rockwell Collins common stock to be issued in connection with the merger having been approved for listing\non the NYSE, subject to official notice of issuance; \n\nthe registration statement on Form S-4, of which this joint proxy statement/prospectus forms a part, having become\neffective under the Securities Act, and not being the subject of any stop order or any legal, administrative or other similar\nproceedings or actions by or before the SEC seeking a stop order; \n\nany applicable waiting period (and any extension thereof) under the HSR Act relating to the consummation of the merger\nhaving expired or early termination thereof having been granted, and any authorization or consent from a governmental\nauthority required to be obtained with respect to the merger under any antitrust laws in Europe, China, the Philippines,\nSouth Korea or Turkey having been obtained and remaining in full force and effect; and \n\nno governmental authority having issued or entered any order or enacted any law after the date of the merger agreement\nhaving the effect of enjoining or otherwise prohibiting the consummation of the merger or the other transactions\ncontemplated by the merger agreement.\n\nConditions to the Obligations of Rockwell Collins and Merger Sub to Complete the Merger\n\n        In addition, the obligations of Rockwell Collins and Merger Sub to complete the merger are subject to the satisfaction or (to the\nextent permitted by law) waiver of the following conditions:\n\nthe representations and warranties of B/E Aerospace set forth in the merger agreement with respect to (i) capitalization\nbeing true and correct in all respects (other than de minimis inaccuracies) and (ii) outstanding equity awards, ownership of\nsubsidiaries, corporate authorization of the merger agreement, required stockholder approval of adoption of the merger\nagreement and the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, the inapplicability of anti-takeover laws, brokers\nand transaction-related fees and expenses, opinions from financial advisors and the valid and binding nature of\nB/E Aerospace\'s amendment to the KLX tax sharing agreement, being true and correct in all material respects, without\ngiving effect to qualifications in such representations and warranties with respect to materiality or material adverse effects\non B/E Aerospace, in the case of clauses (i) and (ii), as of the closing of the merger (or, in the case of representations and\nwarranties made as of a specific date, as of such date), with the representations and warranties listed in clauses (i) and\n(ii) referred to as the B/E Aerospace fundamental representations and warranties; \n\nall other representations and warranties of B/E Aerospace set forth in the merger agreement (other than the B/E Aerospace\nfundamental representations and warranties), without giving effect to qualifications in such representations and warranties\nwith respect to materiality or material adverse effects on B/E Aerospace, being true and correct as of the closing date (or, in\nthe case of representations and warranties made as of a specific date, as of such date), except where failure to be true and\ncorrect, individually or in the aggregate, has had or would reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on\nB/E Aerospace;\n\n148\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n161/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable would\nreasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a material adverse effect on Rockwell Collins; \n\nB/E Aerospace having received a certificate from an executive officer of Rockwell Collins certifying that the above\nconditions have been satisfied; and \n\nB/E Aerospace having received the B/E Aerospace Tax Advisor Opinion (or, if applicable, both the Rockwell Collins counsel).\n\n149\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n162/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nTermination \n\n        The merger agreement may be terminated at any time prior to the effective time, before or after approval is obtained from the\nstockholders of Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace (except as expressly noted otherwise), as follows:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nby the mutual written consent of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace; \n\nby either Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace if: \n\nthe merger has not been consummated on or before 5:00 p.m. (New York time) on October 21, 2017, except where\nthe party seeking to terminate the merger agreement for this reason has failed to perform or comply with any of its\nobligations under the merger agreement and such failure has been the principal cause or resulted in the failure of the\nconsummation of the merger on or before that date, this termination right being referred to as the End Date\nTermination Right; \n\nany governmental authority has issued or entered any final, non-appealable order or enacted any law after the date\nof the merger agreement that has the effect of permanently restraining, enjoining or otherwise prohibiting the\nmerger or the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, except where the issuance of such order\nwas proximately caused by the failure of the party seeking to terminate the merger agreement for this reason to\nperform or comply with any of its obligations under the merger agreement; \n\nthe Rockwell Collins Stockholder Approval has not been obtained upon a vote taken at the duly convened Rockwell\nCollins special meeting or at any adjournment or postponement of such meeting; or \n\nthe B/E Aerospace Stockholder Approval has not been obtained upon a vote taken at the duly convened\nB/E Aerospace special meeting or at any adjournment or postponement of such meeting; \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nby B/E Aerospace: \n\nif Rockwell Collins or Merger Sub breaches or fails to perform any of their respective representations, warranties,\ncovenants or other agreements set forth in the merger agreement, resulting in the failure of a closing condition\nregarding (i) the accuracy of Rockwell Collins\' representations or warranties (treating for this purpose the\nrepresentation and warranty made by Rockwell Collins regarding the truth and accuracy of the Rockwell Collins\nSigning Representation Letter as a Rockwell Collins fundamental representation and warranty in the event the\nB/E Aerospace Tax Advisor Opinion and either the Rockwell Collins Tax Advisor Opinion or the similar opinion of\nthe additional tax counsel cannot be delivered) or (ii) the performance or compliance in all material respects with\ntheir respective obligations under the merger agreement required to be performed or complied with on or prior to\nthe closing of the merger, and, in each case, such breach or failure to perform is incapable of being cured prior to\n5:00 p.m. (New York time) on October 21, 2017 or, if capable of being cured, will not have been cured prior to the\nearlier of 5:00 p.m. (New York time) on October 21, 2017 or the date agreement for this reason if B/E Aerospace is then in material breach of any of its\nmaterial obligations under the merger agreement, resulting in the failure of a closing condition regarding its\nperformance or compliance with its obligations under the merger agreement required to be performed or complied\nwith on or prior to the closing of the merger, the termination right described in this bullet point being referred to as\nthe B/E Aerospace Breach Termination and the merger is abandoned, the terminating party must provide written\nnotice to the other party specifying the provisions of the merger agreement pursuant to which the termination is being made and the merger\nagreement will be null and void and of no effect, without liability on the part of any party to the merger agreement, and the rights and\nobligations of any party to the merger agreement will cease, except that, obligations with respect to certain provisions of the merger\nagreement will survive the termination of the merger agreement, including the following:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nno termination will relieve any party of any liability or damages resulting from any intentional breach of the merger\nagreement prior to such termination or fraud, in which case the aggrieved party will be entitled to all remedies available at\nlaw or in equity, including liability for damages (taking into account all relevant factors, including the loss of the benefit of\nthe merger, any lost stockholder premium, any lost synergies, the time value of money and any benefit to the breaching\nparty or its stockholders arising from such intentional breach or fraud); and \n\nthe confidentiality agreement entered into by Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace in connection with entering into the\nmerger and the provisions of the merger agreement with respect to the effect of termination, termination fees, and general\nprovisions of interpretation and construction will survive any termination of the merger agreement.\n\n        Under the merger agreement, intentional breach means an action or omission taken or omitted to be taken that the breaching party\nintentionally takes (or fails to take) and knows (or should reasonably have known) would, or would reasonably be expected to, cause a\nmaterial breach of the merger agreement.\n\nTermination Fees and Expense Reimbursements \n\n        The merger agreement provides for payment of termination fees in connection with a termination of the merger agreement under the\nfollowing circumstances:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nB/E Aerospace will pay to Rockwell Collins $200 million:
