the terms of\nthe merger agreement.\n\n        The right of either party to receive the applicable termination fee and expense reimbursement, in circumstances in which the\napplicable termination fee or expense reimbursement is owed, is the sole and exclusive monetary remedy of the receiving party against the\nother party and its subsidiaries and representatives for all losses and damages suffered as a result of the failure of the consummation of the\ntransactions contemplated by the merger agreement to be consummated or failure to perform under the merger agreement or otherwise,\nexcept (i) in the event of (a) termination due to failure of a party to include its required recommendation under the merger agreement in\nthis joint proxy statement/prospectus or due to breach of such party\'s non-solicitation obligations, (b) intentional breach of the covenant in\nthe merger agreement related to certain tax matters or fraudulent breach of either party\'s representations and warranties under the merger\nagreement related to their respective tax representation letters or (c) the right of each party to receive the applicable termination fee less\nthe applicable expense reimbursement under certain circumstances and (ii) that any party that fails to timely pay any termination fee or\nexpense reimbursement due pursuant to the merger agreement will be obligated to pay any costs and expenses in connection with any suit\nbrought by the other party that results in a judgment against the delinquent party for the payment of such termination fee and expense\nreimbursement.\n\n        Except as otherwise described under "Termination Fees and Expense Reimbursements" above, all expenses incurred in connection\nwith the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement shall be paid by the party incurring such expenses,\nwhether or not the merger is consummated.\n\nExpenses \n\nAmendment and Waiver \n\nAmendment\n\n        The merger agreement may be amended by mutual agreement of the parties in writing at any time before or after receipt of the\nrespective stockholder approvals of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace, except that no amendment may be made (i) after receipt of\neither of the respective stockholder approvals of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace if such amendment would require, in accordance\nwith applicable law or the rules of any stock exchange, further approval of the parties\' respective stockholders, (ii) that is not permitted\nunder applicable law or (iii) that would adversely affect the rights of Rockwell Collins\' financing sources under the merger agreement\nrelating to amendment, status as third-party beneficiaries, waiver of jury trial or governing law and liability with regard to legal,\nadministrative or other similar proceedings or actions related to such financing sources.\n\n154\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n167/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nWaiver\n\n        At any time prior to the effective time, subject to applicable law, the parties may:\n\nextend the time for the performance of any obligation or other act of any other party to the merger agreement; \n\nwaive any inaccuracies in the representations and warranties of any other party to the merger agreement contained in the\nmerger agreement or in any document delivered pursuant to the merger agreement; or \n\nwaive compliance with any agreement or condition contained in the merger agreement.\n\n        No failure or delay by any party in exercising any right under the merger agreement will operate as a waiver of such right nor will any\nsingle or partial exercise of any such right preclude any other or further exercise of any other right under the merger agreement. Any\nagreement on the part of a party to any such extension or waiver will be valid only if set forth in an instrument in writing signed on behalf\nof such party.\n\nThird-Party Beneficiaries \n\n        The merger agreement is not intended to and will not confer upon any person or entity other than the parties thereto any rights or\nremedies, except for:\n\nfrom and after the effective time, the provisions of the merger agreement relating to indemnification and exculpation from\nliability for the current or former directors and officers of B/E Aerospace; \n\nfrom and after the effective time, the holders of B/E Aerospace common stock and B/E Aerospace equity awards; and \n\nfinancing sources of Rockwell Collins, with respect to amendments to the merger agreement, waiver of jury trial or\ngoverning law and liability with regard to legal, administrative or other similar proceedings or actions related to such\nfinancing sources.\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nGoverning Law; Jurisdiction; Waiver of Jury Trial \n\nGoverning Law; Jurisdiction\n\n        The merger agreement and all legal, administrative and other similar proceedings or actions (whether based on contract, tort or\notherwise) arising out of or relating to the merger agreement or the actions of the parties to the merger agreement in the negotiation,\nadministration, performance and enforcement of the merger agreement, will be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of\nthe State of Delaware, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of laws provision or rule (whether of the State of Delaware or any\nother jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of Delaware.\n\n        Notwithstanding the provision described in the preceding paragraph, the parties have agreed not to bring any legal, administrative or\nother similar proceedings or actions against any of Rockwell Collins\' financing sources relating to the merger in any forum other than the\nSupreme Court of the State of New York or, if exclusive jurisdiction for any such proceeding or action is vested in federal courts, the\nUnited States District Court for the Southern District of New York and appellate courts thereof. In addition, such proceedings or actions\nagainst any of Rockwell Collins\' financing sources will be governed by the laws of the State of New York, except that, prior to the closing\nof the merger, the definition of material adverse effect and the representations and warranties in the merger agreement will, for the\npurposes of any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing document in\n\n155\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n168/330\n\n\x0cTable of Contents\n\nWaiver of Jury Trial\n\nEnforcement \n\n8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nconnection with the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware.\n\n        B/E Aerospace has agreed that it will have no rights or claims against any of Rockwell Collins\' financing sources in connection with\nthe merger agreement, the merger or any financing document in connection with the transactions contemplated by the merger agreement.\n\n        The parties have agreed to waive all rights to trial by jury in any action, proceeding or counterclaim between any of them arising out\nof or relating to the merger agreement.\n\n        The parties have agreed that irreparable damage for which monetary damages, even if available, would not be an adequate remedy,\nwould occur in the event that any party to the merger agreement does not perform the provisions of the merger agreement (including\nfailing to take such actions as are required of such party to consummate the merger agreement) in accordance with the specified terms of\nthe merger agreement or otherwise breach the provisions of the merger agreement. Accordingly, the parties acknowledged and agreed that,\nprior to any termination of the merger agreement in accordance with the terms of the merger agreement, the parties will be entitled to an\ninjunction, specific performance and other equitable relief to prevent breaches of the merger agreement and to enforce specifically the\nterms and provisions of the merger agreement, in addition to any other remedy to which they are entitled at law or in equity. Each of the\nparties agreed that it will not oppose the granting of an injunction, specific performance and other equitable relief on the basis that any\nother party has an adequate remedy at law or that any award of specific performance is not an appropriate remedy for any reason at law or\nin equity. Any party seeking an injunction or injunctions to prevent breaches of the merger agreement and to enforce specifically the terms\nand provisions of the merger agreement will not be required to provide any bond or other security in connection with any such order or\ninjunction.\n\n156\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n169/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nRockwell Collins \n\nINFORMATION ABOUT THE COMPANIES \n\n        Rockwell Collins designs, produces and supports communications and aviation systems for commercial and military customers and\nprovides information management services through voice and data communication networks and solutions worldwide. The integrated\nsystem solutions and products Rockwell Collins provides to its served markets are oriented around a set of core competencies:\ncommunications, navigation, automated flight control, displays/surveillance, simulation and training, integrated electronics and\ninformation management systems. Rockwell Collins also provides a wide range of services and support to its customers through a\nworldwide network of service centers, including equipment repair and overhaul, service parts, field service engineering, training, technical\ninformation services and aftermarket used equipment sales. The structure of Rockwell Collins\' business allows it to leverage these core\ncompetencies across markets and applications to bring high value solutions to its customers.\n\n        Rockwell Collins serves a worldwide customer base through its three operating segments: Commercial Systems, Government\nSystems and Information Management Services. The Commercial Systems segment supplies aviation electronics systems, products and\nservices to customers located throughout the world. The customer base is comprised of original equipment manufacturers of commercial\nair transport, business and regional aircraft, commercial airlines and business aircraft operators. The Government Systems segment\nprovides a broad range of electronic products, systems and services to customers including the U.S. Department of Defense, various\nministries of defense, other government agencies and defense contractors around the world. These products, systems and services support\nairborne, precision weapon, ground and maritime applications on new equipment as well as in retrofit and upgrade applications designed\nto extend the service life and enhance the capability of existing aircraft, vehicle and weapon platforms. The Information Management\nServices segment provides communications services, systems integration and security solutions across the aviation, airport, rail and\nnuclear security markets to customers located around the world. The customer base includes commercial airlines, business aircraft\noperators, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), airport and critical infrastructure operators and major passenger and freight\nrailroads.\n\n        Rockwell Collins serves a broad range of customers worldwide, including the U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Coast Guard, civil\nagencies, airports, defense contractors, foreign ministries of defense, manufacturers of commercial helicopters, manufacturers of\ncommercial air transport, business and regional aircraft, commercial airlines, fractional and other business jet operators, the FAA, critical\ninfrastructure operators and major passenger and freight railroads. Rockwell Collins markets its systems, products and services directly to\nits customers through an internal marketing and sales force. In addition, it utilizes a worldwide dealer network to distribute its products\nand international sales representatives to assist with international sales and marketing. In 2016, various branches of the U.S. Government,\nboth directly and indirectly through subcontracts, accounted for 33% of Rockwell Collins\' total sales.\n\n        Rockwell Collins\' executive offices are located at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa 52498 and its telephone number is\n(319) 295-1000. Rockwell Collins\' website address is www.rockwellcollins.com. Information contained on Rockwell Collins\' website does\nnot constitute part of this joint proxy statement/prospectus. Rockwell Collins\' stock is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker\nsymbol "COL."\n\nB/E Aerospace \n\n        B/E Aerospace is a world leading manufacturer of aircraft cabin interior products. B/E Aerospace designs, develops and manufactures\na broad range of products for both commercial aircraft and\n\n157\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n170/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nbusiness jets. B/E Aerospace\'s manufactured products include aircraft cabin seating, lighting systems, oxygen systems, food and beverage\npreparation and storage equipment, galley systems and modular lavatory systems. B/E Aerospace also provides cabin interior\nreconfiguration, program management and certification services. B/E Aerospace sells and supports its products through its own global\ndirect sales and product support organization.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s commercial aircraft segment includes seating products, interior systems, and engineering services for commercial\naircraft, and brazing technologies and electronic systems for the commercial and military aerospace markets. B/E Aerospace has the\ndesign and engineering capabilities to create and manufacture highly customized products tailored to customers\' unique preferences. As an\nindustry leading manufacturer of interior systems for both narrow- and wide-body aircraft, B/E Aerospace supplies food and beverage\npreparation equipment, galleys and galley air chillers, cabin lighting, oxygen systems and passenger service units (PSUs), lavatories, and\nwater and waste systems. B/E Aerospace services also include optimizing cabin layout and installing crew rest compartments.\nAdditionally, B/E Aerospace is a market leader in the design, engineering, and manufacturing of customized, fully integrated thermal\nmanagement, power conversion and interconnect solutions that address complex power management requirements. Revenues for the\ncommercial aircraft segment in the third quarter of 2016 were $578.8 million.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s business jet segment manufactures products that include a complete line of business jet seating and divan products,\nsuper first class environments, lighting systems, air valves, water and waste systems, oxygen delivery systems and de-icing systems. B/E\nAerospace is internationally recognized as a leading supplier of business jet products and services for leading prominent business jet\nmanufacturers and completion centers. Revenues for the business jet segment in the third quarter of 2016 were $153.9 million.\n\n        B/E Aerospace was founded by Amin and Bob Khoury in 1987 upon the acquisition of Bach Engineering. After acquiring EECO, Inc.\nin 1989, the company\'s name was changed to B/E Avionics. B/E Aerospace became a public company listed on the NASDAQ in April\n1990. In 1992, B/E Aerospace acquired the assets of PTC Aerospace, Inc. and Aircraft Products Company, transforming B/E Aerospace\ninto a cabin interiors provider, and the company\'s name became "B/E Aerospace, Inc." Over the next 10 years, acquisitions of interior\nequipment companies established B/E Aerospace as a renowned interiors provider. In 2001, B/E Aerospace expanded its operations to\ninclude distribution by acquiring M&M Aerospace. Honeywell\'s Consumables Solutions business was acquired in 2008, establishing B/E\nAerospace as a global leader in distributing aerospace fasteners and consumables, and provider of logistics services. In 2014, the\nConsumables Management Segment, which consisted of B/E Aerospace\'s aerospace distribution and energy services businesses, was spun-\noff to form KLX.\n\n        B/E Aerospace\'s executive offices are located at 1400 Corporate Center Way, Wellington, Florida, 33414, its website address is\nwww.beaerospace.com, and its phone number is (561) 791-5000. Information contained on B/E Aerospace\'s website does not constitute\npart of this joint proxy statement/prospectus. B/E Aerospace common stock is listed on the NASDAQ, trading under the symbol "BEAV."\n\nMerger Sub \n\n        Merger Sub, a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins, is a Delaware corporation incorporated on October 19, 2016 for the\npurpose of effecting the merger. Merger Sub has not conducted any activities other than those incidental to its formation and the matters\ncontemplated by the merger agreement, including the preparation of applicable regulatory filings in connection with the merger. The\nprincipal executive offices of Merger Sub are located at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa 52498.\n\n158\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n171/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nROCKWELL COLLINS SPECIAL MEETING \n\n        This joint proxy statement/prospectus is being provided to the Rockwell Collins stockholders as part of a solicitation of proxies by the\nRockwell Collins Board for use at the Rockwell Collins special meeting to be held at the time and place specified below and at any\nproperly convened meeting following an adjournment or postponement thereof. This joint proxy statement/prospectus provides Rockwell\nCollins stockholders with information they need to know to be able to vote or instruct their vote to be cast at the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting.\n\nDate, Time and Place \n\n        The special meeting of Rockwell Collins stockholders will be held at the Cedar Rapids Marriott, 1200 Collins Road NE, Cedar\nRapids, Iowa, on March 9, 2017, at 8:30 a.m. (Central time) Rockwell Collins intends to mail this joint proxy statement/prospectus and the\nenclosed form of proxy to its stockholders entitled to vote at the Rockwell Collins special meeting on or about February 6, 2017.\n\nPurpose of the Rockwell Collins Special Meeting \n\n        At the Rockwell Collins special meeting, Rockwell Collins stockholders will be asked to consider and vote on the following:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\na proposal to issue Rockwell Collins common stock pursuant to the merger agreement, which is further described in the\nsections titled "The Merger" and "The Merger Agreement," beginning on page 57 and page 128, respectively, and a copy of\nwhich is attached as Annex A to the joint proxy statement/prospectus accompanying this notice, which is referred to as the\nShare Issuance proposal; and \n\na proposal to approve the adjournment of the Rockwell Collins special meeting to a later date or dates, if necessary or\nappropriate, to solicit additional proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to\napprove the Share Issuance proposal, which is referred to as the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal.\n\n        Completion of the merger is conditioned on the approval of the Share Issuance proposal.\n\nRecommendation of the Rockwell Collins Board \n\n        On October 21, 2016, the Rockwell Collins Board adopted the merger agreement, declared the merger agreement advisable and\ndetermined that the merger and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement are in the best interests of Rockwell Collins\nand its stockholders. Accordingly, the Rockwell Collins Board unanimously recommends that Rockwell Collins stockholders vote\n"FOR" the Share Issuance proposal and "FOR" the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal.\n\n        Rockwell Collins stockholders should carefully read this joint proxy statement/prospectus, including any documents incorporated by\nreference, and the annexes in their entirety for more detailed information concerning the merger and the other transactions contemplated\nby the merger agreement.\n\nRockwell Collins Record Date; Stockholders Entitled to Vote \n\n        Only holders of record of Rockwell Collins common stock at the close of business on January 18, 2017 will be entitled to notice of,\nand to vote at, the Rockwell Collins special meeting or any adjournments or postponements thereof.\n\n        As of the record date, there were 130,799,839 shares of Rockwell Collins common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the\nRockwell Collins special meeting. Each share of Rockwell Collins common stock outstanding on the Rockwell Collins record date entitles\nthe holder thereof to one vote on each proposal to be considered at the Rockwell Collins special meeting, in person or by\n\n159\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n172/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nproxy through the Internet or by telephone or by a properly executed and delivered proxy with respect to the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting.\n\n        A complete list of stockholders entitled to vote at the Rockwell Collins special meeting will be available for examination by any\nRockwell Collins stockholder in the Investor Relations department at Rockwell Collins\' corporate office at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar\nRapids, Iowa for purposes pertaining to the Rockwell Collins special meeting, during ordinary business hours for a period of 10 days\nbefore the Rockwell Collins special meeting, and at the time and place of the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\nVoting by Rockwell Collins\' Directors and Executive Officers \n\n        As of the record date Rockwell Collins directors and executive officers and their affiliates were entitled to vote 363,896 shares of\nRockwell Collins common stock or approximately less than 1% of the shares of Rockwell Collins common stock outstanding on that date.\nRockwell Collins currently expects its directors and executive officers to vote their shares in favor of all Rockwell Collins proposals, but\nno director or executive officer has entered into any agreement obligating him or her to do so.\n\nQuorum \n\nRequired Vote \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n        The Rockwell Collins by-laws provide that the holders of a majority of the issued and outstanding stock of Rockwell Collins present\neither in person or by proxy will constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        Abstentions will count for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum for the transaction of business at the Rockwell\nCollins special meeting.\n\n        Broker non-votes, if any, will not be counted for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum for the transaction of business\nat the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        The required votes to approve the Rockwell Collins proposals are as follows:\n\nThe Share Issuance proposal requires the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by shares of Rockwell\nCollins common stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the Rockwell Collins special meeting. \n\nThe Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal requires the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the shares of\nRockwell Collins common stock represented (in person or by proxy) at the Rockwell Collins special meeting and entitled\nto vote on the proposal, whether or not a quorum is present.\n\nVoting of Proxies by Holders of Record \n\nHow to Vote by Proxy If You Are the Record Holder of Your Shares\n\n        If you were the record holder of your shares as of the Rockwell Collins record date, you may submit your proxy to vote by mail, by\ntelephone or via the Internet. Note that if you hold your shares through the Rockwell Collins Retirement Savings Plan, which was\nestablished pursuant to Section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code and is referred to as the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, additional\nrestrictions apply as described below under "How to Vote Your 401(k) Plan Shares by Proxy."\n\n160\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n173/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nVoting via the Internet or by Telephone.\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nTo submit your proxy via the Internet, go to www.proxypush.com/COL. Have your proxy card in hand when you access the\nwebsite and follow the instructions to vote your shares. \n\nTo submit your proxy by telephone, call 1-866-883-3382. Have your proxy card in hand when you call and then follow the\ninstructions to vote your shares. \n\nIf you vote via the Internet or by telephone, you must do so no later than 11:59 p.m. (Central time) on March 8,\n2017.\n\n        Voting by Mail.    As an alternative to submitting your proxy via the Internet or by telephone, you may submit your proxy by mail.\n\nTo submit your proxy by mail, simply mark your proxy card, date and sign it and return it in the postage-paid envelope. If\nyou do not have the postage-paid envelope, please mail your completed proxy card to the following address: Shareowner\nServices, P.O. Box 64945, St. Paul, MN 55164-0945. \n\nIf you vote by mail, your proxy card must be received no later than the closing of the polls at the Rockwell Collins\nspecial meeting.\n\nHow to Vote Your Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan Shares by Proxy \n\n        If you hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, you may vote your shares by\ntelephone, mail or via the Internet as described above. If you vote your shares by telephone or via the Internet, your voting instructions\nmust be received before 11:59 p.m. (Central time) on March 5, 2017 in order for the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan trustee to vote your\nshares. If you vote your shares by mail, your voting instructions must be received by March 5, 2017 in order for the Rockwell Collins\n401(k) Plan trustee to vote your shares. If you hold shares through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan and do not timely submit your voting\ninstructions by this deadline, your applicable shares will be voted in the same proportion to the shares held in the Rockwell Collins 401(k)\nPlan for which votes were cast.\n\n        If you hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, you may attend the Rockwell\nCollins special meeting. However, shares held through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan can only be voted as described above, and cannot\nbe voted in person at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\nGeneral \n\n        Please be aware that any costs related to voting via the Internet, such as Internet access charges, will be your responsibility.\n\n        All properly signed proxies that are timely received and that are not revoked will be voted at the Rockwell Collins special meeting\naccording to the instructions indicated on the proxies or, if no direction is indicated, they will be voted as recommended by the Rockwell\nCollins Board. Unless a Rockwell Collins stockholder checks the box on its proxy card to withhold discretionary authority, the proxy\nholders may use their discretion to vote on other matters relating to the Rockwell Collins special meeting. In addition, as noted above, if\nyou hold shares through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, you may attend the Rockwell Collins special meeting, but those shares can only\nbe voted as described above, and cannot be voted at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n161\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n174/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nTreatment of Abstentions; Failure to Vote \n\n        For purposes of the Rockwell Collins special meeting, an abstention occurs when a Rockwell Collins stockholder attends the\nRockwell Collins special meeting, either in person or by proxy, but abstains from voting.\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nFor the Share Issuance proposal, if a Rockwell Collins stockholder present in person at the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting abstains from voting, or responds by proxy with an "abstain" vote, it will have the effect of a vote cast\n"AGAINST" such proposal. If a Rockwell Collins stockholder is not present in person at the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting and does not respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is\npresent). \n\nFor the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal, if a Rockwell Collins stockholder present in person at the Rockwell\nCollins special meeting abstains from voting, or responds by proxy with an "abstain" vote, it will have the effect of a vote\ncast "AGAINST" such proposal. If a Rockwell Collins stockholder is not present in person at the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting and does not respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is\npresent).\n\nShares Held in Street Name \n\n        If you are a Rockwell Collins stockholder and your shares are held in "street name" through a broker, bank or other nominee, you\nmust provide the record holder of your shares with instructions on how to vote the shares. Please follow the voting instructions provided\nby the bank or broker. You may not vote shares held in street name by returning a proxy card directly to Rockwell Collins or by voting in\nperson at the Rockwell Collins special meeting unless you provide a "legal proxy," which you must obtain from your broker, bank or other\nnominee. Further, brokers, banks or other nominees who hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock on behalf of their customers may\nnot give a proxy to Rockwell Collins to vote those shares with respect to the Share Issuance proposal and the Rockwell Collins\nAdjournment proposal without specific instructions from their customers, as brokers, banks and other nominees do not have discretionary\nvoting power on these "non-routine" matters. Broker non-votes occur when a broker or nominee is not instructed by the beneficial owner\nof shares to vote on a particular proposal for which the broker does not have discretionary voting power. Therefore, if you are a Rockwell\nCollins stockholder and you do not instruct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote your shares:\n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Share Issuance proposal, which broker non-votes, if\nany, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present); and \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (regardless of whether a quorum is present).\n\nAttendance at the Rockwell Collins Special Meeting and Voting in Person \n\n        Stockholders who wish to attend the Rockwell Collins special meeting will be required to present verification of ownership of\nRockwell Collins common stock, such as a bank or brokerage firm account statement, and will be required to present a valid government-\nissued picture identification, such as a driver\'s license or passport, to gain admittance to the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        If you are a stockholder of record and plan to attend the Rockwell Collins special meeting and wish to vote in person, you will be\ngiven a ballot at the Rockwell Collins special meeting. Please note, however, that if your shares are held of record by a broker, bank or\nother nominee, and you wish to\n\n162\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n175/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nvote in person at the Rockwell Collins special meeting, you must bring to the Rockwell Collins special meeting a legal proxy from the\nrecord holder of the shares (your broker, bank or other nominee) authorizing you to vote at the Rockwell Collins special meeting.\n\n        No cameras, recording equipment, electronic devices, large bags, briefcases or packages will be permitted in the Rockwell\nCollins special meeting.\n\nRevocability of Proxies \n\n        Any stockholder giving a proxy has the power to revoke it at any time before the proxy is voted at the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting. If you are a stockholder of record, you may revoke your proxy in any of the following ways:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nBy delivering, before 11:59 p.m. (Central time) on March 8, 2017, to Rockwell Collins\' Corporate Secretary or Assistant\nSecretary (at Rockwell Collins\' executive offices at 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa) a signed written notice of\nrevocation bearing a later date than the proxy, stating that the proxy is revoked; \n\nBy duly executing a subsequently dated proxy relating to the same shares of Rockwell Collins common stock and\ndelivering it to Rockwell Collins\' Corporate Secretary or Assistant Secretary at the address in the bullet above before 11:59\np.m. (Central time) on March 8, 2017; \n\nBy duly submitting a subsequently dated proxy relating to the same shares of Rockwell Collins common stock by\ntelephone or via the Internet (i.e., your most recent duly submitted voting instructions will be followed) before 11:59 p.m.\n(Central time) on March 8, 2017; or \n\nBy attending the Rockwell Collins special meeting in person and voting such shares during the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting as described above, although attendance at the Rockwell Collins special meeting will not, by itself, revoke a proxy.\n\n        If you hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, you may revoke your proxy using\nany of the above methods (other than as described in the 4th bullet above), but must do so before 11:59 p.m. (Central time) on March 5,\n2017 if you vote by telephone or via the Internet and your revocation must be received by March 5, 2017 if you vote by mail.\n\n        If your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee or through the Rockwell Collins 401(k) Plan, you may change your vote by\nsubmitting new voting instructions to your broker, bank or other nominee. You must contact your broker, bank or other nominee, or\nRockwell Collins 401(k) Plan administrator to find out how to do so.\n\nSolicitation \n\n        The Rockwell Collins Board is soliciting proxies for the Rockwell Collins special meeting from its stockholders. Rockwell Collins\nwill bear the entire cost of the solicitation of proxies, including preparation, assembly and delivery, as applicable, of this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus, the proxy card and any additional materials furnished to stockholders. Proxies may be solicited by directors, officers\nand a small number of Rockwell Collins\' regular employees personally or by mail, telephone or facsimile, but such persons will not be\nspecially compensated for such service. Rockwell Collins has retained Innisfree M&A Incorporated, a proxy solicitation firm, to assist in\nthe solicitation of proxies for a fee of approximately $23,000 plus reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses. As appropriate, copies of\nsolicitation material will be furnished to brokerage houses, fiduciaries and custodians that hold shares of Rockwell Collins common stock\nof record for beneficial owners for forwarding to such beneficial owners. Rockwell Collins may also reimburse persons representing\nbeneficial owners for their costs of forwarding the solicitation material to such owners.\n\n163\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n176/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nAssistance \n\nTabulation of Votes \n\nAdjournments \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n        If you need assistance with voting via the Internet, voting by telephone or completing your proxy card, or have questions regarding\nthe Rockwell Collins special meeting, please contact Rockwell Collins\' Shareowner Relations line at (319) 295-4045.\n\n        Your vote is very important regardless of the number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock that you own. Please vote\nyour shares via the Internet or by telephone, or sign, date and return a proxy card promptly to ensure that your shares can be\nrepresented, even if you otherwise plan to attend the Rockwell Collins special meeting in person.\n\n        Rockwell Collins has appointed Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, which is referred to as Wells Fargo, to serve as the Inspector of\nElection for the Rockwell Collins special meeting. Wells Fargo will independently tabulate affirmative and negative votes and abstentions.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins special meeting may be adjourned to allow additional time for obtaining additional proxies. No notice of an\nadjourned meeting need be given if the time and place thereof are announced at the meeting at which the adjournment was taken unless:\n\nthe adjournment is for more than 30 days, in which case a notice of the adjourned meeting will be given to each\nstockholder of record entitled to vote at the meeting; or \n\nif after the adjournment, a new record date for determination of stockholders entitled to vote is fixed for the adjourned\nmeeting, in which case the Rockwell Collins Board will fix as the record date for determining stockholders entitled to\nnotice of such adjourned meeting the same or an earlier date as that fixed for determination of stockholders entitled to vote\nat the adjourned meeting, and will give notice of the adjourned meeting to each stockholder of record as of such record\ndate.\n\n        At any adjourned meeting, all proxies will be voted in the same manner as they would have been voted at the original convening of\nthe special meeting, except for any proxies that have been effectively revoked or withdrawn prior to the adjourned meeting.\n\n164\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n177/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nROCKWELL COLLINS PROPOSALS \n\nItem 1.    The Share Issuance Proposal \n\n        (Item 1 on Rockwell Collins Proxy Card)\n\n        In the Share Issuance proposal, Rockwell Collins is asking its stockholders to approve the issuance of Rockwell Collins common\nstock pursuant to the merger agreement. Approval of the Share Issuance proposal by Rockwell Collins stockholders is required for\ncompletion of the merger.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins Board unanimously recommends a vote "FOR" the Share Issuance proposal (Item 1).\n\nItem 2.    The Rockwell Collins Adjournment Proposal \n\n        (Item 2 on Rockwell Collins Proxy Card)\n\n        The Rockwell Collins special meeting may be adjourned to another time or place from time to time, if necessary or appropriate, to\npermit further solicitation of proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the Rockwell Collins Special Meeting to\napprove the Share Issuance proposal.\n\n        If, at the Rockwell Collins special meeting, the number of shares of Rockwell Collins common stock present or represented and\nvoting in favor of the Share Issuance proposal is insufficient to approve the Share Issuance proposal, Rockwell Collins intends to adjourn\nthe Rockwell Collins special meeting in order to enable the Rockwell Collins Board to solicit additional proxies for approval of the Share\nIssuance proposal.\n\n        In the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal, Rockwell Collins is asking its stockholders to authorize the holder of any proxy\nsolicited by the Rockwell Collins Board to vote in favor of granting authority to the proxy holders, and each of them individually, to\nadjourn the Rockwell Collins special meeting to another time and place for the purpose of soliciting additional proxies. If the Rockwell\nCollins stockholders approve the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal, Rockwell Collins could adjourn the Rockwell Collins special\nmeeting and any adjourned session of the Rockwell Collins special meeting and use the additional time to solicit additional proxies,\nincluding the solicitation of proxies from Rockwell Collins stockholders who have previously voted.\n\n        The Rockwell Collins Board unanimously recommends a vote "FOR" the Rockwell Collins Adjournment proposal (Item 2).\n\n165\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n178/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nB/E AEROSPACE SPECIAL MEETING \n\n        This joint proxy statement/prospectus is being provided to the B/E Aerospace stockholders as part of a solicitation of proxies by the\nB/E Aerospace Board for use at the B/E Aerospace special meeting to be held at the time and place specified below and at any properly\nconvened meeting following an adjournment or postponement thereof. This joint proxy statement/prospectus provides B/E Aerospace\nstockholders with information they need to know to be able to vote or instruct their vote to be cast at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\nDate, Time and Place \n\n        The special meeting of B/E Aerospace stockholders will be held at the Hilton Palm Beach Airport, 150 Australian Avenue, West Palm\nBeach, Florida, 33406-1473, on March 9, 2017, at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern time) B/E Aerospace intends to mail this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus and the enclosed form of proxy to its stockholders entitled to vote at the B/E Aerospace special meeting on or about\nFebruary 6, 2017.\n\nPurpose of the B/E Aerospace Special Meeting \n\n        At the B/E Aerospace special meeting, B/E Aerospace stockholders will be asked to consider and vote on the following:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\na proposal to adopt the merger agreement, which is further described in the sections titled "The Merger" and "The Merger\nAgreement," beginning on page 57 and page 128, respectively, and a copy of which is attached as Annex A to the joint\nproxy statement/prospectus accompanying this notice, which is referred to as the Merger proposal; \n\nan advisory (non-binding) proposal to approve the compensation that may be paid or become payable to B/E Aerospace\'s\nnamed executive officers that is based on or otherwise related to the proposed transactions, which is referred to as the\nMerger-Related Compensation proposal; and \n\na proposal to approve the adjournment of the B/E Aerospace special meeting to a later date or dates, if necessary or\nappropriate, to solicit additional proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the special meeting to\napprove the Merger proposal, which is referred to as the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal.\n\n        Completion of the merger is conditioned on the approval of the Merger proposal.\n\nRecommendation of the B/E Aerospace Board \n\n        On October 23, 2016, the B/E Aerospace Board adopted the merger agreement, declared the merger agreement advisable and\ndetermined that the merger and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement are in the best interests of B/E Aerospace and\nits stockholders. Accordingly, the B/E Aerospace Board unanimously recommends that B/E Aerospace stockholders vote "FOR"\nthe Merger proposal, "FOR" the Merger-Related Compensation proposal and "FOR" the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal.\n\n        B/E Aerospace stockholders should carefully read this joint proxy statement/prospectus, including any documents incorporated by\nreference, and the annexes in their entirety for more detailed information concerning the merger and the other transactions contemplated\nby the merger agreement.\n\nB/E Aerospace Record Date; Stockholders Entitled to Vote \n\n        Only holders of record of B/E Aerospace common stock at the close of business on January 18, 2017 will be entitled to notice of, and\nto vote at, the B/E Aerospace special meeting or any adjournments or postponements thereof.\n\n166\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n179/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        As of the record date, there were 101,515,298 shares of B/E Aerospace common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the B/E\nAerospace special meeting. Each share of B/E Aerospace common stock outstanding on the B/E Aerospace record date entitles the holder\nthereof to one vote on each proposal to be considered at the B/E Aerospace special meeting, in person or by proxy through the Internet or\nby telephone or by a properly executed and delivered proxy with respect to the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n        A complete list of stockholders entitled to vote at the B/E Aerospace special meeting will be available for examination by any B/E\nAerospace stockholder in the Investor Relations department at B/E Aerospace\'s corporate office at 1400 Corporate Center Way,\nWellington, Florida, for purposes pertaining to the B/E Aerospace special meeting, between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. (Eastern\ntime) for a period of 10 days before the B/E Aerospace special meeting, and at the time and place of the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\nVoting by B/E Aerospace\'s Directors and Executive Officers \n\n        As of the record date, B/E Aerospace directors and executive officers and their affiliates were entitled to vote 269,296 shares of\nB/E Aerospace common stock or less than 1% of the shares of B/E Aerospace common stock outstanding on that date. B/E Aerospace\ncurrently expects its directors and executive officers to vote their shares in favor of all B/E Aerospace proposals, but no director or\nexecutive officer has entered into any agreement obligating him or her to do so. The number of shares reflected above does not include\nshares subject to outstanding unvested restricted stock awards or shares underlying unvested restricted stock units. For information with\nrespect to restricted stock awards and restricted stock units, please see "\xe2\x80\x94Treatment of Restricted Stock Awards" and "\xe2\x80\x94Treatment of\nRestricted Stock Units" beginning on page 103 and page 104, respectively.\n\nQuorum \n\nRequired Vote \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n        The B/E Aerospace by-laws require that the holders of a majority of the votes entitled to be cast be present in person or by proxy in\norder for the business of the B/E Aerospace special meeting to be transacted.\n\n        Abstentions will count for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum for the transaction of business at the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting.\n\n        Broker non-votes, if any, will not be counted for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum for the transaction of business\nat the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n        The required votes to approve the B/E Aerospace proposals are as follows:\n\nThe Merger proposal requires the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the issued and outstanding shares of B/E\nAerospace common stock. \n\nThe Merger-Related Compensation proposal requires the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by\nstockholders entitled to vote on the proposal that are present in person or represented by proxy, assuming a quorum.\nBecause the vote on the Merger-Related Compensation proposal is advisory only, it will not be binding on either B/E\nAerospace or Rockwell Collins. Accordingly, if the Merger proposal is approved and the merger is completed, the merger-\nrelated compensation will be payable to B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers, subject only to the conditions\napplicable thereto, regardless of the outcome of the approval of the Merger-Related Compensation proposal.\n\n167\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n180/330\n\n\x0c\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nThe B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal requires the affirmative vote of holders of a majority of the votes cast by B/E\nAerospace stockholders present in person or represented by proxy, whether or not a quorum is present.\n\nVoting of Proxies by Holders of Record \n\nHow to Vote by Proxy If You Are the Record Holder of Your Shares\n\n        If you were the record holder of your shares as of the B/E Aerospace record date, you may submit your proxy to vote by mail, by\ntelephone or via the Internet. Note that if you hold your shares through the B/E Aerospace, Inc. Savings Plan, which was established\npursuant to Section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code and is referred to as the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, additional restrictions apply\nas described below under "How to Vote Your B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan Shares by Proxy."\n\nVoting via the Internet or by Telephone.\n\nTo submit your proxy via the Internet, go to www.investorvote.com/BEAV. Have your proxy card in hand when you access\nthe website and follow the instructions to vote your shares. \n\nTo submit your proxy by telephone, call 1-800-652-VOTE(8683). Have your proxy card in hand when you call and then\nfollow the instructions to vote your shares. \n\nIf you vote via the Internet or by telephone, you must do so no later than 11:59 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 8,\n2017.\n\n        Voting by Mail.    As an alternative to submitting your proxy via the Internet or by telephone, you may submit your proxy by mail.\n\nTo submit your proxy by mail, simply mark your proxy card, date and sign it and return it in the postage-paid envelope. If\nyou do not have the postage-paid envelope, please mail your completed proxy card to the following address: Proxy\nServices, c/o Computershare Investor Services, PO Box 30202, College Station, Texas, 77842-9909 \n\nIf you vote by mail, your proxy card must be received no later than 6:00 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 8, 2017.\n\nHow to Vote Your B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan Shares by Proxy \n\n        If you hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, you may vote your shares by telephone,\nmail or via the Internet as described above. If you vote your shares by telephone or via the Internet, your voting instructions must be\nreceived before 11:59 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 6, 2017 in order for the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan trustee to vote your shares. If\nyou vote your shares by mail, your voting instructions must be received before 6:00 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 6, 2017 in order for\nthe B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan trustee to vote your shares. If you hold shares through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan and do not timely\nsubmit your voting instructions by this deadline, your applicable shares will be voted in the same proportion to the shares held in the\nB/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan for which votes were cast.\n\n        If you hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, you may attend the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting. However, shares held through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan can only be voted as described above, and cannot be voted\nin person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n168\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n181/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nGeneral \n\n        Please be aware that any costs related to voting via the Internet, such as Internet access charges, will be your responsibility.\n\n        All properly signed proxies that are timely received and that are not revoked will be voted at the B/E Aerospace special meeting\naccording to the instructions indicated on the proxies or, if no direction is indicated, they will be voted as recommended by the B/E\nAerospace Board. Unless a B/E Aerospace stockholder checks the box on its proxy card to withhold discretionary authority, the proxy\nholders may use their discretion to vote on other matters relating to the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\nTreatment of Abstentions; Failure to Vote \n\n        For purposes of the B/E Aerospace special meeting, an abstention occurs when a B/E Aerospace stockholder attends the B/E\nAerospace special meeting, either in person or by proxy, but abstains from voting.\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nFor the Merger proposal, if a B/E Aerospace stockholder present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting abstains\nfrom voting, or responds by proxy with an "abstain" vote, it will have the effect of a vote cast "AGAINST" such proposal.\nIf a B/E Aerospace stockholder is not present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and does not respond by\nproxy, it will have the effect of a vote cast "AGAINST" such proposal. \n\nFor the Merger-Related Compensation proposal, if a B/E Aerospace stockholder present in person at the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting abstains from voting, or responds by proxy with an "abstain" vote, it will have no effect on the vote count\nfor such proposal. If a B/E Aerospace stockholder is not present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and does\nnot respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present). \n\nFor the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal, if a B/E Aerospace stockholder present in person at the B/E Aerospace\nspecial meeting abstains from voting, or responds by proxy with an "abstain" vote, it will have no effect on the vote count\nfor such proposal. If a B/E Aerospace stockholder is not present in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting and does\nnot respond by proxy, it will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present).\n\nShares Held in Street Name \n\n        If you are a B/E Aerospace stockholder and your shares are held in "street name" through a broker, bank or other nominee, you must\nprovide the record holder of your shares with instructions on how to vote the shares. Please follow the voting instructions provided by the\nbank or broker. You may not vote shares held in street name by returning a proxy card directly to B/E Aerospace or by voting in person at\nthe B/E Aerospace special meeting unless you provide a "legal proxy," which you must obtain from your broker, bank or other nominee.\nFurther, brokers, banks or other nominees who hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock on behalf of their customers may not give a\nproxy to B/E Aerospace to vote those shares with respect to the Merger proposal, the Merger-Related Compensation proposal and the B/E\nAerospace Adjournment proposal without specific instructions from their customers, as brokers, banks and other nominees do not have\ndiscretionary voting power on these "non-routine" matters. Broker non-votes occur when a broker or nominee is not instructed by the\nbeneficial owner of shares to vote on a particular proposal for which the broker does not have discretionary voting power.\n\n169\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n182/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nTherefore, if you are a B/E Aerospace stockholder and you do not instruct your broker, bank or other nominee on how to vote your shares:\n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Merger proposal, which broker non-votes, if any, will\nhave the same effect as a vote AGAINST such proposal; \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the Merger-Related Compensation proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (assuming a quorum is present); and \n\nyour broker, bank or other nominee may not vote your shares on the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal, which broker\nnon-votes, if any, will have no effect on the vote count for such proposal (regardless of whether a quorum is present).\n\nAttendance at the B/E Aerospace Special Meeting and Voting in Person \n\n        Stockholders who wish to attend the B/E Aerospace special meeting will be required to present verification of ownership of B/E\nAerospace common stock, such as a bank or brokerage firm account statement, and will be required to present a valid government-issued\npicture identification, such as a driver\'s license or passport, to gain admittance to the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n        If you are a stockholder of record and plan to attend the B/E Aerospace special meeting and wish to vote in person, you will be given\na ballot at the B/E Aerospace special meeting. Please note, however, that if your shares are held of record by a broker, bank or other\nnominee, and you wish to vote in person at the B/E Aerospace special meeting, you must bring to the B/E Aerospace special meeting a\nlegal proxy from the record holder of the shares (your broker, bank or other nominee) authorizing you to vote at the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting. In addition, as noted above, if you hold shares through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, you may attend the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting, but those shares can only be voted as described above, and cannot be voted at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\n\n        No cameras, recording equipment, electronic devices, large bags, briefcases or packages will be permitted in the B/E\nAerospace special meeting.\n\nRevocability of Proxies \n\n        Any stockholder giving a proxy has the power to revoke it at any time before the proxy is voted at the B/E Aerospace special meeting.\nIf you are a stockholder of record, you may revoke your proxy in any of the following ways:\n\nBy delivering, before 6:00 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 8, 2017, to B/E Aerospace\'s Corporate Secretary, or Assistant\nSecretary, (at B/E Aerospace\'s executive offices at 1400 Corporate Center Way, Wellington, Florida) a signed written notice\nof revocation bearing a later date than the proxy, stating that the proxy is revoked; \n\nBy duly executing a subsequently dated proxy relating to the same shares of B/E Aerospace common stock and delivering\nit to B/E Aerospace\'s Corporate Secretary, or Assistant Secretary, at the address in the bullet above before 12:00 p.m.\n(Eastern time) on March 8, 2017; \n\nBy duly submitting a subsequently dated proxy relating to the same shares of B/E Aerospace common stock by telephone\nor via the Internet (i.e., your most recent duly submitted voting instructions will be followed) before 11:59 p.m. (Eastern\ntime) on March 8, 2017; or \n\nBy attending the B/E Aerospace special meeting in person and voting such shares during the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting as described above, although attendance at the B/E Aerospace special meeting will not, by itself, revoke a proxy.\n\n170\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n183/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        If you hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, you may revoke your proxy using any of\nthe above methods (other than (4) above), but must do so before 11:59 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 6, 2017 if you vote by telephone or\nvia the Internet and your revocation must be received before 6:00 p.m. (Eastern time) on March 6, 2017 if you vote by mail.\n\n        If your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee or through the B/E Aerospace 401(k) Plan, you may change your vote by\nsubmitting new voting instructions to your broker, bank or other nominee. You must contact your broker, bank or other nominee, or B/E\nAerospace 401(k) Plan administrator to find out how to do so.\n\nSolicitation \n\nAssistance \n\nTabulation of Votes \n\nAdjournments \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n        The B/E Aerospace Board is soliciting proxies for the B/E Aerospace special meeting from its stockholders. B/E Aerospace will bear\nthe entire cost of the solicitation of proxies, including preparation, assembly and delivery, as applicable, of this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus, the proxy card and any additional materials furnished to stockholders. Proxies may be solicited by directors, officers\nand a small number of B/E Aerospace\'s regular employees personally or by mail, telephone or facsimile, but such persons will not be\nspecially compensated for such service. B/E Aerospace has retained Georgeson LLC to assist in the solicitation of proxies for a fee of\napproximately $15,000 plus reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses. As appropriate, copies of solicitation material will be furnished\nto brokerage houses, fiduciaries and custodians that hold shares of B/E Aerospace common stock of record for beneficial owners for\nforwarding to such beneficial owners. B/E Aerospace may also reimburse persons representing beneficial owners for their costs of\nforwarding the solicitation material to such owners.\n\n        If you need assistance with voting via the Internet, voting by telephone or completing your proxy card, or have questions regarding\nthe B/E Aerospace special meeting, please contact B/E Aerospace\'s Investor Relations department at (561) 791-5000.\n\n        Your vote is very important regardless of the number of shares of B/E Aerospace common stock that you own. Please vote\nyour shares via the Internet or by telephone, or sign, date and return a proxy card promptly to ensure that your shares can be\nrepresented, even if you otherwise plan to attend the B/E Aerospace special meeting in person.\n\n        B/E Aerospace has appointed Computershare Trust Company, N.A., which is referred to as Computershare to serve as the Inspector\nof Election for the B/E Aerospace special meeting. Computershare will independently tabulate affirmative and negative votes and\nabstentions.\n\n        The B/E Aerospace special meeting may be adjourned to allow additional time for obtaining additional proxies. No notice of an\nadjourned meeting need be given if the time and place thereof are announced at the meeting at which the adjournment was taken unless:\n\nthe adjournment is for more than 30 days, in which case a notice of the adjourned meeting will be given to each\nstockholder of record entitled to vote at the meeting; or \n\nif after the adjournment, a new record date for determination of stockholders entitled to vote is fixed for the adjourned\nmeeting, in which case the B/E Aerospace Board will fix as the record date for determining stockholders entitled to notice\nof such adjourned meeting the same or an earlier date as that fixed for determination of stockholders entitled to vote at the\nadjourned meeting, and will give notice of the adjourned meeting to each stockholder of record as of such record date.\n\n        At any adjourned meeting, all proxies will be voted in the same manner as they would have been voted at the original convening of\nthe special meeting, except for any proxies that have been effectively revoked or withdrawn prior to the adjourned meeting.\n\n171\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n184/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nB/E AEROSPACE PROPOSALS \n\nItem 1.    The Merger Proposal \n\n        (Item 1 on B/E Aerospace Proxy Card)\n\n        In the Merger proposal, B/E Aerospace is asking its stockholders to adopt the merger agreement. Approval of the Merger proposal by\nB/E Aerospace stockholders is required for completion of the merger.\n\nThe B/E Aerospace Board unanimously recommends a vote "FOR" the Merger proposal (Item 1).\n\nItem 2.    The Merger-Related Compensation Proposal \n\n        (Item 2 on B/E Aerospace Proxy Card)\n\n        In the Merger-Related Compensation proposal, B/E Aerospace is asking its stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the merger-\nrelated compensation arrangements of B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers.\n\n        Because the vote on the Merger-Related Compensation proposal is advisory only, it will not be binding on either B/E Aerospace or\nRockwell Collins. Accordingly, if the Merger proposal is approved and the merger is completed, the merger-related compensation will be\npayable to B/E Aerospace\'s named executive officers, subject only to the conditions applicable thereto, regardless of the outcome of the\napproval of the Merger-Related Compensation proposal.\n\n        The B/E Aerospace Board unanimously recommends a vote "FOR" the Merger-Related Compensation proposal (Item 2).\n\nItem 3.    The B/E Aerospace Adjournment Proposal \n\n        (Item 3 on B/E Aerospace Proxy Card)\n\n        The B/E Aerospace special meeting may be adjourned to another time or place from time to time, if necessary or appropriate, to\npermit further solicitation of proxies in the event there are not sufficient votes at the time of the B/E Aerospace Special Meeting to approve\nthe Merger proposal.\n\n        If, at the B/E Aerospace special meeting, the number of shares of B/E Aerospace common stock present or represented and voting in\nfavor of the Merger proposal is insufficient to approve the Merger proposal, B/E Aerospace intends to adjourn the B/E Aerospace special\nmeeting in order to enable the B/E Aerospace Board to solicit additional proxies for approval of the Merger proposal.\n\n        In the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal, B/E Aerospace is asking its stockholders to authorize the holder of any proxy solicited\nby the B/E Aerospace Board to vote in favor of granting authority to the proxy holders, and each of them individually, to adjourn the B/E\nAerospace special meeting to another time and place for the purpose of soliciting additional proxies. If the B/E Aerospace stockholders\napprove the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal, B/E Aerospace could adjourn the B/E Aerospace special meeting and any adjourned\nsession of the B/E Aerospace special meeting and use the additional time to solicit additional proxies, including the solicitation of proxies\nfrom B/E Aerospace stockholders who have previously voted.\n\n        The B/E Aerospace Board unanimously recommends a vote "FOR" the B/E Aerospace Adjournment proposal (Item 3).\n\n172\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n185/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nUNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS \n\n        The following unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements have been prepared to illustrate the estimated effects of\nthe merger and the related financing transactions. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet as of September 30, 2016 is\nbased on the individual historical consolidated balance sheets of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace, and has been prepared to reflect the\nmerger as if it occurred on September 30, 2016, which was the end of Rockwell Collins 2016 fiscal year. The unaudited pro forma\ncondensed combined statement of income for the year ended September 30, 2016 combines the historical results of operations of Rockwell\nCollins and B/E Aerospace, and has been prepared to reflect the merger as if it occurred on October 1, 2015, the first day of Rockwell\nCollins 2016 fiscal year.\n\n        Rockwell Collins operates on a 52/53 week fiscal year ending on the Friday closest to September 30. Fiscal year 2016 was a 52-week\nyear. For ease of presentation, September 30 is utilized consistently throughout these unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial\nstatements and notes to represent the fiscal year-end date. All date references contained herein relate to Rockwell Collins\' fiscal year\nunless otherwise stated. B/E Aerospace\'s fiscal year ends on December 31. As a result of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace\'s different\nfiscal years:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nThe unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet as of September 30, 2016 combines Rockwell Collins\'\nhistorical consolidated balance sheet as of September 30, 2016, which was the end of Rockwell Collins\' 2016 fiscal year,\nand B/E Aerospace\'s historical unaudited condensed consolidated balance sheet as of September 30, 2016, which was the\nend of its third fiscal quarter; and \n\nThe unaudited pro forma condensed combined statement of income for the year ended September 30, 2016 combines\nRockwell Collins\' historical results of operations for the year ended September 30, 2016, which was the end of Rockwell\nCollins\' 2016 fiscal year, and B/E Aerospace\'s historical unaudited results of operations for the 12 months ended\nSeptember 30, 2016, which have been derived from B/E Aerospace\'s condensed consolidated statement of operations for\nthe three months ended December 31, 2015 and from B/E Aerospace\'s condensed consolidated statement of operations for\nthe nine months ended September 30, 2016.\n\n        The historical consolidated financial information in the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements has been\nadjusted to give effect to pro forma events that are (1) directly attributable to the merger, (2) factually supportable and (3) with respect to\nthe unaudited pro forma condensed combined statement of income, expected to have a continuing impact on the combined results of\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements do not give effect to any cost\nsavings, operating synergies or revenue synergies that may result from the merger or the costs to achieve any such cost savings, operating\nsynergies and revenue synergies, except for adjustments to reflect the net decrease in compensation expense related to certain B/E\nAerospace executives and B/E Aerospace Board members for whom employment terminates immediately upon change in control in\naccordance with existing employment arrangements.\n\n        The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements are for informational purposes only and are not necessarily\nindicative of what the actual financial results of Rockwell Collins would have been had the merger occurred on the dates or for the periods\nindicated, nor do they purport to project the financial results of Rockwell Collins for any future periods or as of any date. The unaudited\npro forma combined financial statements contain estimated adjustments, which are based on information available to management;\naccordingly, such adjustments are subject to change and the impact of such changes may be material. Although Rockwell Collins and\nB/E Aerospace have entered into the merger agreement, there is no guarantee that the merger will be completed on the terms set forth\ntherein or at all.\n\n173\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n186/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        The following unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements should be read in conjunction with:\n\nThe accompanying notes to the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements \n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nRockwell Collins\' audited consolidated financial statements and related notes thereto contained in its Annual Report on\nForm 10-K for the year ended September 30, 2016; and \n\nB/E Aerospace\'s audited consolidated financial statements and related notes thereto contained in its Annual Report on\nForm 10-K for the
