proxy\nstatement/prospectus.\n\n176\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n189/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nNOTES TO UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS \n\nNOTE 1: Description of the Transaction and Basis of Presentation \n\n        On October 23, 2016, Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace announced that the board of directors of both companies reached an\nagreement under which Rockwell Collins will acquire B/E Aerospace. Upon completion of the merger, each issued and outstanding share\nof B/E Aerospace common stock will be converted into the right to receive the $62.00 per share merger consideration, including $34.10 in\ncash and a number of Rockwell Collins shares equal to the exchange ratio, which depends on the Rockwell Collins stock price. If the\nRockwell Collins stock price is greater than or equal to $77.41 and less than or equal to $89.97 per share, the exchange ratio will be the\nquotient of $27.90 divided by the Rockwell Collins stock price. If the Rockwell Collins stock price is greater than $89.97, the exchange\nratio will be 0.3101. If the Rockwell Collins stock price is less than $77.41, the exchange ratio will be 0.3604. Accordingly, the actual\nnumber of shares and the value of Rockwell Collins common stock delivered to B/E Aerospace stockholders will depend on the Rockwell\nCollins stock price, and the value of the shares of Rockwell Collins common stock delivered for each such share of B/E Aerospace\ncommon stock may be greater than, less than or equal to $27.90. A 10% increase or decrease in the price of Rockwell Collins common\nstock from the closing price of Rockwell Collins common stock as of January 26, 2017 of $91.26 per share would increase the value of\nmerger consideration to be paid by approximately $283 million or decrease the value of merger consideration to be paid by approximately\n$40 million, respectively.\n\n        Rockwell Collins anticipates that approximately $3.560 billion will be required to pay the aggregate cash portion of the merger\nconsideration to the B/E Aerospace stockholders. Rockwell Collins expects to issue up to $4.35 billion in aggregate principal amount of its\nsenior unsecured notes in one or more public offerings and/or private placements and borrow up to $1.5 billion under a new senior\nunsecured syndicated term loan facility. Rockwell Collins has obtained a bridge loan commitment of $4.35 billion that would be funded\nonly to the extent some or all of the senior unsecured notes described above are not issued prior to the consummation of the acquisition.\nThere can be no assurance that Rockwell Collins will finance the merger in the manner and amount as anticipated.\n\n        The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements were prepared using the acquisition method of accounting in\naccordance with Accounting Standards Codification 805, Business Combinations, or ASC 805, which requires the determination of the\nacquirer, the acquisition date, the fair value of assets and liabilities of the acquiree and the measurement of goodwill. Rockwell Collins is\nconsidered to be the acquirer of B/E Aerospace for accounting purposes.\n\n        To prepare the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements, Rockwell Collins adjusted B/E Aerospace\'s assets and\nliabilities to their estimated fair values based on preliminary valuation work. As of the date of this joint proxy statement/ prospectus,\nRockwell Collins has not completed the detailed valuation work necessary to finalize the required estimated fair values of the B/E\nAerospace assets to be acquired and liabilities to be assumed and the related allocation of purchase price. The final allocation of the\npurchase price will be determined after the transaction is completed and after completion of an analysis to determine the estimated net fair\nvalue of B/E Aerospace\'s assets and liabilities. Accordingly, the final acquisition accounting adjustments may be materially different from\nthe unaudited pro forma adjustments. Also, as of the date of this joint proxy statement/prospectus, Rockwell Collins has not identified all\nadjustments necessary to conform B/E Aerospace\'s accounting policies to Rockwell Collins accounting policies. Rockwell Collins will\nconduct a final review of B/E Aerospace\'s accounting policies as of the date of the completion of the merger in an effort to determine if\ndifferences in accounting policies require adjustment or reclassification of B/E Aerospace\'s results of operations or reclassification of\nassets or liabilities to conform to Rockwell Collins\' accounting policies and classifications. As a result of this review, the final acquisition\naccounting adjustments may be materially different from the unaudited pro forma\n\n177\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n190/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nadjustments. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements do not give effect to any cost savings, operating synergies\nor revenue synergies that may result from the merger or the costs to achieve any such cost savings, operating synergies and revenue\nsynergies, except for adjustments to reflect the net decrease in compensation expense related to certain B/E Aerospace executives and\nB/E Aerospace Board members for whom employment terminates immediately upon change in control in accordance with existing\nemployment arrangements. There were no material transactions between Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace during the periods\npresented in the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements that would need to be eliminated except as detailed in\nNote 3p below.\n\nNOTE 2: Preliminary Consideration Transferred and Preliminary Fair Value of Net Assets Acquired \n\n        The unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet has been adjusted to reflect the estimated fair values of the\nB/E Aerospace identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed. The excess of consideration over these fair values is recorded to\ngoodwill. The preliminary unaudited pro forma purchase price allocation was based on discussions with B/E Aerospace\'s management,\nRockwell Collins historical experience, data that was available through the public domain, Rockwell Collins due diligence review of\nB/E Aerospace\'s business, and reviews of publicly disclosed allocations for other acquisitions in the industry. Until the merger is\ncompleted, Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace are limited in their ability to share information with each other. Upon completion of the\nmerger, additional valuation work will be performed and any increases or decreases in the fair value of assets acquired or liabilities\nassumed will result in adjustments to the balance sheet and/or statement of income until the purchase price allocation is finalized. The\nfollowing tables represent the estimated consideration transferred and preliminary allocation of total estimated consideration transferred as\nif the merger occurred on September 30, 2016:\n\n(in millions)\nCalculation of estimated consideration to be transferred:\n \nCash consideration to be paid for B/E Aerospace outstanding common stock  \n \nCash consideration to be paid for B/E Aerospace expense.\n\nNOTE 3: Pro Forma Adjustments \n\nReclassifications \n\n        The following items are presented as reclassifications in the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements for\npurposes of conforming B/E Aerospace\'s classification of certain assets, liabilities, income and expenses to Rockwell Collins\' classification\nfor the combined presentation:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n$97 million of percentage of completion program costs and estimated earnings in excess of billings have been reclassified\nfrom Inventories, net to Receivables, net \n\n$563 million of Accrued liabilities have been reclassified as Compensation and benefits ($83 million), Advance payments\nfrom customers ($122 million), Accrued customer incentives ($53 million), Product warranty costs ($105 million) and\nOther current liabilities ($200 million) \n\n$2.862 billion of Revenues have been reclassified to Product sales ($2.793 billion) and Service sales ($69 million) \n\n$1.739 billion of Cost of sales have been reclassified to Product cost of sales ($1.707 billion) and Service cost of sales\n($32 million) \n\n$275 million of Research, development and engineering expense has been reclassified to Product cost of sales\n\nAdjustments to Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Combined Balance Sheet \n\n        The following pro forma adjustments have been reflected in the unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet:\n\na.\n\nCash and cash equivalents\n\n        Adjustments to cash include the following;\n\n(in millions)\nNet proceeds of bridge credit facility and new term loan\nFees associated with new Rockwell Collins revolving credit facility\nScheduled payment of accrued interest on B/E Aerospace term loan\nRepayment of B/E Aerospace term loan (see Note 3h)\nCash purchase consideration (see Note 2)\nPro forma adjustment, Cash and cash equivalents\n\n \n\n  Amount\n  $\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n  $\n\n5,799 \n(2)\n(13)\n(2,064)\n(3,560)\n160 \n\n        The $5.799 billion net cash proceeds from new financing assumes gross borrowings of $4.35 billion from the bridge facility and\n$1.5 billion from the new term loan. The gross proceeds are offset by bridge facility fees of $49 million, including $27 million of\ncommitment fees which would be expensed prior to funding, and term loan fees of $2 million. See Note 3h for additional information\nregarding the intended debt financing to fund the transaction.\n\nb.\n\nReceivables, net\n\n        The adjustment reflects the reclassification of $97 million of B/E Aerospace percentage of completion related program costs and\nestimated earnings in excess of billings from Inventories, net to Receivables, net in order to conform to Rockwell Collins presentation.\n\n181\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n194/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nc.\n\nInventories, net\n\nd.\n\nGoodwill\n\ne.\n\nIntangible assets\n\n        The adjustments reflect the reclassification of $97 million of percentage of completion program costs and estimated earnings in\nexcess of billings (see Note 3b) and the elimination of $507 million of B/E Aerospace capitalized development costs on long-term seller\nfurnished equipment (SFE) contracts. Revenue for the SFE contracts is recognized on percentage of completion (units of delivery) basis by\nB/E Aerospace but is expected to be recognized when realizable and earned, consistent with the guidance in Staff Accounting Bulletin 104\n(SAB 104), after the merger in order to conform with Rockwell Collins\' accounting policies. The transition from percentage of completion\nto SAB 104 revenue recognition for the SFE programs is not expected to have a material impact on the timing of revenue recognition\nrelated to those programs, but will have an impact on the timing of costs as reflected in Note 3r.\n\n        The adjustment reflects the elimination of $814 million of historical B/E Aerospace goodwill, offset by the addition of new goodwill\nresulting from the merger. The $6.146 billion of estimated merger-related goodwill is based on the preliminary estimates and information\nsummarized in Note 2.\n\n        The adjustment reflects the elimination of $221 million of historical B/E Aerospace intangible assets, offset by a preliminary fair\nvalue estimate of identifiable intangible assets acquired. The intangible assets to be acquired primarily consist of the following:\n\n(in millions, except estimated life)\nAcquired airline customer relationships\nAcquired OEM customer relationships\nAcquired developed technology\nPro forma adjustment, Intangible assets\n\nEstimated\nFair Value\n\n \n\n1,490 \n259 \n709 \n2,458 \n\n \n  $\n \n \n \n \n  $\n\nEstimated\nLife\n10 years\n13 years\n12 years\n \n\n        The net adjustment of $733 million, comprised of a $219 million reduction of deferred tax assets and a $514 million increase in\ndeferred tax liabilities, is primarily due to recording the deferred tax impact of the acquired intangibles which are not tax deductible and\nthe impact of the inventory adjustments related to the SFE contracts.\n\nf.\n\nDeferred income taxes\n\ng.\n\nOther assets\n\n        Adjustments reflect changes in capitalized debt issuance costs due to the following:\n\n(in millions)\nRockwell Collins new bridge loan funding fees\nRockwell Collins new revolving credit facility fees\nRockwell Collins new term loan fees\nElimination of Rockwell Collins costs related to existing revolving credit facility\nPro forma adjustment, Other assets\n\n \n\n  Amount\n of Contents\n\nh.\n\nShort-term debt and Long-term debt, net\n\n        Adjustments to Short-term debt and Long-term debt, net include the following:\n\n(in millions)\nRockwell Collins borrowings pursuant to bridge financing\nRockwell Collins borrowings pursuant to term loan facility\nRepayment of B/E Aerospace existing term loan facility\nElimination of unamortized issuance costs on repayment of B/E Aerospace\n\nexisting term loan facility\n\nTotal\nLess current portion of new term loan facility\nPro forma adjustment, Long-term debt, net\n\n \n\n  Amount\n  $\n \n \n \n \n\n4,350 \n1,500 \n(2,064)\n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n  $\n\n28 \n3,814 \n(150)\n3,664 \n\n        Rockwell Collins expects to fund the cash component of the acquisition consideration and refinance debt acquired with the\ntransaction by issuing up to $4.35 billion in aggregate principal amount of senior unsecured notes in one or more public offerings and/or\nprivate placements and borrowing up to $1.5 billion under a new senior unsecured syndicated term loan facility. Rockwell Collins has\nobtained a bridge loan commitment of $4.35 billion that would be drawn only to the extent some or all of the senior unsecured notes\ndescribed above are not issued prior to consummation of the acquisition. Rockwell Collins also plans to enter into an agreement to extend\nthe duration of its current five-year revolving credit facility by approximately three years and increase the amount available under the\nfacility to $1.5 billion from $1.2 billion currently available under its five-year and 364-day facilities. There can be no assurance that\nRockwell Collins will finance the merger in the manner and amounts as anticipated.\n\n        Rockwell Collins has assumed, for purposes of the unaudited pro forma condensed combined financial statements, that it will borrow\n$4.35 billion under the bridge facility and $1.5 billion under a new term loan facility. The unaudited pro forma condensed combined\nbalance sheet as of September 30, 2016 has been adjusted to reflect the merger as if it occurred on September 30, 2016, and consequently,\nin connection with obtaining the committed debt financing on such date, approximately $28 million of financing costs were recorded in\nOther Assets on the unaudited pro forma condensed combined balance sheet.\n\n        As noted above, Rockwell Collins anticipates that some or all of the bridge facility will be replaced prior to funding by the issuance\nof debt securities. Further, at or shortly after completion of the merger, Rockwell Collins expects to repay the outstanding $2.064 billion\nprincipal amount of B/E Aerospace\'s existing term loan facility, which includes $28 million unamortized issuance costs. Based on this\nanticipated debt financing and repayment of debt, Rockwell Collins estimates that the debt issuance costs (including underwriting fees and\nrelated expenses) related to the $4.35 billion senior unsecured notes, rather than the bridge facility, would increase from $22 million to\napproximately $40 million, and that the amortization, recorded as interest expense, would decrease from $22 million to approximately\n$4 million for the year ended September 30, 2016. Actual amounts could differ from these assumptions.\n\ni.\n\nj.\n\nAccounts payable\n\nCurrent liabilities\n\n        The adjustments reflect the accrual of $33 million of Rockwell Collins estimated transaction related costs and $65 million of\nB/E Aerospace estimated transaction costs.\n\n        The adjustments reflect the reclassification of $563 million of B/E Aerospace current liabilities from Accrued liabilities to\nCompensation and benefits ($83 million), Advance payments from acquisition and the repayment of the existing debt of B/E Aerospace as presented below:\n\n(in millions)\nFor new debt related to the acquisition:\n\nBridge loan interest expense\nTerm loan interest expense\nBridge loan issuance cost amortization\nTerm loan issuance cost amortization\nCredit facility issuance cost amortization\n\nFor debt expected to be repaid pursuant to the acquisition:\n\nB/E Aerospace term loan interest expense\nB/E Aerospace term loan issuance cost amortization\nRockwell Collins credit facility issuance cost amortization\n\nPro forma adjustment, Interest expense\n\n  Amount\n\n \n\n \n \n  $\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n  $\n\n  \n101 \n38 \n22 \n1 \n3 \n  \n(87)\n(4)\n(2)\n72 \n\n        A 0.125 percent variance in the variable interest rate for the bridge facility would change interest expense for the year ended\nSeptember 30, 2016 by approximately $5 million. A 0.125% variance in the variable interest rate for the term loan would change interest\nexpense for the year ended September 30, 2016 by approximately $2 million.\n\n        As described in Note 3h, Rockwell Collins anticipates that some or all of the bridge facility will be replaced prior to funding by\nproceeds from the issuance of new debt securities. Based on this anticipated debt financing and loan repayment, Rockwell Collins\nestimates that interest expense related to the $4.35 billion senior unsecured notes, rather than the bridge facility, would increase from\n$101 million to approximately $166 million, and that the amortization, recorded as interest expense, would decrease from $22 million to\napproximately $4 million for the year ended September 30, 2016. Further, Rockwell Collins would incur additional post-funding fees\nunder the bridge facility which would be avoided by issuing debt securities. These post-funding fees have not been reflected as an\nadjustment to the unaudited pro forma income statement, as these fees would not have a continuing impact on the combined results of\nRockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace.\n\nv.\n\nIncome tax expense\n\n        Adjustment reflects the applicable tax provision on the pro forma adjustments presented in the unaudited pro forma condensed\ncombined statement of income. The pro forma adjustments pertain primarily to the U.S. tax jurisdiction, and are subject to a 35% federal\ntax rate, plus applicable state taxes.\n\n186\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n199/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nCOMPARISON OF RIGHTS OF STOCKHOLDERS\nOF ROCKWELL COLLINS AND B/E AEROSPACE \n\n        Both Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace are incorporated under the laws of the State of Delaware and, accordingly, the rights of the\nstockholders of each are currently governed by the DGCL. Rockwell Collins will continue to be a Delaware corporation following\ncompletion of the merger and will be governed by the DGCL.\n\n        Upon completion of the merger, the B/E Aerospace stockholders immediately prior to the effective time will become Rockwell\nCollins stockholders. The rights of the former B/E Aerospace stockholders and the Rockwell Collins stockholders will thereafter be\ngoverned by the DGCL and by Rockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation and by-laws.\n\n        The following description summarizes the material differences between the rights of the stockholders of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace based on their respective current certificates of incorporation and by-laws and the DGCL, but is not a complete statement of all\nthose differences, or a complete description of the specific provisions referred to in this summary. Stockholders should read carefully the\nrelevant provisions of the DGCL and the respective current certificates of incorporation and by-laws of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace. For more information on how to obtain the documents that are not attached to this joint proxy statement/prospectus, see\n"Where You Can Find More Information" beginning on page 198.\n\n \nAuthorized Capital\nStock\n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nThe authorized capital stock of Rockwell Collins\nconsists of 1,000,000,000 shares of common stock,\npar value $0.01 per share, and 25,000,000 shares\nof preferred stock, without par value.\n\n \n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\nThe authorized capital stock of B/E Aerospace\nconsists of 200,000,000 shares of common stock,\npar value $0.01 per share, and 1,000,000 shares of\npreferred stock, par value $0.01 per share.\n\nSpecial Meetings of\nStockholders\n\nUnder the DGCL, a special meeting of stockholders may be called by the board of directors or by any other\nperson authorized to do so in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws.\n\n \n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that special meetings of\nstockholders may be called only by the Rockwell\nCollins Board pursuant to a resolution adopted by\na majority of the Rockwell Collins Board.\n\nStockholder Proposals\nand Nominations of\nCandidates for\nElection to the Board\nof Directors\n\nRockwell Collins\' by-laws allow stockholders who\nare record holders on the date of notice and on the\ndate of the annual meeting to nominate candidates\nfor election to the Rockwell Collins Board and to\npropose business to be brought before such annual\nmeeting.\n\n187\n\n \n\n \n\nB/E Aerospace\'s by-laws provide that special\nmeetings of B/E Aerospace stockholders may only\nbe called by the chairman of the B/E Aerospace\nBoard, if any, the president or the secretary (or in\nthe case of death, absence, incapacity or refusal of\nthe secretary, by an assistant secretary or some\nother officer) upon application of a majority of the\nB/E Aerospace Board.\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s by-laws allow stockholders to\npropose business to be brought before an annual\nmeeting and allow stockholders who are record\nholders on the date of notice and on the record date\nfor the determination of stockholders entitled to\nvote at such annual meeting to nominate\ncandidates for election to the B/E Aerospace\nBoard.\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n200/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\n \n\nSuch proposals (other than proposals included in\nthe notice of meeting pursuant to Rule 14a-8\npromulgated under the Exchange Act) and\nnominations, however, may only be brought by a\nstockholder who has given timely notice in proper\nwritten form to Rockwell Collins\' secretary prior to\nthe meeting.\n\nSuch proposals (other than proposals included in\nthe notice of meeting pursuant to Rule 14a-8\npromulgated under the Exchange Act) and\nnominations, however, may only be brought by a\nstockholder who has given timely notice in proper\nwritten form to B/E Aerospace\'s secretary prior to\nthe meeting.\n\n \nIn connection with an annual meeting, to be timely,\nnotice of such proposals and nominations must be\ndelivered to the secretary at Rockwell Collins\'\nprincipal executive office not less than 120 days\nnor more than 150 days prior to the anniversary\ndate of the immediately preceding annual meeting;\nprovided, however, that in the event that the date\nof the meeting is not within 30 days before or\n60 days after such date, notice by the stockholder\nmust be received no earlier than 150 days prior to\nsuch meeting and no later than the later of\n120 days prior to the meeting or, if the first public\nannouncement of such meeting is less than\n130 days prior to such meeting, the 10th day\nfollowing the day on which disclosure of the date\nof the annual meeting was first made by Rockwell\nCollins.\n\nIn connection with an annual meeting, to be timely,\nnotice of such proposals and nominations must be\ndelivered to or mailed and received by the\nsecretary at B/E Aerospace\'s principal executive\noffices not less than 90 days nor more than\n120 days prior to the anniversary date of the\nimmediately preceding annual meeting; provided,\nhowever, that in the event that the date of the\nmeeting is not within 30 days before or 70 days\nafter such date, notice by the stockholder must be\nreceived not later than the close of business on the\n10th day following the day on which notice of the\ndate of the annual meeting was publicly\nannounced.\n\nNumber of Directors\n\nThe DGCL provides that the board of directors of a Delaware corporation must consist of one or more\ndirectors, with the number of directors fixed by or in the manner provided in the corporation\'s bylaws unless\nthe certificate of incorporation fixes the number of directors.\n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation, and\nby-laws provide that the number of directors will\nbe fixed from time to time exclusively pursuant to\na resolution adopted by a majority of the Rockwell\nCollins Board.\n\nThe B/E Aerospace certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that the B/E Aerospace Board will\nconsist of not less than three nor more than nine\ndirectors.\n\nThere are currently nine positions authorized and\nnine directors serving on the Rockwell Collins\nBoard.\n\nThere are currently seven positions authorized and\nseven directors serving on the B/E Aerospace\nBoard.\n\n \n\n \n\nElection of Directors\n\nThe DGCL provides that, unless the certificate of incorporation or bylaws provide otherwise, directors will\nbe elected by a plurality of the votes of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the meeting\nand entitled to vote on the election of directors.\n\n188\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n201/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that the Rockwell Collins Board is\ndivided into three classes of directors serving\nstaggered three-year terms. Each class, to the\nextent possible, will be equal in number. Each\nclass holds office until the third annual\nstockholders\' meeting for election of directors\nfollowing the most recent election of such class.\n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that the B/E Aerospace Board is\ndivided into three classes of directors serving\nstaggered three-year terms. Each class holds office\nuntil the third annual stockholders\' meeting for\nelection of directors following the most recent\nelection of such class.\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRockwell Collins\' directors are elected according\nto the DGCL statute summarized above, except\nthat the Rockwell Collins Board has a majority\nvoting policy for the election of directors pursuant\nto which, in an uncontested election of directors,\nany nominee for director who receives more\n"withheld" votes than "for" votes must promptly\ntender his or her resignation to the Rockwell\nCollins Board. The Rockwell Collins Board\'s\nNominating and Governance Committee will\npromptly consider the resignation offer and make a\nrecommendation to the Rockwell Collins Board as\nto whether to accept or reject the tendered\nresignation and whether other actions should be\ntaken. The Rockwell Collins Board will act on the\ntendered resignation within 90 days following\ncertification of the election results. The Rockwell\nCollins Board\'s Nominating and Governance\nCommittee and the Rockwell Collins Board, in\nmaking such decisions, may consider any factors\nor other information that it considers appropriate\nand relevant.\n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation\nprovides that directors may only be removed for\ncause and by the affirmative vote of 80% of the\noutstanding shares of Rockwell Collins capital\nstock entitled to vote generally in the election of\ndirectors.\n\n \n\n \n\n189\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s by-laws provide that a plurality of\nthe votes properly cast for election to any office\nwill elect to such office. The election of\nB/E Aerospace directors in uncontested elections is\ngoverned by a "plurality plus" standard, pursuant\nto which any director candidate who receives more\n"withhold" votes than votes "for" election shall\ntender his or her resignation from the\nB/E Aerospace Board. The Executive Chairman\nwill then consider such resignation, taking into\naccount B/E Aerospace\'s interests and any current\nor foreseeable factors or circumstances relating to\nsuch director, and recommend to the\nB/E Aerospace Board the action to be taken with\nrespect to such resignation. The B/E Aerospace\nBoard then shall act on such recommendation\nrelative to the tendered resignation.\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that any director may be removed,\nonly for cause, and only by the affirmative vote of\nholders of not less than two-thirds of the total\nnumber of votes of the then outstanding shares of\ncapital stock of B/E Aerospace entitled to vote\ngenerally in the election of directors, voting\ntogether as a single class, but only if notice of such\nproposal was contained in the notice of such\nmeeting.\n\nRemoval of Directors\n\n \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n202/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \nLimitation on Liability\nof Directors\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\n \n\n \n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation\nprovides that no director will be personally liable\nto Rockwell Collins or any of its stockholders for\nmonetary damages for breach of fiduciary duty as\na director, except for liability for (i) any breach of\nthe director\'s duty of loyalty to Rockwell Collins\nor its stockholders, (ii) acts or omissions not in\ngood faith or which involve intentional misconduct\nor a knowing violation of law, (iii) unlawful\npayment of dividends, stock purchase or\nredemption pursuant to Section 174 of the DGCL\nor (iv) any transaction from which the director\nderived an improper personal benefit.\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation\nprovides that no director will be personally liable\nto B/E Aerospace or its stockholders for monetary\ndamages for any breach of fiduciary duty by the\ndirector as a director, except that a director shall be\nliable to the extent that exculpation from liabilities\nis not permitted under the DGCL as in effect at the\ntime such liability is determined.\n\nIndemnification of\nDirectors and Officers\n\nUnder the DGCL, a Delaware corporation must indemnify its present or former directors and officers\nagainst expenses (including attorneys\' fees) actually and reasonably incurred to the extent that the officer or\ndirector has been successful on the merits or otherwise in defense of any action, suit or proceeding brought\nagainst him or her by reason of the fact that he or she is or was a director or officer of the corporation.\n\nDelaware law provides that a corporation may indemnify its present and former directors, officers,\nemployees and agents, as well as any individual serving with another corporation in that capacity at the\ncorporation\'s request against expenses (including attorney\'s fees), judgments, fines and amounts paid in\nsettlement of actions taken, if the individual acted in good faith and in a manner reasonably believed to be\nin, or not opposed to, the best interests of the corporation and, in the case of a criminal proceeding, the\nindividual had no reasonable cause to believe the individual\'s conduct was unlawful; except that no\nindemnification may be paid for judgments and settlements in actions by or in the right of the corporation.\n\nA corporation may not indemnify a current or former director or officer of the corporation against expenses\nto the extent the person is adjudged to be liable to the corporation unless a court approves the indemnity.\n\n190\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n203/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\nThe B/E Aerospace certificate of incorporation\nrequires B/E Aerospace to indemnify any person\nwho was or is a party or is threatened to be made a\nparty to any threatened, pending or completed\naction, suit or proceeding by reason of the fact that\nsuch person is or was a director or officer of B/E\nAerospace against expenses, judgments, fines and\namounts paid in settlement actually and reasonably\nincurred by such person in connection with such\naction, suit or proceeding to the fullest extent\npermitted by Delaware law, as long as the action,\nsuit, proceeding, claim or counterclaim was not\ninitiated by or on behalf of such person. B/E\nAerospace is also required under its certificate of\nincorporation to advance, to the maximum extent\npermitted by Delaware, expenses incurred in\nconnection with any such action, suit or\nproceeding.\n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nRockwell Collins\' by-laws provide that Rockwell\nCollins indemnify any person who was or is a\nparty or is threatened to be made a party to any\nthreatened, pending or completed action, suit or\nproceeding of any nature, whether civil, criminal,\nadministrative, regulatory, arbitral or investigative\n(including actions or suits by or in the right of\nRockwell Collins to procure a judgment), by\nreason of the fact that such person is or was a\ndirector, officer, employee or agent of Rockwell\nCollins or any of its majority-owned subsidiaries\n(or any other entity at Rockwell Collins\' request)\nagainst expenses, judgments, fines and amounts\npaid in settlement actually and reasonably incurred\nby such person in connection with such action, suit\nor proceeding if such person acted in good faith\nand in a manner such person reasonably believed\nto be in or not opposed to the best interests of\nRockwell Collins and, with respect to any criminal\naction or proceeding, had no reasonable cause to\nbelieve his or her conduct was unlawful; except,\nwith regard to actions or suits by or in the right of\nRockwell Collins to procure a judgment, no\nindemnification will be made in respect of any\nclaim, issue or matter as to which the claimant has\nbeen adjudged to be liable to Rockwell Collins,\nunless the Court of Chancery of Delaware or the\ncourt in which the action or suit was brought\ndetermines that, despite the adjudication of such\nliability, that claimant is fairly and reasonably\nentitled to indemnity for the expenses which such\ncourt deems proper.\n\nIn the case of indemnification pursuant to the\nabove described provisions, indemnification will\nbe made only as authorized in the specific case\nupon a determination that indemnification is\nproper in accordance with the standards described\nabove.\n\n \n\n191\n\n \n\n \n\nAny person seeking indemnification under the\nprovision described above will be deemed to have\nmet the standard of conduct required for such\nindemnification unless the contrary is established.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n204/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\n \n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nIn the event there has been no change of control of\nRockwell Collins resulting in the acquisition by,\nwith certain customary restrictions, any individual,\nperson or group of 20% or more of the shares of\ncommon stock or combined voting power then\nentitled to vote in the election of directors, referred\nto later in this paragraph as a change of control,\nsuch determination will be made by, (i) in the case\nof present or former directors or officers of\nRockwell Collins, either a majority of disinterested\ndirectors on the Rockwell Collins Board or, if there\nare no disinterested directors or if such\ndisinterested directors so choose, by independent\ncounsel or the stockholders of Rockwell Collins,\nor (ii) in the case of a person who is not a present\nor former director or officer of Rockwell Collins,\nby the chief executive officer or another officer\nauthorized by the Rockwell Collins Board. In the\nevent there has been a change of control, such\ndetermination will be made by independent\ncounsel or (at the claimant\'s request) the Rockwell\nCollins Board or an officer of Rockwell Collins\nauthorized to make such determination (in the case\nof a present or former officer or director of\nRockwell Collins). Claimants will also be\nindemnified against expenses actually and\nreasonably incurred in cooperating with the person\nor entity making the determination of entitlement\nto indemnification.\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nUnder Rockwell Collins\' by-laws, directors,\nofficers, employees or agents of Rockwell Collins\nwho are successful on the merits or otherwise in\ndefense of any of the above described actions, suits\nand proceedings by reason of the fact that such\nperson was a director, officer, employee or agent\nof Rockwell Collins will be indemnified against\nexpenses actually and reasonably incurred by or on\nbehalf of such person in connection therewith.\n\n192\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n205/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n \n\n \n\n \n\nRockwell Collins\' by-laws also provide that\npersons who are witnesses in the above described\nactions, suits and proceedings by reason of the fact\nthat such person is or was a director, officer,\nemployee or agent of Rockwell Collins or any of\nits majority-owned subsidiaries (or any other entity\nat Rockwell Collins\' request) will be indemnified\nagainst all expenses actually and reasonably\nincurred by or on behalf of such person in\nconnection therewith.\n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation\nprovides that the affirmative vote of the holders of\nat least 80% of the voting power of the then\noutstanding voting stock of Rockwell Collins is\nrequired to amend, alter, change or repeal, or adopt\nany provision of the certificate of incorporation\ninconsistent with, certain designated provisions\nrelating to (i) the number and classification of the\nRockwell Collins Board, removal of Rockwell\nCollins directors, filling vacancies on the Rockwell\nCollins Board and the exemption of members of\nthe Rockwell Collins Board for monetary damages\nrelated to breaches of fiduciary duty in certain\ncircumstances and (ii) amendment of the\ncertificate of incorporation.\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nAmendments to\nCertificate of\nIncorporation\n\nUnder the DGCL, an amendment to the certificate of incorporation generally requires (i) the approval of the\nboard of directors, (ii) the approval of a majority of the voting power of the outstanding stock entitled to\nvote upon the proposed amendment and (iii) the approval of the holders of a majority of the outstanding\nstock of each class entitled to vote thereon as a class, if any.\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation\nprovides that the affirmative vote of not less than\ntwo-thirds of the total number of votes of the then\noutstanding shares of capital stock of B/E\nAerospace entitled to vote generally in the election\nof directors is required to amend or repeal, or\nadopt any provision inconsistent with the purpose\nor intent of, the provision in the certificate of\nincorporation relating to the classification of the\nB/E Aerospace Board and removal of B/E\nAerospace directors.\n\nIn all other instances, the DGCL standard for\namendment to the certificate of incorporation\ndescribed above applies.\n\nIn all other instances, the DGCL standard for\namendment to the certificate of incorporation\ndescribed above applies.\n\n193\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n206/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \nAmendments to\nBylaws\n\n \n\n \n\nCertain Business\nCombinations\n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation and\nby-laws provide that the Rockwell Collins Board\nmay make, alter, amend and repeal the Rockwell\nCollins by-laws, subject to the power of the\nholders of capital stock of Rockwell Collins to\nalter or repeal the by-laws made by the Rockwell\nCollins Board; however, any such amendment or\nrepeal by stockholders of Rockwell Collins will\nrequire the affirmative vote of the holders of at\nleast 80% of the voting power of the then\noutstanding voting stock of Rockwell Collins,\nvoting together as a single class.\n\n \n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\nB/E Aerospace\'s by-laws provide that the by-laws\nmay be adopted, amended or repealed by a vote of\na majority of the directors then in office or by vote\nof a majority of the stock outstanding and entitled\nto vote. Any by-law, whether adopted, amended or\nrepealed by the stockholders or directors, may be\namended or reinstated by the stockholders or the\ndirectors.\n\nSection 203 of the DGCL prohibits a Delaware corporation from engaging in a business combination with a\nstockholder acquiring more than 15% but less than 85% of the corporation\'s outstanding voting stock for\nthree years following the time that person becomes an "interested stockholder," unless prior to such date the\nboard of directors approves either the business combination or the transaction which resulted in the\nstockholder becoming an interested stockholder or the business combination is approved by the board of\ndirectors and by the affirmative vote of at least two-thirds of the outstanding voting stock that is not owned\nby the interested stockholder or certain other exceptions are met. The DGCL allows a corporation\'s\ncertificate of incorporation to contain a provision expressly electing not to be governed by Section 203.\n\n \n\nRockwell Collins\' certificate of incorporation\nincludes restrictions on certain business\ncombinations (discussed further below) in addition\nto the protections of the provisions of Section 203\nof the DGCL discussed above. Because Rockwell\nCollins has not opted out of Section 203 of the\nDGCL, it remains subject to such provision.\n\n194\n\nB/E Aerospace\'s certificate of incorporation does\nnot contain a provision electing not to be governed\nby Section 203 of the DGCL, and so B/E\nAerospace is subject to such provision.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n207/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n \n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\n \n\nRights of B/E Aerospace Stockholders\n\nRights of Rockwell Collins Stockholders\nCertain business combinations (or the agreements\nto enter into such business combinations) with\ninterested stockholders (generally defined as\npersons beneficially owning voting stock of\nRockwell Collins that represents 10% or more of\nvotes then entitled to be cast), including\n(i) mergers or consolidations with interested\nstockholders or their affiliates, (ii) sales or other\ndispositions to interested stockholders of assets or\nsecurities of Rockwell Collins with a fair market\nvalue of $25 million or more, (iii) adoption of any\nplan of liquidation or dissolution proposed by an\ninterested stockholder or (iv) reclassification of\nsecurities (including any reverse stock split) or\nrecapitalization or consolidation of Rockwell\nCollins that increases the proportionate share of\ncapital stock of Rockwell Collins held by an\ninterested stockholder, each require the approval of\nthe holders of at least 80% of the voting power of\nthe then outstanding voting stock of Rockwell\nCollins, unless such business combination is\napproved by at least two-thirds of continuing\ndirectors (generally defined as directors not\naffiliated with the respective interested stockholder\nand those elected to succeed a continuing director\nby two-thirds of remaining continuing directors) or\nif certain price and procedure requirements\ndesigned to ensure certain minimum values of\nconsideration to be paid to holders of Rockwell\nCollins capital stock have been met.\n\n195\n\nStockholder Rights\nPlan\n\n \n\nRockwell Collins does not have a stockholder\nrights plan currently in effect.\n\n \n\nB/E Aerospace does not have a stockholder rights\nplan currently in effect.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n208/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        The validity of the Rockwell Collins common stock will be passed upon for Rockwell Collins by Robert J. Perna, Senior Vice\nPresident, General Counsel and Secretary to Rockwell Collins.\n\nLEGAL MATTERS \n\nEXPERTS \n\n        The consolidated financial statements of Rockwell Collins and its subsidiaries, incorporated in this joint proxy statement/prospectus\nby reference from Rockwell Collins\' Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended September 30, 2016, and the effectiveness of\nRockwell Collins\' and its subsidiaries\' internal control over financial reporting have been audited by Deloitte & Touche LLP, an\nindependent registered public accounting firm, as stated in their reports, which are incorporated herein by reference. Such consolidated\nfinancial statements have been so incorporated in reliance upon the reports of such firm given upon their authority as experts in accounting\nand auditing.\n\n        The consolidated financial statements and the related financial statement schedule of B/E Aerospace, Inc. and subsidiaries,\nincorporated in this joint proxy statement/prospectus by reference from B/E Aerospace, Inc.\'s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year\nended December 31, 2015, and the effectiveness of B/E Aerospace, Inc. and subsidiaries\' internal control over financial reporting have\nbeen audited by Deloitte & Touche LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm, as stated in their reports, which are\nincorporated herein by reference. Such consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule have been so incorporated in\nreliance upon the reports of such firm given upon their authority as experts in accounting and auditing.\n\nDATES FOR SUBMISSION OF STOCKHOLDER PROPOSALS FOR 2017 AND 2018 ANNUAL MEETINGS\n\nRockwell Collins\n\n        Stockholder proposals to be made at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners which will be held on February 2, 2017 must have\nbeen received at Rockwell Collins\' principal executive offices by August 18, 2016, 120 calendar days before the anniversary date of the\nmailing of Rockwell Collins\' proxy statement to stockholders in connection with the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, in order to be\neligible for inclusion in Rockwell Collins\' proxy statement and form of proxy relating to that meeting pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the\nExchange Act. Rockwell Collins\' by-laws require that notice of stockholder proposals to be made at the 2017 Annual Meeting of\nShareowners outside the processes of Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act was to be submitted to Rockwell Collins no earlier than the\nclose of business on September 7, 2016, the 150th day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year\'s annual meeting and no later\nthan the close of business on October 7, 2016, the 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year\'s annual meeting.\n\n        Stockholder proposals to be made at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners must be received at Rockwell Collins\' principal\nexecutive offices by August 18, 2017, 120 calendar days before the anniversary date of the mailing of Rockwell Collins\' proxy statement\nto stockholders in connection with the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, in order to be eligible for inclusion in Rockwell Collins\'\nproxy statement and form of proxy relating to that meeting pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act; provided, however, that if the\ndate of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners has been changed by more than 30 days from February 2, 2018, then the deadline for\ninclusion is a reasonable time before Rockwell Collins begins to print and send its proxy materials for that meeting. Rockwell Collins\' by-\nlaws require that notice of stockholder proposals to be made at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners outside the processes of\nRule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act be submitted to Rockwell Collins no earlier than the close of business on September 5, 2017, the\n150th day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year\'s annual meeting and no later than the close of business on October 5, 2017,\nthe 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the preceding year\'s annual meeting;\n\n196\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n209/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nprovided, however, that if the date of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners is more than 30 days before or more than 60 days after\nsuch anniversary date, notice must be delivered no earlier than the close of business on the 150th day prior to the date of such annual\nmeeting and no later than the close of business on the 120th day prior to the date of such annual meeting or, if the first public\nannouncement of the date of such annual meeting is less than 130 days prior to the date of such annual meeting, the 10th day following the\ndate of such public announcement.\n\n        Pursuant to Rockwell Collins\' by-laws, notice of stockholder proposals must be in proper form, setting forth, as to each matter the\nstockholder proposes to bring before the annual meeting, the following:\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nthe name and address of such stockholder; \n\nthe class or series and number of shares of Rockwell Collins capital stock which are beneficially owned by and of record\nby such stockholder; \n\nany information relating to such stockholder required to be disclosed in a proxy statement or other filings required to be\nmade in connection with solicitation of proxies for the proposal and/or for the election of directors pursuant to Section 14\nof the Exchange Act; \n\na representation that such stockholder is a holder of record of stock of Rockwell Collins entitled to vote at such annual\nmeeting and intends to appear in person or by proxy, whether the stockholder or beneficial owner intends to deliver a proxy\nstatement or form of proxy to holders of Rockwell Collins common stock required to approve or adopt the proposal or elect\nthe nominee or otherwise to solicit proxies\' and\n\nan undertaking by such stockholder to notify Rockwell Collins of any change in the above information as of the applicable record date.\n\nB/E Aerospace\n\n        If the merger is completed by early 2017, B/E Aerospace will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Rockwell Collins and,\nconsequently, will not hold an annual meeting of its stockholders in 2017. B/E Aerospace stockholders will be entitled to participate as\nstockholders of Rockwell Collins in the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Rockwell Collins.\n\n        If the merger is not completed for any reason, then B/E Aerospace will hold an annual meeting of its stockholders in 2017.\n\n        Under B/E Aerospace\'s current certificate of incorporation and by-laws and applicable SEC rules, the deadlines for stockholder\nproposals to be brought before the B/E Aerospace 2017 annual meeting of stockholders or to nominate candidates for election as directors\nare as follows:\n\n        Stockholder proposals to be made at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders must be received at B/E Aerospace\'s principal\nexecutive offices by February 14, 2017, 120 calendar days before the anniversary date of the mailing of B/E Aerospace\'s proxy statement\nto stockholders in connection with the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, in order to be eligible for inclusion in B/E Aerospace\'s\nproxy statement and form of proxy relating to that meeting pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act; provided, however, that if the\ndate of the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders has been changed by more than 30 days from June 14, 2017, then the deadline for\ninclusion is a reasonable time before B/E Aerospace begins to print and send its proxy materials for that meeting. B/E Aerospace\'s by-laws\nrequire that notice of stockholder proposals to be made at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders outside the processes of Rule 14a-8\nunder the Exchange Act be submitted to B/E Aerospace in accordance with the requirements of the by-laws no earlier than the close of\nbusiness on March 30, 2017, 120 days prior to the anniversary date of the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, or later than April 29,\n2017, 90 days prior to the anniversary date of the 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders,\n\n197\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n210/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nprovided that, in the event that the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders is called for a date that is earlier than 30 days before such\nanniversary date or later than 70 days after such anniversary date, notice of stockholder proposals and director nominations, to be timely,\nmust be received not later than the close of business on the tenth day following the day on which B/E Aerospace\'s publicly announced the\ndate of the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.\n\n        Pursuant to B/E Aerospace\'s by-laws, notice of stockholder proposals must be in proper form, setting forth, as to each matter the\nstockholder proposes to bring before the annual meeting, the following:\n\na brief description of the business desired to be brought before the annual meeting and the reasons for conducting such\nbusiness at the annual meeting; \n\nthe name and record address of such stockholder; \n\nthe class or series and number of shares of B/E Aerospace capital stock which are owned beneficially or of record by such\nstockholder; \n\na description of all arrangements or understandings between such stockholder and any other person or persons (including\ntheir names) in connection with the proposal of such business by such stockholder and any material interest of such\nstockholder in such business; and \n\na representation that such stockholder intends to appear in person or by proxy at the annual meeting to bring such business\nbefore the meeting.\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\n\xe2\x80\xa2\n\nHOUSEHOLDING OF JOINT PROXY STATEMENT/PROSPECTUS \n\n        The SEC has adopted rules that permit companies and intermediaries such as brokers to satisfy delivery requirements for proxy\nstatements and annual reports with respect to two or more stockholders sharing the same address by delivering a single proxy statement or\nannual report, as applicable, addressed to those stockholders. As permitted by the Exchange Act, only one copy of this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus is being delivered to stockholders residing at the same address, unless stockholders have notified the company whose\nshares they hold of their desire to receive multiple copies of the joint proxy statement/prospectus. This process, which is commonly\nreferred to as "householding," potentially provides extra convenience for stockholders and cost savings for companies. If, at any time, you\nno longer wish to participate in householding and would prefer to receive a separate joint proxy statement/prospectus, or if you are\nreceiving multiple copies of this joint proxy statement/prospectus and wish to receive only one, please contact the company whose shares\nyou hold at their address identified below. Each of Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace will promptly deliver, upon oral or written\nrequest, a separate copy of this joint proxy statement/prospectus to any stockholder residing at an address to which only one copy was\nmailed. Requests for additional copies should be directed to: Rockwell Collins, Inc., 400 Collins Road NE, Cedar Rapids, Iowa 52498,\nAttn: Shareowner Relations, or contact Rockwell Collins by telephone at (319) 295-4045, or to B/E Aerospace, Inc., 1400 Corporate\nCenter Way, Wellington, Florida, 33414 or contact B/E Aerospace Investor Relations by telephone at (561) 791-5000.\n\nWHERE YOU CAN FIND MORE INFORMATION \n\n        Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace file annual, quarterly and current reports, proxy statements and other information with the SEC.\nYou may read and copy any of this information at the SEC\'s public reference room at 100 F Street, N.E., Washington, D.C. 20549. Please\ncall the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330 or 202-942-8090 for further information on the public reference room. The SEC also maintains an\nInternet website that contains reports, proxy statements and other information regarding issuers, including Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace, who file electronically with the SEC. You can also find information about Rockwell Collins and B/E Aerospace at their Internet websites at\nwww.rockwellcollins.com and www.beaerospace.com, respectively. Information contained on these websites does not constitute part of this\njoint proxy statement/prospectus.\n\n        You may also obtain documents incorporated by reference into this document by requesting them in writing or by telephone from\nInnisfree M&A Incorporated, Rockwell Collins\' proxy solicitor, or Georgeson LLC, B/E Aerospace\'s proxy solicitor, at the following\naddresses and telephone numbers:\n\nFor Rockwell Collins Stockholders:\nInnisfree M&A Incorporated\n501 Madison Avenue, 20th Floor\nNew York, New York 10022\n(877) 825-8772 (toll-free)\n(212) 750-5833 (collect)\n\nFor B/E Aerospace Stockholders:\nGeorgeson LLC\n1290 Avenue of the Americas, 9th Floor\nNew York, New York 10104\n(800) 509-0917 (toll-free)\n \n\n        If you are a stockholder of B/E Aerospace or Rockwell Collins and would like to request documents, please do so by March 2, 2017\nto receive them before your respective company\'s special meeting. If you request any documents from Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace,\nRockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as applicable, will mail them to you by first class mail, or another equally prompt means, within one\nbusiness day after Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace, as the case may be, receives your request.\n\n        This joint proxy statement/prospectus is a prospectus of Rockwell Collins and is a joint proxy statement of Rockwell Collins and B/E\nAerospace for the Rockwell Collins special meeting and the B/E Aerospace special meeting. Neither Rockwell Collins nor B/E Aerospace\nhas authorized anyone to give any information or make any representation about the merger or Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace that is\ndifferent from, or in addition to, that contained in this joint proxy statement/\n\n \n\n \n \n \n \n\n \n \n \n \n \n \n\n200\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n213/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nprospectus or in any of the materials that Rockwell Collins or B/E Aerospace has incorporated by reference into this joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus. Therefore, if anyone does give you information of this sort, you should not rely on it. This joint proxy\nstatement/prospectus is dated February 3, 2017. You should not assume that the information is accurate as of any date other than that date,\nand neither its mailing to B/E Aerospace stockholders or Rockwell Collins stockholders nor the issuance of shares of Rockwell Collins\ncommon stock in the merger will create any implication to the contrary.\n\n201\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n214/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable
