A\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n223/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        THIS AGREEMENT AND PLAN OF MERGER, dated as of October 23, 2016 (this "Agreement"), is made by and among Rockwell\nCollins, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Parent"), Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a Delaware corporation and a wholly owned Subsidiary\nof Parent ("Merger Sub"), and B/E Aerospace, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the "Company"). Defined terms used in this Agreement\nhave the respective meanings ascribed to them herein.\n\nW I T N E S S E T H: \n\n        WHEREAS, the respective boards of directors of Parent, Merger Sub and the Company have unanimously approved the acquisition\nof the Company by Parent upon the terms and subject to the conditions and limitations set forth in this Agreement;\n\n        WHEREAS, the respective boards of directors of the Company (the "Company Board"), Parent (the "Parent Board") and Merger\nSub have unanimously approved and declared advisable this Agreement and the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including\nthe merger of Merger Sub with and into the Company, with the Company surviving as a direct or indirect wholly owned Subsidiary of\nParent (the "Merger"), upon the terms and subject to the conditions and limitations set forth in this Agreement and in accordance with the\nGeneral Corporation Law of the State of Delaware (the "DGCL");\n\n        WHEREAS, the Company Board has, subject to Section 5.6, unanimously resolved to recommend that the Company\'s stockholders\napprove the adoption of this Agreement;\n\n        WHEREAS, the Parent Board has, subject to Section 5.7, unanimously resolved to recommend that Parent\'s stockholders approve the\nissuance of shares of Parent common stock, par value $0.01 per share (the "Parent Common Stock"), in connection with the Merger (the\n"Parent Stock Issuance"); and\n\n        WHEREAS, each of Parent, Merger Sub and the Company desire to make certain representations, warranties, covenants and\nagreements in connection with the Merger and also to prescribe various conditions to the Merger.\n\n        NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and the representations, warranties and covenants and subject to the\nconditions herein contained, and intending to be legally bound hereby, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:\n\nARTICLE I \n\nTHE MERGER\n\n        Section 1.1    The Merger.     Upon the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement, and in accordance with the DGCL, at\nthe Effective Time, Merger Sub shall be merged with and into the Company, whereupon the separate existence of Merger Sub shall cease,\nand the Company shall continue as the surviving corporation of the Merger and a direct or indirect, wholly owned Subsidiary of Parent\n(the "Surviving Corporation").\n\n        Section 1.2    The Closing.     Subject to the provisions of Article VI, the closing of the Merger (the "Closing") shall take place at\n10:00 a.m. (local time) on a date to be specified by the parties hereto, but no later than the second (2nd) Business Day after the satisfaction\nor waiver of the conditions set forth in Article VI (other than those conditions that by their terms are to be satisfied at the Closing, but\nsubject to the satisfaction or waiver of such conditions), unless another time, date or place is agreed to in writing by the parties hereto\n(such date being the "Closing Date"). The Closing shall take place at the offices of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP, 155\nNorth Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois.\n\n        Section 1.3    Effective Time.     Concurrently with the Closing, the Company shall cause a certificate of merger with respect to the\nMerger (the "Certificate of Merger") to be executed and filed with the\n\nA-1\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n224/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nDelaware Secretary of State as provided under the DGCL. The Merger shall become effective at the time the Certificate of Merger has\nbeen duly filed with the Delaware Secretary of State or at such other date and time as is agreed between Parent and the Company and\nspecified in the Certificate of Merger (such date and time being hereinafter referred to as the "Effective Time"). The Merger shall have the\neffects set forth in this Agreement and the applicable provisions of the DGCL.\n\n        Section 1.4    Certificate of Incorporation/Charter; Bylaws.     \n\n        (a)   The Certificate of Incorporation, as in effect immediately prior to the Effective Time, shall be amended in its entirety as\nset forth in Exhibit A hereto and, as so amended, shall be the certificate of incorporation of the Surviving Corporation, until\nthereafter amended as provided by Law and such certificate of incorporation and, in each case, subject to Section 5.8.\n\n        (b)   The bylaws of Merger Sub, as in effect immediately prior to the Effective Time, shall be the bylaws of the Surviving\nCorporation, except as to the name of the Surviving Corporation, which shall be "B/E Aerospace, Inc.", until thereafter amended as\nprovided by Law, the certificate of incorporation of the Surviving Corporation and such bylaws and, in each case, subject to\nSection 5.8.\n\n        Section 1.5    Board of Directors; Officers.     The members of the board of directors of Merger Sub immediately prior to the Effective\nTime shall, from and after the Effective Time, be the members of the board of directors of the Surviving Corporation, and the officers of\nthe Company immediately prior to the Effective Time shall, from and after the Effective Time, be the officers of the Surviving\nCorporation, in each case to hold office in accordance with the certificate of incorporation and bylaws of the Surviving Corporation until\nthe earlier of their death, resignation or removal or until their respective successors are duly elected, designated or qualified.\n\nEFFECT OF THE MERGER ON CAPITAL STOCK; EXCHANGE OF CERTIFICATES\n\nARTICLE II \n\n        Section 2.1    Effect on Securities.     \n\n        (a)    Effect of Merger.     At the Effective Time, by virtue of the Merger and without any action on the part of the Company,\nParent, Merger Sub or the holders of any securities of the Company or Merger Sub:\n\n        (i)    Cancellation of Company Securities.    Each share of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of the Company\n(the "Company Common Stock") held by the Company as treasury stock or held, directly or indirectly, by Parent or\nMerger Sub immediately prior to the Effective Time shall automatically be canceled and retired and shall cease to exist,\nand no consideration or payment shall be delivered in exchange therefor or in respect thereof (such shares, "Canceled\nShares").\n\n        (ii)    Conversion of Company Securities.    Each share of Company Common Stock issued and outstanding\nimmediately prior to the Effective Time (other than Canceled Shares and Dissenting Shares) shall be converted into the\nright to receive, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, (A) $34.10 per share in cash, without interest, from Parent\n(such amount of cash, the "Cash Consideration") and (B) a number of validly issued, fully paid and non-assessable shares\nof Parent Common Stock equal to the Exchange Ratio (and, if applicable, cash in lieu of fractional shares of Parent\nCommon Stock payable in accordance with Section 2.1(c), such shares of Parent Common Stock and any such cash in lieu\nof fractional shares, together with the Cash Consideration, the "Merger Consideration"). Each share of Company\nCommon Stock to be converted into the right to receive the Merger Consideration as provided in this Section 2.1(a)(ii)\nshall no longer be outstanding and shall be\n\nA-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n225/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nautomatically canceled and shall cease to exist, and the holders of certificates (the "Certificates") or book-entry shares\n("Book-Entry Shares"), which immediately prior to the Effective Time represented such Company Common Stock, shall\ncease to have any rights with respect to such Company Common Stock other than the right to receive, upon surrender of\nsuch Certificates or Book-Entry Shares in accordance with Section 2.2, the Merger Consideration.\n\n        (iii)    Conversion of Merger Sub Capital Stock.    Each share of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of Merger\nSub issued and outstanding immediately prior to the Effective Time shall be converted into and become one (1) fully paid\nshare of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of the Surviving Corporation and constitute the only outstanding shares\nof capital stock of the Surviving Corporation.\n\n        (b)    Adjustments.     Without limiting the other provisions of this Agreement, if at any time during the period between the\ndate of this Agreement and the Effective Time, any change in the number or type of outstanding shares of Parent Common Stock\nor Company Common Stock shall occur as a result of a reclassification, recapitalization, exchange, stock split (including a reverse\nstock split), combination or readjustment of shares or any stock dividend or stock distribution with a record date during such\nperiod, the Merger Consideration and any other similarly dependent items, as the case may be, shall be appropriately adjusted to\nprovide the same economic effect as contemplated by this Agreement prior to such event. Nothing in this Section 2.1(b) shall be\nconstrued to permit any party to take any action that is otherwise prohibited or restricted by any other provision of this Agreement.\n\n        (c)    Fractional Shares.     No certificate or scrip representing fractional shares of Parent Common Stock shall be issued upon\nthe conversion of Company Common Stock pursuant to Section 2.1(a)(ii), and such fractional share interests shall not entitle the\nowner thereof to any Parent Common Stock or to vote or to any other rights of a holder of Parent Common Stock. All fractional\nshares that a single record holder of Company Common Stock would be otherwise entitled to receive shall be aggregated and\ncalculations shall be rounded to three (3) decimal places. In lieu of any such fractional shares, each holder of Company Common\nStock who would otherwise be entitled to such fractional shares shall be entitled to an amount in cash, without interest, rounded\ndown to the nearest cent, equal to the product of (i) the amount of the fractional share interest in a share of Parent Common Stock\nto which such holder would, but for this Section 2.1(c), be entitled under Section 2.1(a)(ii) and (ii) the Parent Stock Price. As soon\nas practicable after the determination of the amount of cash, if any, to be paid to holders of Company Common Stock in lieu of any\nfractional share interests in Parent Common Stock, the Exchange Agent shall make available such amount, without interest, to the\nholders of Company Common Stock entitled to receive such cash. The payment of cash in lieu of fractional share interests\npursuant to this Section 2.1(c) is not a separately bargained-for consideration.\n\n        Section 2.2    Exchange of Certificates.     \n\n        (a)    Designation of Exchange Agent; Deposit of Exchange Fund.     Prior to the Closing, Parent shall enter into a customary\nexchange agreement with a nationally recognized financial institution designated by Parent and reasonably acceptable to the\nCompany (the "Exchange Agent") for the payment of the Merger Consideration as provided in Section 2.1(a)(ii). At or prior to the\nEffective Time, Parent shall deposit or cause to be deposited with the Exchange Agent, for exchange in accordance with this\nArticle II through the Exchange Agent, (i) book-entry shares (or certificates if requested) representing the full number of whole\nshares of Parent Common Stock issuable pursuant to Section 2.1(a)(ii) in exchange for outstanding shares of Company Common\nStock and (ii) cash in an aggregate amount necessary to pay the Cash Consideration portion of the Merger Consideration, and\nParent shall, after the Effective Time on the appropriate payment date, if\n\nA-3\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n226/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\napplicable, provide or cause to be provided to the Exchange Agent any dividends or other distributions payable on such shares of\nParent Common Stock pursuant to Section 2.2(d) (such shares of Parent Common Stock and Cash Consideration provided to the\nExchange Agent, together with any dividends or other distributions with respect thereto, the "Exchange Fund"). For purposes of\nthe deposit, Parent shall assume that there will not be any fractional shares of Parent Common Stock. Parent shall make available\nto Exchange Agent, for addition to the Exchange Fund, from time to time as needed, cash sufficient to pay cash in lieu of fractional\nshares in accordance with Section 2.1(c). In the event the Exchange Fund shall at any time be insufficient to make the payments\ncontemplated by Section 2.1(a)(ii), Parent shall promptly deposit, or cause to be deposited, additional funds with the Exchange\nAgent in an amount which is equal to the deficiency in the amount required to make such payment. The Exchange Fund shall not\nbe used for any purpose other than to fund payments pursuant to Section 2.1, except as expressly provided for in this Agreement.\n\n        (b)   As promptly as practicable following the Effective Time and, in no event later than the fifth (5th) Business Day thereafter,\nParent shall cause the Exchange Agent to mail to each holder of record of a Certificate or Book-Entry Share that immediately prior\nto the Effective Time represented outstanding shares of Company Common Stock (i) a letter of transmittal (which shall specify that\ndelivery shall be effected, and risk of loss and title to the Certificates or Book-Entry Shares, as applicable, shall pass only upon\nproper delivery of the Certificates (or affidavits of loss in lieu thereof) or Book-Entry Shares to the Exchange Agent, and which\nshall be in the form and have such other provisions as Parent may reasonably specify) and (ii) instructions (which instructions shall\nbe in the form and have such other provisions as Parent and Company may reasonably specify) for use in effecting the surrender of\nthe Certificates or Book-Entry Shares in exchange for (A) cash in an amount equal to the Cash Consideration multiplied by the\nnumber of shares of Company Common Stock previously represented by such Certificates or Book-Entry Shares, (B) the number\nof shares of Parent Common Stock (which shall be in book-entry form unless a certificate is requested) representing, in the\naggregate, the whole number of shares that such holder has the right to receive in respect of such Certificates or Book-Entry Shares\npursuant to Section 2.1(a)(ii), (C) any dividends or other distributions payable pursuant to Section 2.2(d) and (D) cash in lieu of\nfractional shares of Parent Common Stock payable pursuant to Section 2.1(c).\n\n        (c)   Upon surrender of a Certificate (or affidavit of loss in lieu thereof) or Book-Entry Share for cancellation to the Exchange\nAgent, together with a letter of transmittal duly completed and validly executed in accordance with the instructions thereto, and\nsuch other documents as may be required pursuant to such instructions, the holder of such Certificate or Book-Entry Share shall be\nentitled to receive in exchange therefor, and Parent shall cause the Exchange Agent to pay and deliver in exchange therefor as\npromptly as reasonably practicable, (i) cash in an amount equal to the Cash Consideration multiplied by the number of shares of\nCompany Common Stock previously represented by such Certificate or Book-Entry Shares, (ii) the number of shares of Parent\nCommon Stock (which shall be in book-entry form unless a certificate is requested) representing, in the aggregate, the whole\nnumber of shares that such holder has the right to receive in respect of such Certificate or Book-Entry Shares pursuant to\nSection 2.1(a)(ii), (iii) any dividends or other distributions payable pursuant to Section 2.2(d) and (iv) cash in lieu of fractional\nshares of Parent Common Stock payable pursuant to Section 2.1(c), and the Certificate (or affidavit of loss in lieu thereof) or Book-\nEntry Share so surrendered shall be forthwith canceled. Until surrendered as contemplated by this Section 2.2(c), each Certificate\n(or affidavit of loss in lieu thereof) or Book-Entry Share shall be deemed, from and after the Effective Time, to represent only the\nright to receive the applicable Merger Consideration as contemplated by this Section 2.2(c) and any dividends or other distributions\npayable pursuant to Section 2.2(d). The Exchange Agent shall accept such Certificates (or affidavits of loss in lieu thereof) or\nBook-Entry Shares upon compliance with such reasonable terms and conditions as the Exchange Agent may impose to\n\nA-4\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n227/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\neffect an orderly exchange thereof in accordance with normal exchange practices. No interest shall be paid or accrued for the\nbenefit of holders of the Certificates or Book-Entry Shares on the cash payable upon the surrender of the Certificates or Book-\nEntry Shares.\n\n        (d)    Distributions with Respect to Unexchanged Shares.     Subject to applicable Law, following surrender of a Certificate (or\naffidavit of loss in lieu thereof) or Book-Entry Shares for cancellation to the Exchange Agent, there shall be paid to the holder of\nthe Parent Common Stock issued in exchange for such Certificate or Book-Entry Shares, without interest, (i) at the time of delivery\nof such Parent Common Stock by the Exchange Agent pursuant to Section 2.2(c), the amount of dividends or other distributions\nwith a record date after the Effective Time theretofore paid with respect to such shares of Parent Common Stock and (ii) at the\nappropriate payment date, the amount of dividends or other distributions with a record date after the Effective Time but prior to\nsuch delivery of such Parent Common Stock by the Exchange Agent pursuant to Section 2.2(c), and a payment date subsequent to\nsuch delivery of such Parent Common Stock by the Exchange Agent pursuant to Section 2.2(c), payable with respect to such shares\nof Parent Common Stock.\n\n        (e)   In the event of a transfer of ownership of Company Common Stock that is not registered in the transfer records of the\nCompany, payment of the appropriate amount of Merger Consideration (and any dividends or other distributions with respect to\nParent Common Stock as contemplated by Section 2.2(d)) may be made to a Person other than the Person in whose name the\nCertificate or Book-Entry Share so surrendered is registered, if such Certificate shall be properly endorsed or otherwise be in\nproper form for transfer (and accompanied by all documents reasonably required by the Exchange Agent) or such Book-Entry\nShare shall be properly transferred and the Person requesting such payment shall pay any transfer or other Taxes required by\nreason of the payment to a Person other than the registered holder of such Certificate or Book-Entry Share or establish to the\nsatisfaction of Parent that such Tax has been paid or is not applicable.\n\n        (f)    Termination of Exchange Fund.     Any portion of the Exchange Fund which remains undistributed to the holders of the\nCertificates or Book-Entry Shares for one (1) year after the Effective Time shall be delivered to Parent or its designee upon\ndemand, and any such holders prior to the Merger who have not theretofore complied with this Article II shall thereafter look only\nto Parent as general creditor thereof for payment of their claims for Merger Consideration and any dividends or distributions with\nrespect to Parent Common Stock as contemplated by Section 2.2(d).\n\n        (g)    No Liability.     None of Parent, Merger Sub, the Company or the Exchange Agent shall be liable to any Person in respect\nof any shares of Parent Common Stock (or dividends or distributions with respect thereto) or cash held in the Exchange Fund\ndelivered to a Governmental Authority pursuant to any applicable abandoned property, escheat or similar Law. If any Certificate or\nBook-Entry Share shall not have been surrendered immediately prior to the date on which any Merger Consideration in respect of\nsuch Certificate or Book-Entry Share would otherwise escheat to or become the property of any Governmental Authority, any such\nMerger Consideration in respect of such Certificate or Book-Entry Share shall, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, become\nthe property of Parent free and clear of all claims or interest of any Person previously entitled thereto.\n\n        (h)    Investment of Exchange Fund.     The Exchange Agent shall invest any cash included in the Exchange Fund as directed\nby Parent; provided that no such investment shall relieve Parent or the Exchange Agent from making the payments required by this\nArticle II, and following any losses Parent shall promptly provide additional funds to the Exchange Agent for the benefit of the\nholders of Company Common Stock in the amount of such losses. Any interest or income produced by such investments will be\npayable to Parent or its designee as directed by Parent.\n\nA-5\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n228/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (i)    Withholding.     Parent and the Exchange Agent shall be entitled to deduct and withhold from the Merger Consideration\nand any amounts otherwise payable pursuant to this Agreement to any former holder of Company Common Stock or holder of\nCompany Equity Awards such amounts as Parent or the Exchange Agent are required to deduct and withhold with respect to the\nmaking of such payment under the Code or any provision of applicable Tax Law. Any amounts so withheld shall be treated for all\npurposes of this Agreement as having been paid to the Person in respect of which such deduction and withholding was made by\nParent or the Exchange Agent.\n\n        Section 2.3    Company Equity Awards.     \n\n        (a)    Treatment of Company Restricted Stock Awards.     Except as set forth in Section 2.3(a)(ii), Parent shall not assume any\naward of Company Common Stock subject to time-based, performance or other vesting or lapse restrictions (each a "Company\nRestricted Stock Award") or substitute for any Company Restricted Stock Award any similar award of Parent Common Stock, in\nconnection with the Merger.\n\n          (i)  As of immediately prior to the Effective Time, (A) each Company Restricted Stock Award that was granted prior\nto the date of this Agreement and that remains outstanding immediately prior to the Effective Time, shall, to the extent not\nvested, become fully vested; provided that to the extent that such award is subject to performance conditions, any\nperformance conditions shall be deemed to have been satisfied at the maximum level and (B) each Company Restricted\nStock Award shall be canceled without any action on the part of any holder or beneficiary thereof in consideration for the\nright to receive a lump sum cash payment with respect thereto equal to the product of (1) the Merger Consideration and\n(2) the number of shares of Company Common Stock represented by such Company Restricted Stock Award, less any\napplicable withholding or other Taxes or other amounts required by applicable Law to be withheld; provided, further, that\nnotwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, any payment in respect of any Company Restricted\nStock Award which immediately prior to such cancellation was treated as "deferred compensation" subject to Section 409A\nof the Code shall be made on the applicable settlement date for such Company Restricted Stock Award if required in order\nto comply with Section 409A of the Code. For the purpose of the preceding sentence, the portion of the Merger\nConsideration that consists of shares of Parent Common Stock shall be converted to a lump sum cash payment equal to the\nproduct of (x) the number of such shares of Parent Common Stock and (y) the Parent Stock Price.\n\n         (ii)  Except as provided in Section 2.3(a)(ii) of the Company Disclosure Letter, as of immediately prior to the\nEffective Time each Company Restricted Stock Award that is granted by the Company on or following the date of this\nAgreement and that remains outstanding immediately prior to the Effective Time, shall, without any action on the part of\nthe holders thereof, be assumed by Parent and converted into a restricted stock award of Parent covering that number of\nshares of Parent Common Stock (rounded down to the nearest whole share) equal to the product obtained by multiplying\n(A) the number of shares of Company Common Stock subject to the Company Restricted Stock Award immediately prior\nto the Effective Time by (B) the Equity Award Exchange Ratio; provided that to the extent that such Company Restricted\nStock Award is subject to performance conditions, any performance conditions shall be deemed to have been satisfied at\nthe target level performance with respect to the applicable performance period and shall be subject to the time-based\nvesting schedule applicable to such Company Restricted Stock Award and will be settled as provided in the award\nagreement applicable to such Company Restricted Stock Award, subject only to the continued service of the grantee with\nthe Surviving Corporation, Parent or an Affiliate through each applicable vesting date (except to the extent that the\napplicable award agreement provides for accelerated vesting in connection with termination of service or a\n\nA-6\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n229/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nchange in control occurring after the Effective Time) but shall not be subject to any performance metrics following the\nEffective Time.\n\n        (b)    Treatment of Company RSU Awards.     Except as set forth in Section 2.3(b)(ii) below, Parent shall not assume any\nrestricted stock unit awards, including any stock unit held under the Company 2010 Deferred Compensation Plan (each a\n"Company RSU Award"), or substitute for any Company RSU Award any similar award for Parent Common Stock, in connection\nwith the Merger.\n\n          (i)  As of immediately prior to the Effective Time, (A) each Company RSU Award subject to time-based,\nperformance or other vesting restrictions that was granted prior to the date of this Agreement and that remains outstanding\nimmediately prior to the Effective Time, shall, to the extent not vested, become fully vested; provided that to the extent that\nsuch award is subject to performance conditions, any performance conditions shall be deemed to have been satisfied at the\nmaximum level and (B) each such Company RSU Award, whether payable in cash or shares of Company Common Stock,\nshall be canceled without any action on the part of any holder or beneficiary thereof in consideration for the right to receive\na lump sum cash payment with respect thereto equal to the product of (1) the Merger Consideration and (2) the number of\nshares of Company Common Stock represented by such Company RSU Award, less any applicable withholding or other\nTaxes or other amounts required by applicable Law to be withheld; provided, further, that notwithstanding anything to the\ncontrary contained in this Agreement, any payment in respect of any such Company RSU Award which immediately prior\nto such cancellation was treated as "deferred compensation" subject to Section 409A of the Code shall be made on the\napplicable settlement date for such Company RSU Award if required in order to comply with Section 409A of the Code.\nFor the purpose of the preceding sentence, the portion of the Merger Consideration that consists of shares of Parent\nCommon Stock shall be converted to a lump sum cash payment equal to the product of (x) the number of such shares of\nParent Common Stock and (y) the Parent Stock Price.\n\n         (ii)  Except as provided in Section 2.3(b)(ii) of the Company Disclosure Letter, as of immediately prior to the\nEffective Time each Company RSU Award that is granted by the Company on or following the date of this Agreement and\nthat remains outstanding immediately prior to the Effective Time, shall, without any action on the part of the holders\nthereof, be assumed by Parent and converted into a restricted stock unit award of Parent covering that number of shares of\nParent Common Stock (rounded down to the nearest whole share) equal to the product obtained by multiplying (A) the\nnumber of shares of Company Common Stock subject to the Company RSU Award immediately prior to the Effective\nTime by (B) the Equity Award Exchange Ratio; provided that to the extent that such Company RSU Award is subject to\nperformance conditions, any performance conditions shall be deemed to have been satisfied at the target level performance\nwith respect to the applicable performance period and shall be subject to the time-based vesting schedule applicable to such\nCompany RSU Award and will be settled as provided in the award agreement applicable to such Company RSU Award,\nsubject only to the continued service of the grantee with the Surviving Corporation, Parent or an Affiliate through each\napplicable vesting date (except to the extent that the applicable award agreement provides for accelerated vesting in\nconnection with termination of service or a change in control occurring after the Effective Time) but shall not be subject to\nany performance metrics following the Effective Time.\n\n        (c)    Treatment of Company DSU Awards.     Each stock unit credited to the account of any current or former non-employee\ndirector (or beneficiary thereof) under the B/E Aerospace, Inc. Amended and Restated Non-Employee Directors Stock and\nDeferred Compensation Plan (the "Non-Employee Directors Plan") that is payable in shares of Company Common Stock (each a\n"Company DSU Award") and is outstanding as of immediately prior to the Effective Time shall be\n\nA-7\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n230/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nimmediately converted into the right to receive at the Effective Time the Merger Consideration, less any applicable withholding or\nother Taxes or other amounts required by applicable Law to be withheld; provided that notwithstanding anything to the contrary\ncontained in this Agreement, any payment in respect of any Company DSU Award which immediately prior to such cancellation\nwas treated as "deferred compensation" subject to Section 409A of the Code shall be made on the applicable settlement date for\nsuch Company DSU Award if required in order to comply with Section 409A of the Code.\n\n        (d)    Company ESPP.     Except to the extent it is otherwise determined by Parent and communicated to the Company prior to\nthe Effective Time that the Company ESPP should continue in effect under its current terms, promptly following the date of this\nAgreement upon confirmation by Parent prior to such action being taken, the Company Board (or, if applicable, any committee\nthereof administering the Company ESPP) shall adopt such resolutions or take such other necessary actions such that (i) with\nrespect to any Option Period(s) (as such term is defined in the Company ESPP) outstanding as of the date of this Agreement under\nthe Company ESPP, such Option Period(s) shall terminate and each Option (as such term is defined in the Company ESPP) shall be\ndeemed to have been exercised upon the earlier to occur of (A) the day that is four (4) complete Trading Days prior to the Effective\nTime or (B) the date on which such Option Period(s) would otherwise end, and no additional Option Period(s) shall commence\nunder such Company ESPP after the date of this Agreement; (ii) no individual participating in the Company ESPP shall be\npermitted to (A) increase the amount of his, her or its rate of payroll contributions thereunder from the rate in effect as of the date\nof this Agreement, or (B) except to the extent required by applicable Law, make separate non-payroll contributions to the Company\nESPP on or following the date of this Agreement; (iii) no individual who is not participating in the Company ESPP as of the date\nof this Agreement may commence participation in the Company ESPP following the date of this Agreement; and (iv) subject to the\nconsummation of the Merger, the Company ESPP shall terminate, effective immediately prior to the Effective Time.\n\n        (e)    Company Actions.     Prior to the Effective Time, the Company shall provide such notice, if any, to the extent required\nunder the terms of the Company Equity Plan, obtain any necessary consents, adopt applicable resolutions, amend the terms of the\nCompany Equity Plan or any outstanding awards, and take all other appropriate actions to give effect to the transactions\ncontemplated herein. To the extent such notice or actions are required, the Company shall provide Parent with documentation\nevidencing the completion of the foregoing actions (the form and substance of such documentation shall be subject to review and\napproval by Parent, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed) not later than the Business Day\npreceding the Effective Time.\n\n        Section 2.4    Lost Certificates.     If any Certificate shall have been lost, stolen or destroyed, then upon the making of an affidavit of\nthat fact by the Person claiming such Certificate to be lost, stolen or destroyed and, if required by Parent, the posting by such Person of a\nbond, in such reasonable amount as Parent may direct, as indemnity against any claim that may be made against it with respect to such\nCertificate, the Exchange Agent will issue in exchange for such lost, stolen or destroyed Certificate the Merger Consideration to which the\nholder thereof is entitled pursuant to this Article II.\n\n        Section 2.5    Dissenting Shares.     Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, to the extent that holders of Company\nCommon Stock are entitled to appraisal rights under Section 262 of the DGCL, shares of Company Common Stock issued and outstanding\nimmediately prior to the Effective Time and held by a holder who has properly exercised and perfected his or her demand for appraisal\nrights under Section 262 of the DGCL and not effectively withdrawn or lost such holder\'s rights to appraisal (the "Dissenting Shares"),\nshall not be converted into the right to receive the Merger Consideration, but the holders of such Dissenting Shares shall be entitled to\nreceive such consideration as shall be determined pursuant to Section 262 of the DGCL (it being understood and\n\nA-8\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n231/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nacknowledged that at the Effective Time, such Dissenting Shares shall no longer be outstanding, shall automatically be canceled and shall\ncease to exist and such holder shall cease to have any rights with respect thereto other than the right to receive the "fair value" of such\nDissenting Shares as determined in accordance with Section 262 of the DGCL); provided, however, that if any such holder shall have\nfailed to perfect or shall have effectively withdrawn or lost his, her or its right to appraisal and payment under the DGCL (whether\noccurring before, at or after the Effective Time), such holder\'s shares of Company Common Stock shall thereupon be deemed to have been\nconverted as of the Effective Time into the right to receive the Merger Consideration, without any interest thereon, and such shares shall\nnot be deemed to be Dissenting Shares. The Company shall give prompt notice to Parent of any demands for appraisal of any shares of\nCompany Common Stock, withdrawals of such demands and any other instruments served pursuant to the DGCL received by the\nCompany relating to appraisal demands, and Parent shall have the right to participate in all negotiations and Proceedings with respect to\nsuch demands. Prior to the Effective Time, the Company shall not, without the prior written consent of Parent, make any payment with\nrespect to or settle or compromise or offer to settle or compromise any such demand or Proceeding, or agree to do any of the foregoing.\n\n        Section 2.6    Transfers; No Further Ownership Rights.     After the Effective Time, there shall be no registration of transfers on the\nstock transfer books of the Company of shares of Company Common Stock that were outstanding immediately prior to the Effective Time.\nIf Certificates or Book-Entry Shares are presented to the Surviving Corporation, Parent or the Exchange Agent for transfer following the\nEffective Time, they shall be canceled against delivery of the applicable Merger Consideration, as provided for in Section 2.1(a)(ii), for\neach share of Company Common Stock formerly represented by such Certificates or Book-Entry Shares.\n\n        Section 2.7    Further Action.     If, at any time after the Effective Time any further action is determined by Parent or the Surviving\nCorporation to be necessary or desirable to carry out the purposes of this Agreement or to vest the Surviving Corporation or Parent with\nfull right, title and possession of and to all rights and property of Merger Sub and the Company with respect to the Merger, the officers and\nmanagers of Parent shall be fully authorized (in the name of Merger Sub, the Company, the Surviving Corporation and otherwise) to take\nsuch action.\n\nARTICLE III \n\nREPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF THE COMPANY\n\n        Except (i) as disclosed in the Company SEC Documents filed with (or furnished to) the SEC by the Company on or after\nDecember 31, 2014 and prior to the date of this Agreement (but in each case excluding any risk factor disclosure contained under the\nheading "Risk Factors" (other than any factual information contained therein) or in any "forward-looking statements" legend or in any\nsimilarly non-specific, predictive or forward-looking statements) and to the extent publicly available on the SEC\'s Electronic Data\nGathering Analysis and Retrieval System ("EDGAR") or (ii) as disclosed in the Company Disclosure Letter, the Company hereby\nrepresents and warrants to Parent and Merger Sub as follows:\n\n        Section 3.1    Organization; Qualification.     Each of the Company and its Subsidiaries is a legal entity duly organized and validly\nexisting under the laws of the jurisdiction of its incorporation, formation or organization, as applicable, and has the requisite corporate or\nsimilar power and authority to conduct its business as it is now being conducted and to own, lease and operate its properties and assets in\nthe manner in which its properties and assets are currently operated, except where the failure to be so validly existing and authorized has\nnot been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its\nSubsidiaries, taken as a whole. Each of the Company and its Subsidiaries is duly qualified or licensed to do business and is in good\nstanding in each jurisdiction in which the character or location of the property owned, leased or\n\nA-9\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n232/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\noperated by it or the nature of the business conducted by it makes such qualification or licensing necessary, except where the failure to be\nso duly qualified or licensed and in good standing has not had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the\naggregate, a Company Material Adverse Effect. The Company\'s Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation (the "Certificate of\nIncorporation") and Amended and Restated Bylaws (the "Bylaws"), each as amended as of the date of this Agreement, have been made\navailable to Parent and are currently in effect, and the Company is not in violation of any of the provisions thereof, and the organizational\nor governing documents of each of the Company\'s Subsidiaries, each as amended as of the date of this Agreement, are currently in effect,\nand none of such Subsidiaries is in violation of any of the respective provisions thereof, except, in each case, where such failure or\nviolation has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company\nand its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole.\n\n        Section 3.2    Capitalization; Subsidiaries.     \n\n        (a)   As of the close of business on October 17, 2016 (the "Capitalization Date"), the authorized capital stock of the\nCompany consisted of (i) 200,000,000 shares of Company Common Stock, 101,603,153 of which were issued and outstanding\n(including outstanding Company Restricted Stock Awards representing 1,480,641 shares of Company Common Stock) and\n5,964,264 of which were held by the Company as treasury stock, and (ii) 1,000,000 shares of preferred stock of the Company, par\nvalue $0.01 per share ("Company Preferred Stock"), no shares of which were outstanding. There are no other classes of capital\nstock of the Company and no bonds, debentures, notes or other Indebtedness of the Company having the right to vote (or\nconvertible into or exercisable for securities having the right to vote) on any matters on which holders of capital stock of the\nCompany may vote authorized, issued or outstanding. As of the close of business on the Capitalization Date, there were (A) no\noutstanding Company Options to purchase shares of Company Common Stock, (B) outstanding Company Restricted Stock Awards\nrepresenting 1,480,641 shares of Company Common Stock; (C) outstanding Company RSU Awards representing 265,191 shares of\nCompany Common Stock, which amount may be increased to a maximum of 386,226 shares of Company Common Stock based\non the satisfaction of performance conditions set forth in the applicable award agreements; (D) outstanding Company DSU Awards\nrepresenting 42,813 shares of Company Common Stock; (E) 320,508 shares of Company Common Stock reserved for future\nissuance under the Company ESPP; and (F) 4,532,252 shares of Company Common Stock reserved for future issuance under the\nCompany Equity Plan. From the close of business on the Capitalization Date through the date of this Agreement, there have been\nno issuances of (i) any Company Common Stock, Company Preferred Stock or any other equity or voting interests in the Company\nother than issuances of shares of Company Common Stock pursuant to the exercise, vesting or settlement, as applicable, of the\nCompany Equity Awards outstanding as of the close of business on the Capitalization Date in accordance with the terms of such\nCompany Equity Awards or under the Company ESPP in accordance with its terms and (ii) any Company Equity Awards or any\nother equity or equity-based awards.\n\n        (b)   All of the issued and outstanding shares of Company Common Stock have been, and all of the shares of Company\nCommon Stock that may be issued pursuant to the Company Equity Awards, the Company Equity Plan or the Company ESPP will\nbe, when issued in accordance with the respective terms thereof, duly authorized and validly issued and are, or will be when\nissued, fully paid, nonassessable and free of preemptive rights. The Company has made available to Parent or its counsel accurate\nand complete copies of the Company Equity Plan and the forms of stock option, restricted stock and restricted stock unit\nagreements evidencing the Company Equity Awards and, other than differences with respect to the number of shares of Company\nCommon Stock covered thereby, the grant date, the exercise price, regular vesting schedule and expiration date applicable thereto,\nno such stock option, restricted stock or restricted stock unit agreement\n\nA-10\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n233/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ncontains material terms that are not consistent with, or in addition to, such forms. securities of the Company that is required in connection with the consummation of the transactions\ncontemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        Section 3.5    No Conflict; Required Filings and   (a)   (i) The Company and its Subsidiaries are in possession of all material franchises, grants, licenses, permits, easements,\nvariances, exemptions, consents, certificates, approvals, registrations, clearances, orders and other authorizations necessary for the\nCompany and its Subsidiaries to own, lease and operate their respective properties and assets and to carry on their respective\nbusinesses as now being conducted, under and pursuant to all applicable Laws (the "Company Permits"), (ii) all such Company\nPermits are in full force and effect and (iii) as of the date of this Agreement, no suspension, cancellation, withdrawal or revocation\nthereof is pending or, to the Knowledge of the Company, threatened, except where the failure to be in possession of, failure to be in\nfull force and effect or the suspension, cancellation, withdrawal or revocation thereof has not had, and would not reasonably be\nexpected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Company Material Adverse Effect.\n\n        (b)   Since December 31, 2014, the Company and its Subsidiaries have been and are in compliance with (i) all applicable\nLaws and (ii) all Company Permits, except where any failure to be in such compliance has not had, and would not reasonably be\nexpected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Company Material Adverse Effect.\n\n        (c)   Since December 31, 2014 through the date of this Agreement, none of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries or, to the\nKnowledge of the Company, any of their respective directors, officers or employees, has received any written or, to the Knowledge\nof the Company, oral notification from a Governmental Authority asserting that the Company or any of its Subsidiaries is not in\ncompliance with any Laws or Company Permits, except where any failure to be in such compliance has not had, and would not\nreasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Company Material Adverse Effect.\n\n        Section 3.11    Information Supplied.     None of the information supplied or to be supplied by or on behalf of the Company or any of\nits Subsidiaries for inclusion or incorporation by reference in (a) the Form S-4 to be filed with the SEC by Parent in connection with the\nregistration under the Securities Act of the shares of Parent Common Stock to be issued in the Merger (as amended or supplemented from\ntime to time, the "Form S-4") will, at the time the Form S-4 is filed with the SEC, and at any time it is amended or supplemented or at the\ntime it becomes effective under the Securities Act, contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state any material fact\nrequired to be stated therein, in light of the circumstances under which they are made, not misleading and (b) the joint proxy\n\nA-16\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n239/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nstatement to be sent to the stockholders of Parent relating to the Parent Stockholders\' Meeting and to the stockholders of the Company\nrelating to the Company Stockholders\' Meeting (the "Joint Proxy Statement") will, at the date it, or any amendment or supplement to it,\nis mailed to stockholders of the Company and stockholders of Parent and at the time of the Company Stockholders\' Meeting and at the\ntime of the Parent Stockholders\' Meeting, contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make\nthe statements therein, in light of the circumstances in which they are made, not misleading (except that no representation or warranty is\nmade by the Company regarding such portions thereof that relate expressly to Parent or any of its Subsidiaries, including Merger Sub, or to\nstatements made therein based on information supplied by or on behalf of Parent or Merger Sub for inclusion or incorporation by reference\ntherein). The Joint Proxy Statement will comply as to form in all material respects with the requirements of the Exchange Act and the rules\nand regulations promulgated thereunder.\n\n        Section 3.12    Employee Benefit Plans; Labor.     \n\n        (a)   Section 3.12(a) of the Company Disclosure Letter sets forth a true and complete list, as of the date of this Agreement, of\n(i) each material "employee benefit plan" (as such term is defined in Section 3(3) of ERISA), whether written or unwritten, that the\nCompany, any of its Subsidiaries or any Company ERISA Affiliate adopted, maintains, sponsors, participates in, is a party or\ncontributes to or with respect to which the Company or any of its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, could reasonably be expected to\nhave any material liability; and (ii) each other material employment or employee benefit plan, program, practice, policy,\narrangement or agreement, whether written or unwritten, including any equity option, equity purchase, equity appreciation right or\nother equity or equity-based incentive, cash bonus or incentive compensation, employment, change in control, retention, retirement\nor supplemental retirement, deferred compensation, profit-sharing, unemployment, severance, termination pay, welfare,\nhospitalization or medical, life, accidental death and dismemberment, long- or short-term disability, fringe benefit or other similar\ncompensation or employee benefit plan, program, practice, policy, arrangement or agreement for any current or former employee\nor director of, or other individual service provider to, the Company or any of its Subsidiaries that does not constitute an "employee\nbenefit plan" (as defined in Section 3(3) of ERISA, whether or not ERISA applies), that the Company or any of its Subsidiaries\nadopted, maintains, sponsors, participates in, is a party or contributes to, or with respect to which the Company or any of its\nSubsidiaries could reasonably be expected to have any liability (each, a "Company Benefit Plan"). With respect to each Company\nBenefit Plan, the Company has made available to Parent a true and complete copy of (i) such Company Benefit Plan and all\nmaterial amendments thereto (including a written description of the material provisions of each unwritten Company Benefit Plan),\n(ii) each trust, insurance, annuity or other funding Contract, (iii) the most recent financial statements and actuarial or other\nvaluation reports, (iv) the three most recent annual reports on Form 5500, (v) the most recent determination letter (or, if applicable,\nadvisory or opinion letter) from the IRS, (vi) the most recent summary plan description and any material modification and (vii) all\nmaterial notices given to such Company Benefit Plan, the Company or any Company ERISA Affiliate by the IRS, United States\nDepartment of Labor, Pension Benefit Guarantee Corporation or other Governmental Authority.\n\n        (b)   Except as has not had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Company\nMaterial Adverse Effect, (i) each of the Company Benefit Plans has been established, adopted, operated, maintained and\nadministered in accordance with its terms and applicable Laws, including ERISA and the Code, (ii) all payments and contributions\nrequired to be made under the terms of any Company Benefit Plan and applicable Laws have been timely made or accrued or\notherwise adequately reserved to the extent required by and in accordance with GAAP and (iii) none of the Company or any of its\nSubsidiaries or, to the Knowledge of the Company, any third party, has engaged in any non-exempt "prohibited transaction" (within\nthe meaning of Section 4975 of the Code or Section 406 of ERISA) with respect to any Company Benefit Plan that would result in\nthe imposition of any liability to the Company or any of its Subsidiaries.\n\nA-17\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n240/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable Company\nBenefit Plan or prototype sponsor has remaining a period of time under applicable Code regulations or pronouncements of the IRS\nin which to apply for such a letter and make any amendments Since the date of their most recent\nconsolidated financial statements, none of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries has incurred any material liability for Taxes\noutside the ordinary course of business or otherwise inconsistent with past custom and practice.\n\n        (c)   As of the date of this Agreement, there are no pending, threatened in writing or ongoing audits, examinations,\ninvestigations or other Proceedings by any Governmental Authority in respect of material Taxes of or with respect to the Company\nor any of its Subsidiaries. None of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries has waived any statute of limitations with respect to\nmaterial Taxes or agreed to any extension of time with respect to a material Tax assessment or deficiency. No written claim has\nbeen made by any Governmental Authority in a jurisdiction where the Company or any of its Subsidiaries does not currently file a\nTax Return that it is or may be subject to taxation by that jurisdiction in respect of Taxes that would be covered by or the subject has taken any action resulting in the termination of,\nacceleration of performance required by, or resulting in a right of termination or acceleration under, any Company Material\nContract. As of the date of this Agreement, to the Knowledge of the Company, no other party to any Company Material Contract is\nin breach of or default (or, with the giving of notice or lapse of time or both, would be in default) under the terms of, and none has\ntaken any action resulting in the termination of, acceleration of performance required by, or resulting in a right of termination or\nacceleration under, any Company Material Contract. Each Company Material Contract is (i) a valid and binding obligation of the\nCompany or its Subsidiary that is a party thereto, as applicable, and, to the Knowledge of the Company, the other parties thereto,\n(provided that (A) such enforcement may be subject to applicable bankruptcy, insolvency (including all Laws related to fraudulent\ntransfers), reorganization, moratorium or other similar Laws, now or hereafter in effect, relating to creditors\' rights and remedies\ngenerally and (B) the remedies of specific performance and injunctive and other forms of equitable relief may be subject to\nequitable defenses and to the discretion of the court before which any Proceeding therefor may be brought) and (ii) in full force\nand effect.\n\n        (c)   No (i) current or former officer or director of the Company; (ii) beneficial owner of five percent (5%) or more of any\nvoting securities of the Company; or (iii) any "affiliate" or "associate" of any such Person, has any interest in any Contract or\nproperty (real or personal, tangible or intangible), used in, or pertaining to the business of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries,\nwhich interest would be required to be disclosed pursuant to Item 404(a) of Regulation S-K promulgated by the SEC and that has\nnot been so disclosed in the Company SEC Documents.\n\nA-23\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n246/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Section 3.15    Trademarks, Patents and Copyrights.     \n\n        (a)   Except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse\nto the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the applications for and registrations of Intellectual Property Rights owned\nby the Company or its Subsidiaries are (i) free and clear of all Liens (other than Permitted Liens) and (ii) in effect, subsisting and,\nto the Knowledge of the Company, valid.\n\n        (b)   To the Knowledge of the Company, except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or\nin the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the Company and its Subsidiaries own,\nvalidly license or have the right to use in the manner currently used, all patents, trademarks, trade names, copyrights, Internet\ndomain names, service marks, know-how, trade secrets and other intellectual property rights, and any registrations and applications\ntherefor (the "Intellectual Property Rights") that are used in the respective businesses of the Company and its Subsidiaries.\n\n        (c)   To the Knowledge of the Company, except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or\nin the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the conduct of the respective businesses\nof the Company and its Subsidiaries as currently conducted does not infringe upon, misappropriate or otherwise violate any\nIntellectual Property Rights of any other Person. As of the date of this Agreement, there is no claim for any such infringement,\nmisappropriation or other violation pending or, to the Knowledge of the Company, threatened, except for any such infringement,\nmisappropriation or other violation that has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate,\nmaterially adverse to the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole. To the Knowledge of the Company, no other Person is\ninfringing, misappropriating or otherwise violating any Intellectual Property Right that is material to the respective businesses of\nthe Company and its Subsidiaries as currently conducted, except for any such infringement, misappropriation or other violation\nthat has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company\nand its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole.\n\n        (d)   To the Knowledge of the Company, there have been no material security breaches in the information technology systems\nof the Company and its Subsidiaries or the information technology systems of any other Persons to the extent used by or on behalf\nof the Company and its Subsidiaries. Since December 31, 2014, except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to\nbe, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the Company and its\nSubsidiaries have at all times complied with all applicable Laws, as well as their own rules, policies and procedures, relating to\nprivacy, data protection and the collection, retention, protection and use of personal information.\n\n        (e)   The representations and warranties set forth in this Section 3.15 and Section 3.12(n) are the only representations and\nwarranties being made by the Company in this Agreement with respect to any infringement, misappropriation or other violation of\nIntellectual Property Rights.\n\n        Section 3.16    Real and Except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected\nto be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, (a) each product\nmanufactured, sold, leased or delivered by the Company or any of its Subsidiaries has been in substantial conformity with all applicable\ncontractual specifications and all express and implied warranties made by the Company or any of its Subsidiaries (except to the extent\nnon-conformity is not material or otherwise consented to by a customer), and neither the Company nor any of its Subsidiaries has any\nliability for replacement or repair thereof or other damages in connection therewith, (b) the Company and each of its Subsidiaries (i) is in\ncompliance with all applicable Laws prescribed by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration ("FAA") under Title 14 of the Code of\nFederal Regulations and similar Laws prescribed by foreign aviation authorities (such Laws, including those prescribed by the FAA,\ncollectively, "Aviation Regulations"), (ii) has not violated, been subject to an investigation with respect to or made voluntary disclosures\nwith respect to potential violations of any Aviation Regulations during the last two (2) years and (iii) has not been cited by the FAA or\nforeign aviation authorities for any material discrepancies or violations during inspections or audits during the last two (2) years. Except as\nhas not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to the Company and its\nSubsidiaries, taken as a whole, the Company has not received any Air Worthiness Directives (as such term is defined in the Federal\nAviation Regulations, 14 C.F.R. \xc2\xa7 39, as amended) issued by the FAA (or, with respect to such issuances by any foreign aviation\nGovernmental Authority, the foreign equivalent thereof) pursuant to which a known safety deficiency was found in any of the products of\nthe Company or any of its Subsidiaries at any time during the last two (2) years, and no such Air Worthiness Directives are pending.\n\n        Section 3.20    Foreign Corrupt Practices Act; Anti-Corruption.     \n\n        (a)   Since October 1, 2013, to the Knowledge of the Company, none of the Company or its Subsidiaries, nor any director,\nofficer, employee or agent of the Company, has directly or indirectly made, offered to make, or attempted to make any\ncontribution, gift, bribe, rebate, payoff, influence\n\nA-26\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n249/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\npayment, kickback or other payment to any Person, private or public, regardless of what form, whether in money, property or\nservices, in violation of the FCPA, the U.S. Travel Act, the U.K. Bribery Act 2010, the OECD Convention on Combating Bribery\nof Foreign Public Officials in International Business Transactions or any other applicable Law relating to anti-corruption or anti-\nbribery (collectively, the "Anti-Corruption Laws"). Except for (a) the representations and warranties contained in this\nArticle III and (b) the representations, warranties and covenants contained in the Company Signing Representation Letter and the\nCompany Closing Representation Letter, neither the Company nor any other Person on behalf of the Company makes any express or\nimplied representation or warranty with respect to the Company or any of its Subsidiaries or any other information provided to Parent or\nMerger Sub in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including the accuracy, completeness or timeliness\nthereof.\n\nARTICLE IV \n\nREPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF PARENT AND MERGER SUB\n\n        Except (i) as disclosed in the Parent SEC Documents filed with (or furnished to) the SEC by Parent on or after December 31, 2014\nand prior to the date of this Agreement (but in each case excluding any risk factor disclosure contained under the heading "Risk Factors"\n(other than any factual information contained therein) or in any "forward-looking statements" legend or in any similarly non-specific,\npredictive or forward-looking statements) and to the extent publicly available on EDGAR or (ii) as disclosed in the Parent Disclosure\nLetter, Parent and Merger Sub hereby, jointly and severally, represent and warrant to the Company as follows:\n\n        Section 4.1    Organization; Qualification.     Each of Parent and Merger Sub is a corporation duly organized and validly existing\nunder the laws of the State of Delaware and has the requisite corporate power and authority to conduct its business as it is now being\nconducted and to own, lease and operate its properties and assets in the manner in which its properties and assets are currently operated,\nexcept where the failure to be so validly existing and authorized has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or\nin the aggregate, materially adverse to Parent and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole. Each of Parent and Merger Sub is duly qualified or\nlicensed to do business and is in good standing in each jurisdiction in which the character or location of the property owned, leased or\noperated by it or the nature of the business conducted by it makes such qualification or licensing necessary, except where the failure to be\nso duly qualified or licensed and in good standing has not had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the\naggregate, a Parent Material Adverse Effect. The Parent Organizational Documents have been made available to the Company and are\ncurrently in effect, and neither Parent nor Merger Sub, as applicable, is in violation of any of the provisions thereof, except where such\nfailure or violation has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to Parent\nand its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole.\n\nA-29\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n252/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Section 4.2    Capitalization; Subsidiaries.     \n\n        (a)   As of the close of business on the Capitalization Date, the authorized capital stock of Parent consisted of\n(i) 1,000,000,000 shares of Parent Common Stock, 143,777,488 of which were issued and outstanding and 13,587,492 of which\nwere held by Parent as treasury stock, and (ii) 25,000,000 shares of preferred stock of Parent, without par value, no shares of which\nwere outstanding. There are no other classes of capital stock of Parent and no bonds, debentures, notes or other Indebtedness of\nParent having the right to vote (or convertible into or exercisable for securities having the right to vote) on any matters on which\nholders of capital stock of Parent may vote authorized, issued or outstanding. As of the close of business on the Capitalization\nDate, there were (A) outstanding options to purchase 3,893,821 shares of Parent Common Stock and (B) outstanding Parent Equity\nAwards (other than options to purchase Parent Common Stock) representing 756,217 shares of Parent Common Stock.\n\n        (b)   All of the issued and outstanding shares of Parent Common Stock have been, and all of the shares of Parent Common\nStock that may be issued pursuant to the Parent Equity Awards, the Parent 2015 Long-Term Incentives Plan or the Parent\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan will be, when issued in accordance with the respective terms thereof, duly authorized and validly\nissued, and, along with the shares of Parent Common Stock issuable pursuant to this Agreement (subject to obtaining the Parent\nStockholder Approval), are, or will be when issued, fully paid, nonassessable and free of preemptive rights. All of the outstanding\nParent Common Stock has been sold pursuant to an effective registration statement filed under the federal securities Laws or an\nappropriate exemption therefrom.\n\n        (c)   As of the date of this Agreement, other than as set forth in Section 4.2(a), there are no (i) existing options, warrants, calls,\npreemptive rights, subscriptions or other rights, restricted stock awards, restricted stock unit awards, convertible securities,\nagreements, arrangements or commitments of any kind obligating Parent to issue, transfer, register or sell, or cause to be issued,\ntransferred, registered or sold, any shares of capital stock of Parent or securities convertible into or exchangeable for such shares,\nor obligating Parent to grant, extend or enter into such options, warrants, calls, preemptive, subscriptions or other rights, restricted\nstock awards, restricted stock unit awards, convertible securities, agreements, arrangements or commitments, (ii) outstanding\nobligations of Parent to repurchase, redeem or otherwise acquire any capital stock of Parent or any securities representing the right\nto purchase or otherwise receive any capital stock of Parent, (iii) stockholder agreements, voting trusts or similar agreements with\nany Person to which Parent is a party (A) restricting the transfer of the capital stock of Parent or (B) affecting the voting rights of\ncapital stock of Parent or (iv) outstanding or authorized equity or equity-based compensation awards, including any equity\nappreciation rights, security-based performance units, "phantom" stock, profit-participation or other security rights issued by\nParent, or other agreements, arrangements or commitments of any character (contingent or otherwise) to which Parent is party, in\neach case pursuant to which any Person is entitled to receive any payment from Parent based in whole or in part on the value of\nany capital stock of Parent.\n\n        (d)   All of the issued and outstanding capital stock of Merger Sub is, and at the Effective Time will be, owned by Parent or a\ndirect or indirect wholly owned Subsidiary of Parent. Merger Sub has no outstanding options, warrants, rights or any other\nagreements pursuant to which any Person other than Parent may acquire any equity security of Merger Sub.\n\n        (e)   The number of shares of authorized Parent Common Stock that have not been issued, subscribed for or otherwise\ncommitted to be issued is at least equal to the number of shares of Parent Common Stock to be issued pursuant to this Agreement.\n\nA-30\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n253/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Section 4.3    Authority Relative to Agreement.     \n\n        (a)   Each of Parent and Merger Sub have all necessary corporate power and authority to execute, deliver and perform their\nrespective obligations under this Agreement and, subject (in the case of the issuance of shares of Parent Common Stock in\nconnection with the Merger) to obtaining the Parent Stockholder Approval, to consummate the transactions contemplated by this\nAgreement. The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by Parent and Merger Sub, and the consummation by\nParent and Merger Sub of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, have been duly and validly authorized by all necessary\ncorporate action by Parent and Merger Sub, and (in the case of the Parent Stock Issuance, except for the (i) receipt of the Parent\nStockholder Approval and (ii) filing of the Certificate of Merger with the Delaware Secretary of State) no other corporate action or\nproceeding on the part of Parent or Merger Sub is necessary to authorize the execution, delivery and performance of this\nAgreement by Parent and Merger Sub and the consummation by Parent and Merger Sub of the transactions contemplated by this\nAgreement. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by Parent and Merger Sub and, assuming due authorization,\nexecution and delivery of this Agreement by the other parties hereto, constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of each of\nParent and Merger Sub, enforceable against each of Parent and Merger Sub in accordance with its terms, except that (A) such\nenforcement may be subject to applicable bankruptcy, insolvency (including all Laws related to fraudulent transfers),\nreorganization, moratorium or other similar Laws, now or hereafter in effect, affecting creditors\' rights and remedies generally and\n(B) the remedies of specific performance and injunctive and other forms of equitable relief may be subject to equitable defenses\nand to the discretion of the court before which any Proceeding therefor may be brought.\n\n        (b)   The Parent Board and the board of directors of Merger Sub have, by resolutions unanimously adopted thereby,\n(i) approved this Agreement and the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, (ii) determined that this Agreement and the\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement are advisable and in the best interests of Parent and Merger Sub and their respective\nstockholders, as applicable, (iii) in the case of the Parent Board, directed that the Parent Stock Issuance be submitted to a vote at\nthe Parent Stockholders\' Meeting and (iv) in the case of the Parent Board, resolved to make the Parent Recommendation; provided\nthat any change, modification or rescission of such Parent Recommendation by the Parent Board in accordance with this\nAgreement shall not be a breach of the representation in this clause (iv). Parent, acting in its capacity as the sole stockholder of\nMerger Sub, has approved and adopted this Agreement. As of the date of this Agreement, none of the aforesaid actions by the\nParent Board or the board of directors of Merger Sub have been amended, rescinded or modified.\n\n        Section 4.4    Vote Required.     The approval by a majority of votes cast at the Parent Stockholders\' Meeting of the Parent Stock\nIssuance (the "Parent Stockholder Approval") is the only vote of holders of securities of Parent that is required in connection with the\nconsummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        Section 4.5    No Conflict; Required Filings and Consents.     \n\n        (a)   Neither Since the date of their most recent\nconsolidated financial statements, neither Parent nor any of its Subsidiaries has incurred any material liability for Taxes outside the\nordinary course of business or otherwise inconsistent with past custom and practice.\n\n        (c)   As of the date of this Agreement, there are no pending, threatened in writing or ongoing audits, examinations,\ninvestigations or other Proceedings by any Governmental Authority in respect of material Taxes of or with respect to Parent or any\nof its Subsidiaries. Neither Parent nor any of its Subsidiaries has waived any statute of limitations with respect to material Taxes or\nagreed to any extension of time with respect to a material Tax assessment or deficiency. No written claim has been made by any\nGovernmental Authority in a jurisdiction where Parent or any of its Subsidiaries does not currently file a Tax Return that it is or\nmay be subject to taxation by that jurisdiction in respect of Taxes that would be covered by or the subject of such Tax Return, nor\nhas any such assertion been threatened or proposed in writing and received by Parent or any of its Subsidiaries.\n\n        (d)   All Taxes that Parent or any of its Subsidiaries are or were required by Law to withhold or collect have been duly and\ntimely withheld or collected in all material respects on behalf of its respective employees, independent contractors or other third\nparties and, have been timely paid to the proper Governmental Authority or other Person or properly set aside in accounts for this\npurpose.\n\n        (e)   Neither Parent nor any of its Subsidiaries has ever been a member of a consolidated, combined or unitary Tax group\n(other than such a group the common parent of which is Parent or any of its Subsidiaries), and neither Parent nor any of its\nSubsidiaries has any liability for Taxes of any other Person (other than Taxes of Parent or any Subsidiary) under Treasury\nRegulation Section 1.1502-6 (or any similar provision of foreign, state or local law), as a transferee or successor, by Contract or\notherwise.\n\n        (f)    Neither Parent nor any of its Subsidiaries is a party to or is bound by any Tax sharing, Tax allocation or Tax\nindemnification agreement or arrangement (other than such an agreement or arrangement exclusively between or among Parent\nand its Subsidiaries or customary commercial Contracts entered into in the ordinary course of business, the principal subject matter\nof which is\n\nA-37\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n260/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nnot Taxes) that will not be terminated on or before the Closing Date without any future liability to the Company or its Subsidiaries.\n\n        (g)   There are no Liens for a material
