      Section 4.14    Material Contracts.     Except as has not had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the\naggregate, a Parent Material Adverse Effect, none of Parent or any of its Subsidiaries is in breach of or default (or, with the giving of\nnotice or lapse of time or both, would be in default) under the terms of, and none has taken any action resulting in the termination of,\nacceleration of performance required by, or resulting in a right of termination or acceleration under, any Contract material to Parent and its\nSubsidiaries, taken as a whole (each a "Parent Material Contract"). As of the date of this Agreement, to the Knowledge of Parent, no\nother party to any Parent Material Contract is in breach of or default (or, with the giving of notice or lapse of time or both, would be in\ndefault) under the terms of, and none has taken any action resulting in the termination of, acceleration of performance required by, or\nresulting in a right of termination or acceleration under, any Parent Material Contract. Each Parent Material Contract is (a) a valid and\nbinding obligation of Parent or its Subsidiary that is a party thereto, as applicable, and, to the Knowledge of Parent, the other parties\nthereto, (provided that (i) such enforcement may be subject to applicable bankruptcy, insolvency (including all Laws related to fraudulent\ntransfers), reorganization, moratorium or other similar Laws, now or hereafter in effect, relating to creditors\' rights and remedies generally\nand (ii) the remedies of specific performance and injunctive and other forms of equitable relief may be subject to equitable defenses and to\nthe discretion of the court before which any Proceeding therefor may be brought) and (b) in full force and effect.\n\n        Section 4.15    Trademarks, Patents and Copyrights.     \n\n        (a)   Except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse\nto Parent and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the applications for and registrations of Intellectual Property Rights owned by\nParent or its Subsidiaries are (i) free and clear of all Liens (other than Permitted Liens) and (ii) in effect, subsisting and, to the\nKnowledge of Parent, valid.\n\n        (b)   To the Knowledge of Parent, except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the\naggregate, materially adverse to Parent and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, Parent and its Subsidiaries own, validly license or\nhave the right to use in the manner currently used, all Intellectual Property Rights that are used in the respective businesses of\nParent and its Subsidiaries.\n\n        (c)   To the Knowledge of Parent, except as has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the\naggregate, materially adverse to Parent and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, the conduct of the respective businesses of Parent\nand its Subsidiaries as currently conducted does not infringe upon, misappropriate or otherwise violate any Intellectual Property\nRights of any other Person. As of the date of this Agreement, there is no claim for any\n\nA-38\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n261/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nsuch infringement, misappropriation or other violation pending or, to the Knowledge of Parent, threatened, except for any such\ninfringement, misappropriation or other violation that has not been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in\nthe aggregate, materially adverse to Parent and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole. To the Knowledge of Parent, no other Person is\ninfringing, misappropriating or otherwise violating any Intellectual Property Right that is material to the respective businesses of\nParent and its Subsidiaries as currently conducted, except for any such infringement, misappropriation or other violation that has\nnot been, and would not reasonably be expected to be, individually or in the aggregate, materially adverse to Parent and its\nSubsidiaries, taken as a whole.\n\n        (d)   To the Knowledge of Parent, there have been no material security breaches in the information technology systems of\nParent and its Subsidiaries or the information technology systems of any other Persons to the extent used by or on behalf of Parent\nand its Subsidiaries. Without limiting the foregoing, none of Parent or its Subsidiaries,\nnor, to the Knowledge of Parent or its Subsidiaries, any director, officer, employee, stockholder (solely to the extent acting on\nbehalf of Parent) or agent of Parent, has directly or indirectly offered or given anything of value to (i) any foreign official, any\nforeign political party or official thereof or any candidate for political office or (ii) any Person, while knowing that all or a portion\nof such thing of value will be offered, given or promised, directly or indirectly, to any foreign official, to any foreign political party\nor official thereof or to any candidate for foreign political office for the purpose of the following: (A) influencing any act or\ndecision of such foreign official, political party, party official or candidate in his, her or its official capacity, including influencing\nsuch foreign official, political party, party official or candidate to do or omit to do any act in violation of the lawful duty of such\nforeign official, political party, party official or candidate, or securing any improper advantage or (B) inducing such foreign\nofficial, political party, party official or candidate to use his, her or its influence with a foreign Governmental Authority, or\ninstrumentality thereof, to affect or influence any act or decision of such Governmental Authority or instrumentality, in order to\nassist Parent or any Subsidiaries in obtaining or retaining business for or with or directing business to, any Person.\n\n        (b)   To the Knowledge of Parent, neither Parent nor any of its Subsidiaries (i) is under external or internal investigation for\nany material violation of the Anti-Corruption Laws, (ii) has received any notice or other communication (in writing or otherwise)\nfrom any Governmental Authority regarding any material violation of, or failure to comply with, any Anti-Corruption Laws or\n(iii) is the subject of any internal complaint, audit or review process regarding a material violation of the Anti-Corruption Laws.\n\n        (c)   Parent and its Subsidiaries maintain an adequate system or systems of internal controls reasonably designed to (i) ensure\ncompliance with the Anti-Corruption Laws and (ii) prevent and detect violations of the Anti-Corruption Laws.\n\nA-40\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n263/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable capital\ncontributions to, or investments in, any other Person (other than to or in the Company or any direct or indirect wholly owned\nSubsidiary of the Company);\n\n        (n)   terminate, enter into, agree to any material amendment or modification of or renew or waive any material rights under\nany Company Material Contract or any Contract relating to Company Leased Real Property, in each case other than Company\nMaterial Contracts of the type described in Sections 3.14(a)(i), (ii), (v) , (vi), (xii) or (xv) in the ordinary course of business\nconsistent with past practice;\n\nA-44\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n267/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable any material change to its methods of accounting, except as required by GAAP (or any interpretation thereof),\nRegulation S-X of the Exchange Act or a Governmental Authority or quasi-Governmental Authority (including the Financial\nAccounting Standards Board or any similar organization);\n\n        (q)   make or agree to make any capital expenditure exceeding $25,000,000 in the aggregate in state, local or\nnon-U.S. Law) with respect to any material Tax; or (vi) surrender any right to claim a material Tax refund;\n\n        (x)   take (or knowingly fail to take) any action, including of Contents\n\n        (z)   enter into any agreement to do, or adopt any resolutions in support of, any of the foregoing.\n\n        Section 5.2    Conduct of Business by Parent Pending the Merger.     Parent covenants and agrees that, between the date of this\nAgreement and the earlier of the Effective Time and the date, if any, on which this Agreement is terminated in accordance with\nSection 7.1, except (A) as may be required by Law, (B) as may be agreed in writing by the Company (which consent shall not be\nunreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned), (C) as may be expressly contemplated or permitted pursuant to this Agreement or (D) as\nset forth in Section 5.2 of the Parent Disclosure Letter, (x) Parent shall conduct its business in the ordinary course of business and in a\nmanner consistent with past practice and, to the extent consistent therewith, use reasonable best efforts to preserve its assets and business\norganization and maintain its existing relationships with material customers, suppliers, distributors, regulators and business partners, and\n(y) Parent shall not, directly or indirectly:\n\n        (a)   amend the Parent Organizational Documents in a manner that would be adverse to the Company or its stockholders or\nwould, or would reasonably be expected to, have the effect of delaying or preventing the consummation of the Merger or the other\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement;\n\n        (b)   increase the size of the Parent Board;\n\n        (c)   except with respect to quarterly cash dividends paid in the ordinary course, consistent with past practice, subject to\nincrease by no more than twenty-five percent (25%) on a quarterly basis, declare, set aside, authorize, make or pay any dividend or\nother distribution, payable in cash, stock, property or otherwise, with respect to its capital stock or other equity interests;\n\n        (d)   adopt a plan of complete or partial liquidation or dissolution;\n\n        (e)   adjust, split, combine, subdivide or reclassify Parent\'s capital stock; or\n\n        (f)    issue or sell any shares of Parent Common Stock representing more than five percent (5%) of the issued and outstanding\nshares of Parent Common Stock as of the date of this Agreement; provided, however, that Parent may issue or sell shares of Parent\nCommon Stock pursuant to Parent Equity Awards, the Parent 2015 Long-Term Incentives Plan, the Parent Employee Stock\nPurchase Plan and any other Parent Benefit Plan; or\n\n        (g)   enter into any agreement to do, or adopt any resolutions in support of, any of the foregoing.\n\n        Section 5.3    Preparation of the Form S-4 and the Joint Proxy Statement; Stockholder Meetings.     \n\n        (a)   As promptly as practicable after the execution of this Agreement (but in any event, no more than thirty (30) days\nfollowing the date hereof, unless the parties otherwise agree to another time period), Parent and the Company shall jointly prepare,\nand Parent and the Company, as applicable, shall cause to be filed with the SEC the Joint Proxy Statement in preliminary form.\nParent shall prepare (and consider the Company\'s comments in good faith) and cause to be filed with the SEC within thirty\n(30) days after the execution of this Agreement, the Form S-4, in which the Joint Proxy Statement will be included as a prospectus,\nin connection with the registration under the Securities Act of the Parent Common Stock to be issued in the Merger. Each of Parent\nand the Company shall use its reasonable best efforts to (i) cause the Form S-4 and the Joint Proxy Statement to comply with the\napplicable rules and regulations promulgated by the SEC, (ii) have the Form S-4 declared effective under the Securities Act as\npromptly as practicable after such filing (including by responding to comments from the SEC), and, prior to the effective date of\nthe Form S-4, take all action reasonably required to be taken under any applicable state securities Laws in connection with the\nParent Stock Issuance and (iii) keep the Form S-4 effective through the Closing Date in order to permit the consummation of the\nMerger. Each of Parent and\n\nA-46\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n269/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nthe Company shall furnish all information as may be reasonably requested by the other in connection with any such action and the\npreparation, filing and distribution of the Form S-4 and the Joint Proxy Statement. As promptly as practicable after the Form S-4\nshall have become effective, each of Parent and the Company shall use its reasonable best efforts to cause the Joint Proxy\nStatement to be mailed to its respective stockholders. No filing of, or amendment or supplement to, the Form S-4 will be made by\nParent, and no filing of, or amendment or supplement to, the Joint Proxy Statement will be made by Parent or the Company, in\neach case without providing the other party with a reasonable opportunity to review and comment thereon. If, at any time prior to\nthe Effective Time, any information relating to Parent of the Company or any of their respective Affiliates, directors or officers,\nshould be discovered by Parent or the Company which should be set forth in an amendment or supplement to either the Form S-4\nor the Joint Proxy Statement, so that either such document would not include any misstatement of a material fact or omit to state\nany material fact necessary to make the statements therein, in light of the circumstances under which they are made, not\nmisleading, the party that discovers such information shall promptly notify the other parties hereto and an appropriate amendment\nor supplement describing such information shall be prepared and, following a reasonable opportunity for the other party (and its\ncounsel) to review and comment on such amendment or supplement, promptly filed with the SEC and, to the extent required by\napplicable Law, disseminated to the stockholders of Parent and the Company. Subject to applicable Law, each party shall notify the\nother promptly of the time when the Form S-4 has become effective, of the issuance of any stop order or suspension of the\nqualification of the Parent Common Stock issuable in connection with the Merger for offering or sale in any jurisdiction, or of the\nreceipt of any comments from the SEC or the staff of the SEC and of any request by the SEC or the staff of the SEC for\namendments or supplements to the Joint Proxy Statement or the Form S-4 or for additional information and shall supply each other\nwith copies of all correspondence between either party or any of its Representatives, on the one hand, and the SEC or its staff, on\nthe other hand, with respect to the Joint Proxy Statement, the Form S-4 or the Merger.\n\n        (b)   Subject to the earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with Section 7.1, the Company shall, as soon as\npracticable following the effectiveness of the Form S-4, duly call, give notice of, convene (on a date selected by the Company in\nconsultation with Parent, which date is intended to be the date of the Parent Stockholders\' Meeting) and hold a meeting of its\nstockholders (the "Company Stockholders\' Meeting") for the purpose of seeking the Company Stockholder Approval, and shall\nsubmit such proposal to such holders at the Company Stockholders\' Meeting and shall not submit any other proposal to such\nholders in connection with the Company Stockholders\' Meeting without the prior written consent of Parent. The Company in\nconsultation with Parent shall set a record date for Persons entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Company Stockholders\' Meeting\nand shall not change such record date without the prior written consent of Parent and shall not adjourn or otherwise postpone or\ndelay such Company Stockholders\' Meeting without the prior written consent of Parent. If the Company Board has not made a\nCompany Adverse Recommendation Change, the Company shall, through the Company Board, make the Company\nRecommendation, and shall include such Company Recommendation in the Joint Proxy Statement, and use its reasonable best\nefforts to (i) solicit from its stockholders proxies in favor of the adoption of this Agreement and (ii) take all other action necessary\nor advisable to secure the Company Stockholder Approval. Notwithstanding any Company Adverse Recommendation Change,\nunless this Agreement is terminated in accordance with its terms, the obligations of the parties hereunder shall continue in full\nforce and effect and such obligations shall not be affected by the commencement, public proposal, public disclosure or\ncommunication to the Company of any Company Acquisition Proposal (whether or not a Company Superior Proposal).\n\nA-47\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n270/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (c)   Subject to the earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with Section 7.1, Parent shall, as soon as practicable\nfollowing the effectiveness of the Form S-4, duly call, give notice of, convene (on a date selected by Parent in consultation with the\nCompany, which date is intended to be the date of the Company Stockholders\' Meeting) and hold a meeting of its stockholders (the\n"Parent Stockholders\' Meeting") for the purpose of seeking the Parent Stockholder Approval, and shall submit such proposal to\nsuch holders at the Parent Stockholders\' Meeting and shall not submit any other proposal to such holders in connection with the\nParent Stockholders\' Meeting without the prior written consent of the Company. Consents; Filings.     \n\n        (a)   Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the parties hereto will cooperate with each other and use (and will\ncause their respective Subsidiaries to use) their respective reasonable best efforts to consummate the transactions contemplated by\nthis Agreement and to cause the conditions to the Merger set forth in Article VI to be satisfied as promptly as reasonably\npracticable, including using reasonable best efforts to accomplish the following as promptly as reasonably practicable: (i) the\nobtaining of all actions or non-actions, consents, approvals, registrations, waivers, permits, authorizations, orders, expirations or\nterminations of waiting periods, and other confirmations from any Governmental Authority or other Person that are or may become\nnecessary, proper or advisable in connection with the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including\nthe Merger; (ii) the preparation and making of all registrations, filings, forms, notices, petitions, statements, submissions of\ninformation, applications and other documents (including filings with Governmental Authorities) that are or may become\nnecessary, proper or advisable in connection with the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including\nthe Merger; (iii) the taking of all steps as may be necessary, proper or advisable to obtain an approval from, or to avoid a\nProceeding by, any Governmental Authority or other Person in connection with the consummation of the transactions contemplated\nby this Agreement, including the Merger; (iv) the defending of any lawsuits or other Proceedings, whether judicial or\nadministrative, challenging this Agreement or that would otherwise prevent or materially delay the consummation of the\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement, including the Merger, performed or consummated by each party in accordance with\nthe terms of this Agreement, including seeking to have any stay or temporary restraining order entered by any court or other\nGovernmental Authority vacated or reversed; and (v) the execution and delivery of any additional instruments that are or may\nbecome reasonably necessary, proper or advisable to consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement,\n\nA-48\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n271/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nincluding the Merger, and to carry out fully the purposes of this Agreement. reasonable access to\nParent\'s Representatives, during normal business hours and upon reasonable notice throughout the period from the date of this\nAgreement to the Effective Time (or until the earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with Section 7.1), to the\npersonnel, advisors, properties, books and records of the Company and its Subsidiaries and, during such period, shall (and shall\ncause each of its Subsidiaries to) furnish reasonably promptly to such Representatives all information concerning the business,\nproperties and personnel of the Company and its Subsidiaries, and to provide copies thereof, as may reasonably be requested;\nprovided, however, that nothing herein shall require the Company or any of its Subsidiaries to disclose any information to Parent or\nMerger Sub if such disclosure would, in the reasonable judgment of the Company, (i) violate applicable Law or the provisions of\nany agreement to which the Company or any of its Subsidiaries is a party or (ii) jeopardize any attorney-client or other legal\nprivilege; provided, further, however, that in each such case, the Company shall cooperate with Parent to enable Parent and\nParent\'s Representatives to enter into appropriate confidentiality, joint defense or similar documents or arrangements so that Parent\nand Parent\'s Representatives may have access to such information. No investigation or access permitted pursuant to this\nSection 5.5(a) shall affect or be deemed to modify any representation, warranty, covenant or agreement made by the Company\nhereunder. All information furnished by the Company, its Subsidiaries and the Company\'s officers, employees and other\nRepresentatives pursuant to this Section 5.5(a) shall be kept confidential in accordance with the Confidentiality Agreement.\n\n        (b)   Upon reasonable notice, Parent shall (and shall cause each of its Subsidiaries and Merger Sub to) afford to\nRepresentatives of the Company reasonable access, during normal business hours and upon reasonable notice throughout the\nperiod from the date of this Agreement the Effective Time (or until the earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with\nSection 7.1), to the personnel, advisors, properties, books and records of Parent and its Subsidiaries and, during such period, shall\n(and shall cause each of its Subsidiaries to) furnish reasonably promptly to such Representatives all information concerning the\nbusiness, properties and personnel of Parent and its Subsidiaries, and to provide copies thereof, as may reasonably be requested;\nprovided, however, that nothing herein shall require Parent or any of its Subsidiaries to disclose any information to the Company if\nsuch disclosure would, in the reasonable judgment of Parent, (i) violate applicable Law or the provisions of any agreement to\nwhich Parent or any of its Subsidiaries is a party or (ii) jeopardize any attorney-client or other legal privilege; provided, further,\nhowever, that in each such case, Parent shall cooperate with the Company to enable the Company and the Company\'s\n\nA-50\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n273/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nRepresentatives to enter into appropriate confidentiality, joint defense or similar documents or arrangements so that the Company\nand the Company\'s Representatives may have access to such information. No investigation or access permitted pursuant to this\nSection 5.5(b) shall affect or be deemed to modify any representation, warranty, covenant or agreement made by Parent or Merger\nSub hereunder. All information furnished by the Company, its Subsidiaries, Merger Sub and Parent\'s officers, employees and other\nRepresentatives pursuant to this Section 5.5(b) shall be kept confidential in accordance with the Confidentiality Agreement.\n\n        Section 5.6    No Solicitation by the Company.     \n\n        (a)   From the date of this Agreement until the earlier of the Effective Time and the termination of this Agreement in\naccordance with Section 7.1, except as provided in Section 5.6(b) or Section 5.6(d), (i) the Company shall immediately cease, and\nshall instruct and use its reasonable best efforts to cause its officers, directors and other Representatives to cease, and cause to be\nterminated all existing discussions, negotiations and communications with any Persons or entities with respect to any Company\nAcquisition Proposal (other than the transactions contemplated by this Agreement); (ii) the Company shall not, and shall not\nauthorize or permit any of its Representatives to, directly or indirectly through another Person, (A) initiate, seek, solicit, knowingly\nencourage (including by way of furnishing any non-public information) or knowingly induce or take any other action which would\nreasonably be expected to lead to a Company Acquisition Proposal, (B) engage in negotiations or discussions with, or provide any\nnon-public information or non-public data to, any Person (other than Parent or any of its Affiliates or Representatives) relating to\nany Company Acquisition Proposal or grant any waiver or release under any standstill or other agreement (except that if the\nCompany Board determines in good faith that the failure to grant any waiver or release would be inconsistent with its fiduciary\nduties under applicable Law, the Company may waive any such standstill provision in order to permit a third party to make a\nCompany Acquisition Proposal) or (C) resolve to do any of the foregoing; (iii) the Company shall not provide and shall, within\none (1) Business Day of the date of this Agreement, terminate access of any third party to any data room (virtual or actual)\ncontaining any of the Company\'s information; and (iv) within two (2) Business Days after the date of this Agreement, the\nCompany shall demand the return or destruction of all confidential, non-public information and materials and all other information\nand materials related to any Company Acquisition Proposal that have been provided to third parties that have entered into\nconfidentiality agreements relating to a possible Company Acquisition Proposal with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries.\n\n        (b)   Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time prior to obtaining the Company Stockholder Approval, if the Company\nreceives a bona fide written Company Acquisition Proposal from a third party that was not initiated, sought, solicited, knowingly\nencouraged, knowingly induced or otherwise procured in violation of this Agreement, then the Company may (i) contact the\nPerson who has made such Company Acquisition Proposal in order to clarify the terms of such Company Acquisition Proposal so\nthat the Company Board (or any committee thereof) may inform itself about such Company Acquisition Proposal, (ii) furnish\ninformation concerning its business, properties or assets to such Person pursuant to a confidentiality agreement with confidentiality\nterms that, taken as a whole, are not materially less favorable to the Company than those contained in the Confidentiality\nAgreement and (iii) negotiate and participate in discussions and negotiations with such Person concerning such Company\nAcquisition Proposal, in the case of clauses (ii) and (iii), if the Company Board determines in good faith that such Company\nAcquisition Proposal constitutes or is reasonably likely to constitute or result in a Company Superior Proposal. The Company\n(A) shall promptly (and in any case within twenty-four (24) hours) provide Parent notice (1) of the receipt of any Company\nAcquisition Proposal, which notice shall include a complete, unredacted copy of such Company Acquisition\n\nA-51\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n274/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nProposal, and (2) of any inquiries, proposals or offers received by, any requests for non-public information from, or any\ndiscussions or negotiations initiated or continued (or sought to be initiated or continued) with, the Company or any of its\nRepresentatives concerning a Company Acquisition Proposal, and disclose the identity of the other party (or parties) and the\nmaterial terms of such inquiry, offer, proposal or request and, in the case of written materials, provide copies of such materials,\n(B) shall promptly (and in any case within twenty-four (24) hours) make available to Parent copies of all written materials\nprovided by the Company to such party but not previously made available to Parent and (C) shall keep Parent informed on a\nreasonably prompt basis (and, in any case, within twenty-four (24) hours of any significant development) of the status and material\ndetails (including amendments and proposed amendments) of any such Company Acquisition Proposal or other inquiry, offer,\nproposal or request.\n\n        (c)   Except as permitted by Section 5.6(d) or Section 5.6(e), neither the Company Board nor any committee thereof shall\n(i) withdraw, qualify or modify, or publicly propose to withdraw, qualify or modify, the Company Recommendation, in each case\nin a manner adverse to Parent or Merger Sub, (ii) approve or recommend any Company Acquisition Proposal or (iii) adopt or\napprove, or publicly propose to adopt or approve, or allow the Company to execute or enter into, any binding or non-binding letter\nof intent, agreement in principle, memorandum of understanding, merger agreement, acquisition agreement, option agreement,\njoint venture agreement, partnership agreement or other agreement, commitment, arrangement or understanding contemplating or\notherwise in connection with, or that is intended to or would reasonably be expected to lead to, any Company Acquisition Proposal\n(other than a confidentiality agreement pursuant to Section 5.6(b)) (any action described in clauses (i) and (ii) of this sentence\nbeing referred to as a "Company Adverse Recommendation Change").\n\n        (d)   If, at any time prior to the receipt of the Company Stockholder Approval, the Company Board receives a Company\nAcquisition Proposal that the Company Board determines in good faith constitutes a Company Superior Proposal that was not\ninitiated, sought, solicited, knowingly encouraged, knowingly induced or otherwise procured in violation of this Agreement, the\nCompany Board may (i) effect a Company Adverse Recommendation Change or (ii) cause the Company to terminate this\nAgreement pursuant to Section 7.1(c)(iii) in order to enter into a definitive agreement providing for such Company Superior\nProposal if (A) the Company Board determines in good faith that the failure to take such action would be inconsistent with its\nfiduciary duties under applicable Law; (B) the Company has notified Parent in writing that it intends to effect a Company Adverse\nRecommendation Change or terminate this Agreement; (C) if applicable, the Company has provided Parent a copy of the proposed\ndefinitive agreements between the Company and the Person making such Company Superior Proposal; (D) for a period of four\n(4) days following the notice delivered pursuant to clause (B) of this Section 5.6(d), the Company shall have discussed and\nnegotiated in good faith and made the Company\'s Representatives available to discuss and negotiate in good faith (in each case to\nthe extent Parent desires to negotiate) with Parent\'s Representatives any proposed modifications to the terms and conditions of this\nAgreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement so that the failure to take such action would no longer be\ninconsistent with the Company Board\'s fiduciary duties under applicable Law (it being understood and agreed that any amendment\nto any material term or condition of any Company Superior Proposal shall require a new notice and a new negotiation period that\nshall expire on the later to occur of (1) two (2) days following delivery of such new notice from the Company to Parent and (2) the\nexpiration of the original four (4)-day period described in clause (D) above); and (E) no earlier than the end of such negotiation\nperiod, the Company Board shall have determined in good faith, after considering the terms of any proposed amendment or\nmodification to this Agreement, that (x) the Company Acquisition Proposal that is the subject of the notice described in clause (B)\nabove still constitutes a Company Superior\n\nA-52\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n275/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nProposal and (y) the failure to take such action would still be inconsistent with its fiduciary duties under applicable Law.\n\n        (e)   Other than in connection with a Company Superior Proposal (which shall be subject to Section 5.6(d) and shall not be\nsubject to this Section 5.6(e)), prior to obtaining the Company Stockholder Approval the Company Board may take any action in\nresponse to a Company Intervening Event prohibited by clause (i) of Section 5.6(c), only if (i) the Company Board determines in\ngood faith that the failure to take such action would be this\nSection 5.6(e) (which notice shall specify the facts and circumstances providing the basis of the Company Intervening Event and\nfor the Company Board\'s determination to effect a Company        (f)    Nothing contained in this Agreement shall prohibit the Company or the Company Board from (i) disclosing to its\nstockholders a position contemplated by Rules 14d-9 and 14e-2(a) promulgated under the Exchange Act, or from issuing a "stop,\nlook and listen" statement pending disclosure of its position thereunder or (ii) making any disclosure to its stockholders if the\nCompany Board determines in good faith that the failure of the Company Board to make such disclosure would be inconsistent\nwith its fiduciary duties under applicable Law; provided, however, that (1) in no event shall this Section 5.6(f) affect the obligations\nspecified in Section 5.6(d) or 5.6(e) and (2) any such disclosure (other than issuance by the Company of a "stop, look and listen" or\nsimilar communication of the type contemplated by Rule 14d-9(f) under the Exchange Act) that addresses or relates to the\napproval, recommendation or declaration of advisability by the Company Board with respect to this Agreement or a Company\nAcquisition Proposal shall be deemed to be a Company Adverse Recommendation Change unless the Company Board in\nconnection with such communication publicly states that its recommendation with respect to this Agreement has not changed or\nrefers to the prior recommendation of the Company Board, without disclosing any Company Adverse Recommendation Change.\n\n        Section 5.7    No Solicitation by Parent.     \n\n        (a)   From the date of this Agreement until the earlier of the Effective Time and the termination of this Agreement Parent\nAcquisition Proposal (other than the transactions contemplated by this Agreement); (ii) Parent shall not, and shall not authorize or\npermit any of its Representatives liabilities, including advancement of\nexpenses, for acts or omissions occurring at or prior to the Effective Time now existing in favor of the current or former directors\nor officers of the Company (the "D&O Indemnified Parties") as provided in the Certificate of Incorporation, the Bylaws or any\nindemnification Contract between such directors or officers and the Company (in each case, as in effect on the date of this\nAgreement) shall survive the Merger and shall continue in full force and effect. For a period of six (6) years from the Effective\nTime, the Surviving Corporation shall, and Parent shall cause the Surviving Corporation to, maintain in effect the exculpation,\nindemnification and advancement of expenses equivalent to the provisions of the Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws as in\neffect immediately prior to the Effective Time with respect to acts or omissions occurring prior to the Effective Time and shall not\namend, repeal or otherwise modify any such provisions in any manner that would adversely affect the rights thereunder of any\nD&O Indemnified Parties; provided, however, that all rights to indemnification in respect of any action pending or asserted or any\nclaim made within such period shall continue until the disposition of such action or resolution of such claim. From and after the\nEffective Time, Parent shall guarantee and stand surety for, and shall cause the Surviving Corporation to honor, in accordance with\ntheir respective terms, each of the covenants contained in this Section 5.8.\n\n        (b)   Prior to the Effective Time, the Company shall or, if the Company is unable to, Parent shall cause the Surviving\nCorporation as of or after the Effective Time to, purchase a six (6)-year prepaid "tail" policy, with terms, conditions, retentions and\nlimits of liability that are no less favorable than the coverage provided under the Company\'s existing policies of directors\' and\nofficers\' liability insurance and fiduciary liability insurance, with respect to matters arising on or before the Effective Time\n(including in connection with this Agreement and the transactions or actions contemplated by this Agreement), and Parent shall\ncause such policy to be maintained in full force and effect, for its full term, and cause all obligations thereunder to be honored by\nthe Surviving Corporation, and no other party shall have any further obligation to purchase or pay for insurance hereunder;\nprovided, however, that the Company shall not pay, and the Surviving Corporation shall not be required to pay, in excess of 300%\nof the last annual premium paid by the Company prior to the date of this Agreement in respect of such "tail" policy. If the\nCompany or the Surviving Corporation for any reason fail to obtain such "tail" insurance policies prior to, as of or after the\nEffective Time, Parent shall, for a period of six (6) years from the Effective Time, cause the Surviving Corporation to maintain in\neffect the current policies of directors\' and officers\' liability insurance and fiduciary liability insurance maintained by the Company\nwith respect to\n\nA-56\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n279/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nmatters arising on or before the Effective Time; provided, further, however, that after the Effective Time, Parent shall not be\nrequired to pay annual premiums in excess of 300% of the last annual premium paid by the Company prior to the date of this\nAgreement in respect of the coverage required to be obtained pursuant hereto, but in such case shall purchase as much coverage as\nreasonably practicable for such amount.\n\n        (c)   The covenants contained in this Section 5.8 are intended to be for the benefit of, and shall be enforceable by, each of the\nD&O Indemnified Parties and their respective heirs and shall not be deemed exclusive of any other rights to which any such\nPerson is entitled, whether pursuant to Law, contract or otherwise.\n\n        (d)   In the event that Parent or the Surviving Corporation or any of their respective successors or assigns (i) consolidates with\nor merges into any other Person and shall not be the continuing or surviving corporation or entity of such consolidation or merger\nor (ii) transfers or conveys all or substantially all of its properties and assets to any Person, then, and in each such case, proper\nprovision shall be made so that the successors or assigns of Parent or the Surviving Corporation, as the case may be, shall assume\nthe obligations set forth in this Section 5.8.\n\n        Section 5.9    Notification of Certain Matters.     Subject to applicable Law, the Company shall give prompt notice to Parent, and\nParent shall give prompt notice to the Company, of (a) the occurrence or non-occurrence of any event whose occurrence or non-\noccurrence, as the case may be, would reasonably be expected to cause, in the case of the Company, any condition set forth in Section 6.2\nnot to be satisfied, or in the case of Parent, any condition set for the in Section 6.3 not to be satisfied, at any time from the date of this\nAgreement to the Effective Time; (b) any notice or other communication received by such party from any Governmental Authority in\nconnection with this Agreement, the Merger or the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement, or from any Person alleging that\nthe consent of such Person is or may be required in connection with the Merger or the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement\nand (c) any claims, investigations or Proceedings commenced or, to such party\'s Knowledge, threatened in writing against, relating to or\ninvolving or otherwise affecting such party or any of its Subsidiaries that relate to this Agreement, the Merger or the other transactions\ncontemplated by this Agreement. Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, no such notification shall affect the\nrepresentations, warranties, covenants or agreements of the parties or the conditions to the obligations of the parties hereunder.\n\n        Section 5.10    Public Disclosure.     So long as this Agreement is in effect, neither Parent, nor the Company, nor any of their\nrespective Affiliates, will disseminate any press release or other public announcement concerning this Agreement, the Merger or the other\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement, except as may be required by Law or the rules of a national securities exchange or to the\nextent disclosed in or consistent with the Joint Proxy Statement or Form S-4, without the prior consent of each of the other parties hereto,\nwhich consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. The parties have agreed to the text of the joint press release\nannouncing the execution of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, without prior consent of the other parties, each party (a) may\ncommunicate information that is not confidential information of any other party to financial analysts, investors and media representatives\nin a manner consistent with its past practice in compliance with applicable Law and (b) may disseminate the information included in a\npress release or other document previously approved for external distribution by the other parties. Notwithstanding any other provision of\nthis Agreement, the requirements of this Section 5.10 shall not apply to (i) any such press release or public announcement if (A) the\nCompany Board has effected any Company Adverse Recommendation Change in accordance with this Agreement or (B) the Parent Board\nhas effected a Parent Adverse Recommendation Change in accordance with this Agreement and (ii) any disclosure by the Company or\nParent of any information concerning this Agreement, the Merger or the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement in connection\nwith a determination by (A) the Company in accordance with Section 5.6(b) or Section 5.6(d) that a Company Acquisition Proposal\nconstitutes, or\n\nA-57\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n280/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nmay constitute, a Company Superior Proposal, (B) Parent in accordance with Section 5.7(b) of Section 5.7(d) that a Parent Acquisition\nProposal constitutes, or may constitute, a Parent Superior Proposal, or (C) any dispute between the parties regarding this Agreement, the\nMerger or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        Section 5.11    Employee Benefits; Labor.     \n\n        (a)   For purposes of this Section 5.11, (i) the term "Covered Employees" shall mean employees who are actively employed\nby the Company or any of its Subsidiaries immediately prior to the Effective Time; and (ii) the term "Continuation Period" shall\nmean the period beginning at the Effective Time and ending on December 31st of the year following the year in which the\nEffective Time occurs.\n\n        (b)   During the Continuation Period, Parent shall, or shall cause a Subsidiary of Parent to, provide to the Covered Employees\nfor so long as such Covered Employees remain employees of Parent or any of its Subsidiaries during the Continuation Period,\ncompensation (such term to include salary or base rate of compensation, annual cash bonus opportunities, commissions and\nseverance) and benefits that are in the aggregate, no less favorable than the compensation (excluding any equity or equity-based\ncompensation, retention, change of control, transaction or similar bonuses and nonqualified deferred compensation) and benefits\n(excluding any defined benefit pension plan or retiree medical benefits) being provided by the Company or its Subsidiaries to\nCovered Employees immediately prior to the Effective Time.\n\n        (c)   In the event any Covered Employee first becomes eligible to participate under any Parent Benefit Plan following the\nEffective Time, Parent shall, or shall cause a Subsidiary of Parent to, for Covered Employees who become eligible during the\ncalendar year including the Effective Time, use commercially reasonable efforts to (i) waive any preexisting condition exclusions\nand waiting periods with respect to participation and coverage requirements applicable to any Covered Employee under any Parent\nBenefit Plan providing medical, dental or vision benefits to the same extent such limitation would have been waived or satisfied\nunder any similar Company Benefit Plan the Covered Employee participated in immediately prior to coverage under the Parent\nBenefit Plan; and (ii) provide each Covered Employee with credit for any copayments and deductibles paid prior to the Covered\nEmployee\'s coverage under any Parent Benefit Plan during the plan year in which the Effective Time occurs, to the same extent\nsuch credit was given under any similar Company Benefit Plan that Covered Employee participated in immediately prior to\ncoverage under the Parent Benefit Plan, in satisfying any applicable deductible or out-of-pocket requirements under the Parent\nBenefit Plan for the plan year in which the Effective Time occurs.\n\n        (d)   As of the Effective Time, Parent shall recognize, or shall cause a Subsidiary of Parent to recognize, all service of each\nCovered Employee prior to the Effective Time, to the Company (or any predecessor entities of the Company or any of its\nSubsidiaries) for vesting and eligibility purposes (but not for benefit accrual purposes under any defined benefit pension plan) and\nfor purposes of determining future vacation accruals and severance amounts to the same extent as such Covered Employee\nreceived, immediately before the Effective Time, credit for such service under any similar Company Benefit Plan in which such\nCovered Employee participated immediately prior to the Effective Time; provided that service of each Covered Employee prior to\nthe Effective Times shall not be recognized for the purpose of any entitlement to participate in, or receive benefits with respect to,\nany (i) non-elective employer contributions under any plan of Parent under Section 401(k) of the Code or (ii) Parent retiree\nmedical program in which any Covered Employee participates after the Effective Times. In no event shall anything contained in\nthis Section 5.11 result in any duplication of benefits for the same period of service.\n\n        (e)   In the event that the employment of any of the Covered Employees specified on Section 5.11(e) of the Company\nDisclosure Letter is terminated by the Company, Parent or Surviving Corporation to, provide severance benefits to such Covered Employee\nthat are at least as favorable as those set forth on Section 5.11(e) of the Company Disclosure Letter.\n\n        (f)    Parent shall cause the Surviving Corporation to perform the Company\'s obligations under the agreements set forth on\nSection 5.11(f) of the Company Disclosure Letter subject to the terms of such agreements.\n\n        (g)   The Company and its Subsidiaries shall satisfy all legal or contractual requirements to provide notice to, or to carry out\nany consultation procedure with, any employee or groups of employees of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries, or any labor or\ntrade union, labor organization or works council, which is representing any employee of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries, in\nconnection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        (h)   After the date of this Agreement and prior to the Effective Time, the Company (i) shall not terminate, except for cause,\nany of the employees of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries listed on Section 5.11(h) of the Company Disclosure Letter, and\n(ii) shall notify Parent in writing as promptly as practicable in the event that any employee listed on Section 5.11(h) of the\nCompany Disclosure Letter has given, or has been given, notice of termination of his or her employment.\n\n values in the amounts set forth in the last column of such\nschedule, provided that such Covered Employees are employees of Parent or a Subsidiary of Parent on the day following the\nClosing Date, which Parent Retention Awards shall vest 50% on the six-month anniversary of the Closing Date and the remaining\n50% on the first anniversary of the Closing Date; provided that the Covered Employee remains employed by Parent or a Subsidiary\nof Parent through each such vesting date.\n\n        (j)    The parties hereto acknowledge and agree that all provisions contained in this Section 5.11 with respect to employees of\nthe Company and its Subsidiaries are included for the sole benefit of the respective parties hereto and shall not create any right\n(i) in any other Person, including employees, former employees, any participant or any beneficiary thereof, in any Company\nBenefit Plan, or (ii) to continued employment with the Company, Parent or their respective Subsidiaries or Affiliates.\nNotwithstanding anything in this Section 5.11 to the contrary, nothing in this Agreement, whether express or implied, shall be\ntreated as an amendment or other modification of any Company Benefit Plan or any other employee benefit plans of the Company,\nParent or any of their respective Subsidiaries or Affiliates or shall prohibit Parent or any of its Subsidiaries or Affiliates from\namending or terminating any employee benefit plan.\n\n        Section 5.12    Merger Sub.     Parent will take all actions necessary to (a) cause Merger Sub to perform its obligations under this\nAgreement and to consummate the Merger on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and (b) ensure that Merger Sub prior to\nthe Effective Time shall not conduct any business, incur or guarantee any Indebtedness or make any investments, other than as specifically\ncontemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        Section 5.13    Rule 16b-3 Matters.     Prior to the Effective Time, Parent and the Company shall take all such steps as may be\nreasonably necessary or advisable (to the extent permitted under applicable Law and no-action letters issued by the SEC) to cause any\ndispositions of Company Common Stock (including derivative securities with respect to Company Common Stock) or acquisitions of\nParent Common Stock (including derivative securities with respect to Parent Common Stock) resulting from the transactions contemplated\nby this Agreement by each individual who is subject to the reporting requirements of Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act with respect to the\nCompany or will become subject\n\nA-59\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n282/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nto such reporting requirements with respect to Parent, to be exempt under Rule 16b-3 promulgated under the Exchange Act, to the extent\npermitted by applicable Law.\n\n        Section 5.14    Repayment and Termination of Existing Credit Agreement.     At least one (1) Business Day prior to the Closing Date,\nthe Company shall deliver to Parent an executed copy of a customary payoff letter from the agents under the Existing Credit Agreement in\nform and substance reasonably satisfactory to Parent relating to the repayment in full of all obligations thereunder or secured thereby, the\ntermination of all commitments in connection therewith and the release of all Liens securing the obligations thereunder (the "Payoff\nLetter"). The Company shall, and shall cause its Subsidiaries to, deliver to Parent (or the agent under the Existing Credit Agreement, in\nthe case of prepayment and termination notices) prior to the Closing, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to Parent, all the\ndocuments, filings and notices required for the termination of commitments under the Existing Credit Agreement and the release of all\nLiens securing the obligations thereunder, including the filing of UCC releases, termination of control agreements, and delivery of\npossessory collateral, which shall in each case be subject to the occurrence of the Closing and the repayment in full of all obligations then\noutstanding under the Existing Credit Agreement.\n\n        Section 5.15    Certain Tax Matters.     \n\n        (a)   Each of the Company and Parent shall use its reasonable best efforts to obtain the Tax opinions described in\nSection 6.2(e) and Section 6.3(e).\n\n        (b)   Immediately prior to Closing, the Company shall execute and deliver representation letters to Parent Tax Counsel,\nCompany Tax Counsel and the Additional Tax Counsel (as applicable) substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit B, with such\nchanges, updates or refinements, jointly agreed to by each law firm that is delivering an opinion described in Sections 6.2(e) or\n6.3(e), as may be necessary to reflect any changes in, or clarifications of, facts prior to the Closing (the "Company Closing\nRepresentation Letter").\n\n        (c)   Immediately prior to Closing, Parent shall execute and deliver representation letters to Parent Tax Counsel, Company Tax\nCounsel and the Additional Tax Counsel (as applicable) substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit C, with such changes, updates\nor refinements, jointly agreed to by each law firm that is delivering an opinion described in Sections 6.2(e) or 6.3(e), as may be\nnecessary to reflect any changes in, or clarifications of, facts prior to the Closing (the "Parent Closing Representation Letter").\n\n        (d)   The Company shall use its reasonable best efforts not to take or cause to be taken any action that would cause to be\nuntrue (or fail to take or cause not to be taken any action which inaction would cause to be untrue) any of the representations,\nwarranties and covenants made in the Company Signing Representation Letter. As of the date of this Agreement, Company knows\nof no reason why it would not able to deliver the Company Closing Representation Letter.\n\n        (e)   Parent shall use its reasonable best efforts not to take or cause to be taken any action that would cause to be untrue (or fail\nto take or cause not to be taken any action which inaction would cause to be untrue) any of the representations, warranties and\ncovenants made in the Parent Signing Representation Letter. As of the date of this Agreement, Parent knows of no reason why it\nwould not be able to deliver the Parent Closing Representation Letter.\n\n        (f)    The Company has received an opinion of Shearman & Sterling LLP, dated as of the date hereof, to the effect that, on the\nbasis of the facts, representations, assumptions, limitations and exclusions set forth or referred to in such opinion, the Merger will\nnot cause the KLX External Spin-Off to fail to qualify for the KLX Spin-Off Tax Treatment and such opinion has not been\nrescinded, revoked or modified. The parties acknowledge that in rendering the opinion described in this Section 5.15(f),\nShearman & Sterling LLP has required and relied upon (and has incorporated by reference) reasonable and customary\nrepresentations, warranties and covenants, including the Parent Signing Representation Letter and the Company Signing\nRepresentation Letter.\n\nA-60\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n283/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (g)   Parent has received an opinion of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP, dated as of the date hereof, to the effect\nthat, on the basis of the facts, representations, assumptions, limitations and exclusions set forth or referred to in such opinion, the\nMerger will not cause the KLX External Spin-Off to fail to qualify for the KLX Spin-Off Tax Treatment and such opinion has not\nbeen rescinded, revoked or modified. The parties acknowledge that in rendering the opinion described in this Section 5.15(g),\nSkadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP has required and relied upon (and has incorporated by reference) reasonable and\ncustomary representations, warranties and covenants, including the Parent Signing Representation Letter and the Company Signing\nRepresentation Letter.\n\n        (h)   The Company shall deliver, or cause to be delivered, a copy of the KLX Closing Representation Letter, if any, to Parent\nprior to Closing; provided that Parent acknowledges and agrees that KLX is not required to deliver a KLX Closing Representation\nLetter pursuant to the KLX TSA Amendment.\n\n        (i)    Parent and the Company shall use reasonable best efforts to jointly engage, promptly following the date hereof, one of\nthe law firms set forth on Schedule 5.15(i) or, if unable to engage any of such firms, such other law firm of recognized national\nstanding expert in the matters at issue that is mutually acceptable to Parent and the Company (such selected firm, the "Additional\nTax Counsel") to serve as the Additional Tax Counsel pursuant to this Agreement. Each of the Company and Parent agrees to pay\nfifty percent (50%) of the fees and expenses of the Additional Tax Counsel.\n\n        Section 5.16    Stock Exchange Listing.     Parent shall use its reasonable best efforts to cause the shares of Parent Common Stock to\nbe issued in connection with the Merger to be approved for listing on the NYSE, subject to official notice of issuance, at or prior to the\nEffective Time.\n\n        Section 5.17    Parent\'s Financing Activities.     \n\n        (a)   Parent and Merger Sub will keep the Company reasonably informed on a reasonably current basis of the status of\nmaterial developments in respect of obtaining financing for the Merger and the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        (b)   Parent and Merger Sub acknowledge and agree that the obtaining of the financing for the Merger and the other\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement is not a condition to the Closing. For the avoidance of doubt, if financing for the\nMerger and the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement has not been obtained, Parent and Merger Sub shall continue to\nbe obligated, prior to any termination of this Agreement pursuant to Section 7.1 and subject to the fulfillment or waiver of the\nconditions set forth in Article VI, to complete the Merger and consummate the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        (c)   Without limiting the generality of Section 5.4, prior to the Closing, the Company shall, and shall cause its Subsidiaries to,\nand shall use its reasonable best efforts to cause its and their respective Representatives to, on a timely basis, upon the reasonable\nrequest of Parent, provide reasonable cooperation that is customary in connection with the arrangement, marketing, syndication\nand consummation of debt and/or equity financing deemed reasonably necessary by Parent (including upon a request to Parent by\nits financing sources) in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement and consistent with transactions that are\nsubstantially similar to the transactions contemplated by this Agreement,
