The Company hereby consents to the reasonable use of the\nCompany\'s and its Affiliates\' trademarks, service marks and logos solely in connection with the financing for the Merger and the\nother transactions contemplated by this Agreement; provided that such trademarks, service marks and logos are used in a manner\nthat is not intended to or reasonably likely to harm or disparage the Company or its Affiliates or the reputation or goodwill of the\nCompany or its Affiliates, and on such other customary terms and conditions as shall be mutually agreed.\n\n        Section 5.18    Stock Exchange Delisting; Deregistration.     Prior to the Effective Time, the Company shall cooperate with Parent and\nuse its reasonable best efforts to take, or cause to be taken, all actions, and do or cause to be done all things, necessary, proper or advisable\non its part under Laws and rules and policies of NASDAQ to cause the delisting of the Company and of the shares of Company Common\nStock from NASDAQ as promptly as practicable after the Effective Time and the deregistration of the shares of Company Common Stock\nunder the Exchange Act as promptly as practicable after such delisting. The Company shall not cause the Company Common Stock to be\ndelisted from NASDAQ prior to the Effective Time. If the Surviving Corporation is required to file any quarterly or annual report by a\nfiling deadline that is imposed by the Exchange Act which falls on a date within the ten (10) days following the Closing Date, the\nCompany will deliver to Parent at least five (5) Business Days prior to the Closing a substantially final draft of any such annual or\nquarterly report reasonably likely to be required to be filed during such period.\n\n        Section 5.19    State Takeover Laws.     If any state takeover statute becomes or is deemed to become applicable to the Company or\nthe Merger or the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement, then the Company Board shall take any and all actions necessary to\nrender such statutes inapplicable to the foregoing.\n\n        Section 5.20    Stockholder Litigation.     The Company shall give Parent the opportunity to participate in the defense or settlement of\nany stockholder litigation brought by any stockholder of the Company against the Company and/or its directors or executive officers\nrelating to the Merger and the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement, whether commenced prior to or after the execution and\ndelivery of this Agreement. The Company agrees that it shall not settle or offer to settle any litigation commenced prior to or after the date\nof this Agreement against the Company or any of its directors or executive officers by any stockholder of the Company relating to this\nAgreement, the Merger, any other transaction contemplated by this Agreement or otherwise, without the prior written consent of Parent.\n\n        Section 5.21    Resignations.     Prior to the Effective Time, upon Parent\'s request, the Company shall cause any director of the\nCompany and each subsidiary of the Company to execute and deliver a letter effectuating his or her resignation as a director of such entity\neffective as of the Effective Time.\n\nA-64\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n287/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        Section 5.22    Board Membership.     Prior to the Effective Time, Parent shall take all necessary corporate action so that, upon and\nafter the Effective Time, (i) the size of the Parent Board is increased by two (2) members to a total of eleven (11) members, (ii) an\nindividual selected by the Company who meets Parent\'s independence criteria as in effect as of the date of this Agreement and who is\notherwise reasonably acceptable to Parent is appointed to the Parent Board as a member of the class of directors of the Parent Board with\nterms expiring in 2018 and (iii) an individual selected by the Company who meets Parent\'s independence criteria as in effect as of the date\nof this Agreement and who is otherwise reasonably acceptable to Parent is appointed to the Parent Board as a member of the class of\ndirectors of the Parent Board with terms expiring in 2020.\n\n        Section 5.23    Dividend Record Dates.     The Company shall coordinate with Parent to designate the record dates and payment dates\nfor the Company\'s quarterly dividends to coincide with the record dates and payment dates for Parent\'s quarterly dividends, it being the\nintention of the parties that holders of Parent Common Stock and Company Common Stock shall not receive dividends twice for a\ncorresponding fiscal quarter of either Parent or the Company.\n\nARTICLE VI \n\nCONDITIONS TO THE MERGER \n\n        Section 6.1    Conditions to the Obligations of Each Party.     The respective obligations of each party to consummate the Merger and\nthe other transactions contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the satisfaction or (to the extent permitted by Law) waiver by the\nCompany and Parent at or prior to the Closing of the following conditions:\n\n        (a)   Parent shall have obtained the Parent Stockholder Approval and the Company shall have obtained the Company\nStockholder Approval;\n\n        (b)   the Parent Stock Issuance shall have been approved for listing on the NYSE, subject to official notice of issuance;\n\n        (c)   the Form S-4 shall have become effective under the Securities Act and shall not be the subject of any stop order or any\nProceedings by or before the SEC seeking a stop order;\n\n        (d)   (i) any applicable waiting period (and any extension thereof) under the HSR Act relating to the consummation of the\nMerger shall have expired or early termination thereof shall have been granted and (ii) any authorization or consent from a\nGovernmental Authority required to be obtained with respect to the Merger under any Antitrust Law as set forth on Section 6.1(d)\nof the Parent Disclosure Letter hereto shall have been obtained and shall remain in full force and effect;\n\n        (e)   no Governmental Authority of competent jurisdiction shall have issued or entered any Order after the date of this\nAgreement, and no Law shall have been enacted or promulgated after the date of this Agreement, in each case, that (whether\ntemporary or permanent) is then in effect and has the effect of enjoining or otherwise prohibiting the consummation of the Merger\nor the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement.\n\n        Section 6.2    Conditions to Obligations of Parent and Merger Sub to Effect the Merger.     The obligations of Parent and Merger Sub\nto effect the Merger and the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the satisfaction or (to the extent permitted by\nLaw) waiver by Parent at or prior to the Closing of the following additional conditions:\n\n        (a)   each of the representations and warranties of the Company (i) contained in Section 3.2(a) shall be true and correct in all\nrespects (other than de minimis inaccuracies) as of the Closing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date (except to the\nextent such representations and warranties are expressly made as of a specific date, in which case such representations and\nwarranties shall be so true and correct as of such specific date only), (ii) contained in\n\nA-65\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n288/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nSections 3.2(b), 3.2(c), 3.2(d), 3.3, 3.4, 3.24, 3.25, 3.26 and 3.28(a) (together with Section 3.2(a), the "Company Fundamental\nRepresentations") shall be true and correct in all material respects, without giving effect to any materiality or "Company Material\nAdverse Effect" qualifications therein, as of the Closing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date (except to the extent\nsuch representations and warranties are expressly made as of a specific date, in which case such representations and warranties\nshall be so true and correct as of such specific date only) and (iii) contained in this Agreement (other than the Company\nFundamental Representations), without giving effect to any materiality or "Company Material Adverse Effect" qualifications\ntherein, shall be true and correct as of the Closing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date (except to the extent such\nrepresentations and warranties are expressly made as of a specific date, in which case such representations and warranties shall be\nso true and correct as of such specific date only), except where the failure of such representations and warranties to be true and\ncorrect, individually or in the aggregate, has not had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, a Company Material Adverse\nEffect;\n\n        (b)   the Company shall have performed or complied in all material respects with its obligations required under this\nAgreement to be performed or complied with on or prior to the Closing;\n\n        (c)   since the date of this Agreement, there shall not have occurred any event, occurrence, development or change that has\nhad or would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Company Material Adverse Effect;\n\n        (d)   Parent shall have received a certificate signed by an executive officer of the Company certifying as to the matters set\nforth in Section 6.2(a), Section 6.2(b) and Section 6.2(c); and\n\n        (e)   Parent shall have received the written opinion of Parent Tax Counsel (or, if Parent Tax Counsel advises that it will not\ndeliver a written opinion to Parent, a written opinion from each of (i) Company Tax Counsel and (ii) the Additional Tax Counsel)\nas of the Closing Date to the effect that, on the basis of the facts, representations, assumptions, limitations and exclusions set forth\nor referred to in such opinion, the Merger will not cause the KLX External Spin-Off to fail to qualify for the KLX Spin-Off Tax\nTreatment. In rendering the opinion described in this Section 6.2(e), Parent Tax Counsel (or Company Tax Counsel and Additional\nTax Counsel) may require and rely upon (and may incorporate by reference) reasonable and customary representations, warranties\nand covenants, including the Parent Closing Representation Letter and the Company Closing Representation Letter.\n\n        Section 6.3    Conditions to Obligation of the Company to Effect the Merger.     The obligation of the Company to effect the Merger\nand the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement is subject to the satisfaction or (to the extent permitted by Law) waiver by the\nCompany at or prior to the Closing of the following additional conditions:\n\n        (a)   each of the representations and warranties of Parent and Merger Sub (i) contained in Section 4.2(a) shall be true and\ncorrect in all respects (other than de minimis inaccuracies) as of the Closing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date\n(except to the extent such representations and warranties are expressly made as of a specific date, in which case such\nrepresentations and warranties shall be so true and correct as of such specific date only), (ii) contained in Sections 4.2(b), 4.2(c),\n4.2(d), 4.3, 4.4, 4.23 and 4.24 (together with Section 4.2(a), the "Parent Fundamental Representations") shall be true and correct\nin all material respects, without giving effect to any materiality or "Parent Material Adverse Effect" qualifications therein, as of the\nClosing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date (except to the extent such representations and warranties are expressly\nmade as of a specific date, in which case such representations and warranties shall be so true and correct as of such specific date\nonly) and (iii) contained in this Agreement (other than the Parent Fundamental Representations), without\n\nA-66\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n289/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ngiving effect to any materiality or "Parent Material Adverse Effect" qualifications therein, shall be true and correct as of the\nClosing Date as though made on and as of the Closing Date (except to the extent such representations and warranties are expressly\nmade as of a specific date, in which case such representations and warranties shall be so true and correct as of such specific date\nonly), except where the failure of such representations and warranties to be true and correct, individually or in the aggregate, has\nnot had, and would not reasonably be expected to have, a Parent Material Adverse Effect;\n\n        (b)   Parent and Merger Sub shall have performed or complied in all material respects with each of their respective obligations\nrequired under this Agreement to be performed or complied with on or prior to the Closing;\n\n        (c)   since the date of this Agreement, there shall not have occurred any event, occurrence, development or change that has\nhad or would reasonably be expected to have, individually or in the aggregate, a Parent Material Adverse Effect;\n\n        (d)   the Company shall have received a certificate signed by an executive officer of Parent certifying as to the matters set\nforth in Section 6.3(a), Section 6.3(b) and Section 6.3(c); and\n\n        (e)   the Company shall have received the written opinion of Company Tax Counsel (or, if Company Tax Counsel advises that\nit will not deliver a written opinion to the Company, a written opinion from each of (i) Parent Tax Counsel and (ii) Additional Tax\nCounsel) as of the Closing Date to the effect that, on the basis of the facts, representations, assumptions, limitations and exclusions\nset forth or referred to in such opinion, the Merger will not cause the KLX External Spin-Off to fail to qualify for the KLX Spin-\nOff Tax Treatment. In rendering the opinion described in this Section 6.3(e), Company Tax Counsel (or Parent Tax Counsel and\nAdditional Tax Counsel) may require and rely upon (and may incorporate by reference) reasonable and customary representations,\nwarranties and covenants, including the Company Closing Representation Letter and the Parent Closing Representation Letter.\n\n        Section 6.4    Frustration of Closing Conditions.     Neither Parent nor Merger Sub may rely on the failure of any condition set forth\nin Section 6.1 or Section 6.2 to be satisfied if such failure was primarily caused by the failure of Parent or Merger Sub to perform any of\ntheir respective material obligations under this Agreement. The Company may not rely on the failure of any condition set forth in\nSection 6.1 or Section 6.3 to be satisfied if such failure was primarily caused by its failure to perform any of its material obligations under\nthis Agreement.\n\nARTICLE VII \n\nTERMINATION, AMENDMENT AND WAIVER \n\n        Section 7.1    Termination.     Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement to the contrary, this Agreement may be\nterminated at any time prior to the Effective Time, whether before or after the Company Stockholder Approval or Parent Stockholder\nApproval is obtained (except as otherwise expressly noted), as follows:\n\n        (a)   by mutual written consent of each of Parent and the Company; or\n\n        (b)   by either Parent or the Company, if:\n\n          (i)  the Merger shall not have been consummated on or before 5:00 p.m. (New York time) on October 21, 2017 (the\n"Termination Date"); provided that the right to terminate this Agreement pursuant to this Section 7.1(b)(i) shall not be\navailable to any party if the failure of such party to perform or comply with any of its obligations under this Agreement has\nbeen the principal cause of or resulted in the failure of the Closing to have occurred on or before the Termination Date;\n\nA-67\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n290/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n         (ii)  prior to the Effective Time, any Governmental Authority of competent jurisdiction shall have issued or entered\nany Order after the date of this Agreement or any Law shall have been enacted or promulgated after the date of this\nAgreement that has the effect of permanently restraining, enjoining or otherwise prohibiting the Merger or other\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement, and in the case of such an Order, such Order shall have become final and\nnon-appealable; provided, however, that the right to terminate this Agreement under this Section 7.1(b)(ii) shall not be\navailable to a party if the issuance of such Order was proximately caused by, or resulted in, the failure of such party, and in\nthe case of Parent, including the failure of Merger Sub, to perform or comply with any of its obligations under this\nAgreement;\n\n        (iii)  the Company Stockholder Approval shall not have been obtained upon a vote taken thereon at the Company\nStockholders\' Meeting duly convened therefor or at any adjournment or postponement thereof; or\n\n        (iv)  the Parent Stockholder Approval shall not have been obtained upon a vote taken thereon at the Parent\nStockholders\' Meeting duly convened therefor or at any adjournment or postponement thereof;\n\n        (c)   by the Company if:\n\n          (i)  Parent or Merger Sub shall have breached or failed to perform any of their respective representations, warranties,\ncovenants or other agreements set forth in this Agreement, which breach or failure to perform (A) would result in the\nfailure of a condition set forth in Section 6.3(a) (treating for this purpose Section 4.13(j) as a Parent Fundamental\nRepresentation under Section 6.3(a), but only if both Company Tax Counsel and either Parent Tax Counsel or Additional\nTax Counsel cannot deliver the opinions described in Section 6.3(e)) or Section 6.3(b) and (B) is not capable of being cured\nby Parent or Merger Sub, as applicable, by the Termination Date or, if capable of being cured, shall not have been cured by\nParent or Merger Sub on or before the earlier of (x) the Termination Date and (y) the date that is thirty (30) calendar days\nfollowing the Company\'s delivery of written notice to Parent of such breach or failure to perform; provided that the\nCompany shall not have the right to terminate this Agreement pursuant to this Section 7.1(c)(i) if the Company is then in\nmaterial breach of any of its material obligations under this Agreement so as to result in the failure of a condition set forth\nin Section 6.2(b);\n\n         (ii)  at any time prior to the receipt of the Parent Stockholder Approval, the Parent Board shall have (A) made a\nParent Adverse Recommendation Change, (B) failed to include in the Joint Proxy Statement the Parent Recommendation\nor (C) materially violated or breached any of its obligations under Section 5.7;\n\n        (iii)  at any time prior to receipt of the Company Stockholder Approval, in order for the Company to enter into a\ndefinitive agreement with respect to a Company Superior Proposal to the extent permitted by, and subject to the applicable\nterms and conditions of, Section 5.6(d); provided that prior to or simultaneously with such termination, the Company pays\nor causes to be paid to Parent the Company Termination Fee; or\n\n        (iv)  if the condition set forth in Section 6.3(e) has not been satisfied within twenty (20) Business Days following the\ndate on which all conditions of the Closing were satisfied or waived, other than (A) the condition set forth in Section 6.3(e)\nand (B) those conditions that by their terms cannot be satisfied prior to the Closing, but which conditions would be satisfied\nor would be capable of being satisfied if the Closing occurred as of such date.\n\nA-68\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n291/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (d)   by Parent if:\n\n          (i)  the Company shall have breached or failed to perform any of its representations, warranties, covenants or other\nagreements set forth in this Agreement, which breach or failure to perform (A) would result in the failure of a condition set\nforth in Section 6.2(a) (treating for this purpose Section 3.27 as a Company Fundamental Representation under\nSection 6.2(a), but only if both Parent Tax Counsel and either Company Tax Counsel or Additional Tax Counsel cannot\ndeliver the opinions described in Section 6.2(e)) or Section 6.2(b) and (B) is not capable of being cured by the Company by\nthe Termination Date or, if capable of being cured, shall not have been cured by the Company on or before the earlier of\n(x) the Termination Date and (y) the date that is thirty (30) calendar days following Parent\'s delivery of written notice to the\nCompany of such breach or failure to perform; provided that Parent shall not have the right to terminate this Agreement\npursuant to this Section 7.1(d)(i) if Parent or Merger Sub is then in material breach of any of its material obligations under\nthis Agreement so as to result in the failure of a condition set forth in Section 6.3(b);\n\n         (ii)  at any time prior to the receipt of the Company Stockholder Approval, the Company Board shall have (A) made a\nCompany Adverse Recommendation Change, (B) failed to include in the Joint Proxy Statement the Company\nRecommendation or (C) materially violated or breached any of its obligations under Section 5.6;\n\n        (iii)  at any time prior to receipt of the Parent Stockholder Approval, in order for Parent to enter into a definitive\nagreement with respect to a Parent Superior Proposal to the extent permitted by, and subject to the applicable terms and\nconditions of, Section 5.7(d); provided that prior to or simultaneously with such termination, Parent pays or causes to be\npaid to the Company the Parent Termination Fee; or\n\n        (iv)  if the condition set forth in Section 6.2(e) has not been satisfied within twenty (20) Business Days following the\ndate on which all conditions of the Closing were satisfied or waived, other than (A) the condition set forth in Section 6.2(e)\nand (B) those conditions that by their terms cannot be satisfied prior to the Closing, but which conditions would be satisfied\nor would be capable of being satisfied if the Closing occurred as of such date.\n\n        Section 7.2    Effect of Termination.     In the event that this Agreement is terminated and the Merger abandoned pursuant to\nSection 7.1, written notice thereof shall be given by the terminating party to the other party, specifying the provisions hereof pursuant to\nwhich such termination is made, and this Agreement shall forthwith become null and void and of no effect without liability on the part of\nany party hereto, and all rights and obligations of any party hereto shall cease; provided, however, that, except as otherwise provided in\nSection 7.3 or in any other provision of this Agreement, no such termination shall relieve any party hereto of any liability or damages\nresulting from any intentional breach of this Agreement prior to such termination or fraud, in which case, except as provided in\nSection 7.3, the aggrieved party shall be entitled to all remedies available at law or in equity, including liability for damages determined\ntaking into account all relevant factors, including the loss of the benefit of the Merger, any lost shareholder premium, any lost synergies,\nthe time value of money and any benefit to the breaching party or its shareholders arising from such intentional breach or fraud; and\nprovided, further, that the Confidentiality Agreement, this Section 7.2, Section 7.3 and Article VIII shall survive any termination of this\nAgreement pursuant to Section 7.1. For purposes of this Agreement, "intentional breach" shall mean an action or omission taken or\nomitted to be taken that the breaching party intentionally takes (or fails to take) and knows (or should reasonably have known) would, or\nwould reasonably be expected to, cause a material breach of this Agreement.\n\nA-69\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n292/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable This Agreement may be amended by mutual agreement of the parties hereto in writing at any time\nbefore or after receipt of the Company Stockholder Approval or Parent Stockholder Approval; provided, however, that after the Company\nStockholder Approval or Parent Stockholder Approval has been obtained, there shall not be any amendment that by applicable Law or in\naccordance with the rules of any stock exchange requires further approval by the stockholders of the Company or Parent, as applicable,\nwithout such further approval of such stockholders nor any amendment or change not permitted under applicable Law; provided, further,\nthat no amendment to this Agreement shall be made that would adversely affect the rights of the Financing Sources as set forth in this\nSection 7.4 or Sections 8.8, 8.13 or 8.14 without the prior written consent of the Financing Sources.\n\n        Section 7.5    Extension; Waiver.     At any time prior to the Effective Time, subject to applicable Law, any party hereto may\n(a) extend the time for the performance of any obligation or other act of any other party hereto, (b) waive any inaccuracy in the\nrepresentations and warranties of the other party contained herein or in any document delivered pursuant hereto and (c) waive compliance\nwith any agreement or condition contained herein. Any such extension or waiver shall only be valid if set forth in an instrument in writing\nsigned by the party or parties to be bound thereby. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no failure or delay by the Company, Parent or Merger\nSub in exercising any right hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof nor shall any single or partial exercise thereof preclude any other or\nfurther exercise of any other right hereunder. Any agreement on the part of a party hereto to any such extension or waiver shall be valid\nonly if set forth in an instrument in writing signed on behalf of such party.\n\nA-72\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n295/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nARTICLE VIII \n\nGENERAL PROVISIONS \n\n        Section 8.1    Non-Survival of Representations and Warranties.     The representations, warranties and agreements in this Agreement\nand in any certificate delivered pursuant hereto shall terminate at the Effective Time; provided, however, that this Section 8.1 shall not\nlimit any covenant or agreement of the parties which by its terms contemplates performance after the Effective Time.\n\n        Section 8.2    Expenses.     Except as expressly set forth herein (including Section 7.3), all expenses incurred in connection with this\nAgreement and the transactions contemplated by this Agreement shall be paid by the party incurring such expenses, whether or not the\nMerger is consummated.\n\n        Section 8.3    Notices.     All notices, consents and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be given (and shall\nbe deemed to have been duly given upon receipt) by hand delivery, by prepaid overnight courier (providing written proof of delivery) or\nby confirmed facsimile transmission or electronic mail, addressed as follows:\n\nif to Parent or Merger Sub:\n\nRockwell Collins, Inc.\n400 Collins Road N.E.\nCedar Rapids, IA 52498\n \nPhone:\n \nFax:\n \nEmail:\n  Robert Perna\nAttention:\n\n(319) 263-0212\n(319) 295-3599\nrobert.perna@rockwellcollins.com\n\nwith a copy (which shall not constitute notice) to:\n\nSkadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP\n155 North Wacker Drive\nChicago, Illinois 60606\n \nPhone:\n \nFax:\n  Charles.Mulaney@skadden.com;\nEmail:\nRichard.Witzel@skadden.com\n\n(312) 407-0700\n(312) 407-0411\n\nAttention:\n\n  Charles W. (addressee\'s local time) or on any day that is not a Business Day shall be deemed to have been received\nat 9:00 A.M. (addressee\'s local time) on the next Business Day; provided, further, that notice of any change to the address or any of the\nother details specified in or pursuant to this Section 8.3 shall not be deemed to have been received until, and shall be deemed to have been\nreceived upon, the later of the date specified in such notice or the date that is five (5) Business Days after such notice would otherwise be\ndeemed to have been received pursuant to this Section 8.3.\n\n        Section 8.4    Interpretation; Certain Definitions.     \n\n        (a)   The parties have participated collectively in the negotiation and drafting of this Agreement. In the event an ambiguity or\nquestion of intent or interpretation arises, this Agreement shall be construed as if drafted collectively by the parties, and no\npresumption or burden of proof shall arise favoring or disfavoring any party by virtue of the authorship of any provisions of this\nAgreement.\n\n        (b)   The words "hereof," "herein," "hereby," "hereunder" and "herewith" and words of similar import shall refer to this\nAgreement as a whole and not to any particular provision of this Agreement. References to articles, sections, paragraphs, exhibits,\nannexes and schedules are to the articles, sections and paragraphs of, and exhibits, annexes and schedules to, this Agreement,\nunless otherwise specified, and the table of contents and headings in this Agreement are for reference purposes only and shall not\naffect in any way the meaning or interpretation of this Agreement. Whenever the words "include," "includes" or "including" are\nused in this Agreement, they shall be deemed to be followed by the phrase "without limitation." Words describing the singular\nnumber shall be deemed to include the plural and vice versa, words denoting any gender shall be deemed to include all genders,\nwords denoting natural persons shall be deemed to include business entities and vice versa and references to a Person are also to its\npermitted successors and assigns. The phrases "the date of this Agreement" and "the date hereof" and terms or phrases of similar\nimport shall be deemed to refer to October 23, 2016, unless the context requires otherwise. References to any information or\ndocument being "made available" or "furnished" and words of similar import shall include such information or document having\nbeen posted to the online data room hosted on behalf of the Company by Merrill Corporation at\nhttps://us1.merrillcorp.com/bidder/index_frame.do?projectId=219685 prior to the date of this Agreement. Terms defined in the text\nof this Agreement have such meaning throughout this Agreement, unless otherwise indicated in this Agreement, and all terms\ndefined in this Agreement shall have the meanings when used in any certificate or other document made or delivered pursuant\nhereto unless otherwise defined therein. Any Law defined or referred to herein or in any agreement or instrument that is referred to\nherein means such Law as from time to time amended, modified or supplemented, including (in the case of statutes) by succession\nof comparable\n\nA-74\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n297/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nsuccessor Laws (provided that for purposes of any representations and warranties contained in this Agreement that are made as of a\nspecific date or dates, references to any statute shall be deemed to refer to such statute, as amended, and to any rules or regulations\npromulgated thereunder, in each case, as of such date). All references to "dollars" or "$" refer to currency of the United States.\n\n        Section 8.5    Severability.     If any term, provision, covenant or restriction of this Agreement is held by a court of competent\njurisdiction or other authority to be invalid, void or unenforceable, the remainder of the terms, provisions, covenants and restrictions of\nthis Agreement shall remain in full force and effect and shall in no way be affected, impaired or invalidated. Upon such determination that\nany term or other provision is invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced, the parties hereto shall negotiate in good faith to modify this\nAgreement so as to effect the original intent of the parties as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner in order that the Merger\nbe consummated as originally contemplated to the fullest extent possible.\n\n        Section 8.6    Assignment.     Neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations hereunder shall be assigned by any\nof the parties hereto (whether by operation of Law or otherwise) without the prior written consent of the other parties hereto, except that\nany Merger Sub may assign any or all of its rights, interests and obligations hereunder to one or more direct or indirect wholly owned\nSubsidiaries of Parent, or a combination thereof so long as such assignment would not delay, impair or prevent consummation of the\nMerger or otherwise have a Parent Material Adverse Effect and Parent continues to remain liable for all of such obligations as if no such\nassignment had occurred. Subject to the preceding sentence, this Agreement will be binding upon, inure to the benefit of and be\nenforceable by the parties and their respective permitted successors and assigns. Any attempted assignment in violation of this Section 8.6\nshall be null and void.\n\n        Section 8.7    Entire Agreement.     This Agreement (including the exhibits, annexes and appendices hereto) constitutes, together with\nthe Confidentiality Agreement, the Company Disclosure Letter and the Parent Disclosure Letter, the entire agreement, and supersedes all\nother prior agreements and understandings, both written and oral, among the parties, or any of them, with respect to the subject matter\nhereof.\n\n        Section 8.8    No Third-Party Beneficiaries.     This Agreement is not intended to and shall not confer upon any Person other than the\nparties hereto any rights or remedies hereunder; provided, however, that it is specifically intended that (a) the D&O Indemnified Parties\n(with respect to Section 5.8 and this Section 8.8 from and after the Effective Time), (b) from and after the Effective time, the holders of\nCompany Common Stock and Company Equity Awards (with respect to Article II) and (c) each Financing Source (solely with respect to\nthis Section 8.8 and Sections 7.4, 8.13 and 8.14 hereof) are each intended third-party beneficiaries hereof.\n\n        Section 8.9    Governing Law.     This Agreement and all Proceedings (whether based on contract, tort or otherwise) arising out of or\nrelating to this Agreement or the actions of Parent, Merger Sub or the Company in the negotiation, administration, performance and\nenforcement thereof, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of Delaware, without giving effect to\nany choice or conflict of laws provision or rule (whether of the State of Delaware or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the\napplication of the Laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of Delaware.\n\n        Section 8.10    Specific Performance.     The parties agree that irreparable damage for which monetary damages, even if available,\nwould not be an adequate remedy, would occur in the event that any party hereto does not perform the provisions of this Agreement\n(including failing to take such actions as are required of it hereunder to consummate this Agreement) in accordance with its specified\nterms or otherwise breach such provisions. Accordingly, the parties acknowledge and agree that, prior to any termination of this\nAgreement in accordance with Section 7.1, the parties shall be entitled to an\n\nA-75\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n298/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ninjunction, specific performance and other equitable relief to prevent breaches of this Agreement and to enforce specifically the terms and\nprovisions hereof, in addition to any other remedy to which they are entitled at law or in equity. Each of the parties agrees that it will not\noppose the granting of an injunction, specific performance and other equitable relief on the basis that any other party has an adequate\nremedy at law or that any award of specific performance is not an appropriate remedy for any reason at law or in equity. Any party seeking\nan injunction or injunctions to prevent breaches of this Agreement and to enforce specifically the terms and provisions of this Agreement\nshall not be required to provide any bond or other security in connection with any such order or injunction.\n\n        Section 8.11    Consent to Jurisdiction.     \n\n        (a)   Each of the parties hereto hereby, with respect to any legal claim or Proceeding arising out of this Agreement or the\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement, (i) expressly and irrevocably submits, for itself and with respect to its property,\ngenerally and unconditionally, to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Delaware Court of Chancery and any appellate court therefrom\nwithin the State of Delaware (or, if the Delaware Court of Chancery declines to accept jurisdiction over a particular matter, any\nstate or federal court within the State of Delaware), (ii) agrees that it will not attempt to deny or defeat such personal jurisdiction\nby motion or other request for leave from any such courts, (iii) agrees that it will not bring any claim or Proceeding relating to this\nAgreement or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement except in such courts and (iv) irrevocably waives, to the fullest\nextent it may legally and effectively do so, and agrees not to assert, by way of motion or as a defense, counterclaim or otherwise,\nany objection which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of venue of any claim or Proceeding arising out of or relating to\nthis Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, each of Parent, Merger Sub and the Company agrees that a final and\nnonappealable judgment in any Proceeding shall be conclusive and may be enforced in other jurisdictions by suit on the judgment\nor in any other manner provided by Law.\n\n        (b)   Each party irrevocably consents to the service of process in any claim or Proceeding with respect to this Agreement and\nthe transactions contemplated by this Agreement or for recognition and enforcement of any judgment in respect hereof brought by\nany other party hereto may be made by mailing copies thereof by registered or certified United States mail, postage prepaid, return\nreceipt requested, to its address as specified in or pursuant to Section 8.3 and such service of process shall be sufficient to confer\npersonal jurisdiction over such party in such claim or Proceeding and shall otherwise constitute effective and binding service in\nevery respect.\n\n        Section 8.12    Counterparts.     This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, all of which shall together be considered\none and the same agreement. Delivery of an executed signature page to this Agreement by electronic transmission shall be as effective as\ndelivery of a manually signed counterpart of this Agreement.\n\n        Section 8.13    WAIVER OF JURY TRIAL.     EACH OF PARENT, MERGER SUB AND THE COMPANY HEREBY\nIRREVOCABLY WAIVES ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION, PROCEEDING OR COUNTERCLAIM\n(WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE) BETWEEN ANY OF THEM ARISING OUT OF OR\nRELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE ACTIONS OF PARENT, MERGER SUB OR THE COMPANY IN THE\nNEGOTIATION, ADMINISTRATION, PERFORMANCE AND ENFORCEMENT THEREOF, INCLUDING WITH RESPECT\nTO ANY PROCEEDING OR COUNTERCLAIM THAT INVOLVES THE FINANCING SOURCES.\n\n        Section 8.14    Certain Claims.     \n\n        (a)   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, each of the parties hereto agrees that it will not\nbring or support any Proceeding (whether based on contract, tort or otherwise) against the Financing Sources in any way relating to\nthis Agreement or the Merger,\n\nA-76\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n299/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nincluding any dispute arising out of or relating in any way to any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing\ndocument in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement or the performance thereof, in any forum other than\nthe Supreme Court of the State of New York, County of New York, or, if under applicable Law, exclusive jurisdiction is vested in\nthe federal courts, the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York (and appellate courts thereof). The parties\nhereto further agree that all of the provisions of Section 8.13 relating to waiver of jury trial shall apply to any Proceeding\nreferenced in this Section 8.14(a).\n\n        (b)   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, each of the parties hereto agrees that all\nProceedings (whether based on contract, tort or otherwise) against the Financing Sources in any way relating to this Agreement or\nthe Merger, including any dispute arising out of or relating in any way to any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive\nfinancing document in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, or the performance thereof, shall be\ngoverned by and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of New York; provided, however, that on or prior to the\nClosing Date, the definitions of Company Material Adverse Effect and the representations set forth in this Agreement shall, for the\npurposes of any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing document in connection with the transactions\ncontemplated by this Agreement, be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of Delaware, without\ngiving effect to any choice or conflict of laws provision or rule (whether of the State of Delaware or any other jurisdiction) that\nwould cause the application of the Laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of Delaware.\n\n        (c)   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, the Company agrees that neither it nor any of its\nRepresentatives or Affiliates shall have any rights or claims against any Financing Source in connection with or related to this\nAgreement, the Merger or any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing document in connection with the\ntransactions contemplated by this Agreement, or any alternative financing in connection therewith. In addition, no Financing\nSource shall have any liability or obligation to the Company or any of the Company\'s Affiliates or Representatives in connection\nwith or related to this Agreement, the Merger or any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing document in\nconnection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including for any consequential, special, exemplary, punitive or\nindirect damages (including any loss of profits, business or anticipated savings) or damages of a tortious nature. Nothing in this\nSection 8.14(c) shall modify or alter the rights of Parent under any commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing\ndocument in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement between or among Parent and any of its\nSubsidiaries and any Financing Source entered into in connection with or as contemplated by this Agreement, and in the event of a\nconflict between the foregoing and any provision in any commitment letter, engagement letter or any such definitive financing\ndocumentation, as applicable, the provisions of such commitment letter, engagement letter or definitive financing documentation,\nas applicable, shall govern and control.\n\n        (d)   In executing any certificate or other documentation in connection with this Agreement, directors, officers and employees\nof Parent and the Company are acting in their corporate capacities and are not assuming personal liability in connection therewith.\n\n[Remainder of page intentionally left blank; signature page follows.]\n\nA-77\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n300/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Parent, Merger Sub and the Company have caused this Agreement to be executed as of the date first\nwritten above by their respective officers thereunto duly authorized.\n\n  ROCKWELL COLLINS, INC.\n\nBy:\n\n/s/ ROBERT K. of Contents\n\nAPPENDIX A\n\nDEFINITIONS \n\n        As used in this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following meanings:\n\n        "Affiliate" shall mean, with respect to any Person, any individual, partnership, corporation, entity or other Person that directly, or\nindirectly through one or more intermediaries, Controls, is Controlled by, or is under common Control with, the first Person specified.\n\n        "Business Day" shall mean any day other than a Saturday, Sunday or a day on which all banking institutions in New York, New York\nare authorized or obligated by Law or executive order to close.\n\n        "Code" shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.\n\n        "Company Acquisition Proposal" shall mean a proposal or offer from any Person providing for any (i) merger, consolidation, share\nexchange, business combination, recapitalization or similar transaction involving the Company, pursuant to which any such Person would\nown or control, directly or indirectly, twenty percent (20%) or more of the voting power of the Company, (ii) sale or other disposition,\ndirectly or indirectly, of assets of the Company (including the capital stock or other equity interests of any of its Subsidiaries) or any\nSubsidiary of the Company representing twenty percent (20%) or more of the consolidated assets, revenues or net income of the Company\nand its Subsidiaries taken as a whole, (iii) issuance or sale or other disposition of capital stock or other equity interests representing twenty\npercent (20%) or more of the voting power of the Company, (iv) tender offer, exchange offer or any other transaction or series of\ntransactions in which any Person will acquire, directly or indirectly, beneficial ownership or the right to acquire beneficial ownership of\ncapital stock or other equity interests representing twenty percent (20%) or more of the voting power of the Company or (v) any related\ncombination of the foregoing.\n\n        "Company Disclosure Letter" shall mean the disclosure letter delivered by the Company to Parent simultaneously with the\nexecution of this Agreement.\n\n        "Company Equity Awards" shall mean the Company Options, Company Restricted Stock Awards, Company RSU Awards and\nCompany DSU Awards.\n\n        "Company Equity Plan" shall mean the BE Aerospace, Inc. 2005 Long-Term Incentive Plan, as amended from time to time, and any\nother equity or equity-based plan, program, or arrangement of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries or any predecessor thereof, other\nthan the Company ESPP.\n\n        "Company ERISA Affiliate" shall mean any Person under common control with the Company within the meaning of\nSection 414(b), Section 414(c), Section 414(m) or Section 414(o) of the Code, and the regulations issued thereunder.\n\n        "Company ESPP" shall mean the B/E Aerospace, Inc. Amended and Restated 1994 Employee Stock Purchase Plan, as amended\nfrom time to time.\n\n        "Company Intervening Event" means a material event or circumstance that was not known to the Company Board on the date of\nthis Agreement (or if known, the consequences of which were not known to the Company Board as of the date of this Agreement), which\nevent or circumstance, or any consequence thereof, becomes known to the Company Board prior to the Company Stockholder Approval;\nprovided, however, that in no event shall any inquiry, offer or proposal that constitutes or would reasonably be expected to lead to a\nCompany Acquisition Proposal constitute a Company Intervening Event.\n\n        "Company Material Adverse Effect" shall mean any event, occurrence, development or change that has a material adverse effect on\nthe business, financial condition or results of operations of the Company and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole; provided, however, that\nnone of the following (or the\n\nAppendix A-1\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n304/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nresults thereof) shall constitute or be taken into account in determining whether a Company Material Adverse Effect shall have occurred:\n(i) changes in general economic, financial market, regulatory, business, financial, political, geopolitical, credit or capital market conditions,\nincluding interest or exchange rates; (ii) general changes or developments in any of the industries or markets, or in the business conditions\nin the geographic regions, in which the Company or any of its Subsidiaries operate (or applicable portions or segments of such industries\nor markets); (iii) changes in any applicable U.S. Laws or accounting regulations or principles or interpretations thereof; (iv) any change in\nthe price or trading volume of the Company\'s securities or other financial instruments or change in the Company\'s credit rating, in and of\nitself (provided that the facts or occurrences giving rise to or contributing to such change that are not otherwise excluded from the\ndefinition of "Company Material Adverse Effect" may be taken into account in determining whether a Company Material Adverse Effect\nhas occurred); (v) any failure by the Company to meet its internal or published projections, budgets, plans or forecasts of its revenues,\nearnings or other financial performance or results of operation or any published analyst or other third party estimates or expectations of the\nCompany\'s revenue, earnings or other financial performance or results of operations for any period, in and of itself (provided that the facts\nor occurrences giving rise to or contributing to such failure that are not otherwise excluded from the definition of "Company Material\nAdverse Effect" may be taken into account in determining whether a Company Material Adverse Effect has occurred); (vi) any outbreak or\nescalation of hostilities or war or any act of terrorism, or any acts of God, weather-related events, fires or natural disasters; (vii) any action\ntaken or not taken at the express written request of Parent after the date of this Agreement; or (viii) the public announcement or pendency\nof the Merger or the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement or the identity of Parent; provided that if the facts, circumstances,\nevents, changes, occurrences or effects set forth in clauses (i) through (iii) and (vi) above have a material disproportionate impact on the\nCompany and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, relative to the other participants in the industries in which the Company and its\nSubsidiaries operate, such facts, circumstances, events, changes, occurrences or efforts may be taken into account in determining whether\na Company Material Adverse Effect has occurred.\n\n        "Company Option" shall mean each option to purchase shares of Company Common Stock.\n\n        "Company Recommendation" shall mean the recommendation of the Company Board that the stockholders of the Company adopt\nthis Agreement and approve the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including the Merger.\n\n        "Company Signing Representation Letter" shall mean the representation letter executed by the Company on or prior to the date of\nthis Agreement and delivered to Parent Tax Counsel and Company Tax Counsel, attached hereto as Exhibit D.\n\n        "Company Superior Proposal" shall mean a bona fide written Company Acquisition Proposal (provided that for purposes of this\ndefinition, references to twenty percent (20%) in the definition of "Company Acquisition Proposal" shall be deemed to be references to\nfifty percent (50%)) which the Company Board determines in good faith (i) to be reasonably likely to be consummated if accepted and\n(ii) to be more favorable to the Company\'s stockholders from a financial point of view than the Merger and the other transactions\ncontemplated by this Agreement, in each case, taking into account at the time of determination all relevant circumstances, including the\nvarious legal, financial and regulatory aspects of the proposal, all the terms and conditions of such proposal and this Agreement, and any\nchanges to the terms of this Agreement offered by Parent in response to such Company Acquisition Proposal.\n\n        "Company Tax Counsel" shall mean Shearman & Sterling LLP or such other nationally recognized law firm as the Company may\nselect.\n\n        "Company Termination Fee" shall mean $200,000,000.00.\n\nAppendix A-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n305/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        "Confidentiality Agreement" shall mean the confidentiality agreement, dated July 7, 2016, between Parent and the Company.\n\n        "Contract" shall mean any binding written contract, subcontract, lease, sublease, conditional sales contract, purchase order, sales\norder, license, indenture, note, bond, loan, instrument, understanding, permit, concession, franchise, commitment, partnership, limited\nliability company or other agreement.\n\n        "Control" shall mean the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and\npolicies of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities or partnership or other interests, by Contract or otherwise. The\nterms "Controlling" and "Controlled by" shall have correlative meanings.\n\n        "Customs & International Trade Authorizations" shall mean any and all licenses, registrations, and approvals required pursuant to\nthe Customs & International Trade Laws for the lawful export or import of goods, software, technology, technical data, and services and\ninternational financial transactions.\n\n        "Customs & International Trade Laws" shall mean the applicable export control, sanctions, import, customs and trade, anti-bribery,\nand anti-boycott Laws of any jurisdiction in which the Company or any of its Subsidiaries is incorporated or does business, including the\nUK Bribery Act 2010, the Tariff Act of 1930, as amended, and other applicable Laws, administered or enforced by the U.S. Department of\nCommerce, U.S. International Trade Commission, U.S. Customs and Border Protection, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, and\ntheir predecessor agencies; the Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended; the Export Administration Regulations, including related\nrestrictions with regard to transactions involving Persons on the U.S. Department of Commerce Denied Persons List, Unverified List or\nEntity List; the Arms Export Control Act, as amended; the International Traffic in Arms Regulations, including related restrictions with\nregard to transactions involving Persons on the Debarred List; the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, as amended; the\nTrading With the Enemy Act, as amended; the Iran Sanctions Act, as amended, the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year\n2012, the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013, and the embargoes and restrictions administered by OFAC; Executive\nOrders regarding embargoes and restrictions on transactions with designated countries and entities, including Persons designated on\nOFAC\'s list of Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons, and Persons designated on the U.S. Department of State sanctions\nlists; the anti-boycott Laws administered by the U.S. Department of Commerce; and the anti-boycott Laws administered by the U.S.\nDepartment of the Treasury.\n\n        "Delaware Secretary of State" shall mean the Secretary of State of the State of Delaware.\n\n        "Environmental Laws" shall mean all applicable and legally enforceable Laws relating to pollution or protection of the environment,\nnatural resources or human health and safety, including Laws relating to Releases of Hazardous Materials and the manufacture, processing,\ndistribution, use, treatment, storage, Release, transport or handling of Hazardous Materials, including the Federal Water Pollution Control\nAct (33 U.S.C. \xc2\xa71251 et seq.), the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act of 1976 (42 U.S.C. \xc2\xa76901 et seq.), the Safe Drinking Water\nAct (42 U.S.C. \xc2\xa73000(f) et seq.), the Toxic Substances Control Act (15 U.S.C. \xc2\xa72601 et seq.), the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. \xc2\xa77401 et seq.),\nthe Oil Pollution Act of 1990 (33 U.S.C. \xc2\xa72701 et seq.), the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act of\n1980 (42 U.S.C. \xc2\xa79601 et seq.), the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. \xc2\xa71531 et seq.), and other similar foreign, state and local\nstatutes, in effect as of the date of this Agreement.\n\n        "Equity Award Exchange Ratio" means the quotient obtained by dividing (i) the Merger Consideration by (ii) the Parent Stock\nPrice; provided that the value of the portion of the Merger Consideration that consists of shares of Parent Common Stock shall be\ndetermined by multiplying (x) the number of such shares of Parent Common Stock by (y) the Parent Stock Price.\n\nAppendix
