A-9\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n312/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nExhibit A \n\nAMENDED AND RESTATED\n\nCERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION\n\nOF\n\nB/E AEROSPACE, INC. \n\n        FIRST:    The name of the corporation is B/E Aerospace, Inc. (the "Corporation").\n\n        SECOND:    The address of the registered office of the Corporation in the State of Delaware is 1209 Orange Street, Wilmington,\nCounty of New Castle, Delaware 19801. The name of its registered agent at that address is The Corporation Trust Company.\n\n        THIRD:    The purpose of the Corporation is to engage in any lawful act or activity for which a corporation may be organized under\nthe General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware as set forth in Title 8 of the Delaware Code (the "DGCL").\n\n        FOURTH:    The total number of shares of stock which the Corporation shall have authority to issue is 1,000 shares of Common\nStock, each having a par value of one cent ($0.01).\n\n        FIFTH:    The following provisions are inserted for the management of the business and the conduct of the affairs of the Corporation,\nand for further definition, limitation and regulation of the powers of the Corporation and of its directors and stockholders:\n\n        (1)   The business and affairs of the Corporation shall be managed by or under the direction of the Board of Directors.\n\n        (2)   The directors shall have concurrent power with the stockholders to make, alter, amend, change, add to or repeal the By-\nLaws of the Corporation.\n\n        (3)   The number of directors of the Corporation shall be as from time to time fixed by, or in the manner provided in, the By-\nLaws of the Corporation. Election of directors need not be by written ballot unless the By-Laws so provide.\n\n        (4)   In addition to the powers and authority hereinbefore or by statute expressly conferred upon them, the directors are hereby\nempowered to exercise all such powers and do all such acts and things as may be exercised or done by the Corporation, subject,\nnevertheless, to the provisions of the DGCL, this Certificate of Incorporation, and any By-Laws adopted by the stockholders;\nprovided, however, that no By-Laws hereafter adopted by the stockholders shall invalidate any prior act of the directors which\nwould have been valid if such By-Laws had not been adopted.\n\n        SIXTH:    Meetings of stockholders may be held within or without the State of Delaware, as the By-Laws may provide. The books of\nthe Corporation may be kept (subject to any provision contained in the DGCL) outside the State of Delaware at such place or places as\nmay be designated from time to time by the Board of Directors or in the By-Laws of the Corporation.\n\n        SEVENTH:    The Corporation reserves the right to amend, alter, change or repeal any provision contained in this Certificate of\nIncorporation, in the manner now or hereafter prescribed by statute, and all rights conferred upon stockholders herein are granted subject\nto this reservation.\n\n        EIGHTH:    The Corporation reserves the right to amend, alter, change or repeal any provision contained in this Certificate of\nIncorporation, in the manner now or hereafter prescribed herein and by the laws of the State of Delaware, all rights conferred upon\nstockholders herein are granted subject to this reservation.\n\n1\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n313/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        NINTH:    With respect to acts or omissions occurring at or prior to the effective time of the merger between the the Corporation and\nQuarterback Merger SubCorp. (the "Effective Time"), this Corporation shall, to the maximum extent permitted from time to time under the\nlaw of the State of Delaware, indemnify and, upon request, advance expenses to any person who is or was a party or is threatened to be\nmade a party to any threatened, pending or completed action, suit, proceeding or claim, whether civil, criminal, administrative or\ninvestigative, by reason of the fact that such person is or was or has agreed to be a director or officer of this Corporation prior to the\nEffective Time or while a director or officer is or was serving, prior to the Effective Time, at the request of this Corporation as a director,\nofficer, partner, trustee, employee or agent of any corporation, partnership, joint venture, trust or other enterprise, including service with\nrespect to employee benefit plans, against expenses (including attorney\'s fees and expenses), judgments, fines, penalties and amounts paid\nin settlement incurred in connection with the investigation, preparation to defend or defense of such action, suit, proceeding or claim;\nprovided, however, that the foregoing shall not require this Corporation to indemnify or advance expenses to any person in connection\nwith any action, suit, proceeding, claim or counterclaim initiated by or on behalf of such person. Such indemnification shall not be\nexclusive of other indemnification rights arising under any by-law, agreement, vote of directors or stockholders or otherwise and shall\ninure to the benefit of the heirs and legal representatives of such person. Any person seeking indemnification under this Article 9 shall be\ndeemed to have met the standard of conduct required for such indemnification unless the contrary shall be established. Any repeal or\nmodification of the foregoing provisions of this Article 9 shall not adversely affect any right or protection of a director or officer of this\nCorporation with respect to any acts or omissions of such director or officer occurring prior to such repeal or modification.\n\n        TENTH:    With respect to acts or omissions occurring at or prior to the Effective Time, a director of this Corporation shall not be\nliable to this Corporation or its stockholders for monetary damages for breach of fiduciary duty as a director, except to the extent that\nexculpation from liabilities is not permitted under the Delaware General Corporation Law as in effect at the time such liability is\ndetermined. Any repeal or modification of the foregoing provisions of this Article 10 shall not adversely affect any right or protection of a\ndirector or officer of this Corporation with respect to any acts or omissions of such director or officer occurring prior to such repeal or\nmodification.\n\n* * * * *\n\n2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n314/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nAnnex B\n\nOctober 23, 2016\n\nThe Board of Directors\nRockwell Collins, Inc.\n400 Collins Road N.E.\nCedar Rapids, Iowa 52498\n\nMembers of the Board of Directors:\n\n        You have requested our opinion as to the fairness, from a financial point of view, to Rockwell Collins, Inc. (the "Company") of the\nconsideration to be paid by the Company in the proposed merger (the "Transaction") of Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a wholly-owned\nsubsidiary of the Company (the "Merger Subsidiary"), with B/E Aerospace, Inc. (the "Merger Partner"). Pursuant to the Agreement and\nPlan of Merger (the "Agreement"), among the Company, the Merger Subsidiary and the Merger Partner, the Merger Partner will become a\nwholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, and each share of common stock, par value $0.01 per share, of the Merger Partner (the "Merger\nPartner Common Stock") issued and outstanding immediately prior to the effective time of the Transaction (other than Canceled Shares (as\ndefined in the Agreement) and Dissenting Shares (as defined in the Agreement)), will be converted into the right to receive consideration\nper share equal to $34.10 in cash, without interest (the "Cash Consideration"), and that number of shares of common stock, par value $0.01\nper share, of the Company (the "Company Common Stock") equal to the Exchange Ratio (and, if applicable, cash in lieu of fractional\nshares of Parent Common Stock (as defined in the Agreement) payable in accordance with the Agreement) (such number of shares of\nCompany Common Stock and any such cash in lieu of fractional shares, together with the Cash Consideration, the "Consideration"). For\npurposes of the Agreement, the Exchange Ratio means the following (in each case rounded to four decimal places): (i) if the Parent Stock\nPrice (as defined in the Agreement) is an amount greater than $89.97, then the Exchange Ratio is 0.3101; (ii) if the Parent Stock Price (as\ndefined in the Agreement) is an amount greater than or equal to $77.41 but less than or equal to $89.97, then the Exchange Ratio shall be\nan amount equal to the quotient obtained by dividing $27.90 by the Parent Stock Price (as defined in the Agreement); and (iii) if the Parent\nStock Price (as defined in the Agreement) is less than $77.41, then the Exchange Ratio is 0.3604.\n\n        In connection with preparing our opinion, we have (i) reviewed a draft dated October 23, 2016 of the Agreement; (ii) reviewed\ncertain publicly available business and financial information concerning the Merger Partner and the Company and the industries in which\nthey operate; (iii) compared the proposed financial terms of the Transaction with the publicly available financial terms of certain\ntransactions involving companies we deemed relevant and the consideration received for such companies; (iv) compared the financial and\noperating performance of the Merger Partner and the Company with publicly available information concerning certain other companies we\ndeemed relevant and reviewed the current and historical market prices of the Merger Partner Common Stock and the Company Common\nStock and certain publicly traded securities of such other companies; (v) reviewed certain internal financial analyses and forecasts\nprepared by the managements of the Merger Partner and the Company relating to their respective businesses and by the Company relating\nto the Merger Partner\'s business, as well as the estimated amount and timing of the cost savings and related expenses and synergies\nexpected to result from the Transaction (the "Synergies"); and (vi) performed such other financial studies and analyses and considered\nsuch other information as we deemed appropriate for the purposes of this opinion.\n\nB-1\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n315/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        In addition, we have held discussions with certain members of the management of the Merger Partner and the Company with respect\nto certain aspects of the Transaction, the past and current business operations of the Merger Partner and the Company, the financial\ncondition and future prospects and operations of the Merger Partner and the Company, the effects of the Transaction on the financial\ncondition and future prospects of the Company, and certain other matters we believed necessary or appropriate to our inquiry.\n\n        In giving our opinion, we have relied upon and assumed the accuracy and completeness of all information that was publicly available\nor was furnished to or discussed with us by the Merger Partner and the Company or otherwise reviewed by or for us. We have not\nindependently verified any such information or its accuracy or completeness and, pursuant to our engagement letter with the Company, we\ndid not assume any obligation to undertake any such independent verification. We have not conducted or been provided with any valuation\nor appraisal of any assets or liabilities, nor have we evaluated the solvency of the Merger Partner or the Company under any state or\nfederal laws relating to bankruptcy, insolvency or similar matters. In relying on financial analyses and forecasts provided to us or derived\ntherefrom, including the Synergies, we have assumed that they have been reasonably prepared based on assumptions reflecting the best\ncurrently available estimates and judgments by management as to the expected future results of operations and financial condition of the\nMerger Partner and the Company to which such analyses or forecasts relate. We express no view as to such analyses or forecasts\n(including the Synergies) or the assumptions on which they were based. We have also assumed that the Transaction and the other\ntransactions contemplated by the Agreement will have the tax consequences described in discussions with, and materials furnished to us\nby, representatives of the Company, and will be consummated as described in the Agreement, and that the definitive Agreement will not\ndiffer in any material respects from the draft thereof furnished to us. We have also assumed that the representations and warranties made\nby the Company and the Merger Partner in the Agreement and the related agreements are and will be true and correct in all respects\nmaterial to our analysis. We are not legal, regulatory or tax experts and have relied on the assessments made by advisors to the Company\nwith respect to such issues. We have further assumed that all material governmental, regulatory or other consents and approvals necessary\nfor the consummation of the Transaction will be obtained without any adverse effect on the Merger Partner or the Company or on the\ncontemplated benefits of the Transaction.\n\n        Our opinion is necessarily based on economic, market and other conditions as in effect on, and the information made available to us\nas of, the date hereof. It should be understood that subsequent developments may affect this opinion and that we do not have any\nobligation to update, revise, or reaffirm this opinion. Our opinion is limited to the fairness, from a financial point of view, of the\nConsideration to be paid by the Company in the proposed Transaction and we express no opinion as to the fairness of the Consideration to\nthe holders of any class of securities, creditors or other constituencies of the Company or as to the underlying decision by the Company to\nengage in the Transaction. Furthermore, we express no opinion with respect to the amount or nature of any compensation to any officers,\ndirectors, or employees of any party to the Transaction, or any class of such persons relative to the Consideration to be paid by the\nCompany in the Transaction or with respect to the fairness of any such compensation. We are expressing no opinion herein as to the price\nat which the Company Common Stock or the Merger Partner Common Stock will trade at any future time.\n\n        We have acted as financial advisor to the Company with respect to the proposed Transaction and will receive a fee from the Company\nfor our services, a substantial portion of which will become payable only if the proposed Transaction is consummated. In addition, the\nCompany has agreed to indemnify us for certain liabilities arising out of our engagement. During the two years preceding the date of this\nletter, we and our affiliates have had commercial or investment banking relationships with the Company and the Merger Partner for which\nwe and such affiliates have received customary\n\nB-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n316/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\ncompensation. Such services during such period have included acting as joint bookrunner and joint lead arranger on the Company\'s\nrevolving credit facility in February 2016; as joint lead arranger and joint bookrunner on the Merger Partner\'s credit facilities in December\n2014 and in May 2016; as lead arranger and lead-left bookrunner on credit facilities of KLX Inc., an entity that was spun out of the Merger\nPartner in December 2014 ("KLX"), in December 2014 and May 2015; as lead bookrunner on an offering of debt securities of KLX in\nNovember 2014; and as financial advisor to the Merger Partner in connection with the spin-off of KLX in December 2014. We and our\naffiliates also provided asset management services to the Company during such period. In addition, our commercial banking affiliate is an\nagent bank and a lender under outstanding credit facilities of the Company, the Merger Partner and of KLX, for which it receives\ncustomary compensation or other financial benefits. We anticipate that we and our affiliates will arrange and/or provide financing to the\nCompany in connection with the Transaction for customary compensation. In addition, we and our affiliates hold, on a proprietary basis,\nless than 1% of the outstanding common stock of each of the Company and the Merger Partner. In the ordinary course of our businesses,\nwe and our affiliates may actively trade the debt and equity securities or financial instruments (including derivatives, bank loans or other\nobligations) of the Company or the Merger Partner for our own account or for the accounts of customers and, accordingly, we may at any\ntime hold long or short positions in such securities or other financial instruments.\n\n        On the basis of and subject to the foregoing, it is our opinion as of the date hereof that the Consideration to be paid by the Company\nin the proposed Transaction is fair, from a financial point of view, to the Company.\n\n        The issuance of this opinion has been approved by a fairness opinion committee of J.P. Morgan Securities LLC. This letter is\nprovided to the Board of Directors of the Company (in its capacity as such) in connection with and for the purposes of its evaluation of the\nTransaction. This opinion does not constitute a recommendation to any shareholder of the Company as to how such shareholder should\nvote with respect to the Transaction or any other matter. This opinion may not be disclosed, referred to, or communicated (in whole or in\npart) to any third party for any purpose whatsoever except with our prior written approval. This opinion may be reproduced in full in any\nregistration, proxy or information statement relating to the Transaction which the Company must, under any applicable law, file with any\ngovernment agency or distribute to its shareholders and where such filing must include this opinion. This opinion may not otherwise be\ndisclosed publicly in any manner without our prior written approval.\n\nVery truly yours,\n\nJ.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC\n\nB-3\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n317/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nANNEX C \n\n388 Greenwich St\nNew York, NY 10013\n\nOctober 23, 2016\n\nThe Board of Directors\nB/E Aerospace, Inc.\n1400 Corporate Center Way\nWellington, FL 33414\n\nMembers of the Board:\n\n        You have requested our opinion as to the fairness, from a financial point of view, to the holders of the common stock of B/E\nAerospace, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Company"), of the Merger Consideration (defined below) to be received by such holders\npursuant to the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of October 23, 2016 (the\n"Merger Agreement"), among Rockwell Collins, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Parent"), Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a Delaware\ncorporation and a wholly owned subsidiary of Parent ("Merger Sub"), and Company. As more fully described in the Merger Agreement,\n(i) Merger Sub will be merged with and into Company (the "Merger") and (ii) each outstanding share of the common stock, par value\n$0.01 per share, of Company ("Company Common Stock"), other than shares of Company Common Stock held by holders who are\nentitled to and properly demand appraisal of their shares of Company Common Stock and shares of Company Common Stock that are\nowned, directly or indirectly, by Parent, Company (as treasury shares or otherwise) or Merger Sub (such holders, collectively, "Excluded\nHolders"), will be converted into the right to receive $34.10 in cash (the "Cash Consideration") and that number of shares (and cash in lieu\nof any fraction thereof) of common stock, par value $0.01 per share ("Parent Common Stock"), of Parent equal to (a) if the Parent Stock\nPrice (as defined in the Merger Agreement) is greater than $89.97, 0.3101; (b) if the Parent Stock Price is greater than or equal to $77.41\nbut less than or equal to $89.97, the quotient (rounded to four decimal places) obtained by dividing (x) $27.90 by (y) the Parent Stock\nPrice; and (c) if the Parent Stock Price is less than $77.41, 0.3604 (the "Stock Consideration"; together with the Cash Consideration, the\n"Merger Consideration").\n\n        In arriving at our opinion, we reviewed the Merger Agreement and held discussions with certain senior officers, directors and other\nrepresentatives and advisors of Company and certain senior officers and other representatives and advisors of Parent concerning the\nbusinesses, operations and prospects of Company and Parent. We examined certain publicly available business and financial information\nrelating to Company and Parent as well as certain financial forecasts and other information and data relating to Company and Parent which\nwere provided to or discussed with us by the respective managements of Company and Parent, including information relating to the\npotential strategic implications and operational benefits (including the amount, timing and achievability thereof) anticipated by the\nmanagements of Company and Parent to result from the Merger. We reviewed the financial terms of the Merger as set forth in the Merger\nAgreement in relation to, among other things: current and historical market prices and trading volumes of Company Common Stock and\nParent Common Stock; the historical and projected earnings and other operating data of Company and Parent; and the capitalization and\nfinancial condition of Company and Parent. We considered, to the extent publicly available, the financial terms of certain other\ntransactions which we considered relevant in\n\n   \n\nC-1\n\nCitigroup Global Markets Inc.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n318/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nevaluating the Merger and analyzed certain financial, stock market and other publicly available information relating to the businesses of\nother companies whose operations we considered relevant in evaluating those of Company and Parent. We also evaluated certain potential\npro forma financial effects of the Merger on Parent. In addition to the foregoing, we conducted such other analyses and examinations and\nconsidered such other information and financial, economic and market criteria as we deemed appropriate in arriving at our opinion. The\nissuance of our opinion has been authorized by our fairness opinion committee.\n\n        In rendering our opinion, we have assumed and relied, without independent verification, upon the accuracy and completeness of all\nfinancial and other information and data publicly available or provided to or otherwise reviewed by or discussed with us and upon the\nassurances of the managements of Company and Parent that they are not aware of any relevant information that has been omitted or that\nremains undisclosed to us. With respect to financial forecasts and other information and data relating to Company and Parent provided to\nor otherwise reviewed by or discussed with us, we have been advised by the respective managements of Company and Parent that such\nforecasts and other information and data were reasonably prepared on bases reflecting the best currently available estimates and judgments\nof the managements of Company and Parent as to the future financial performance of Company and Parent, the potential strategic\nimplications and operational benefits anticipated to result from the Merger and the other matters covered thereby, and have assumed, with\nyour consent, that the financial results (including the potential strategic implications and operational benefits anticipated to result from the\nMerger) reflected in such forecasts and other information and data will be realized in the amounts and at the times projected.\n\n        We have assumed, with your consent, that the Merger will be consummated in accordance with its terms, without waiver,\nmodification or amendment of any material term, condition or agreement and that, in the course of obtaining the necessary regulatory or\nthird party approvals, consents and releases for the Merger, no delay, limitation, restriction or condition will be imposed that would have\nan adverse effect on Company, Parent or the contemplated benefits of the Merger. Our opinion, as set forth herein, relates to the relative\nvalues of Company and Parent. We are not expressing any opinion as to what the value of the Parent Common Stock actually will be when\nissued pursuant to the Merger or the price at which the Parent Common Stock will trade at any time. We have not made or been provided\nwith an independent evaluation or appraisal of the assets or liabilities (contingent or otherwise) of Company or Parent nor have we made\nany physical inspection of the properties or assets of Company or Parent. Our opinion does not address the underlying business decision of\nCompany to effect the Merger, the relative merits of the Merger as compared to any alternative business strategies that might exist for\nCompany or the effect of any other transaction in which Company might engage. We also express no view as to, and our opinion does not\naddress, the fairness (financial or otherwise) of the amount or nature or any other aspect of any compensation to any officers, directors or\nemployees of any parties to the Merger, or any class of such persons, relative to the Merger Consideration. Our opinion is necessarily\nbased upon information available to us, and financial, stock market and other conditions and circumstances existing, as of the date hereof.\n\n        Citigroup Global Markets Inc. has acted as financial advisor to Company in connection with the proposed Merger and will receive a\nfee for such services, a significant portion of which is contingent upon the consummation of the Merger. We also will receive a fee in\nconnection with the delivery of this opinion. We and our affiliates in the past have provided, and currently provide, services to Company\nunrelated to the proposed Merger, for which services we and such affiliates have received and expect to receive compensation, including,\nwithout limitation, during the two year period prior to the date hereof, having acted or acting (i) as financial advisor to Company in\nconnection with Company\'s spin-off of KLX Inc. in December 2014, and (ii) as lender, syndication agent, joint lead arranger and joint\nbook-runner in connection with a term loan and revolving credit facility of Company. We and our affiliates in the past have also provided,\nand currently provide, services to\n\nC-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n319/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nParent unrelated to the proposed Merger, for which services we and such affiliates have received and expect to receive compensation,\nincluding, without limitation, during the two year period prior to the date hereof, acting as lender, syndication agent, joint lead arranger\nand joint book-runner in connection with two revolving credit facilities of Parent, as well as acting as lender in connection with certain\ncommitted corporate credit card facilities of Parent. In the ordinary course of our business, we and our affiliates may actively trade or hold\nthe securities of Company and Parent for our own account or for the account of our customers and, accordingly, may at any time hold a\nlong or short position in such securities. In addition, we and our affiliates (including Citigroup Inc. and its affiliates) may maintain\nrelationships with Company, Parent and their respective affiliates.\n\n        Our advisory services and the opinion expressed herein are provided for the information of the Board of Directors of Company in its\nevaluation of the proposed Merger, and our opinion is not intended to be and does not holders of Company\nCommon Stock (other than Excluded Holders) in the Merger is fair, from a financial point of view, to such holders.\n\nVery truly yours,\n\nCITIGROUP GLOBAL MARKETS D \n\n200 West Street -- New York, NY 10282-2198\nTel: 212-902-1000 -- Fax: 212-902-3000\n\nPERSONAL AND CONFIDENTIAL \n\nOctober 23, 2016\n\nBoard of Directors\nB/E Aerospace, Inc.\n1400 Corporate Center Way\nWellington, Florida 33414-2105\n\nLadies and Gentlemen:\n\n        You have requested our opinion as to the fairness from a financial point of view to the holders (other than Rockwell Collins Inc.\n("Parent") and its affiliates) of the outstanding shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share (the "Shares"), of B/E Aerospace, Inc.\n(the "Company") of the Merger Consideration (as defined below) to be paid to such holders pursuant to the Agreement and Plan of\nMerger, dated as of October 23, 2016 (the "Agreement"), by and among Parent, Quarterback Merger Sub Corp., a wholly owned\nsubsidiary of Parent ("Merger Sub"), and the Company. Pursuant to the Agreement, Merger Sub will be merged with and into the\nCompany (the "Merger") and each outstanding Share (other than Canceled Shares and Dissenting Shares (as defined in the Agreement))\nwill be converted into $34.10 in cash (the "Cash Consideration") and that number of shares (and cash in lieu of any fraction thereof) of\ncommon stock, par value $0.01 per share ("Parent Common Stock"), of Parent equal to (a) if the Parent Stock Price (as defined in the\nAgreement) is greater than $89.97, 0.3101; (b) if the Parent Stock Price is greater than or equal to $77.41 but less than or equal to $89.97,\nthe quotient (rounded to four decimal places) obtained by dividing $27.90 by the Parent Stock Price; and (c) if the Parent Stock Price is\nless than $77.41, 0.3604 (the "Stock Consideration"; together with the Cash Consideration, the "Merger Consideration").\n\n        Goldman, Sachs & Co. and its affiliates are engaged in advisory, underwriting and financing, principal investing, sales and trading,\nresearch, investment management and other financial and non-financial activities and services for various persons and entities. Goldman,\nSachs & Co. and its affiliates and employees, and funds or other entities they manage or in which they invest or have other economic\ninterests or with which they co-invest, may at any time purchase, sell, hold or vote long or short positions and investments in securities,\nderivatives, loans, commodities, currencies, credit default swaps and other financial instruments of the Company, Parent, any of their\nrespective affiliates and third parties, or any currency or commodity that may be involved in the transaction contemplated by the\nAgreement (the "Transaction"). We have acted as financial advisor to the Company in connection with, and have participated in certain of\nthe negotiations leading to, the Transaction. We expect to receive fees for our services in connection with the Transaction, the principal\nportion of which is contingent upon consummation of the Transaction, and the Company has agreed to reimburse certain of our expenses\narising, and indemnify us against certain liabilities that may arise, out of our engagement. We have Securities and Investment Services\nProvided by Goldman, Sachs & Co. provided certain financial advisory and/or underwriting services to the Company and/or its affiliates\nfrom time to time for which our Investment Banking Division has received, and may receive, compensation, including having acted as\nbook manager with respect to a private offering of KLX, Inc.\'s, a former subsidiary of the Company, 5.875% Senior Notes due 2022\n(aggregate principal amount of $1,200,000,000) in November 2014; as lead arranger with respect to the Company\'s term loan (aggregate\nprincipal amount\n\nD-1\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n321/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nof $2,200,000,000) put in place in November 2014; as the Company\'s financial advisor in connection with the spin-off of KLX, Inc., in\nDecember 2014; and as a participant in the Company\'s revolving credit facility (aggregate principal amount of $600,000,000) put in place\nin December 2014. We may also in the future provide financial advisory and/or underwriting services to the Company, Parent and their\nrespective affiliates for which our Investment Banking Division may receive compensation.\n\n        In connection with this opinion, we have reviewed, among other things, the Agreement; annual reports to stockholders and Annual\nReports on Form 10-K of the Company and Parent for the five fiscal years ended December 31, 2015 and September 30, 2015,\nrespectively; certain interim reports to stockholders and Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q of the Company and Parent; certain other\ncommunications from the Company and Parent to their respective stockholders; certain publicly available research analyst reports for the\nCompany and for Parent; and certain internal financial analyses and forecasts for the Company prepared by its management and for Parent\nprepared by its management, in each case, as approved for our use by the Company (the "Forecasts"), and certain operating synergies\nprojected by the managements of the Company and Parent to result from the Transaction, as approved for our use by the Company (the\n"Synergies"). We have also held discussions with members of the senior managements of the Company and Parent regarding their\nassessment of the strategic rationale for, and the potential benefits of, the Transaction and the past and current business operations,\nfinancial condition and future prospects of the Company and Parent; reviewed the reported price and trading activity for the Shares and\nshares of Parent Common Stock; compared certain financial and stock market information for the Company and Parent with similar\ninformation for certain other companies the securities of which are publicly traded; reviewed the financial terms of certain recent business\ncombinations in the aerospace and defense industry and in other industries; and performed such other studies and analyses, and considered\nsuch other factors, as we deemed appropriate.\n\n        For purposes of rendering this opinion, we have, with your consent, relied upon and assumed the accuracy and completeness of all of\nthe financial, legal, regulatory, tax, accounting and other information provided to, discussed with or reviewed by, us, without assuming any\nresponsibility for independent verification thereof. In that regard, we have assumed with your consent that the Forecasts and the Synergies\nhave been reasonably prepared on a basis reflecting the best currently available estimates and judgments of the management of the\nCompany. We have not made an independent evaluation or appraisal of the assets and liabilities (including any contingent, derivative or\nother off-balance-sheet assets and liabilities) of the Company or Parent or any of their respective subsidiaries and we have not been\nfurnished with any such evaluation or appraisal. We have assumed that all governmental, regulatory or other consents and approvals\nnecessary for the consummation of the Transaction will be obtained without any adverse effect on the Company or Parent or on the\nexpected benefits of the Transaction in any way meaningful to our analysis. We have assumed that the Transaction will be consummated\non the terms set forth in the Agreement, without the waiver or modification of any term or condition the effect of which would be in any\nway meaningful to our analysis.\n\n        Our opinion does not address the underlying business decision of the Company to engage in the Transaction, or the relative merits of\nthe Transaction as compared to any strategic alternatives that may be available to the Company; nor does it address any legal, regulatory,\ntax or accounting matters. This opinion addresses only the fairness from a financial point of view to the holders (other than Parent and its\naffiliates) of Shares, as of the date hereof, of the Merger Consideration to be paid to such holders pursuant to the Agreement. We do not\nexpress any view on, and our opinion does not address, any other term or aspect of the Agreement or Transaction or any term or aspect of\nany other agreement or instrument contemplated by the Agreement or entered into or amended in connection with the Transaction,\nincluding, the fairness of the Transaction to, or any consideration received in connection therewith by, the holders of any other class of\nsecurities, creditors, or other constituencies of the\n\nD-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n322/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nCompany; nor as to the fairness of the amount or nature of any compensation to be paid or payable to any of the officers, directors or\nemployees of the Company, or class of such persons, in connection with the Transaction, whether relative to the Merger Consideration to\nbe paid to the holders (other than Parent and its affiliates) of Shares pursuant to the Agreement or otherwise. We are not expressing any\nopinion as to the prices at which shares of Parent Common Stock will trade at any time or as to the impact of the Transaction on the\nsolvency or viability of the Company or Parent or the ability of the Company or Parent to pay their respective obligations when they come\ndue. Our opinion is necessarily based on economic, monetary, market and other conditions as in effect on, and the information made\navailable to us as of, the date hereof and we assume no responsibility for updating, revising or reaffirming this opinion based on\ncircumstances, developments or events occurring after the date hereof. Our advisory services and the opinion expressed herein are\nprovided for the information and assistance of the Board of Directors of the Company in connection with its consideration of the\nTransaction and such opinion does not constitute a recommendation as to how any holder of Shares should vote with respect to such\nTransaction or any other matter. This opinion has been approved by a fairness committee of Goldman, Sachs & Co.\n\n        Based upon and subject to the foregoing, it is our opinion that, as of the date hereof, the Merger Consideration to be paid to the\nholders (other than Parent and its affiliates) of Shares pursuant to the Agreement is fair from a financial point of view to such holders.\n\nVery truly yours,\n\n(GOLDMAN, SACHS & CO.)\n\nD-3\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n323/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nANNEX E\nSection 262 of the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware\n8 Del.C. \xc2\xa7 262\n\xc2\xa7 262. Appraisal rights\n\n        (a)   Any stockholder of a corporation of this State who holds shares of stock on the date of the making of a demand pursuant to\nsubsection (d) of this section with respect to such shares, who continuously holds such shares through the effective date of the merger or\nconsolidation, who has otherwise complied with subsection (d) of this section and who has neither voted in favor of the merger or\nconsolidation nor consented thereto in writing pursuant to \xc2\xa7 228 of this title shall be entitled to an appraisal by the Court of Chancery of\nthe fair value of the stockholder\'s shares of stock under the circumstances described in subsections (b) and (c) of this section. As used in\nthis section, the word "stockholder" means a holder of record of stock in a corporation; the words "stock" and "share" mean and include\nwhat is ordinarily meant by those words; and the words "depository receipt" mean a receipt or other instrument issued by a depository\nrepresenting an interest in 1 or more shares, or fractions thereof, solely of stock of a corporation, which stock is deposited with the\ndepository.\n\n        (b)   Appraisal rights shall be available for the shares of any class or series of stock of a constituent corporation in a merger or\nconsolidation to be effected pursuant to \xc2\xa7 251 (other than a merger effected pursuant to \xc2\xa7 251(g) of this title and, subject to paragraph (b)\n(3) of this section, \xc2\xa7 251(h) of this title), \xc2\xa7 252, \xc2\xa7 254, \xc2\xa7 255, \xc2\xa7 256, \xc2\xa7 257, \xc2\xa7 258, \xc2\xa7 263 or \xc2\xa7 264 of this title:\n\n        (1)   Provided, however, that, except as expressly provided in \xc2\xa7 363(b) of this title, no appraisal rights under this section shall\nbe available for the shares of any class or series of stock, which stock, or depository receipts in respect thereof, at the record date\nfixed to determine the stockholders entitled to receive notice of the meeting of stockholders to act upon the agreement of merger or\nconsolidation, were either: (i) listed on a national securities exchange or (ii) held of record by more than 2,000 holders; and further\nprovided that no appraisal rights shall be available for any shares of stock of the constituent corporation surviving a merger if the\nmerger did not require for its approval the vote of the stockholders of the surviving corporation as provided in \xc2\xa7 251(f) of this title.\n\n        (2)   Notwithstanding paragraph (b)(1) of this section, appraisal rights under this section shall be available for the shares of\nany class or series of stock of a constituent corporation if the holders thereof are required by the terms of an agreement of merger\nor consolidation pursuant to \xc2\xa7\xc2\xa7 251, 252, 254, 255, 256, 257, 258, 263 and 264 of this title to accept for such stock anything\nexcept:\n\n        a.     Shares of stock of the corporation surviving or resulting from such merger or consolidation, or depository\nreceipts in respect thereof;\n\n        b.     Shares of stock of any other corporation, or depository receipts in respect thereof, which shares of stock (or\ndepository receipts in respect thereof) or depository receipts at the effective date of the merger or consolidation will be\neither listed on a national securities exchange or held of record by more than 2,000 holders;\n\n        c.     Cash in lieu of fractional shares or fractional depository receipts described in the foregoing paragraphs (b)(2)a.\nand b. of this section; or\n\n        d.     Any combination of the shares of stock, depository receipts and cash in lieu of fractional shares or fractional\ndepository receipts described in the foregoing paragraphs (b)(2)a., b. and c. of this section.\n\n        (3)   In the event all of the stock of a subsidiary Delaware corporation party to a merger effected under \xc2\xa7 251(h), \xc2\xa7 253 or\n\xc2\xa7 267 of this title is not owned by the parent immediately prior to the merger, appraisal rights shall be available for the shares of\nthe subsidiary Delaware corporation.\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n324/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (4)   In the event of an amendment to a corporation\'s certificate of incorporation contemplated by \xc2\xa7 363(a) of this title,\nappraisal rights shall be available as contemplated by \xc2\xa7 363(b) of this title, and the procedures of this section, including those set\nforth in subsections (d) and (e) of this section, shall apply as nearly as practicable, with the word "amendment" substituted for the\nwords "merger or consolidation," and the word "corporation" substituted for the words "constituent corporation" and/or "surviving\nor resulting corporation."\n\n        (c)   Any corporation may provide in its certificate of incorporation that appraisal rights under this section shall be available for the\nshares of any class or series of its stock as a result of an amendment to its certificate of incorporation, any merger or consolidation in\nwhich the corporation is a constituent corporation or the sale of all or substantially all of the assets of the corporation. If the certificate of\nincorporation contains such a provision, the provisions of this section, including those set forth in subsections (d), (e), and (g) of this\nsection, shall apply as nearly as is practicable.\n\n        (d)   Appraisal rights shall be perfected as follows:\n\n        (1)   If a proposed merger or consolidation for which appraisal rights are provided under this section is to be submitted for\napproval at a meeting of stockholders, the corporation, not less than 20 days prior to the meeting, shall notify each of its\nstockholders who was such on the record date for notice of such meeting (or such members who received notice in accordance\nwith \xc2\xa7 255(c) of this title) with respect to shares for which appraisal rights are available pursuant to subsection (b) or (c) of this\nsection that appraisal rights are available for any or all of the shares of the constituent corporations, and shall include in such notice\na copy of this section and, if 1 of the constituent corporations is a nonstock corporation, a copy of \xc2\xa7 114 of this title. Each\nstockholder electing to demand the appraisal of such stockholder\'s shares shall deliver to the corporation, before the taking of the\nvote on the merger or consolidation, a written demand for appraisal of such stockholder\'s shares. Such demand will be sufficient if\nit reasonably informs the corporation of the identity of the stockholder and that the stockholder intends thereby to demand the\nappraisal of such stockholder\'s shares. A proxy or vote against the merger or consolidation shall not constitute such a demand. A\nstockholder electing to take such action must do so by a separate written demand as herein provided. Within 10 days after the\neffective date of such merger or consolidation, the surviving or resulting corporation shall notify each stockholder of each\nconstituent corporation who has complied with this subsection and has not voted in favor of or consented to the merger or\nconsolidation of the date that the merger or consolidation has become effective; or\n\n        (2)   If the merger or consolidation was approved pursuant to \xc2\xa7 228, \xc2\xa7 251(h), \xc2\xa7 253, or \xc2\xa7 267 of this title, then either a\nconstituent corporation before the effective date of the merger or consolidation or the surviving or resulting corporation within\n10 days thereafter shall notify each of the holders of any class or series of stock of such constituent corporation who are entitled to\nappraisal rights of the approval of the merger or consolidation and that appraisal rights are available for any or all shares of such\nclass or series of stock of such constituent corporation, and shall include in such notice a copy of this section and, if 1 of the\nconstituent corporations is a nonstock corporation, a copy of \xc2\xa7 114 of this title. Such notice may, and, if given on or after the\neffective date of the merger or consolidation, shall, also notify such stockholders of the effective date of the merger or\nconsolidation. Any stockholder entitled to appraisal rights may, within 20 days after the date of mailing of such notice or, in the\ncase of a merger approved pursuant to \xc2\xa7 251(h) of this title, within the later of the consummation of the offer contemplated by\n\xc2\xa7 251(h) of this title and 20 days after the date of mailing of such notice, demand in writing from the surviving or resulting\ncorporation the appraisal of such holder\'s shares. Such demand will be sufficient if it reasonably informs the corporation of the\nidentity of the stockholder and that the stockholder intends thereby to demand the appraisal of such holder\'s shares. If such notice\ndid not notify stockholders of the effective date of the merger or consolidation, either (i) each such\n\nE-2\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n325/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\nconstituent corporation shall send a second notice before the effective date of the merger or consolidation notifying each of the\nholders of any class or series of stock of such constituent corporation that are entitled to appraisal rights of the effective date of the\nmerger or consolidation or (ii) the surviving or resulting corporation shall send such a second notice to all such holders on or\nwithin 10 days after such effective date; provided, however, that if such second notice is sent more than 20 days following the\nsending of the first notice or, in the case of a merger approved pursuant to \xc2\xa7 251(h) of this title, later than the later of the\nconsummation of the offer contemplated by \xc2\xa7 251(h) of this title and 20 days following the sending of the first notice, such second\nnotice need only be sent to each stockholder who is entitled to appraisal rights and who has demanded appraisal of such holder\'s\nshares in accordance with this subsection. An affidavit of the secretary or assistant secretary or of the transfer agent of the\ncorporation that is required to give either notice that such notice has been given shall, in the absence of fraud, be prima facie\nevidence of the facts stated therein. For purposes of determining the stockholders entitled to receive either notice, each constituent\ncorporation may fix, in advance, a record date that shall be not more than 10 days prior to the date the notice is given, provided,\nthat if the notice is given on or after the effective date of the merger or consolidation, the record date shall be such effective date. If\nno record date is fixed and the notice is given prior to the effective date, the record date shall be the close of business on the day\nnext preceding the day on which the notice is given.\n\n        (e)   Within 120 days after the effective date of the merger or consolidation, the surviving or resulting corporation or any stockholder\nwho has complied with subsections (a) and (d) of this section hereof and who is otherwise entitled to appraisal rights, may commence an\nappraisal proceeding by filing a petition in the Court of Chancery demanding a determination of the value of the stock of all such\nstockholders. Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time within 60 days after the effective date of the merger or consolidation, any\nstockholder who has not commenced an appraisal proceeding or joined that proceeding as a named party shall have the right to withdraw\nsuch stockholder\'s demand for appraisal and to accept the terms offered upon the merger or consolidation. Within 120 days after the\neffective date of the merger or consolidation, any stockholder who has complied with the requirements of subsections (a) and (d) of this\nsection hereof, upon written request, shall be entitled to receive from the corporation surviving the merger or resulting from the\nconsolidation a statement setting forth the aggregate number of shares not voted in favor of the merger or consolidation and with respect to\nwhich demands for appraisal have been received and the aggregate number of holders of such shares. Such written statement shall be\nmailed to the stockholder within 10 days after such stockholder\'s written request for such a statement is received by the surviving or\nresulting corporation or within 10 days after expiration of the period for delivery of demands for appraisal under subsection (d) of this\nsection hereof, whichever is later. Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, a person who is the beneficial owner of shares of such\nstock held either in a voting trust or by a nominee on behalf of such person may, in such person\'s own name, file a petition or request from\nthe corporation the statement described in this subsection.\n\n        (f)    Upon the filing of any such petition by a stockholder, service of a copy thereof shall be made upon the surviving or resulting\ncorporation, which shall within 20 days after such service file in the office of the Register in Chancery in which the petition was filed a\nduly verified list containing the names and addresses of all stockholders who have demanded payment for their shares and with whom\nagreements as to the value of their shares have not been reached by the surviving or resulting corporation. If the petition shall be filed by\nthe surviving or resulting corporation, the petition shall be accompanied by such a duly verified list. The Register in Chancery, if so\nordered by the Court, shall give notice of the time and place fixed for the hearing of such petition by registered or certified mail to the\nsurviving or resulting corporation and to the stockholders shown on the list at the addresses therein stated. Such notice shall also be given\nby 1 or more publications at least 1 week before the day of the hearing, in a newspaper of general circulation published in the City of\nWilmington, Delaware or such\n\nE-3\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n326/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\npublication as the Court deems advisable. The forms of the notices by mail and by publication shall be approved by the Court, and the\ncosts thereof shall be borne by the surviving or resulting corporation.\n\n        (g)   At the hearing on such petition, the Court shall determine the stockholders who have complied with this section and who have\nbecome entitled to appraisal rights. The Court may require the stockholders who have demanded an appraisal for their shares and who hold\nstock represented by certificates to submit their certificates of stock to the Register in Chancery for notation thereon of the pendency of the\nappraisal proceedings; and if any stockholder fails to comply with such direction, the Court may dismiss the proceedings as to such\nstockholder. If immediately before the merger or consolidation the shares of the class or series of stock of the constituent corporation as to\nwhich appraisal rights are available were listed on a national securities exchange, the Court shall dismiss the proceedings as to all holders\nof such shares who are otherwise entitled to appraisal rights unless (1) the total number of shares entitled to appraisal exceeds 1% of the\noutstanding shares of the class or series eligible for appraisal, (2) the value of the consideration provided in the merger or consolidation for\nsuch total number of shares exceeds $1 million, or (3) the merger was approved pursuant to \xc2\xa7 253 or \xc2\xa7 267 of this title.\n\n        (h)   After the Court determines the stockholders entitled to an appraisal, the appraisal proceeding shall be conducted in accordance\nwith the rules of the Court of Chancery, including any rules specifically governing appraisal proceedings. Through such proceeding the\nCourt shall determine the fair value of the shares exclusive of any element of value arising from the accomplishment or expectation of the\nmerger or consolidation, together with interest, if any, to be paid upon the amount determined to be the fair value. In determining such fair\nvalue, the Court shall take into account all relevant factors. Unless the Court in its discretion determines otherwise for good cause shown,\nand except as provided in this subsection, interest from the effective date of the merger through the date of payment of the judgment shall\nbe compounded quarterly and shall accrue at 5% over the Federal Reserve discount rate (including any surcharge) as established from time\nto time during the period between the effective date of the merger and the date of payment of the judgment. At any time before the entry of\njudgment in the proceedings, the surviving corporation may pay to each stockholder entitled to appraisal an amount in cash, in which case\ninterest shall accrue thereafter as provided herein only upon the sum of (1) the difference, if any, between the amount so paid and the fair\nvalue of the shares as determined by the Court, and (2) interest theretofore accrued, unless paid at that time. Upon application by the\nsurviving or resulting corporation or by any stockholder entitled to participate in the appraisal proceeding, the Court may, in its discretion,\nproceed to trial upon the appraisal prior to the final determination of the stockholders entitled to an appraisal. Any stockholder whose\nname appears on the list filed by the surviving or resulting corporation pursuant to subsection (f) of this section and who has submitted\nsuch stockholder\'s certificates of stock to the Register in Chancery, if such is required, may participate fully in all proceedings until it is\nfinally determined that such stockholder is not entitled to appraisal rights under this section.\n\n        (i)    The Court shall direct the payment of the fair value of the shares, together with interest, if any, by the surviving or resulting\ncorporation to the stockholders entitled thereto. Payment shall be so made to each such stockholder, in the case of holders of uncertificated\nstock forthwith, and the case of holders of shares represented by certificates upon the surrender to the corporation of the certificates\nrepresenting such stock. The Court\'s decree may be enforced as other decrees in the Court of Chancery may be enforced, whether such\nsurviving or resulting corporation be a corporation of this State or of any state.\n\n        (j)    The costs of the proceeding may be determined by the Court and taxed upon the parties as the Court deems equitable in the\ncircumstances. Upon application of a stockholder, the Court may order all or a portion of the expenses incurred by any stockholder in\nconnection with the appraisal proceeding, including, without limitation, reasonable attorney\'s fees and the fees and expenses of experts, to\nbe charged pro rata against the value of all the shares entitled to an appraisal.\n\nE-4\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n327/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\nTable of Contents\n\n        (k)   From and after the effective date of the merger or consolidation, no stockholder who has demanded appraisal rights as provided\nin subsection (d) of this section shall be entitled to vote such stock for any purpose or to receive payment of dividends or other\ndistributions on the stock (except dividends or other distributions payable to stockholders of record at a date which is prior to the effective\ndate of the merger or consolidation); provided, however, that if no petition for an appraisal shall be filed within the time provided in\nsubsection (e) of this section, or if such stockholder shall deliver to the surviving or resulting corporation a written withdrawal of such\nstockholder\'s demand for an appraisal and an acceptance of the merger or consolidation, either within 60 days after the effective date of the\nmerger or consolidation as provided in subsection (e) of this section or thereafter with the written approval of the corporation, then the\nright of such stockholder to an appraisal shall cease. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no appraisal proceeding in the Court of Chancery\nshall be dismissed as to any stockholder without the approval of the Court, and such approval may be conditioned upon such terms as the\nCourt deems just; provided, however that this provision shall not affect the right of any stockholder who has not commenced an appraisal\nproceeding or joined that proceeding as a named party to withdraw such stockholder\'s demand for appraisal and to accept the terms offered\nupon the merger or consolidation within 60 days after the effective date of the merger or consolidation, as set forth in subsection (e) of this\nsection.\n\n        (l)    The shares of the surviving or resulting corporation to which the shares of such objecting stockholders would have been\nconverted had they assented to the merger or consolidation shall have the status of authorized and unissued shares of the surviving or\nresulting corporation.\n\nE-5\n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n328/330\n\n\x0c8/28/2019\n\n \n\nhttps://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/861361/000104746917000512/a2230778zdefm14a.htm\n\n. Adopt the Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of October 23, 2016, by and among Rockwell\nCollins, Inc., Quarterback Merger Sub Corp. and B/E Aerospace, Inc., as amended from time to time. + ForAgainst Abstain The Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR Proposal 2. 2. The undersigned hereby constitutes and appoints Messrs. Joseph T. Lower and Ryan M. Patch, or either of them, with full power of substitution to each, proxies to vote and act at the Special Meeting of Stockholders of B/E Aerospace, Inc. (the \xe2\x80\x9cCompany\xe2\x80\x9d) to be held on March 9, 2017 at the Hilton Palm Beach Airport, 150 Australian Avenue, West Palm Beach, Florida 33406-1473 at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern Time) and at any adjournment thereof (the \xe2\x80\x9cMeeting\xe2\x80\x9d), upon and with respect to the number of shares of Common Stock, par value $0.01 per share that the undersigned would be entitled to vote if personally present. The undersigned hereby instructs such proxies, or their substitutes, to vote on those matters appearing on the reverse side hereof as specified by the undersigned and in such manner as they may determine on any other matter that may come before the Meeting, all as indicated in the accompanying Notice of Special Meeting and Joint Proxy\nStatement/Prospectus attached thereto, receipt of which is hereby acknowledged. All proxies heretofore given by the undersigned in respect of the Meeting are hereby revoked. Unless otherwise specified in the boxes provided on the reverse side hereof, this Proxy will be voted (1) FOR Proposal 1, (2) FOR Proposal 2, (3) FOR Proposal 3, and (4) in the discretion of the named proxies as to any other matter that may properly come up before the Meeting. CONTINUED AND TO BE VOTED ON REVERSE SIDE C Non-Voting Items Change of Address \xe2\x80\x94 Please print new address below.
